reviews.review: Get active at Lumpini Park. My partner and I visited Lumpini Park because we're exercise junkies. Little did we know it was just the place for us. Being someone who obsesses over sport and it's development, this park is a model that English authorities need to adopt. There's a flat, mapped out 2.5km running loop, which you can also bike and skate on, free exercise classes and advice, exercise machine, stretching polls and more! It was fantastic to see all shapes and sizes getting active! We ran at night and felt completely safe! Would love to visit in the day to see that city skyline. MD

Good for a morning run. Get there early ideally before sun up for a coolish jog, lots of paths and a marked route to take your choice, you can even join in the exercise classes which are held there each morning and evening, Kung fu to aerobics, the choice is yours.It's a lot busier in the evenings.

Love this park. This park is a beautiful place to come and relax around nature after spending all day exploring the city. It's an amazing spot for a jog or even just to people watch. We even got lucky and saw one of the monitor lizards that swim about the park. It was huge! A beautiful find and I would definitely recommend.

Nice park with pedal boats at two lakes!. Lumpini park is a Nice park with pedal boats at two lakes! Very nice to walk around and relax in this park nested in the middle of Bangkok. You can rent the pedal boats or simply enjoy the nature with a lot of birds and trees to enjoy.
A nice place to jog or relax when it is cool.. Early morning walks are the best activity for the park before the day gets hot. Food and drinks can be found there from street vendors.
few hours in Lumpini park. Really nice (but hot) stroll around the park. All activities very reasonably priced. Especially got a kick out of the huge lizards hanging around the lake.

Oasis in the center of concrete jungle. Great place for morning and evening jog or run. Morning is preferable to escape from the famous Bangkok heat.Lot of people doing morning exercises there and sometime, running events are organised there too.Walking distance from Silom MRT and Saladeang BTS station.

Jog. I had a jog here this morning as this across the road from my hotel. This is a large open space and great for joggers as the lanes are marked and you can see the route. This is 2.5km to go around once. Many locals jogging here in the morning and a great vibe. Its hot but you expect that. Great to see there is a fitness area which is open and free for anyone to use too

Little oasis in the heart of Bangkok . This is an idyllic little oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Great place to go for a walk or relax under the shade. Surrounded by skyscrapers and traffic. Great for taking photos

Relax day away from Traffic. i've been there many times its a nice place for go to jogging in the morning and have a picnic there, One amazing thing that i saw there is alot of big lizard (huge!) if you want to run away from a crazy traffic for a day. this is a good place to go :) Or picnic with a family

Nice bit of green in a bustling city. Nice bit of green space in a bustling city but that's all. Went out onto the lake on a swan Pedlo which was nice and seen monitor lizards swimming around which was a fright at first as they look like snakes when submerged. Not really much else going on
Park. Nature and green in the middle of Bangkok skyscrapers. Relaxing place. Good for walk, run, take pictures.

very nice place to visit if you want to do some morning excercise before starting your day. i booked a hotel in silom sala daeng to be able to enjoy going to this park everyday in the early morning. it is a park of a 2.5 km circular track with 2 lakes within the track.you could walk ,run or even do some fitness activities using the free apparatuses which are available in a lot of places inside the park.do not forget to take a selfie photo with the monitor lizard of the park if you are lucky to see it.

Paradise in a busy City, nice and calm in the middle of the madness of Bangkok. I visit this place once or twice when visiting Bangkok and it never fails to please me. The moniter lizards get bigger each year as do the fish and giant turtles

green oasis. Lumpini looks like NYC's Central Park. It is very clean, green, well arranged and full of people exercising (tai chi, aerobics, etc). Perfect for late afternoon walk, or early morning workout.
lake park. it is within the city and accessible through the skytrain.well maintained and very beautiful park. Good place to relax
Nice garden in the city. Great place to jog, it open since very early morning 4 am and you may jog in the evening. Many joggers, very greenery surrounding and atmosphere.

Rainly day and nature hmm. That title just my Dreams! Imagine! When you goes there understand me, what ı want to say. Its beauty park between some activity for everyone each day. grandma, dad,Child... Everyone run to run for health themselfs.

AMAZING. During my Solo backpacking travel i´ve went a few times to this park just to escape the crowdy city. it is peacefull, quiet, and nice to do some excercise.also now and than you can follow free sport classes which is really amazing to do. there is also an Old school outdoor gym in the middle of the park and i can reccomend it to all the gym lovers. also go with a sunset, it is amazing when te sun dissapears behind the huge buildings

nice. its a beautiful spot in the heart of Bangkok.i went there my fisrt day and i saw a lot of people doing excercise.jogging, running and walking. its perfect for fit people.it has two lakes and you can feed the fishesits very calm and you can just rest, do some excercise and enojy

Nice Place. The place is really big and the air is very fresh. It's best if you go during the day, which isn't much of a problem with all the tree's around. Its very good for taking a long walk and exercising.

Second best Bangkok city park. This is a great park to go for a walk in after a day of work. It's in the center of town, just a quick walk away from Saladaeng BTS, great place to go for a free aerobics workout with the locals or just chill by the lake and feed the fish. It's super clean and well laid out. You can rent a boat and go out on the lake. It can get pretty hot in the middle of the day, though. I'd recommend going no earlier than 3:30 or 4:00 pm to avoid getting super sweaty.

green space in Bangkok. If you go midday you might not see the magic of Lumpini Park. It is best viewed early in the morning when Thais are doing aerobics and Thai Chi. There are huge monitor lizards and you can hire boats. If you like cycling you can whizz right around the park. If you don't like cycling make sure you stay out of the cycle lanes. You can buy water at the edge of the park, I would take some with you. If you like to hunt pokemon this is the place for you, there are groups of pokemon hunters who meet here. You can see the skyscrapers over the park.

Good place to go for a run . Located near Emporium and Em quartier, this park is very popular. Thoroughly enjoyed running here even though it's a small loop. Did a few kliks here before running on the Sukhumwit. Pleasant park to relax from the busy commercial area

Lumpini Park Everyday Park. If you want to walk around away from street vendors and commuters, just enjoy walking at Lumpini Park which is across only where I stayed at Dusit Thani. The park has nothing mush to offer but it sure will add some photos to your Bangkok stay.

Great park. Our hotel is located in front of Lumpini Park. It was very easy for us to gain access to the park, so we went and explored it a few times at different times of the day. It was great seeing so much interesting activity early morning. So many locals and visitors exercising. The facilities of the park are very impressive, from ponds and space to stroll and enjoy the beauty of the region, to exercise machines made available for the general public to use.There were facilities for picnics, exercising, swimming, shows and exercising. All in all, a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.

Nice central park!!. Spent alot of time in Lumphini with our 2 yr old adoptive son from Thailand. A great outing in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Alot of things to do for all ages. Go!

A nice park in the city Centre . A nice park surrounded by High towers, with few pods and living animals. I was disappointed by seeing a waste deposit right at a side of the park. You can see many birds, giant lizards, a lot of cats and runners.

Amazing place to admire Bangkok's skyline!. The park is gorgeous! It is in the middle of the city, surrounded by skyscrapers, yet retaining a nice peaceful atmosphere. We found it a great place to admire the contrast between the nature and modern Bangkok. Definitely worth the stop!
full of protestors. nice to see the real bangkok, all in lumpini park. it seems to be nice place when there is no protestors camping in its grounds LOL

good park for fresh air and exercise. well laid out park that hosts many special events, good cycle track, long walk around lake. few animals and birds around. nice for a stroll and very close to asoke bts.
Lovely park. Beautiful and relaxing place in the middle of the big city.Nice,clean and safe.You can rent a boat as well.Very suitable for jogging.

Nice park in the middle of Bangkok . Nice park, a lot of free stuff to do. There is a complete open air fitnesscenter. A huge pond from which you can see a lot of the impressive buildings Bangkok has to offer.

Nice park to go for a run around. Nice park to get your mileage in or to get some running done to work off all the food and drink. Quite a few drink stalls around the route too. Decent location with quite a few hotels surrounding it within running distance.

quite. Was so nice to get away from the noise of the City tuk tuk and motorcycle. Lovely lake to sit and look at , was so funny as we came across a gym the bench and bike were held together with tape but there were a few people using it . I had a nasty bite by a big ant on my foot stung for days ,

very quiet and peaceful. its such a pleasure to take a walk around the park where u can just lay down on the grass near the small lake and read a book or else go for running enjoying the beautiful paths of the park. enjoyable!!!

Got to see some Komodo Dragons. Nice park within Bangkok. Got to see some large lizards right away when we walked in. Need to go by the water. Nice place to visit if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

A peaceful place of serenity. Within walking distance from our hotel we went for a relaxing afternoon walk. Park is well maintained and offers many peaceful benches to just sit and watch birds and people. Look for different varieties of orchids attached to many trees.

Nice Park in the inner city . Good for walking cycling, there is an outdoor gym. Or if you just want to relax, with a book. There's also pedalo hire on the lake. It's a massive place. The mrt is lumpini station.
Park of the people. Nice park with lots of things to do (especially at night). It is on the end of Silom Road in Bangkok.

Great Place in the heart of Bangkok. It is an iconic place with wonderful, atmosphere in which nature meet the modernity of one of the busy city of Asia. There's an ornamental lake and various other activities such as Tai Chi and fitness class. You can just forget time and spend an entire day there. It's a cool place to hang out, close to the centre of action Sukhumvit.

Great to get out of the city while in the city. My accomodation (Cube Hostel) was very close to Lumpini, which made it a great option for an early morning jog. There are a lot of runners there in the morning; I suggest getting there before the sun comes up so that the air is a little cooler. I went three times and didn't see any wildlife, but I did enjoy the greenery in the middle of the otherwise very urban city. Also great in the afternoon if you're dying in the heat and need some shade and cool grass to sit on. Lots of Pokestops for Pokemon Go players and very easy to catch pokemon here, particularly Magikarp and the female Nidoran. There's also an outdoor gym which I had a bit of a go on. Only a couple of the machines have weights, most are bodyweight only but there are a LOT of them. Very few people were using them properly - I even saw a guy casually using a leg press on no weight while reading a newspaper... but great for some variety of exercise even if your hotel has a gym. There's even a pool there and some courts but I didn't check them out too closely.

The nature is also in the heart of Bangkok, must be seen !. Central Park for New York, Lumpini Park for Bangkok ! Every big city need some nature, here you can meet the real spirit of Bangkok, natural modernity...iconic place with wonderful, atmosphere in which nature meet the modernity of one of the most buzy city in Asia...

Park yourself in Lumpini. This is a great place for the jogging addict, its packed with runners in the early morning and early evenings. There's an ornamental lake and various other activities such as Tai Chi and fitness class. It's a cool place to hang out, close to the centre of action at both Silom and Sukhumvit.

Go here if you wanna see monitor lizards, cool crows and weight-lifting in the park!. I was excited to see a giant monitor lizard...and see one I did, within 2 minutes of being in the park! I think they are so cool! I wonder if anyone gets bitten by them though. Anyway, they swim in the canals along with catfish, turtles and other fish. You can feed them bread or fish food sold by hawkers (don't worry, you won't have to find them, they'll find you) for about 20 baht. Fun to watch the fish all splash around for this food, mouths agape. That said I feel bad that they're not in the wild.I'm goin' to hell for enjoying watching them, aren't I??!! :(There's a real deal open air gym in one area, and random gym equipment scattered around that area. I would personally feel too self-conscious to work out in public like this, but some people might enjoy that. We also fed wild crows that seemed to like us, but probably only liked us for the chorizo bread we shared with them. :)

A place to rest. This park is the place to be if you want to get out of the busy areas in bangkok. It's very quiet, clean and beautiful. Whenever you feel you need some rest in the nature, go to Lumpini Park!

Wonderful place. I went early enough in the morning to see all the people exercising, loads of free exercise and gym equipment to use, a wonderful walk, bikes, some nice places to buy drinks, when it gets hot you will need it.Wonderful wildlife walking around, kids play parks and areas, just a beautiful place to visit!
Beautiful . I love this place, very peaceful and always interesting. Just to lay down on the lawns or stroll around on the sealed walkways its a great escape from the madness of Bkk.

Great place to exercise. It is a lot like Bangkok's Central Park. It is a great place to see Bangkok's sporty people and enjoy some green park as well. There is also usually food stalls outside the main gate which you can enjoy after your exercise!

Nice park in central Bangkok. I used to work close to Lumpini Park so I often went jogging there in the past. I was there just last week, that was what prompted me to write this review. I should go more oftenIt's a nice and decently quiet place, quite a big lake, it feels great to sit down on the grass and and just relax or why not lay down and sleep for a while like the Thai's do.The big lizards by the lake are cool, they are big...Nothing too do there of course but nice greenery in the middle of Bangkok

Not bad . If you have nothing to do one afternoon and you want to escape the hassle of the city go and have a good walk around. It was nice for a short walk but it's not something I would go out of my way to do as there is much better things to see and do. One good point is that it's free and in the open air.
Just a park. It's a big, open, expanse, with many walkable areas. But other than that, I couldn't see much of anything as it being an attraction. Walking Silom Road would be more interesting...

Nice Oasis. There was a large number of men sleeping on the benches in the park. Everytime we thought we found a quiet spot, someone was sleeping on a bench. There was also a creepy "massage man" who came up and tried to "rub" my shoulders and grabbed my wrist. The man who was "growling" like a bear topped off the experience. Made us uncomfortable to say the least. Get rid of the crazy people and the park has lots of potential.

Best park in Bangkok. the park is located in Bangkok city centre. You can take a train (MRT- Lumpinee station) or (BTS-PleonChit station) The park is not too big but good enough for a run after stressful day at work. It is also near some shopping places where you could get food or even watch a movie afterward.
Lumpini park is a really nice park in Bangkok. Great park for a walk. Very well kept place. A lot of people jogging and walking and exercising. Nice big lizards by the lake.
Best place in Bkk. Go there to relax. Buy a juice and sit on the bench and look at the big lizzards. A lot of thai people come here

Breathe of Fresh Air. If needing to get out of the hustle and bustle this is a relaxing spot. Conveniently located off the MRT it is easy to get to. Various activities are possible. If looking to meet locals, I highly recommend coming here and striking up conversation.

Good exercise place in the city centre. It's a big park in the middle of the city. U can join the aerobics group or some exercise activity for free. Jogging is widely do as majority group of the park. At night, u stills can do exercise up to 10 pm. There is a parking lot available!
Worth a visit if you are looking for greenery. Worth a visit if you want to catch some quiet moments and greenery in Bangkok. Many resting spots inside the park and a playground for kids.
time out. lovely place to walk around. See the locals exercising. Nice setting and peaceful. Food vendors on the north side and I had a great buffet breakfast for THB40 !

One of my favourite places in Bangkok - reminiscent of Central Park, New York. A "must do" place to visit in Bangkok - for walks, join the communal gym (hundreds of people all exercising to music), spot the water monitors (big reptiles) in the waterways, take a pedal boat ride - and admire the city skyline from the tranquility of one of the most beautiful parts of Bangkok. Close to transport, close to the shopping centres. It's huge.
Very relaxing place. Good place to take a short break from busy Bangkok. Not exactly High Park or Central Park but still lots of going on over there every day. Mostly know from its kite festival.

Beautiful, relaxing place to walk. This wonderful park was located a few blocks from our hotel and we decided it would be a nice early evening walk.This wonderful green space has swan boats, beautiful gardens and sculptures. I think we were most impressed by the designated spaces for bike riding and fitness.There was an entire section of outdoor fitness equipment and weight lifting that many people seemed to take advantage of.A nice place for a relaxing walk in a beautiful green spaces in the middle of Bangkok

The only green lung in the center of Bangkok!. As a Bangkok resident, I have been several times to Lumpini Park but have now stopped to as unfortunately you cannot take your dog even on a lead! The explanation I was given is that if it was allowed, locals would not clean after them! A pity as this is the only park in the very heart of Bangkok.

Loud, crowded, not good for chilling.... This park is nothing like an european vision of what a park should be: nice, relaxing, greean, peaceful place where you can lay on the grass and read or have a picnic. We, were hoping to get away from the busy Bangkok streets and relax in the nature, but we were very disappointed. The park is full of people, it's not very convenient to sit on a grass... and what's worst of all; it's full of vendors and hasslers- just like on the streets.

Lovely break in the middle of the city . Lovely break in the middle of the city, it was an overcast day when we visited but worth a visit. Great gardens and place to get away from all the traffic and noise.

green park. free entrance ticket for this park. the park is so big with nice atmosphere. This garden was treated very well. you can take a look, many local people using this park for sport activities such as gym outdoor, running or come here for relax. very good

Love it here for walking. Great here to get away from everything and clear your head from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.Joggers and walkers all ages go here very good park to go to just be careful of hot days,
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park with a lake in the middle of the busy city. I really enjoyed walking in Lumpini Park.
Peaceful and serene. The lumpini park is a very refreshing place in the middle of a very busy city. It is quite large and provides an opportunity to relax and enjoy nature.
Paddle boats. Great park park in the middle of a bustling city.Fun PADDLE BOATS and huge tame waterdragons..easy to get to..plenty of shade.

Nice big park - grest for Pokemon Go!. This park was fairly close to my hotel. I walked down to get some exercise and get out of my room a couple times. Looks like they have some great facilities and have a lot of people in the park enjoying the outdoors. If you want to paly Pokémon Go in Bangkok - this looks like a good place to do it.
Nice. This was a great park to walk, run or ride around, we walked. Not sure on the size of it but you could spend a couple of hours wandering around. It seems to have good security.

Don't miss the lizards in the lake. This is Bangkok's very own Central Park, a green oasis surrounded by skyscrapers. There's a lovely lake in the middle and grassy spaces all around. We were lucky in the it was cloudy the day we went, so it was easy walking about. But I don't think we covered more than half the park. We spent time watching two Monitor Lizards making out on the edge of the lake. We thought it was a remarkable sight, but were later told it's a common enough sight at Lumpini Park!

lovely park in the middle of Bangkok!. Bangkok is very noisy and polluted. Going into Lumpini park helps you to have a quiet place, all green with a large water pound. Kids love it as they have fun there. Good for a morning jogging while travelling.

A park with monitor lizards.. What's not to like. We had a walk round the park. There are monitor lizards wandering around. You can buy food at the entrances and feed the fish. There are swan boats to pedal around the lake.

Nice relaxing spot in bangkok. We went to this place after weekend market. We were damn tired with almost 0 energy left in us.We went to this park to relax and gain some power.Superb park. Well maintained.Public having best time of their.There's lake in between and you can sit around and have best of this view.Superb place.

Safe back to nature in Bangkok. Ideally go on the weekend,Thais love this area of park and you will be rewarded by exhibitions of Thi chi ,sword dancing,work out junkies plus a Thai monk in for good luck.A fantastic place to visit with good entertainment plus happy people.Every time we visit Bangkok we visit to get some sanity in this city of excitement.

Beautiful and relaxing. This is one of our favourite places in Bangkok. Great for people watching, you can rent a paddle boat for only 40 Baht for 30 minutes and float around the Lake. Keep your eye out for Water Monitors and tortoises which are abundant. Try to visit in the late afternoon or evening to avoid the worst of the heat.

Will be back for a good run. The park's huge and the promise of seeing a komodo is indeed true. Although it's a public park, it's very clean. Facilities are available and they're functional. There are a good number of activities that can be done and we'll be back for a good run around the entire park next time.
Lumpini Park.. Regular visitor to this Park. Almost 100 years old now and relaxing place to go if you have free time when visiting Bangkok.

A good place for a nice walk and relaxing. A big green park in the heart of BKK. you can reach there by walk from Siam and si lom area. we would recommend you to walk there instead of using transportation. the night breeze also nice there. we like to sit near the lake and chat

An oasis in the urban jungle. A beautiful place with rivers and trees in a city of traffic jams and smog. A nice place to rest while traversing this giant city. Or to sit under a tree and wait out a rain storm.

park is a park. Park is a park but this part is kind of nice it's in the big part of the city plus it's not too hot not too cold it's just nice relaxing Park how much you can say about it on the outside there are some food carts to enjoy the day but I suggest get yourself couple sodas and a blanket and go sit out and enjoy the Sun

A gem amidst the concrete jungle. If you want to relax and fill your eyes with greens, have some relaxing time at this park. After going to a number of temples in Bangkok, we decided to go to this park to have a different experience. Unlike to normal city parks back home, this park is well maintained. The toilets are very clean and complete with soap and tissues. It is very relaxing and safe even if you are strolling by yourself.

Beautiful Garden and Lush Green scenery. Its a beautiful garden in Bangkok . I was there for a get together and the place was very well lit. We had lot of activities planned for us .The garden is very well maintained and is easily accessible!
Oasis in a bustling city. Great park for jogging, relaxing, or working out. Like Bangkok's central park (New York). Free gym equipment on western side. Nearest MRT Lumpini.

A Green Amidst The City. I got here in the hopes of finding the Red Cross center in Bangkok. Walked from Sukhumvit road (yes Ii know, I'm like Dora the explorer right? haha) and stumbled in this relaxing park. If you are planning on staying in Bangkok for a bit longer and needs to excercise or jog, then this is the place for you. It has an MRT access so you won't have to walk like me hahaha. Anyway, interms of safety, a lot of locals excercise here too, so you won't be alone.

clean and spacy. YES, we have seen some Komodo dragons! you need to seek the near the water, in the brooks that go to the lake.. They seem slow, passive and apathetic, but trust me - they are not! ^^also there were a lot of gymnastic apparatus right in the park, our daughters liked them a lot!
Love this park. I Always go to this park when i am in BKK and love Walking around in this park. Recomend it a lot. Good Place for running biking and in the evening there is also free gym sessions

Beautiful. This park is wonderful. It's perfect for a cheap day out. They have peddle swan boats there that are great fun and good value. They also have wild monitor lizards that are fascinating to watch.

Heart green. There is a green oasis in the heart of city. There are all in one, relaxing, chill out, exercise, shopping, eating
Recommended to come in the evening around 5pm. you will meet everything as described

Calm amongst the chaos.. One of the must see attractions of Bangkok when you are here. Amazing to think that amongst all of the chaos of Bangkok, you can just step off of the street into a rather large area of tranquility.

The lung of bangkok. Lumpini Park
Lumpini Park, the first park in Bangkok, was created by King Rama VI on royal property. This park offers a multi-purpose open public space, housing various recreational centres, health-related associations and clubs.

Holiday. After a busy day went here for a sit down wow so much here from aerobic classes to jogging to even a club for catching Pokemon and all free also saw the monitor lizards that wonder free great place

Big green open park in the city. The park is well maintained with lots of shade trees for the tropical heat. Daylight hours are the best time to visit as lighting is not the best in that area at night.

Great food! Great prices! Hit the food tents at night. Bring your own napkins if you're a messy eater, the toilet paper that is on each table doesn't quite cut it. Aside from that, everything is outstanding! You must try the fried morning glory...amazing with just the right amount of heat! A cold beer to wash the food down always helps. Bring small bills since this will not be an expensive meal. Four of us were stuffed. We ordered 6 assorted plates and each had at least one large beer, all for around 1700 baht total!! Service was great!

The breath of Bangkok. Visit the park in the early morning: you could join a running team or just take a tai chi session among varans or start your day with an aerobic lesson on the grass. Crowdy throuhghout the day, you'll forget that the noisy and messy Bangkok is right behind those palm trees...
Good green space. Great place to get away from the traffic and noise of this busy city. Look out for monitor lizards, herons, terrapins carp and catfish (as well as cyclists).

Oasis in the middle of the Bangkok. if you are staying close to Lumphini thn this is the place for early morning exercise and a glimpse of the community of users who frequent this park for exercise, tai chi, martial arts or meeting up with friends. Beautifully clean and a true oasis in the middle of Bangkok

Beautiful mornings here for running, Tai Chi and just people watching!. We typically visit early morning to enjoy a run on the running trail where you'll be sharing with many other runners, walkers, running clubs, etc. The view is scenic and the run is not very difficult and easily tracked by the distance markers on the trail. Along the run you will see Tai Chi classes, Zumba classes all sorts of people visiting the park and using the free exercise equipment or visiting any of the many food vendors parked just outside. You'll find fresh squeezed juices and all sorts of cooked food and sometimes even massage vendors! There's even a gym on the park grounds but we haven't visited. A great experience just for the peacefulness, the scenery and for relaxation.

Never boring -- always a great place to be in the moment. Whether you are there for the day or night, Lumpini Park is always a great place to visit. I have been there several times for walking, listening to concerts, and just to see how the city blends together.

The best park in Thailand.. Having lived in Thailand for 8 years but leaving in 2011 I have travelled extensively around the country so know the place quite well. This is very much out of character for Thailand in being of an international/European standard park. It is clean, quite and well maintained. The very best thing about it though is the presence of a huge number of free roaming monitor lizards. There's are huge impressive animals that can not be seen to close anywhere else. It really is a unique feature that should not be missed. There are also terrapins, birds, butterflies and other exotic animals to encounter as well as peddle boats and an open air gym to use. The whole park is a fantastic break from the noise, smell and general chaos of Bangkok.

Exiting!. Just go there, and see these large creatures - this park i perfect for people who had enough of street vendors, trying to sell you some bad quality suits - branding them as Armani og Boss. Go here, you will se these big lizards, else wait for them.OBS: This place is also good for Pokemon Go players, so whats not to like :-)

Awesome giant park. I really like Lumpini park. It's right by the BTS stop, so it's very convenient, and it's pretty giant. There are usually people here all through the day and night, and it feels really safe. I like how green and lush it is. There are lots of cool places to take pictures here.
Dont bother. It is not a special place at all. It looks nice in the pictures but the water is polluted and the food court is very outdated and basically just nasty

Love to stroll in the park.. Love to walk in the park in the morning, the birds are singing and it's so relaxing to stop on the bridges and feed the large fish and turtles that are flocking to get a bite. If you are lucky you will be able to see the lizards, they look scary but are very polite and actually scared of you. Be quiet you will maybe have good luck and see one of the baby lizards in the grass.Also lime to stop at the outside gym and observe the muscle guys training in the morning.Hope you will find it as exiting as I do to just stroll in the park and feed the animals.
Complete. There was combine everything you want excercise relaxing shopping and eating and also chill out drinking or just walking around but a bit traffics

Beware the Bikes & Lizards!. A nice inner-city park with lots of lakes and pathways to walk or jog. Note it is also used by cyclists and is also home to some quite large monitor lizards ...just stay out of both their way!
one enough. There are combine with everything in one place excercise, shopping, eating relax or just only chillout walkig or sightseeing please come to try.
realex. this a real nice place to chill out in the big mango Bangkok.exercises equipment,big lakes old trees,bicycle roads ,clean air,and wild animals,all together always a place to go.Enjoy it!!!!
Good park. This is apparently the biggest park in the downtown Bangkok area but wasnt actually that big', but was ok to do a few laps jogging in the morning.

The best park for a run and an open air workout. If you like running (or jogging), make sure you do it in Lumpini. The 2.5k circuit will test your stamina and if you feel like lifting some weights, for just THB 60 you can lift some weights in an old school open air gym (somewhat antique equipment - Arnol'd era if you know what I mean), nevertheless a good complement to a run.
A good Park inside A big City. Big pond full of fish and turtles - A jogging and cycle track - well maintained - Peaceful area - nice for families

A park in Bangkok...the only one. The park is well maintained but suffers of flagrant lack of personality. The amenaties are rare and not extremely well conceived. But this park mainly suffers of the lack of other green spaces in Bangkok which counts only 1 sqm of park by inhabitants.

Nice and serene!. Spent an hour or so on my first day in Bangkok here, it was nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok traffic! There were a few monitor lizards chilling in the shallows of the lake and a terrapin knocking around. Lay on the grass to read a book for a while and after about 30 seconds I was being eaten alive by ants. It is a nice spot though and worth a wander round either for escape or to waste an hour or two!

Just a park. Maybe do have a walk trough it if you are in the area, but Lumpini Park is nothing really special. Just and average park with some roads trough it. Might be a good place for doing sports or going for a run though.
Good for spending time. If you have time, this place is good for walking, running and spending time if weather be good. In fact this just a regular park, but it's good to get free of city atmosphere.
A park. Nothing special. Very humid, not much to see or/and do. Boring. A lot of cyclists. Lizards cross the road. That's about it.

Join the locals and a few expats. This is one of the rae open spaces in the central city but easily accessible on either the Skytrain or metro... a great place to walk or jog and on Sundays you get to see local families enjoying picnics and karaoke!! There is a boating lake that is popular and in winter summer concerts free for all... a small gem to enjoy if the city just gets too much!

Varanos and cheap gyms. Best place in Bangkok for going running!
There is fitness classes, open small gyms, a swimming pool and nice place where to have a enjoy a picnic.
The lungs of the city: Enjoy a break!

Depends on time of day/season/weather. I like early morning when it is cool. This is when you will see many different groups exercising their chosen philosophy from yoga to Tai Chi to swords. With a calm lake, clear skies and beautiful sunrise colors you better have your camera because the lake with the Bangkok skyline as a background is gorgeous. Don't be surprised if you see the very large lizards swimming near the shoreline scrounging for food and resident cats pretending they own the park and are letting you visit out of the goodness of their hearts. A great oasis in the hectic "desert" of Bangkok.

Just a park. You might read "Bangkok's Central Park". Well. It's not that great. I think it's more important for the locals, as they use it for workouts. If you live nearby and want to have a run, you should go here. Just for the view: Not that much.
Serene place to chill. If you have time post all the sight seeing and shopping in Bangkok, you can visit Lumpini for a lazy stroll.

Loved the aerobics at 6am. We stayed quite close to the park, and I had heard about the aerobics at 6am, so I rose early to take part. As I made my way, I could see lots of runners and people performing Tai Chi in small groups. Once we reached the aerobics it will already briefly underway, and I joined in quickly. It was very energetic and perhaps a bit hard to follow exactly, but I enjoyed. I approached the instructor afterwards and gave her a tip out of appreciation - I could see others were doing that as well. In the park, there are pond areas to rent a paddle vessel.I would really recommend taking the time to walk through this park. In the hustle and bustle of Bangkok, it can be a welcome change.

great place to forget that you're in the city. you wouldn't think that this place is in the middle of bangkok city centre - very quiet! lots of wildlife knocking about - little terrapins and lizards and stuff which was well cool. loads of exercise equipment if you can stand the heat and a gym hidden away full of burly thai men - not sure how you'd be accepted if you went in there as a tourist! lots of joggers and cyclists in the evenings if that's your thing as well. reccomend.
Nice. It's a nice park for walking around, also with kids. A few playgrounds are fun for the kids. But there was hardly any place to buy food or drinks.
Good place to relax. We went with the family , a nice place to relax with in the city , there is a small lake and boating also offered. A lot of people are doing jogging there.

Get away from the city hustle and bustle!. This is my favorite park in Bangkok. It has an awful lot of shade and an extra wide pathway for walking or running. It sports a bike lane but be advised there are specific times for riding, (I think 10am - 3pm). You have the opportunity to see big and small turtles, the famous monitor lizards and many other examples of everyday city wildlife.If you are a runner and your hotel is near Lumpini make sure you head out and give it's ~2.5km look a whirl. The shade and surroundings mean for a peaceful experience. Plus the wide lanes provide plenty of room for everyone.
worth a visit. I went there because we were staying nearby. I saw a squirrel and a couple of big monitor lizards. There isn't a big variety of vegetation but it's quiet and pleasant for a stroll

Thailand's central park. Lumpini park is similar to central park in many respects - it is a large square park in the middle of Bangkok. It has a lake and is great place to relax. It also has areas for outdoor aerobics and an outdoor gym. Loads to see and do but ultimately, it is a park and a fun place to de-stress.
Good chill park. There are people running, some excercises with music, a lot of cast sleeping on benches. It's typical but pleasant park worth visiting
great park in the heart of Bangkok. nice park with big lake right in the center of Bangkok - remains small version of Central Park in NY, very small version:)

Monitor lizards are a must see!. The park itself is not much to look at. However we went early evening in the hope of spotting a monitor lizard. Didn't see much at first so decided to hire paddle boats on the larger pond. The boats proved to be perfect for lizard spotting as they started to come out from under jetties and they are excellent swimmers, we even saw one catching a fish. In all we must have seen about 20 lizards, babies through to full grown. Definitely a unique Bangkok experience

A great location for head spacing. Lumpini Park offers peace and tranquility within Bangkok city. It is free to walk and there are many things to see from push bike riders, tai chi, tennis, walking, monitor lizards, ducks, water activities for families etc. In the early morning there are people selling fresh fruit and vegetables near the entry point to Lumpini Park. I bought the most delicious mango there.
Beautiful gardens, perfect spot to relax!. Perfect place for a stroll away from the chaos of Bangkok. Beautiful scenery, definitely worth a visit!

Something for everyone in Lumpini Park. Lumpini park is beautiful, it's a great way to see the city like a local. I enjoyed seeing the locals working out, watching the children playing and going for a swan bought ride.

A nice park to get away from the crowds. A large and nicely laid out park. Ideal for escaping the crowds in Bangkok. It is a good place to have a nice relaxing stroll. There are many monitor lizards around near the lakes as well some bird life. There is some gym equipment around that can be used, but it is pretty average. A note beware of cyclists during the day.Overall a nice park and recommended if you're in Bangkok.
Huge Warans and Fitnesscenter for free. It it a very clean park in the middle of Bangkok where Warans run free and you can use fitness equipment toghether with thai people. Also great for running!

Oasis in the Middle of Mayhem. Lumpini Park is a 142 acre park that provides an oasis of peace and tranquility in the middle of one of Bangkok's busiest business districts - that of the Satthorn/Silom/Suriwong Roads area.The park was created in by King Rama VI in the 1920s on royal property that he donated to the people. A large statue of Rama VI on horseback stands at the main entrance to the park. It is full of trees, shrubs and a large lake, and is home to a surprisingly large number of birds.The park is very popular with locals and tourists alike for a morning or evening stroll, or for the more strenuously-minded, a jog around the lake or some exercise in the special exercise areas.Do not be surprised if you are stopped by Thais who want to practice their English on you. If you have the time, spend five or ten minutes talking to them, helping them with their language training and getting some insights into Thai culture for yourself.

An oasis in a busy city. Bangkok is a great city. It gets really busy to just roam about in the crazy traffic. So on a recent visit, I decided to go to Lumpini park in the city. It was such a relief to breathe in fresh air here. It is really calming to visit this park. It is beautiful and quite large. There are groups of people exercising here. Unfortunately, I did not visit all of the park, but it did seem really nice to sit on one of the benches and enjoy the cool breeze in the early evening.

Enjoyable Run. I like being fit and during my stay in Bangkok I visited this park on many occasions. There are many scenic spots especially around the lakes. On weekends it gets very crowded but it is always nice to have company when you are having a morning or evening run.

Sunday Jog. As an avid jogger I had decided that my stay in BKK had to include at least a run and I'm glad I braved the 80+°F.It turned out that I missed a race, a 10k that started at 6am (like most races in Bangkok apparently) but I didn't miss the ambiance, the groups practicing Tai-Chi, everybody standing still at 8am for the national anthem and most runners with charity T-shirts, apparently the Thai run FOR something or someone. So if you can't skip a jog that park is the place to go because the streets of Bangkok are really dangerous after 8 am.

beautifull park. our childeren did some excercices there, and we met a man who had a book of all tourists he could find.. he did know lots of words in different languages, he even gave me a note with a few words in english - thai

Beautiful park in the center of Bangkok. Lumpini park is a large and beautiful park and the green lung of Bangkok. There is a nice flora and fauna (birds and innocent lizards). The park is well designed and maintained. The park is also useful for jogging and aerobics. On the small lake there is possibility to rent a small boat or waterbike. There is also a small playfield for young children.

Relaxing green space in the city with real Dragons. The park is well maintained and offers a wide green area to take time out from busy Bangkok. It has a boating lake, outdoor fitness stations, an indoor gym and pool plus small stalls selling local food and soft drinks. There are plenty of bathroom facilities in the park. The park is reached by catching the Sky train to Sala Daeng station or the MRT (metro) to Silom station. In some places the footway is a little uneven. There is a circular road running through the park where people jog, run and cycle. The park is famous for the free roaming large monitor lizards that get on with life despite the people. A good way to chill out for an hour.

Natural beauty and large park. This is a very large and interesting park. Many activities available and entrance is free. Lots of things to do, to see and places to buy water and snacks. One of the most naturally beautiful and well manicured parks I have been to.

relax and enjoy. juxtaposed with the hussle and bustle of Bangkok Lumpini Park is an oasis. My most favourite experience is a Thai massage nearby and then going and sitting in the park with a snack from a street food vendor, some water and my book for an hour of reading. Bangkok doesnt need to be experienced at breakneck speed.

Nice sporty park. We went for a stroll here, at the time were day becomes night and really enjoyed watching all the runners doing their daily excercise.Its an okay park, lots of stuff inside of it and I always love parks in the middle of the big city.Definately worth a visit, if you live nearby.

Great place to relax or get your sports on!. Lumpini Park is easy to get to...it's at the hub of two major transportation systems (the BTS and the MRT) and the intersection of two major roads. You can jog, sightsee, relax, and even ride paddle boats on its fairly large pond/lake. I play basketball here, but you can lift weights, play volleyball, swim (for the latter two, you must join the sports club...maybe 40-50 baht/year along with a doctor's certification of health). A hidden treasure (in my opinion) is the existence of monitor lizards that patrol the canals. Some of these lizards are 4 - 5 feet long. If nothing else, Lumpini Park has an ample number of benches, tables, or simply grass to relax on and enjoy a pleasant Bangkok afternoon.

A huge and somewhat quiet oasis. We went in the late afternoon and the park was busy but not crowded. There is a running lane, joggers, quite a lot of water with cycle-boats for hire and fish, turtles and monitor lizards in the water, a large playground for kids and lots of activities going on.With so much water it was quite a few mosquitoes around, but that goes for most of the city.

A beautiful and relaxing park. This is a great place to get away from the crowds and see how locals live. Take a walk, use some of the work out machines, have a picnic or take a paddle boat ride on the lake and spot turtles and lizards!

Nice oasis of calm. We walked through the park on our way to the snake farm. Nice and peaceful with the lizards plentiful and easy to spot. Not a real destination unless you want to go boating on the lake or run/cycle around but a nice respite from the city never the less

Great place to visit on a Sunday morning.. Lots to see. Many active people playing badminton, ballroom dancing walking, biking etc. Fun to watch the monitor lizards swimming in the lake. Some are 6 feet or more. Not dangerous. Good for all sorts of visits

The best place to get lost. Several times I guided meditation in the park and even if I attach picture of the meeting point, some people keep getting lost, with a good reason. The park is big, there are several roads, but it is such a lovely place! You can sit under a huge umbrella and do picnic, or go running and even there is free aerobics in the afternoon. Such a pleasant place, recommended.

Lots of things to do here.. Compared to other big city park in Bangkok, Suan Lumpini has many things to do. Joining Taichi group in the morning, exercising, riding a bicycle or boat, or just strolling in the park, ect. There is a public library in the center of park so if heat started to get you or your kids, you can take a five and cool off at the library. It is an air-conditioned building and there is a special room for children so you can leave kids here for some time while you can go around park. Of course, only if your kids can stay here unsupervised and alone. There are lots of giant water lizards in the park, especially near the lake but they are harmless so don't be scared. Feeding animal or fish is not allowed yet you can buy animal feeds around the park anyway. Normaĺly, security guards might say something to you if you feeding pigeons but not to fish.Happy trip!
Good place to spend a hot day in some shade.. Good place to walk around and take it easy, learn how Thai people do the same. Have a bottle of water or two with you!

Peace and Quite. very close to railway stations, so not clogged up on BKK roadsm (nightmare), the large monitor lizards are quite a surprise in a public park, dont see these in europe, not in a public park anyway,,,,,,,,good to amble around park, if only for the peace and quite, away from the hustle and bussell of vibrant BANGKOK..........
Nice park when tired of city noice.. A beautiful park in the city center. When you need to relax from shopping or city noise, this is one of the many parks to visit.
Bustling park with cool wildlife . The park was very nice. Well maintained and manicured. The unexpected surprise was the abundance of wildlife in the pond. Tons of monitors, turtles, and fish.
Running. Lovely place for a jog. Many other runners between 6 and 8pm. Very friendly atmosphere. There is a bag storage service at the northwest corner in the park.

Great Green Space. Plenty of shade and a relaxing retreat. Lumpini is a short walk from Silom MRT and BTS Stations. This is a large park popular with Joggers and walkers, and also those who like to sit under a shady tree and rest.

Green Space!. How can one not rate green space in the urban jungle of Bangkok as excellent? This place is a hot-spot for both those living in Bangkok and visitors alike, looking to escape car exhaust. There's a huge, paved walk/runway around the park itself ready for you to get your exercise on and a few little ponds full of fish just waiting to be fed. Lots of grassy, shaded areas to escape the mid-day sun as well. Definitely go!

Very good for cycling and jogging. My favorite go to after a hard day of work. A big park with lots of activities. You can go there for so;e running or cycling but you need to check the hours. Bicycles are not allowed all day.

Run with the locals. If you want to run around a park full of green in Bangkok, this is the place, with distance markers painted on the ground along the circuit. Join in with the locals and take in the sights all around. The monitor lizards are harmless although I did see a runner have to jump over one as it made its way across the path with no regard for any oncoming foot traffic.Go when it's cooler later in the day and take some money for a cold drink if needed.

Nice view and atmosphere for those who want to relax. Lumpini park provides the green scenery with the good faciity and view, especially the lake. People usually use this park for jogging or cycling in the lane, which is in good condition. Parking lot maybe become a bit of problem because there is not so much space. But it is still recommended to come if you want to know about the green area in Bangkok

First thing in the morning, take in Lumpini Park.. Balance is everything in life. The chaos that makes Bangkok such a remarkable destination finds a balance in areas such as Lumpini Park. There are few better ways to start a day than an early morning walk or jog around this park, joining the hundreds of other locals out and about undertaking their daily exercise. It is fascinating to watch the simple and easy interaction of Thais as they start their day in such an uncomplicated and charming way. Early mornings and evenings are the best times as you will avoid the heat of the day. I just can't imagine a visit to Bangkok without spending some time here, it makes me feel at ease and puts a smile on my face as I take in all that is on offer.
Nice park where you can breath. A large green park with lots of fitness activities one can do by himself. We saw some varane in the waters. You can cycle or rent a boat.
A grener location in the middle of Bangkok. Nice park for relaxing from the hyper activity and dense traffic of Bangkok.No need to pay a special visit if you are far from Silom area.
This is a place where you run and relax. Running and peddling the boat is one of my favorite activities in Lumpini park. The area is just bustling with so much energy.
Boring spot. Park like any other just watch out for really big reptiles. I mean big and nasty. A lot of bums sleeping there too

Nice retreat from the city. If you're staying in Silom, Lumphini Park provides a retreat from the city dust, crowd and noise. The place is calm and relaxing, and sometimes you can come across some activities in the park. Beware of the giant lizards though!

Nice place to go for a quiet walk in central Bangkok. Spent a quiet afternoon walking round, looking at large lizards swimming around.
Feed the fish BUT Dont feed the pigeons.

Don't waste your time. Lots of other far more interesting attractions in Bangkok. This is just an ordinary park - not really very much to see. If you have a limited time in Bangkok, do something else instead

A pleasant park in the centre of Bangkok. This park is a pleasant place to stroll around if yoy want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. There are plenty benches to relax and the toilet facility are clean and abundant

Nice place to chill in BKK. Stayed at Muse hotel which is a 5min walk to Lumpini Park. Very spacious and green with lakes and small river. Full with fish and giant lizards. Took one of the small boats around the lake and got some bread to feed the fish. Amazing how much fish is in there. Was very enjoyable.

Average park with nothing much. Can stroll around peacefully. Average park with nothing much. Can stroll around peacefully
Suppose this is meant more for the locals to chill and relax for a moment in the hectic Bangkok city
Morning Walk. Middle of the city...Morning walk in the park refreshing with pure air....calm ..Greens ..Lake...birds ...You should experiences that
Very nice. . I fantastic tribute to the Queen and the royal family. It was redtfull and very well maintained by thr psrk keepers. I loved my time there.

Bangkok's Central Park. Best idea for any days: for sport, relax or romantic time. Many lizards, cats and birds living in this place. I like just siting on the grass or on one of the many benches
with book. Catamarans available too for a small fee.

awesome place to exercise or run in bangkok. awesome place to exercise or run in bangkok - well marked path, greenery, fellow enthusiasts, quiet, relatively good air. I wish every city had place like this in asia. Wonderful. Highly recommended!

Great Place to run. Even though in the middle of the city the vibe in the morning is great. You can join groups or just do you own thing. They have like body resistance gym equipment in the park. lovely.

If you have time see some wildlife.. I didn't visit the whole park but, what you'll see in 10 minutes will be enough to don't forget the visit!
Big lizard, monitor water, walking free in the park, turtles and beautiful birds.
Breath of air. Nice to wander or run around with others at sunset when it fills with people doing various forms of exercise.Oasis from traffic and noise

Great Thai Boxing match. I went here to see some Muy Thai fights. I thought it was great, I sat right up front for 2,000 baht and there were refreshments to enjoy while you watch. I would definitely go again.

Oasis in the concrete jungle. Want a break from the noise, smoke and smell of Bangkok? Lumpini Park is a wonderful place to visit when you need to escape the concrete and reconnect with nature. The park is well laid out with walking and running tracks. There are lots of lakes, trees and quiet places you can go to sit down, reflect and view birds and little animals.If you get hungry there are food stalls outside the wall. Thirsty? there are lots of places to buy a drink in the park.I go at 5am to run the 2.534km around the outside. It is fun to see old mostly ethnic chinese thai people exercising

This park is seriously huge!. Now this is probably the biggest disappointment of our trip. This wasn't originally included in our itinerary but we decided to include because we read on the CebuPac magazine that there will be an Elephant Parade until Jan 29th. Lumpini Park is a huge park and we had no idea where this exhibit is located. We continued walking to the end of the park only to find nothing. Asking random people there is such a challenge due to the language barrier. I managed to ask one woman and she tried her best to get her message across by saying, "Elephant... go home." THAT IS SUCH A BUMMER! I could swear we saw that it was until Jan 29th, but when I checked the website again afterwards, it says Jan 27th. Sob. Sob. We went there for nothing. It was a very tiring experience due to all that walking we did, but it was pretty nice to rest against a tree and just have some quiet time. I truly appreciated that. :)

Total Relaxation !!. Its a vast garden. Full of greenery. You need at least one and half hour to roam around in this garden. Fitness lovers can use open gyms available at every corner in the garden. You can attend aerobics in morning and evening time. Very close to Lumpini Metro station, at walk able distance.

Fantastic Park to visit. Lots to see and do. Tranquil layout supplemented by lakes. Interesting clock tower band stand and library. Exotic flowers and trees. Paddle boats for hire. Exercise machines freely available.

Great park with a lot of activities. There are a lot of activities I this park. When we went there was an organized run, aerobics class, tennis, swimming and basketball. I'm sure there was a ton more to do as well.

good run. great place to run, i run in the early evening about 17:30 , take water !!!!
good place to do a run very easy to follow route, and writing on the floor of the route is a good idea for distance in kilometers, lots of people running very enjoyable.
nice oasis in the middle of the city. very nice to be able to escape the concrete jungle that is bangkok and jus enjoy the open spaces that the park offers.
Lumphini Park. So many lizards! In different sizes! We had a lovely walk around the lake. It's a great public park to escape the stress of central Bangkok.

A really lovely park. A good way to relax in Bangkok. You can walk around the park in 30 mins or an hour, keep an eye out for the big lizards that live around the lake, look for the gym where the muscle guys workout. A lot of people jogging but I prefer to buy an ice cream and just walk to enjoy the beautiful surrounds.

Nice view. Even in business travel, I got a day of tourism to enjoy the quietness and admire some ancient sites in the history of the city with some collegues. And we got some fun moment at Lumpini Park
Only if you need a green break. This is a lovely park - but I'm guessing you haven't travelled around the world to experience a park. Great spot for little kids that need a break from the 'city"

Excellent escape of the heat and pollution. Perfect spot to go for a run, enjoy some yoga classes or to just sit down with some friends, cool down and a enjoy a more pleasant air than in the city center!

Excellent for a short walk.. If your tired of running around Bangkok this is the place for you.The grounds are kept in great condition and you can spend a few hours walking round. The ponds are full of fish and turtles which you can feed (you can buy food from sellers round the park) and massive lizzards roam the place.
All green in the hear of the cty. I 1st came here 12 years and surprised to see such a park in the heart of a city. Great for unwinding and detoxing.

Nice place. It was nice place in Bangkok.I visited there many times for shopping,dinning and sight seeing. Location was centrally located, easy to visit by MRT,subway or taxi.I prefer best dinner time there.
My favourite place to hand and meditate. This is a great park. I often go here to meditate when I am in Bangkok very peaceful and nice to hang out on the grass.

Nice park. Good place to escape the busy streets. Well maintained park with enough room to walk around for an hour or so. A lot of locals jogging in this park after work. If you are lucky you'll spot some big one meter long lizards.

A nice park, but not much to do when we were there. We went to check out this park in the middle of a weekday. We got an appreciation for how nice a park this was, but there was not many othere people around.

Fun day at the park. A large park with lots to do inside - running, cycling, outdoor exercise machines, swimming pool, aerobics in the evening, and 2 lakes where you can hire out pedalos and do some turtle spotting. Even though it was in the middle of Bangkok, it was quiet and the air was fresh. The closest MRT station is Silom.

Nice retreat from hustle & bustle of the city!. I spent half a day here walking around and reading whilst waiting for my mum to arrive from the UK. Its a nice little retreat which appears a million miles away from the hecticness of the city.

Beautiful park right in the centre of BKK. I was quite surprised at the amount of greenery in the city and this park is very much the jewel.
Great place to ride a bike, go for a run or a stroll and even hire a little boat.
Watch out for the friendly, but reclusive Monitor lizards.

Freshest air in Bangkok. I always try to visit Lumpini at least once per trip to Bangkok. Bangkok is not known for fresh air, quite the opposite! Lumpini is great place to get a lungful or two of relatively fresh air. Not many facilities but refreshments are available although quite a few of the concessions were closed on my last visit. Not a problem. All you need is a bottle of water and enjoy a gentle stroll along the, very clean pathways. The Monitor Lizards are a treat.

Oasis in the city. This park is pleasant and big enough to feel that you get away from the city when you are right in the midst of it all. There are a variety of diverse activities available but just a walk around the 2.5km circuit is very nice. As you proceed you can observe all the different groups and their specialities.
very nice and beautiful. very nice and beautiful nice for walking and not far from the main touristic area in bangkok silom..
Beautiful, natural area. Lumpini park is a beautiful green area in the middle of Bangkok. It is nice and peaceful. As you walk around you are sure to see monitor lizards.

Personal favorite!. Spent my last day in Bangkok in Lumpini park - THE WHOLE DAY! It was just so refreshing and nice to be surrounded by everything so green in the middle of the city. Reminded me of central park, definitely. Since I don't have much access to such peaceful nature-surrounded atmosphere back in HCMC (been living here for 2 years now), Lumpini Park was the highlight of my entire trip :)
Just your average park.. Really average park - not a lovely tourist one. Probably not worth the effort to be honest. Heavy traffic in the area - potentially high cab fee.

Dont wear a red t-shirt. Heart of the old kingdom. Roylaists everywhere. Fun to walk around in the morning and watching the Tai Chi exercises going on - average participant age is about 80 years old. Very busy during public holidays and festivals. Good for joggers and cyclists..

Amazing park hidden right in the middle of downtown bangkok. Awesome place to run in the heart of bangkok. 1 full loop is approximately 2.5 km. This park is packed with fitness people at 6am and 6pm. Can get very hot during mid day so go early or very late. Super cool if you visit after a rainy day as the giant monitor lizards like to dry off in visible areas. Watch the road as you might see one crossing the payment right in front of you.

A very nice park. We had a very nice visit to the park recently. Positives - the park is very big. There are several play areas for kids. Our son enjoyed spotting the huge monitor lizards in and around the water. Negatives - things are a bit run down (but good for the Asian scale). It was quite damp and several trees had fallen over - due to recent rains.

a spot of nature amidst the concrete jungle. a small much needed bit of greenery in Bangkok. Small but picturesque. Feed the fish or grab some Thai food at one off the surrounding stalls or the restaurant. peaceful - sort of.

nice chillout but not much going on. Whilst this is a nice green area to escape to from the busy surroundings...there is not a great deal going on so not ideal to kill time.the boats on the lake were ok for about 15-20 mins but again...not much else you can do once you have been round once..

Go see the crazy commodo Dragons. Had a wander around this park for a couple of hours. Initially not a lot to see until you discover the lakes at the side full of commodo Dragons. There are masses of them almost like visiting a free zoo. Very cool and a little intimidating. The food court was shut and to be honest there is not a lot else here.

Good place to relax.. Need a little green eyes is a visit to Lumpini Park just what you need. Nice place to go for a walk.Tip: in the southern part of the park, there are stalls with breakfast. You can rent a rowboat on the lake.

Morning warmer. Lumpini is the place of the locals and foreigners alike for early morning activities. You can walk, run, join a class, sit in the park and watch the crowd or eat breakfast at the food hawker area.

this is THE central park of BKK. Busy but peaceful.. My girlfriend and I go there quite often. It is a large and diverse area with two large lakes, many paths, nice trees and flower beds as well as some slightly more natural parts. In the early evenings many Bangkokians go walking or jogging there, you can do pedaloing on the lakes, enjoy counting the water monitors, see a reasonable number of species of birds, feed the fish, or (not for me) take part in the aerobics.

Pretty park. This is an interesting place, however, it does have the poisonous monitor lizards which constitute a potential hazard. Very pretty, well kept up, centrally located. At night, homeless people sleep there, but are rousted by 0500 each day by the police. Also, particularly in the evenings, a placed for men-women and men-men assignations.
Nice green place in a big city. Nice place for somebody who likes cycling, jogging or just walking in green area. Many people relaxing there. You can get there by BTS.

Quiet restful times. A bit of the countryside coming into the heart of a manic, bustling city. Different walks to take, jogging and cycling tracks. A large lake with views of city skyscrapers hidden around its edges. Corners of different styles of flora and fauna. Interesting all year round and well maintained and nearby streets cleared and washed don each day. Quiet secluded areas. Swimming available for those feeling brave lots of different exotic shrubs and trees to view.
Don't be surprised if a lizard crosses your path!. The park is used for exercise - walking, jogging, gym or cycling. It is a very relaxing atmosphere even if you out for Sunday stroll.

Peaceful . This is an amazing park in the middle of the city which allows you to take a break from the hustle and bustle of down town Bangkok. The gardens are really well manicured and there is a walking/jogging/cycling path around the perimeter. This place is a hive of activity around dusk with group aerobics classes taking place as well as hundreds of joggers taking to the track. There is a huge lake in the middle with peddle boats for hire, you can even buy bags of bread and pellets to feed to the fish. Keep an eye out for the resident monitor lizards during the warmer months!

Relaxing afternoon in the park. Beautiful park teeming with wildlife! Birds, lizards, terrapins and fish all call Lumpini Park home. Be aware the park is a no smoking zone and you may only ride a push bike between certain hours

Great place to slow down in a fast city.. I love walking in this park, plenty of trees for shade on a hot day. there are carts of food and some clothing carts too just outside the park so a snack is readily available most of the day.

Like an Oasis in the city. I love wild life but I didn't expect to see such a range of birds and lizards in the city. It is a beautiful place to wander around, there's plenty of shade. It was also fascinating to see so many locals doing exercise and dance.

Great oase in the center of Bangkok. We arrived by metro (Lumphini), and only had to cross the street to enter the park. At the entrance was a small stall selling drinks, and I recommend to buy something (Hot!). Immediately you will notice the noise level dropping whilst in the park. There are some temples and shrines to look at, beautiful flowers and plants too. A 1.5km walk will bring you to Central World (via Ratchadamri Road).

Green Oasis in City Centre. If you are feeling like some space after hitting the busy Bangkok city streets, you might like a stroll in Lumpini Park. A green oasis, there are many paths to follow and the park is popular with locals who from early morning will be engaged in all sorts of fitness activities, including Tai chi, walking and jogging. It is also interesting to spot the big monitor lizards which inhabit the gardens and lake! It is often too hot to contemplate a picnic, but walk there early morning and later afternoon for some time away from the traffic.
Go see the big lizards!. I only went in search of the lizards and was pleasantly surprised by this park in the center of Bangkok. It was a nice break from the noise and heat.

Nice park. A nice park with artificial lake, trees and bike/walk paths for locals and others to chill. A quick walk and close to other places of interest + metro station. Not a big fan of the monitor lizards/goannas though

Quiet Place Away From the Bustle of Bangkok. Basically a huge park in the centre of Bangkok and a nice place if you want to come and escape the hectic streets of Bangkok. There are some small parks for children to play and some great open spaces to just relax. Likely that you will also see quite a lot of monitor lizards hanging around the waters edge.Nice place to come to relax.
Large garden with lizards. Pleasant Sunday stroll. The monitor lizards are by the water mostly. A few refreshment huts are in the park too

The park is huge and full of things to see.. I went on a morning and saw people doing thai chi, exercising and taking a morning stroll. There are lots of big monitor lizards near the water edge and if you sit long enough they will move around you. I also saw some turtles or tortoises by the water.

Beautiful Park. . Lumpini Park got such a great name where is so-called the Buddha birth - place in near the border Sri Lanka and Nepal in Buddhism episide. The one in Bangkok is great too also less busier than the rest of her attractions.

Bangkok's outdoor gym. Every city has a go-to park for outdoor exercise and this is Bangkok's. The park is a hive of activity in the early morning and evenings. It features a 2.5km running loop including distance markers. Includes a bonus obstacle course in the form of the prehistoric looking monitor lizards who are much quicker than they look. BYO water and catch a taxi or the BTS if you're not staying within a few hundred metres, many of the surrounding streets aren't suitable for running.
Beautiful quiet. Really nice park. We saw it through "bangkok in motion" tour. I would recommend taking a short walk around.
Attractive Park in the heart of BKK. Lumpini Park is well looked after and provides a haven from the noise and bustle of this busy city. Admission is free and the park is quite extensive.
nice park. the greenery all around is the best better than the worlds best of all the all of this is the river all side and the view from there os the best
Saw HUGE Lizards. Nice park in the center of the city. Easy way to kill time and really nice for the free exercise equipment. Cool Lizards live near the water.
Wide open space and well kept. wonderful park for a afternoon walk, very clear and well kept. Many different activities in the park..

Serenity in the midst. . Found a great place for a little peace and quiet in all the hustle and bustle of Bangkok city. Great to be able to relate with a little serenity in this busy city. It kind-of feels like Central Park in New York where one can take a breather in the middle of whatever if happening. Take your stress away and make it happen.

One of the few places left on Bangkok that makes us forget for a moment the pollution and overcrowding of Bangkok.. One of the few places left on Bangkok that makes us forget for a moment the pollution and overcrowding of Bangkok.I like to go in the late after noon when the freshness starts to fall, there are all kinds of free activitees sports, aerobic, tai chi, jogging, etc.the park has a large area with 2 large lakes or you can rent small boats pedalo,Ample parking is located on the outside which is often full on weekendsthe park closes to 21.00 pm

Oasis of green in the middle of Bangkok. Observe locals here! During the morning you can see people jogging, various chinese tai chi, weapon practicing, chinese chess, yoga groups and much more assembled here. More young kdis are here on the weekends to row boats and cycle boats. The attraction is free to everyone and quite safe as there are security and lots of people around. People seem quite friendly and welcoming just dont bother them or be rude like pointing and taking photos if not allowed.

No better place to unwind. Thankfully we stayed opposite Lumpini and had a chance to savour this little piece of tranquility in the middle of this crazy city. Great for unwinding, people and wildlife watching.

Very Peaceful. I love Lumpini Park. The environment , the lake, the gargen are all perfectly calm you. I can just sit next to lake for hours. Many people to run in the morning or night. Very good park.
A really nice open space in Bangkok. Really pretty for Bangkok and lots of open space. You can run the circuit and ride bikes at certain times. A good way to get outside in Bangkok

Such a great escape in the middle of this busy city. Lumpini Park remains one of my favourite places in all of Bangkok, as it is like a little slice of peace and quiet in this frantically busy city. It is like the lungs the city needs to breathe and take a moment and every time I visit here, I am glad I did. A walk though it also shows a different side of Bangkok life as this is a favourite relaxation place for the locals. Put on your walking shoes and head here for a relied for the busyness and for some real beauty of Bangkok.

Beautiful green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Lumphini park is a lovely green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Whether you want to go for a run, a bike ride or simply a relaxing stroll, this is the place for you. Good chance to experience Tai Chi. Almost impossible to miss the large native iguanas near the edge of the lake. Just beautiful.

Great Park. We walked here from our hotel so 10.41km round trip so we were pretty tired on our return but it was worth it. A great little spot out of the busy traffic and a nice open garden. Great for exercising. Would visit here again!

some green in the middle of the city. Walk around our seats enjoying one of the lakes, also you can find in this park some boats to rent, a small temple and some public free gyms.
The downside to me is the cleanliness and maintenance, 2 important points that should be improved urgently.
The top point was the lizard, huge and walking freely around the lakes, something unique.
Nice park for a walk. Big park close to ploenchit road/wireless road and worth a visit. Lots of interesting people and events. Impressive water monitors ( Varaan in Dutch).

A breath of fresh air in Bangkok. I was informed that Thai people and expats meet up in the early hours to exercise and my idea was to meet up and exercise one morning. The best we could do was 9:30. Ha ha.
It is a lovely green lung in busy Bangkok.

Relaxing and cool place. it was a great place to relax after long day walking, it's very good Park for trekking, cycling and doing exercises with local Thai people .. don't miss 06:00 PM hour and you will find a surprise.. just follow the rumor ;)

kool. a cool and scenic spot in between the sky scrappers of Bangkok. A water body with a track around it, so much of activity with people of all ages busy doing exercises, yoga, aerobics and relaxing. a peaceful pocket to relax
Superb trees. Amazing to see such a park downtown. Trees are wonderful, and it gives a peaceful moment in the Thaï mess ;o)

A park in the mid of Bangkok. This is a wonderful park to stroll, sit, cycle, or whatever you wanna do. The park is clean, peacefully and a pleasure to visit. It is the Central Park of NY but way better. When you walk be aware that not only humans visit the park, there are many komodo dragons sneaking around. Big ones but also small ones and if you are lucky they cross your path and glide into the water. Many Thai families have their lunch break and many tourists enjoy the view. When in Bangkok do not hestitate to visit the park!

Beat the heat. Beautiful park in central Bangkok. Great oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. Many joggers in the park and a few lakes. I even saw some giant lizard roaming free on the grass and water... a mini Jurassic Park.

A little getaway from the bustling city. During my work trip, I would come over to the park in the morning for a run. The park opens pretty early, (I usually go at 6am) and closes after sunset (not exactly sure when). During the weekends, there is almost a carnival like atmosphere in the park. Many local old folks would gather to picnic, practice martial arts, ballroom dancing or simply hang around and drink tea. There are free aerobics classes conducted by volunteers which anyone can participate. There is also a public open air gym for people who wanna flex some muscles.In the park, there are a few ponds where u can rent a paddle boat. Be careful of roaming monitor lizards, they swim well. One point to note is the daily National Anthem broadcast at 8am I think. Everyone will come to a halt and be sure to do so too.Overall, Im glad there is a park in the middle of bustling Bangkok. it's a nice change of pace and scenery.

Could be a nice place. The park has the potential to be a nice recreation area, unfortunately, at least in my opinion, it is not.
