The behavior of some of the visitors was disturbing and walking around was not exciting at all. No blame, the park is in the middle of a crowded city with not much green left so everyone looking for a quiet and green corner goes there.

Park. Because i had watched movie called 7 something and this place was one of the set so when i got time to bangkok i must see this place. No different like any other park, i came at night there were a lot of people jogging here

Too many people!. Since most people know Lumphini park when you say "park" in bangkok, this park has too many peopleIt has many entrance but the one most accessible is the one near the bts saladaeng road/mrt silom. This park has various features and perhaps is the "Central Park" of Thailand.There are street food in the evening along the Rajadamri road of this park. The other exit that I have used is the one where you can walk to Langsuan road with also cafes and restaurants.The monitor lizard ( perhaps smaller version of Varan and Comodo ) can be found here walking and enjoying the park as well. I got shocked the first time I saw it!If you want a quieter and less populous park, try the Chuvit park garden which is infront of Sofitel hotel and in between Nana and Asoke BTS

A nice retreat from a rowdy Bangkok. Don't necessarily go out of your way for this park, but if you're close to it and you want to take a break from Bangkok's bustling roads, this is the perfect place to do so. You can spend a couple hours just walking around and enjoying nature's presence. Keep an eye out for lizards, they hang out around the edges of the lakes and they can get impressingly huge!
Did not impact. Maybe we visited at the wrong time 10.00. I get that it is a green space in a sprawling metropolis but I didn't find that it had too much character compared to other world cities

Sweet escaoe. The perfect escape of the crowded city and the noise. This green space is for nature lovers the place to be in the middle of the city. Take some water with you because there are no shops inside.

Nice break from the city. A little oasis from the urban noise, Lumpini park has a nice tiny lake, where you can hire a boat. Large lizards walk free but as far as we saw, not dangerous. But very popular among instagramers :) You can easily spend 3-4 hours just laying on the grass beside the lake, or why not run with the hundreds of runners on the alleys. Outdoor exercising activities are also available.
A breathe of fresh air in the middle of Bangkok. We have visited Lumpini park many times. it is a hive of activity and the monitor lizards are not to be missed

Ok park, stinky dirty sorrounding area. The park looks beautiful from a distance, the bad part is the dirtiness around and the fact that you better not touch the water since it all stinks and is contaminated in Thailand. Nice walking paths tho.

Restful relaxing, wildlife. We visited Lumpini around 4 pm. To our delight they have pedal boats, and row boats that you can go on the lake with 20 baht for 30 mins, with a 20 baht deposit that you lose if you are late back, or as in out case lose your ticket, (that's not on the signs). I. The lake there are fish to feed, turtles and monitor lizards, there are also pigeons at the edge of the lake that you can feed.at 5pm the Zumba/aerobics starts throughout the park in several places. Anyone can jump on in and give it a go. Whilst pedalling in the boat and also walking lakeside we saw big lizards, incredible to see in their natural habitat. They also have a nice playground for the children to play in.

Lots of Joggers. If you jog, jog in Lumpini Park. This is an old park but people of Bangkok use this park! As I've already mentioned, if you jog, jog in this park -- you will be jogging in the mornings and evenings with 100's of other joggers.This is not a spectacular new inter city park, its an older intercity park but I like the park!

A great place to relax. We stumbled on the park by accident and were so glad that we did.In the heat of a Bangkok afternoon, the well maintained park is a real relief. Lots of trees, shaded areas, huge boating lake and walks around and through the park.Lots of Bangkok residents come here to run, jog, cycle, exercise and relax.Look out for the massive lizards and fish feeding.Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.

My sublime oasis in Bangkok. On almost every trip to Bangkok i find time to visit Lumpini Park; it has a very attractive lake with lovely pathways through a wide range of plants, shrubs and trees. Whilst there are plenty of activities going on [cycling, exercise, Tai Chi, aerobics] it is still peaceful. There is a concert hall, various exhibition centres and lovely views across the trees of the Bangkok skyline. The crowning glory of its quirkiness is the quaint bell tower that always strikes the hour at 7 minutes past!!
big park in the heart of Bangkok. it is a big park in the heart of the city. there is a gym also in the park where you have a lot of equipment for exercising. walking distance from patpong street

Surprising but not wonderful . We only had one night in Bangkok as part of a layover, so certainly aren't experts, however walked out to this park and some of the local areas to get as much of a feel for the place as we could in our short time. This park was a real mixture. Lots of activity, runners and families after work. Also huge amounts of wildlife, massive monitor lizards (up to 6ft long) and terrapins dot the side of the lakes which is amazing. It was sad to see so much rubbish around but we may have gone on a bad day. Worth a wander in even if it's just for thewildlife. If your looking for the Monitor Lizards head to the path between the lake on the left of the park, as that's where they seemed to all be.

Heerlijk rustpunt in BKK. I visited Lumphini Park in the evening, when many people are excercising. Walking, jogging, dancing or Tai Chi. It can be quite busy, but still it is a great place to be and to be away from the traffic. In the morning it was even better. Birds singing and mainly elderly doing their exercises and walking with their friends. You can hear the birds and other animals really well. I love this park!

A beautiful park oasis in the heart of metropolis. The first time I went here, this park reminded me of New York's Central Park. For a mega city the size of Bangkok, with it's high rises and skyscrapers and tight real estate, this park is very open and HUGE! It's so peaceful, and so green and full of life - be it chirping birds, or blooming palms ad bushes, or lazy tanning iguanas, Whenever visiting Bangkok, I always try to choose a hotel within a 20 minute walk to Lumpini Park. Last fall, around Thanksgiving time, there was a water festival (Loi Krathong) and the park lake was full of flower wreaths that people put in the water to pray away life's worries and problems. But the park is amazing year round. People go there to do yoga, to go for a morning run, there is even an old school outdoor free weights gym, you can rent a paddle boat shaped like a swan to paddle the lake, and so much more. Highly recommended.

Baby Godzilla's in the Heart of Bangkok. If you love reptiles, you do not want to skip visiting this park. Lumpini park is home to 6 foot water monitors, turtles, numerous water fowl and giant fish. It is unbelievable that is a busy city such as Bangkok that this is this park thriving with such diverse urban wild life. We visit Lumpini park at least one time every time we are in Bangkok

Lumpini Park is a Breath of Fresh Air!. Once you make it across the street (a life-threatening proposition), Lumpini is a beautiful oasis in the middle of busy, bustling, Bangkok. While we were there we saw a very charming exhibit of ceramic elephants painted by artists around the world and soon to be auctioned off. The lake in the middle of the park is a great place to rent a paddle boat. It's also fun to come early in the day and watch all the folks doing Tai Chi. I recommend Lumpini--Bangkok's 'Central Park'--for a lovely respite in Bangkok.

Lots of life in this park, and a lot for children to do. Bangkok's parks are not necessarily main attractions such as the likes of others in NY / Sydney or London, but it is a lovely place full of Thai life and lots of play areas for children. You can also hire pedalo boats on the lake. If the heat doesn't get to you there are lovely running tracks around the lake and gardens too. In the cooler months (Jan/Feb) there are weekly Sunday concerts on the lawns.

Bangkok's Own Central Park. A green oasis in the middle of a concrete jungle. An excellent place to jog, play basketball, workout on the public exercise equipment, and beat the heat. Take the kids to play on the playgrounds or check out the schedule for the free Sunday concerts in the park by the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra.

Be aware of the kaimans. We came here by accident. It's actually a nice and peaceful park. People come here for jogging, Thai Chi practicing or a picnic.What surprised us were all the kaimans (or whatever crocodile-like specious this was) in the river. Although the didn't seem to be small, nobody took notice about them... This was a little strange to us.Go there if you like to relax from the hustle and bustle in the town.

Nice park in the middle of bangkok. Big park in Bangkok town with great atmosphere. Perfect for baby stroller walk,jogging and relaxing. It is unbelievable to find a green place in the middle of Bangkok.But not good for rainy day.
The Breath of Bangkok. I love to exercise in Lumpini Park due to large jogging track and local sport membership rate for swimming , badminton and gym

Beautiful Park. A really beautiful park . Plenty of shaded places if its a really hot day . Saw quite a few komodo dragens here , one was just sitting on the bridge the rest were either roaming around the gardens or at the water parts .
Just another park, nice but no need to go out of your way.. It's nothing special. Nice but nothing there really. just another park that you can find anywhere. No need to go out of your way.

Good run. Good services for change & shower at any corner, plus fountains inside the park to make sure you are hydrated enough.Prefer early hours or later after work, busier but milder temp. Watch out the alligators in the ponds

Park is great on a Sunday ! Try the local food (street restaurant on Silom side). The local food restaurant is one of our favorites. Its located on Rajadamri Road side of the park. Not open on Mondays. Food is cheap and excellent !Lumpini Park is great to visit when its not too hot and on weekends !

Only you have plenty of time. This is a biggest pubic park in Bangkok downtown. Good for relax and strolling around the park but it's would be better to go there early morning or late afternoon. It's really hot in the day time. This park is close to sky train station 'ratchadamri' and 'saladaeng' and subway station 'Silom' and ' lumpini'

Very Pleasant!. The thing that struck us most was that on a beautiful sunny weekend day, the place was virtually empty!!
It's very green and clean and is very easy to find. It's also well worth a visit just see the MASSIVE lizards!

lovelyhuge oasis from the busy city. Our family (2 adults and 2 children) spent an afternoon here during our last trip to Bangkok. We found it was easy to get to via BTS from our hotel. We loved the paddleboats (cheap) and the kids enjoyed seeing the monitor lizards and birds. We enjoyed walking around the park and people-watching. The park wasn't busy and we don't think we'd got around half of it. Wish we'd taken some running gear as there were lots of people running/walking around the well-marked and used paths. All in all, a cheap fun memorable relaxing afternoon seeing a different side to Bangkok.
lumpini park is amazing. in the morning you can see lots of people ding chi gong or thai chi in lumpini park. there are also lots of monitors and other animals. its funny to watch them.

Fantastic Way to Laze a few Hours. I loved the free and easy style of Lumpini Park, its not big and doesn't get a lot of tourists, but a nice way to spend a few hours, walking, taking photo's and admiring the Thai people going through their routines of exercise, lots of unusual wildlife to admire like huge Monitor lizards, turtles and various birds.

Relaxing in the heart of the city. This park was not too far from our hotel and it only cost a few baht to ride the train to the closest stop. It was hot and humid out but there are lots of trees so there was some shade. The paths wind through the park and around the ponds so the view is quite pleasant. We had gone to the park hoping to see a variety of birds. We did see birds including egrets nesting in one tree but there were no waterbirds to be seen. We soon discovered the reason, there are water monitor lizards in the park and if you watch for a few minutes you'll see one swimming in the water. One that we saw must have been two metres long. We saw a smaller one eating a fish on the shore and there are lots of fish in the ponds.Lots of people are just walking but many were running and there is an indoor gym in the park although I don't know how you obtain access. There was also an outdoor workout area full of obviously homemade equipment and it seemed to be well used. A bike lane was marked on some of the paths but signs indicated that use was restricted to selected hours.Overall, the park is a nice place for a quiet stroll and worth the effort to get there. Note; the train station is across a busy road but if you go down into the subway station you can easily cross underground into the park.

Good for late afternoon relax.. It was just in front of our hotel and once we went in, late afternoon, to get some fresh breeze in a quiet environment. It is good for that standing like an oasis in the middle of the chaotic Bangkok traffic. They have some interesting fauna in the park.

Smallish and not great but nicely in the centre of crowded Bangkok. Smallish and not great but nicely in the centre of crowded Bangkok. Almost an ability to get away from the traffic for a few minutes and even breathe some fresh-ish air. But nothing much to do there.
Don't miss it!. Monitor lizards, people watching, coconut ice cream and all around good vibes for families, couples and even runners!

Lovin' Lumpini Every Time. Each time I return to Bangkok, I always visit Lumpini park. A fantastic respite from the heat and craziness of Bangkok and Silom Road. Ride a swan boat, nap under a tree, or just laze in the airconditioned library; I'm always recharged after a visit. At night time, the park becomes an exercise zone, take a zumba class near the entrace or jog along with the hundreds of others around the perimeter. Make sure you don't go against the flow though.
A oasis in the city. Love to walk and just enjoy the quiet and peacefull walk around the lake. Great for running, or Walking and just look at people.

Good place to relax. I stay in Sathorn occasionally and its great to be able to cross a busy road and enter a large and peaceful park Plenty of joggers, but fine just to sit and forget that you're in ther middle of a city of 12 or so million people.

A great distraction from the city!. A very beautiful and peaceful park and a great place to escape from the chaotic big city. Go early in the day to avoid the heat and plan on spending 2 -3 hours leisurely strolling around the grounds. Also do not miss the Monitor lizards; one of the highlights of a visit to Lumpini Park. Easy access from the BTS station. Water and food are available at the park entrances.

ITS A PARK. If you are in town for a few weeks and are a runner or just like to get fresh air to exercise. I would say stop by, its a quick way to see normal people as well.. Nothing really special, other than the outside weights... It also, has gazebos with grills for a picnic...

Lumpini Park Bangkok Thailand. A beautiful park in the centre of Bangkok. Many pathways and roads around the parks water features which also are a home for the large water dragons, up to 2 meters in length. Play areas, jogging, exercise areas, a music bandstand for classical music concerts and many beautiful botanical gardens. Walking around on a hot at any time of the day

A green oasis. Lovely park close to the So Sofitel hotelVery well maintained.Used by Thais for exercise.Lovely lakes and the swan boats are very beautiful to watch if a little too energetic for my knees.Enjoyed strolling in the park when after lunch- quite warm but lots of shade

A nice park. It's quite a nice park, and it's big enough for a very nice stroll. Look out for the massive monitor lizards in and around the lake. Don't, though, get caught drinking or smoking here lest you fancy paying a hefty fine.

Nice Park in Heart of The City. Lumpini Park is located off Silom , easy access from BTS as MRT . You can stroll is the park and forget about city for while. Can rent boat on the lake or meet different size lizards walking around. People jogging and biking and enjoy their park

could be greener.... It is a pity that the park is full of concrete paths and concrete sitting areas. Instead of having more of the green bushes and trees, there is a lot of open spaces with grass. The result is that there is much less shade than it could be and all in all it looks like they struggled to make an oasis in a desert, not like we're in a tropical country with lush vegetation. Don't miss big lizards at the lake!

Heaven in "heavenly' Bangkok. Lumpini Park is one of the best tourist attractions in Bangkok. Truly man made nature's paradise, it is made for everyone, couples, families, children, photographers and fitness freaks.Must visit on the Bangkok tour.

Great Central Park with Nice Views!!. Lumpini park is a really nice park in Bangkok. Two of the parks that I think is the best are 9th King Country park and the Lumpini. Even though Lumpini park is much smaller than the park than the other park that I think is the best, but it has a great view with the background of towers and sky. It just looks amazing. What I liked about the park is the views with the background of towers. But the air wasn’t really good, because it’s in a city, which there were many cars. Also, there were many crow which it is really noisy. The best way to get there is probably take the taxi or MRT. And lastly, you should bring a water with you if you are jogging. There isn’t much shops for you to buy drinks in the park. But still, I loved the views, it’s just amazing, and it is also nice for you to take photographs.

One of Bangkok's few open spaces. I love going here with my daughter (<2) as it's one of Bangkok's few open spaces that she can run around.Tip- Its always hot so you can cool down in the library which has great aircon & a great seperate library downstairs for children & it has 2 play houses. Also a library on the ground level for adults.- Drinks, ice creams & other food are at the different entrance gates to the park.To do- Walking, running & cycling are very popular although there are NO bikes to rent which is a real shame.- Pedal boats, rowing boats & canoes are nice to take out & v.cheap (40b/30mins & 40b refundable deposit). Due to the heat & for relaxation most take pedal boats which have a covering roof.- Open air gym.- Swimming pool- Open air yoga / aerobics (I'm not exactly sure when but I think morning yoga & I've seen aerobics in the middle of the park after work 1700-1800 (I think)- spot huge monitor lizards

Nice moment . I enjoyed walking in Lumpini Park. Very clean, many people are sleeping or have a rest there.People do also their favorite sport and jogging. U can see pharang I reccomend U. Because u are out of Bangkok pollution
Refreshing,energetic,natural!. One of the best parks in Bangkok,in the evening you will see hundreds of people running and exercising with the loud thai music!...beautiful place i will visit it again

Nice Central Park . I was walking around Bangkok and ran into this park . I'm told it's like Bangkok's Central Park . A lot of people jogging and walking and exercising . ( a lot of health issues with locals ) music and a lake and a fountain . Nice .
Nice stroll and big lizards. Great park if you want to get away from the hectic streets of Bangkok. Nice big lizards by the lake.

Beautiful place to relax. I've visited this park on few occasions and every single time I've found it really difficult to leave. Very well kept place. Must visit while in Bangkok if you want to relax, have a little jog or just lie on the grass and do nothing.

Impressive Park. I was passing through Lumpini, walking to dinner, and was impressed by the amount of people out exercising- there were crossfit, taebo, yoga, aerobics, and large groups of folks exercising. And of course there were plenty of runners. It was nice to see so many people out and about, especially with the oppressive heat and humidity in Bangkok,

Great place - need more time and a bike. Fantastic place - heaps to do but we had too little time - and it was very hot. Wish we had a bike - best way to get around I think. Next time will go in early morning - cooler.
Central park of Bangkok. This park is huge. Full of activities, jogging, outdoor fitness, sports. Walking around here is quite nice. locate in the middle of Bangkok. a beautiful park.

Step aside fron downtown Bangkok. Lumpini Park is a great opportunity to step aside from cars, motor bikes, shops and western tourists. It's a peaceful green haven surrounded by skyscrapers and traffic clogged streets. Bangkok residents flock there for early morning exercise and Sunday afternoon picnics but it never seems to feel crowded. There are plenty of free toilets and picnic tables, a chance to buy refreshments at one of the entrances and two lovely lakes providing pedalos and rowing boats. Best of all just chill out under a shady tree and watch a Tai Chi class.

crazy gym. There's an elephants graveyard of gym equipment on Sarina Road near gate 7. Not the park equipment, this is an informal set up that is fun. Would suit chalk dust lifters not the colour coordinated types...

Oasis of calm in a concrete jungle.. I love Lumpini, in the heart of the city, surrounded by skyscrapers, a great place for a walk or just sit and relax at a cafe. Pedalos on the lakes for the energetic and monitor lizards all around (some of which are quite large).
The local Thais use it as a cycle track and general keep fit area.
Nice park to walk and to relax. It is a nice park where to sit and relax. We enjoy reading our book for a while after a walk in Bangkok. The vegetation is really nice and the views amazing.

Great escape from the city. Lumpini Park is right next to the busyness of Silom Road, but it's a peaceful and quiet escape from the city. If you're looking for a properly Thai (rather than touristy) experience, it's definitely worth a visit. It's also a great place to see the huge water monitors lounging in the river. As with all waterways in Bangkok, the river is not amazingly clean, but it is still a great place for walking or jogging.

Good place for running . Again forget that roads full of traffic are all around and forget about air quality there is no choice if you want to run outside.The parc is perfect for running or cycling (special hours for cycling).You will encounter lézards, some of them quite big, turtles, birds.Free zumba, taichee...Nice place for a bit of nature in this city however that park is not that big.

Pandas on Parade!. Went to see“1600 Pandas” by French artist Paulo Grangeon at Lumpini Park. The panda paper sculptures have been exhibited across the globe since 2008 to highlight the importance of wildlife conservation and sustainability. While walking through the park, we came across a large aerobics class and monitor lizards! Must visit this park more often

Retreat from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. A quaint little park with a lake in the middle of an urban jungle offers travelers a respite from the hustle and bustle of the cities in Bangkok. I went on a weekday morning for a stroll and there wasn't many people around, save for the locals doing taichi. There's some sort of a pedal boat rental available at 40 baht/30 minutes at the lake. It has facilities which are common in a park. Park isn't very big and is walkable. Great place if you're looking for some fresh air and green scenery.

Nice relaxing place. I still remember jogging here with my friends or alone in the morning. It was a great time and really great oxygen in Bangkok, you can walk for a while and go to JJ market or other nice park. And it was suck a bit cus I used to go running and biking with my exbut bad memory can't ruin this place. It's just too nice. Should come back more ...this place is for every ages , family , couples, alone.

It's a park.... We went early about 10am, nothing was open. A lot of cyclists and joggers. Our daughter enjoyed the health park & play ground. The highlight was feeding the fish and lizards. You don't go to Bangkok for the greenery.

nice quite place to spend a few hours away from the city noise ,,. great park . good for a jog or just flop on the grass for a few hours . vary pleasant ,, its a place for fitness people ., open air gym , jogging track . rollerskating . anything goes on the road that surounds the inside of the park . in the middle its grass and trees , very nice .
Nice. In a big city like this, this park offers a secure way to walk, run and go for a ride in a bicycle ! Easy access through metro or BTS! Lumpini is ok! At the weekends too crowded!

Great way to spend an afternoon!. Spent an afternoon here a couple of days ago! The sun was shining and we had a great time, unfortunately on Mondays the food court is not open so we had to exit the park and go and get some food from the Japanese district across the street (I wasn't complaining) and we went back to eat our food. The day was particular hot and we decided to rent a pedalow. It costs 40 bhat for 30 mins and you also need to pay an additional 40 bhat as a deposit which you subsequently get back if you return on time. Bangkoks most beautiful park, 100% worth a visit.

It's a park. Large park I. The middle of a concrete jungle. You can rent a paddle boat and go around the lake. It is clean and tidy but very hot not a great deal of shade. When we were there around 20 people had assorted kites out flying them, it was a lovely sight.

Nice retreat from the busy city!. We spent a couple of hours in Lumpini Park which was a great place to go to get away from the traffic, noise and busy streets of Bangkok. While we were there we saw herons and monitor lizards in the lake. At around 6pm there are a lot of people jogging and also taking part in large communal dance classes which is fun to watch.

Nice place for a stroll . Iv been here a few times it's a nice little green space in the hustle and bustle. The first time they had a tent protest but I wondered around photographing lizards and birds. No body bothered me. There are joggers and people doing Thai chi. Sitting under a tree for half an hour can really take the edge off the Bangkok heat. Overall very relaxing. Best part is nobody will try to sell you anything here.
Nice park in the town. A park to chill out and spend some relaxing time when in need to escape the city center. You can rent a small boat and paddle around the lake with your other half

Very spacious. Went for a very relaxing stroll around Lumpini Park after a meal. If this is your first visit, beware that if you want to use the toilet block, remember to buy tissues from the Lady sat out front. You have been warned.

clean and safe. A large park in the centre of the city,that is clean,tidy and safe.It is used by many sports groups and also for walkers and joggers in the morning and evenings.There are many locals use this and it is a great way to come in contact with them,as they love to chat to you when you are in the park.It is easy to get to and safe to use.also a great way to spend a few hours relaxing from shopping

Lumpini Park. The most beautiful park. Lots of walking and jogging tracks utilized by many people. Take drinking water as its always hot in Bangkok. Plenty of benches to rest on. Gorgeous views at every turn, and large lakes to enjoy.Beware of the Monitor lizards (Water dragons)around the lake edges. Some are pretty large ... So best avoided.

oasis .... Great green space in a city that has very little of this left now. Local people watching great. Free gym weight training areas. Yoga, tai chi, free aerobics almost every day. Huge monitor lizards around the lake to see. Nice place to walk in early morning or to run as the locals come out in droves to do.Nice place for an evening walk before closing time too. Cross the park from Silom go across to the Rhum Rudi side and go through the 'paupers village' .
A relaxing park. Lumpini Park was a pleasant place for a break from the heat and noise of Bangkok. It's clean and well kept. Definitely worth wandering through while in Bangkok!

Best place in Bangkok for a run!. Running around Lumpini early morning is the best experience ever, you witness Bangkok locals taking part in their daily exercises. The park is at its best between 6am and 8am.

Nice Park to relax. We spent some time here to dry from the water fights during the Songkran water festival. It's a nice wide open Park with a lot of green. A good spot to calm down from all the hustle and bustle in Bangkok.

Escape from the bustle. This park is a really nice place to go and get away from the hustle and bustle of the big city. The tropical gardens are really well maintained and plenty of seats all around the park to stop and take a breath of fresh air. There are a couple of lakes within the park and lots of large monitor lizards wandering around near the water. As others have said, it's probably the number 1 place in Bangkok to go for a walk/run and the track that runs around it is full of people doing just that. There are also playgrounds for children, a gym area and a section of the park where everyone is doing tai chi. It's pretty central and easy to get to from the BTS Skytrain or taxi and has market type food stalls both outside and inside the park (open at lunch).

Beautiful, well-kept park with lots to do.. We spent a few hours here exploring the park, as it makes a nice escape from the business/dirtiness of central Bangkok. There's plenty to do here, from picnics to pedalos. We hired a swan pedalo for an hour and it was a great way to take in the scenery and relax. The outdoor gym was also interesting to try out. The lakes house a variety of wildlife, from birds and ducks to fish (which you can buy food for), turtles and monitor lizards. Would definitely recommend paying this park a visit if you want a relaxing couple of hours.

Thai morning exercise.. Get up early in the morning and go to Lumpini Park. You will enjoy looking at all the people exercising, single, small groups ore large groups. Many companies employedmeet there in the morning to exercise before they go to work. You will see many interesting and enjoyable ways of exersice, espesially done by single people.Lumpini Park is also nice for an late evening walk. Viggo DT Strömstad

Perfect. My second time to lumpini park and i find it to be absolutely ideal for a nice peaceful walk.Weight pit was very busy and bigger than I expected. There is also nautilus machines.One thing i didn't see was park map areas, so definitely take your own map so that you can explore every inch of this park.It's definitely the central park of bangkok and very comparable.

another world in the middle on Bangkok - go there. this park is so amazing, so green and lush in the middle of bangkok, i go here a lot while in bkk just to walk around and relax unwind, you get so many different people here exercising or just walking in this tranquil setting - the ponds are beautiful
Good for a walk. This place can be easily accessed from Rajdamri BTS (200meters). Good for morning workouts etc. There is also a temporary market selling everyday stuff.

Lush green and relaxing in heart of the crowded city. . Lunch green. Visited this place in the morning and evening. Both the time see lot of people jogging, running, cycling. Old people just relaxing. Seen lot of Laughter clubs,small kids playing in the garden. Always love to visit central garden.

Beautiful place to run/ walk. Very relaxing, where a lot of local Bangkok people go to run or exercise in the morning. There is gorgeous lake and ponds, a Chinese temple, and cute statues. There are places to stretch and workout equipment. Maybe you can spot a monitor lizard on your run!
LOVE!. Honestly this is the gettaway from the city life of Bangkok for all RUNNERS this is where you do your running rather than risking your life on the streets of Bangkok!

Refreshing greenery surrounded by concrete. We visited the park around 6pm on a weeknight and were surrounded by locals running and doing exercise classes in any open spaces in the park. It was a really unique experience to observe all this. The lake and many trees were a refreshing sight compared to the concrete buildings making up most of Bangkok.

Relaxing Haven. An oasis in the middle of a busy city center. I truly love Lumphini Park! There's a lot of things to do in here such as, free zumba lessons, usage of free public gym equipments, boat riding, jogging & other fitness related activities, picnics etc. The place is very close to Silom area, you can use the passage inside the MRT Silom station. This place is so relaxing!

Heart of the City for Running or Sports activities. This is perfectly situated for people who love running but wouldn't opt running on streets for safety reasons. As it is in the heart of the city, one doesnt feel it to be far from their home.Secondly, very well maintained. For running, or evening sport-dance or few Tai Chi in morning one could join in.The Park also provides with a free Gym with basic utilities and a paid Gym with additional utilities along with a Swimming Pool.
Bangkok 2016 visit. Nice park with plenty going on, people really friendly. Plenty. Of toilets!! Handy for Sky Train! Plenty of toys for the kids to play on.

Nature in the centre of BKK. Morning jogging and exercising is what I always look forward in this park when Im in BKK. There are gym equipments in the park, albeit old and rusty and you can see Thai and foriegners using them. The park has many activities, for old people, for teenagers and for couples. Restrooms are not free. Many shops selling food. My favourite are the fruits and the soya drink in bottle. You can also try boating especially if you are with kids. The park is so huge that it has several entrances and exits. be sure to look for monitor lizards on the grass or crossing the paved road.

nice for locals or a little night walk. i work close to lumpini park so me and my colleagues go for a run after work sometimes! thais see parks more as a fitness studio than anything else so be prepared to see tons of people running, doing yoga or having dance classes! gotta say tho it is one of the nicest parks, lots of fountains and big lakes inside so if you are close its good for a stroll!
Good for a run. Nice size park with a good running trail. Lots of trees and many people out walking or running. Great place in the city

Worth a visit. Went on a mid-week day so very quiet. Lots of things to see in the park, so worth a visit-saw a lizard and a few turtles so the kids were delighted. LOADS of exercise equipment, which looks quite new.The food court was closed but there were water fountains - I would say, though, definitely plan to bring water and a few snacks with you at a minimum.

The one lovely place in the whole city. this park is gorgeous , thank god its there to remind you of beauty and greenery in such a disgusting city. we tried to get here a few times to walk in relative peace and enjoy the flowers
Nice place. If you have some spare time in the evening this is the place to go... Nice park with lots of green space in the middle of the city! we even did pedal boating and my toddler enjoyed a lot.

Peaceful with a hint of fresh air. Fresh air is hard to come by in Bangkok, so I counted my lucky stars when we came here. Its great for a walk, so you can enjoy the greenery and the lakes. You can really unwind from the hussle and bussle of Bangkok.They also have a few festivals here during the year and a small market with numerous food stalls for you to try the local foods.

A park in central BKK. A nice open green space in the middle of Bangkok. Take a break from the traffic and shopping chaos in this park. The large monitor lizards that live in the park are harmless as long as you don't harass the little dears. Not somewhere to be at night, but perfectly safe in the daytime.

A serene park in the middle of the city. I recommend to visit at late afternoon for the weather may be very hot. The park is very big and quiet. All you can hear are chirping birds and the trees. It's very unusual to see a place like this in the middle of city where animals can walk or fly freely and used it as their habitat.

Nice place to explore. It is quite a peaceful place to visit, despite being close to a busy road, and once inside the park you don't notice the road really.We hired a pedalo for 80 baht for 30 mins, 40 of which is a deposit which you get back at the end. In the lake, we saw some monitor lizards (I think), birds, fish and terrapins.The park is very clean and beautiful, and we spent a good few hours there.There are little shops selling water and ice creams for very cheap near the entrance - we got 2 waters and 2 ice creams for around 30 baht.Overall, this was a very nice place to visit for a little peace and quiet from the busy city.

Insight into BKK Life. I love Lumpini Park. The park is located right down the street from where I stayed at the Mandarin Hotel and was a pivot point for my long walks through Bangkok. The park is beautifully maintained with a lake and a variety of recreational areas. I'm a big fan of frangipani and walking through the park gave me the opportunity to see these beautiful trees in full bloom. The fragrance was intoxicating. What I liked most about the park was seeing local folks out enjoying the morning (talking, laughing, jogging, walking, tai chi and singing). As I'm sure you're well aware, Bangkok is very warm almost year round; so a good suggestion is to hit the park early. It's well-worth a stroll.
Lovely park to walk around. This park was close to our hotel so walked around it/ through a couple of times. Was great to see the monitor lizards just mooching around :)
A good place to relax or to run. After strolling around in Bangkok it's good to to visit this central green park. To relax a bit, to walk or to run. It offers good space for walking.

Great central park for some relaxation. Always try to spend some time in the park when in Bangkok. clean and friendly people. Never felt threatened. good walking spaces, green spaces, lakes. easy to get to and from by taxi

Park for runners.. Nothing spectacular for tourists but good for running. If you like running head here and first thing in the morning before the heat/humidity gets up.The park is about a 2.5k loop it even has markers on the floor too say how far you are around every 100 meters.There are also 3 or 4 toilets on the way round the loop for those who get runners trots, there is also a shop so can pick up a bottle of water for 8 baht.When I have run here there has always been hundreds of other runners, there are also people doing Tai Chi.

Water monitors and Asians doing Calisthenics to crazy techno. I love this place and come here all the time. Clean, quiet during the day, with early morning and after work government sponsored exercise classes to super fast technoo music that are a trip to watch. Sometimes you also see elderly women doing synchronized dances with flags of some kind. Small and large water monitor lizards wander freely around as well (which was fascinating for me the first time I saw one). You can also walk to the small pond to rent a swan boat. There are various venders near the entrance selling drinks.

Relaxation!. Its so nice to come here for hour or few during the busy days in Bangkok! So relaxing, get away from busy and noisy streets...atleast for a moment. Spotted also monitor lizard here walking around!

A nice retreat!. A very excellent park to unwind and exercise! It is also near our hotel, MRT and BTS stations along Silom Road, as well as the noisy nightlife of Pat Pong.It is also quite shocking and alarming at first sitting and sleeping beside the lake with monitor lizards (some so huge, like really huge) springing up near you. So be aware of that. You can also bike as well, even on a hot midday sun it would be a great relaxing retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city.Plus you get a great views of the city as well!We literally walked our way to Jim Thompson House, so I guess its walkable from there? lol

Clean. Nice to see such an open dedicated park land in the middle of a huge busy city. We had limited time while in Bangkok and only spend around 20 minutes so only really had time to walk around the more popular areas however as we left it started to get very busy with people.

Lovely place. This is a nice place to visit away from theBangkok heat. You can sit in the shade to watch the birds,sit by the river, you can see the tortoise swimming or resting. If you are lucky , even can see huge lizards swimming catching fish n fighting

Great for runners. I love running in this park. There is always so much going on and many interesting things to see. You will often come across displays (such as recent elephants, Bangkok foodie and pandas exhibitions), street theatre and live performances, and see lots of interesting fitness activities. The external circuit is about 2.4km and there are many internal pathways to keep it interesting. Best early mornings and evenings to avoid Bangkok heat! Bring some money if you wish to sample the street food and drinks on sale.

Must visit for everyone who likes running . Daytime the park is just a normal Park, but at about 5pm, people from all around will gather together to make some sports. It is really nice to see hundreds of people running together, some offer zumba or dance lessons for free. It is really worth a visit for everyone who doesn't want to miss out his daily sports routine!

Oasis in the middle of the city. This reminds me a lot of central park in New York City, USA. It is a very nice large green space in the middle of the city. Very pleasant to walk around with paddle boats and a fun playground.
Quiet place. Lumpini Park is a place that is quiet in downtown Bangkok. If dizziness because of the commotion of the city, you should take a rest in the garden expanse and beautiful.
Quiet green place in the middle of urban Bangkok. It's great when it's hot on the streets, there is a lake and shady lawns, don't forget to bring some bread to feed giant lizzards and carps!

Nice park, but... it's a park . We decided to have a have a stroll round this park as it's fairly highly rated on Tripadvisor and we were looking for a more relaxed way to end our holiday. It's a nice park but at the end of the day, it's a park and if you walk around the edge it's 2.6km but in the heat of Bangkok it's intense and will have you sweating in seconds. There is a lake with peddle boats but the boats are really dated and the lake looks filthy! There are monitor lizards around but I couldn't help but notice there are also a lot of homeless people around in the shaded areas, under trees, next to bushes and on benches. Do not visit when the sun is at its most intense which we did between 12-2, it's a killer! Make sure you have water with you if you do head this way. There is some stalls just before you enter and 1 official stall just inside the gate but no further stalls inside so if you don't have any water make sure you buy some.

Lovely!. I LOVE Lumpini park and visited it a few times during my stays in Bangkok. It's perfect for walks, runs, or just sitting over a meal. Very beautiful setting. It gets pretty busy around 4pm with locals getting their day's workout in.
Surprisingly Lovely Park!. Just walking around Bangkok, we stumbled across this park trying to find a place to see the water. Great View of the city! Clean & calm place to just be :)

Don't bother. Nice to walk around in an open landscape in central Bangkok. Besides that, there was nothing elsa that really attracted me.Fun for the children to feed the fish from rental boats.Your precious Bangkok time could be spent wiser.

Just another park. But with monitor lizards.. Traveled quite a distance to this place after reading all the great reviews. But I feel this place is quite a letdown. It's just another park in the middle of the city. Probably would be a nice place to cycle around but didn't have a bike with me so I had to walk in the sweltering heat trying to figure out what to do. The only redeeming point of this park are the monitor lizards. We saw more than 20 in our 1-2 hours walk around the park there and the size ranges from tiny to huge! It was fascinating to observe them swimming in the lake. Otherwise, this park is just... Nothing fascinating.

Wonderful little oasis. We stumbled across this park- wow! It's beautiful and clean, and a wonderful place to wander around. There are lakes where you can hire a pedals, a gym, exercise equipment, a food court, pool, tennis court...and the list goes on. Very popular with locals cycling, running, doing aerobics or just chilling out. The most interesting thing for us was the wildlife. There are enormous monitor lizards just wandering about- incredible! There's also huge fish and Terrapins in the lakes that you can spend hours watching.

Monitor lizards!. This is a nice park - it's pretty much like any other park though, except for one thing...there are 3-foot monitor lizards running around! I saw about 5 of them near the entrance at the intersection of Rama IV and Wireless. They're swimming and just hanging around right near your feet. I mean, where else can you see this?
Lovely park. Decided to come here as it was very close to our hotel, was lovely and relaxing! Loved seeing the turtles and monitor lizards (they were huge). Would definitely return!
Nice place for exercise or chill. There are a lot of exercise equipments that you can use for free. Many benches to chill and there are some shy lizards.

Beautiful park close to several hotels. If you are looking to get out and be one with your mind, this is a great break. There is a large paved path around the entire park. Walk, jog, or just sit and take it in.

Best place to relax or exercise in the centre of Bangkok. My most favourite place in Bangkok so far. In my opinion it is the best place to relax or exercise in the centre of this metropolis. Excellent city park. Every time I visit Bangkok I go to Lumpini Park almost on a daily basis in the evenings. Although right in the centre, you can easily detach yourself from the crowded rush and industrial noise whilst relaxing by the ponds, exercising with dozens of other people (across all ages) to the rhythm of music, or simply go for an evening jog (which I particularly love). Compare it to other city parks, such as Hyde Park in London or Central Park in NYC, and this one (due to the overall climate and atmosphere) would be my favourite.
nice. nice park. possible to chill out. a break from the city. good to walk around a bit or lying down at the grass.
One of the few parks. A good place to get away from the endless traffic and fumes. Lizards and trees, some flowers. Market at night?

A large green space in a crowded part of Bangkok. Lumbini Park is a large park with an artificial lake and wide open spaces. It was created by Rama VI in the 1920s, and Rama VI’s statue stands prominently in the park. The park provides very good relief in an otherwise crowded part of Bangkok.

Exercise Heaven. I live 2 blocks from Lumpini Park and go there at least 5 days to exercise and relax. It is in the center of Bangkok and has a great 2.5 kilometer exercise track. Great place to exercise outdoors and take advantage of the great weather in Bangkok and still get your exercise in.

good to breath and walk in the morning. we like to go here for walking in the morning, if you are stay in Silom area that you can walk directly to Lumpini park, it's not too far you can walk to get a good air with natural view :)
Nice park. It was fun to paddle around the lake and feed the fish. You can buy food for them on the way into the park ;)
Nice park. This is a nice park in the centre of Bangkok, not too big. Good place to spot massive monitor lizards.

Sunrise in Lumpini. The Lumpinipark is just opposite of our Hotel The Dusit Thani.It's great to walk in the early morning through the park. lot's of Bankokians vcome here for Jogging, gymnastic, Tai Chi lessons, cooking classes or others like fruit carving lessons. Where if not here you will meet the Bankokians living in the condos nearby. Daytime if it s not so hot, Office staffs will spend theire lunchtime here. lovely lake and you are a Little away from the noise of Rama IV or Ratschdamry Rd
Lovely. Pleasant early morning and late afternoon for a leisurely walk. Very scenic and plenty of locals out and about for a bit of cultural interaction.

Bangkok does it like the best of them. You've got to do this at least once. Get up very early and go to Lumpini Park; I'm talking really early, maybe get there 6.00-7.00am. I recommend you try this your first morning in Bangkok, when your body clock and adrenaline wake you up early anyway. It will still be scorchingly hot, be warned. Prepare to be amazed, at the beauty of the Thai people, going about their exercises, prayer, dancing, martial arts, you name it, it is going on at Lumpini Park, very early in the morning. Lumpini is Bangkok's equivalent of Central Park in New York, Hyde Park in London, Luneta Park in Manila, the People's Park in Beijing etc etc. Watch out for the National Anthem at 8.00am and make sure you stand up and observe it; then it's all over and people disperse back to their regular days.

A great surprise in the middle of Bangkok. This a big open space in the middle of Bangkok. The park was initially developed in the 1920's by the king. This type of foresight is rare in any country. The park is full of fitness trails and walking routes. there are Monitor lizards in and around the park. This is a great half day of just walking and enjoying the outdoors. This is also a good place to jog if it is nearby your hotel.

Perfect spot in the middle of the city. I stayed across the road from Lumpini Park as I wanted to be close to somewhere I could exercise. Went for runs in the early mornings and the park was bustling with other runners, tai chi practitioners, walkers and people from all walks of life. It was fascinating and made for a more enjoyable run. It seems like people from everywhere come to the park to exercise or to relax. A little slice of tranquility in the middle of the chaos that is Bangkok!

Wide open space within crowded Bangkok. Lumpini Park is a lovely place to visit but as with many urban spaces there needs to be a measure of caution taken by foreign and domestic visitors alike. Females do not need to visit the park alone and definitely do not need to travel into secluded areas of the park without a confident male escort (stay on the path and well in-sight of others). Leave the park before sundown. There are usually street vendors at the entrance to the park so don't bother bringing a picnic unless you just want to. There are little boats which you can paddle around the lake for a small fee and sitting mats which can be rented from a kind lady on a bicycle. When you are ready to leave just leave the mat near the path and the lady will pick it up. If you see a mat by the path, then you can start using it but you will have to pay the rent fee when the lady comes by (no transfers). The statue of the Thai King "Rama Five" is at the entry to the park. If you search the statue base facing the "Skytrain" you will find marks from bullet strikes which happened during the Red Shirt Protest and Military Crackdown in 2010. Decide for yourself if rubber bullets made these marks. Many Thai Citizens died in the defense of democracy around this statue in 2010. Please be respectful.

Awesome park in the middle of the city. Walked here from our hotel based on the previous reviews and we definitely were not disappointed! Within two minutes saw a huge lizard and walked about half the park and my son and I counted 35! Beautiful park to Come to relax, exercise or just sit and read. Definitely a must if you have kids.

Morning or evening exersice is the best in the park. For me it is the best park in Bangkok with a lot trees and flowers...doing exercise in morning or evening is the best, feeling to make yourself motivated for the day ahead
I like lunch time. around the park, many out side restaurant open lunch time. price little high, 5-10B more local price. however that's okay, caz enjoy other place and feeling.

Lovely place away from the busy city. Really cool park that is definitely worth a visit. We got the BTS skytrain here and walked around for an hour or so. We saw the massive lizard things that just roam around freely and came across a man feed lettuce to the fish in the lake. He gave us some so we could join in and there was even a turtle that popped up for food!Really pretty place - highly recommend!

Great place to relax for a few hours. We visited here as a way to relax in Bangkok after a long couple of days in the temples and markets. Lovely park with a nice lake you can take pedal boats out along with tracks to run. The highlight was all the iguanas and turtles in the water and out sunning themselves which was nice to see.

A large surprise, Normally not a fan of a Park. Blown away with how active the local population is before the heat increases before 8am. Amazing botanical environment but also the park is broken up into many areas which form as different activities. Well worth an early morning walk to get the feeling for how the locals live.

Awesome city centre park where you're most likely to see a Monitor Lizard. Work out for free with all the outdoor gym equipment available to use throughout the park, join one of the group fitness classes, or just chill by the water with a drink and watch everyone else run past. A beautiful, must see Bangkok attraction.

Relaxing "Respite". A Great place to get some exercise...... Great running or walking area, with a few other exercise equipment as well.
Beautifully lanscaped.... good location to unwind, and get away from the noisy traffic.

Good place to play and get away from the city. My family and I visited the park on our last morning in Bangkok.It is a lovely green park and a nice escape from the city. There are interesting exercise stations scattered around that the locals seem to love as well as a large lake with boats. There are a number a good playgrounds which suit younger kids. My toddler had a ball playing here and enjoyed seeing the big lizards.It is easy to get to being right on a train station.

A lovely park to walk around and relax. We had a view of this park from our hotel room, it is such a busy little place, early morning joggers and tai chai, yoga etc, there is a lake you can take a ride on, just nice to walk around, you will see quite large monitor lizards which are quite harmless. Nice if you are in the area.

Very Good Places for Jogging / Running or sport activities. Very nice park. Many people do the sport activities in the morning. I just finished my 10K this morning. The pleasant place with fresh air in the morning and you will see a sun rise in the east side of the park. Very nice view

Visited Lumpini Park. Visited Lumpini Park, nice quiet place in middle of Bangkok. We visited mid day, probably better early morning or early evening.Disappointed with the amount of rubbish laying around, needs people to go round picking it up. The Fountains were not working. This park needs some TLC to make it a better place to visit but still enjoyed our visit.

Huge, beautiful, clean. I read about this park which was named after the Buddha's birthplace in Nepal, and decided to pay it a visit. This place can be reached by MRT getting off at Lumphini Station.Lumphini Park was huge and well maintained. I had gone there early in the morning and saw some elderly people doing qigong, and even a one to one taichi training. Besides these activities which were more popular with the elderly, there were also several joggers.At 8.00 am, the National Anthem was played and everybody stopped doing whatever they were doing and stood at attention.There was an exercise corner with some equipment. I did a few rounds.
Amazing. Nice place for a couple of hours break during a sunny day. Plenty of green space and magnificent view of the surronding city. Do not miss it
Day to relax!. Its like the central park of Bangkok with a little pagoda at the middle, good place for quiet and meditation.

Monitor lizards and group fitness . We were told to go here to see the monitor lizards if we had chance and were not disappointed.
We arrived to see hundreds of people exercising, a band playing, paddling on the lake and a really calm atmosphere despite the craziness of the city.
If you are down that way, do take a look early evening. It's worth it!

Riding boats. I love to ride boats together! It sounds fun!!
My views from boat riding was so superb that I can see few animals out of the water!

Take a break and relax in Bangkok. A short walk from a MRT station, you can enjoy a nice walk and see the local folks relaxing. You may find a group doing exercises and one time I came upon a young man practicing his Muay Thai moves! If you have some extra time in Bangkok, then take a break here to view the people in a different setting.
Morning visit. Nice place to have a walk in the morning. There were also runners, and the lane are wide enough to accommodate. Grab some local breakfast by gate 6.
Open Space. A breath of fresh air and a respite from the bustle that is Silom 24 hours per day. Great to take a break from the concrete and glass, even if it's just for a moment.
Very good. This is a big park which u can reach by the metro stations silom and lumpini. It is vry nice and they do activities there and people go there to exercise.

Big park, very quiet. Take BTS to Silom and forgot which exit number but it clearly written on the sign exit. It is huge garden and only senior people who come there and people who jog. I came in the morning so the park is very quiet, there are security guards on the entry and exit although they cannot speak English but they can direct you to the station when you lost. It is green and you can smell the fresh air of trees. There is swimming pool and badminton building. If I don't see it clearly there is a hall or library inside, I didn't go inside, just passing by because there are floor renovation outside. Nice to relax a bit.
Nice greenery in the midle of the highrises. Nice greenery in the midle of the highrises in BKK city but nothing really special..... exept for the quiet...

A green paradise in the middle of the city . If you love to walk and enjoy nature this is a must for you. The park is very beautiful, peaceful and well kept. There is a small area with various fitness equipment you can use whenever you want, some monuments for you to see, tiny boats you can use to explore the pond and plenty of benches to rest on.
Lovely park. went with kids and took a ride with "swans" on a lake. Lovely park but really hot during the day. Suggest going early in the morning or evening.
Beautiful. Just beside our hotel, Park Plaza Sukhumvit. The place is beautiful to just stay, relax, take pictures, stroll.

Love the atmosphere here. This is a park where i run everyday at around 4pm when its hot and humid and was surprised to see hundreds of people also running. There are also some outdoor fitness classes open to the general public which looked great.

Cute monitor lizards everywhere. Nice place to rest and refresh from the big city.
Lots of greenery and small (and not so small) animals. You can also feed the fish right out of your hands... Nice
Good for evening walk. Visited this park during stay at nearby metropolitan hotel. Good for morning exercise routine or for a quite evening stroll.

Great spot to escape the Bangkok madness for a while. Great spot to escape from the hustle and bustle of the city for an hour. Tip: Sit by the lake for a while, you will usually see the impressively large resident monitor lizards

Good for jogging and bird watching. This is about the only place in central BKK where one can jog outdoors. As an added bonus, for me, it has quite a few very tame birds around; the only place I manage to get good photos of Coppersmith Barbet. The enormous Water Monitors are an added bonus.

Not central park but enjoyable. This park was a great stop for a short excursion in a paddle boat swan (80 baht for 1/2 hour but 40 baht is a deposit you'll get back) and to visit with a few local Thais. It was fairly quiet on a weekday afternoon. People were napping from homeless to business people but the monitor lizards were out en masse.I am told there is exercise to be had at 6 am or 7 am and you can join in but this was our leisure day so we got up late and sat and listened to music and read in the park instead.Check out the very old gym equipment that is there for people to use. At night, on the corner of the park there is a dinner square of various "restaurants" more like food carts. You can eat and have a beer with the locals if you can find a seat. Very tasty food.

great park for jogging!. This park was located about 1 mile from my hotel. The path to get there was "questionable", as it involved jogging next to a rather smelly canal, but the park was definitely worth it. I like to go for morning jogs when I am traveling on business, usually around sunrise (which was about 6:30am during the time of my visit). I got to the park around 6:40am and it was already pretty busy. The park is a favorite of all ages and backgrounds. There are numerous areas where locals practice Tai-Chi and yoga, exercise on the aerobic activity areas, and of course walk and jog. There are a few restrooms and water fountains around the park as well as some vending areas for food and drink, so it's well supported for jogging.The park is surrounded on all sides by fairly busy streets, but large enough such that traffic noises disappear in the central areas of the park.The landscaping and the "feel" of the park are beautiful and relaxing, and these jogs were definitely some of the best experiences during my trip.

One of Our Favorite Places in Bangkok. We went to Lumpini Park every morning of our stay, its a fantastic Green oasis in the middle of Bangkok and a welcome place to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life and breath some fresher air. We were lucky as our hotel (Banyan Tree) was only a short stroll away from the park which made it quite easy for us to get to but I would not hesitate to travel some distance to it as it was well worth it.As others have said the Monitors and Turtles are a great thing to see but there are also some nice birds, including birds of prey to be seen. It was great to feed the Koi and Cat Fish which are plentiful and come straight to the top for the bread once you throw it in the water.It was nice to sit off and watch the world go by and its not long before you are engaged in conversation with the locals who were very proud of their park and their city.Lots of little snack kiosks around so getting a welcome cold drink or something light to eat was not a problem.If you are into keeping fit, there are plenty of free outdoor gym equipment you can use and an outdoor gym which again proved very popular with local people.The staff work very hard to keep the park well maintained with some really nice floral displays, especially around by the Kings statue.The park is also a botanical gardens so most of the trees and shrubs are labelled so you can see what species they are if you are into that kind of thing (we are).I would certainly say add this to your itinerary if you are planning a Bangkok trip, we thought it was probably one of the highlights of our visit and the best thing, its completely free.

Quality time right at the heart of the bustling city. We had just finished a late night flight to Bangkok and had some hours to go before our trip to Pattaya was scheduled and we had no energy to go explore the city as a whole. Lumpini Park seemed the right place to relax. So we caught the Airprot link metro to Makkasan and from there, caught the MRT to Silom station, which led us right to the entrance of Lumpini park. There is an information desk from where we collected our Park map. Its a clean neat green park with no-nonsense people jogging,cycling, walking, boating or just sight-seeing, each one at their own world. The park didn't seem to be much of a touristy spot and hence was ideal to get a glimpse of Bangkok's daily life. You can choose to go boating or just stroll around munching the snacks you get around or just lie down and go for a sleep with no concern, just like I did. It's a lovely place to be in Bangkok and if lucky, you can spot one or two komodo dragons as well.
Very Peaceful. I jog around the park in the morning and there was much to be enjoyed and experienced. Surprisingly, there were a lot of people in the morning but very quiet and peaceful.
A lovely park. This is a lovely park but very hot, nice place to while away a few hours. Many people use it to exercise and jog.

Good place to relax and to enjoy some nature in Bangkok . Lumpini park is one of the bigger parks in Bangkok. It has been improved a lot over the last few years and it offers some unique little sights and activities inside.You will find several art installations and interesting statues. There is a small library, a closed and open concert hall, nice pavilions and other things to see. On some weekends there will be free open-air concerts, which are very nice.You can also find huge lizards and turtles in the park or you rent a boat and spend some time on the big lakes.It is also nice to just sit down to watch the joggers, the families and tourists going by. There is also a community swimming pool, tennis courts and a new gym inside the park and the public can train there for a few hundred baht a year. Overall a nice place to walk around and relax for a few hours.

Not quite Central Park. Lumpini Park is set in the center of a host of high rises. There is a walking path around the park with it's 2 ponds (one on the left side; one if you stick to the right side of the park as you're walking). As you get into the park there are some trees which help provide some cooling from the rather intense sun. Both ponds provide paddle boats that are reasonably priced. The better albeit smaller pond is the one on the right if you are paddle boating because it has more shade and you'll be able to see more of the rather large fish, turtles, egrets and lizards. A fun thing to do is to stop at one of 7/11's that are everywhere and get some bread to feed the fish as you're boating.
Good jog. I went there for a jog in the morning. It was refreshing, the track was nice. There were lots of ppl jogging, doing yoga.The park is easy to reach.
Oasis in the hard of Bangkok. It's nice to walk around in the park and they have a lot of sport activities. You can bike, run, fitness and you can even rent a pedal.

Big, green, nice and its free. We go to the Park every week----we cycle there, sometimes our daughter roller-blades there.Often the have food stalls near by, and sometimes their pop-events and exhibitions to enjoy.Face it, everybody loves a big green park, and unlike my former park, Lincoln Park, there is no lake front or beach. However, there are some fairly large lizards or monitors swimming and walking around----be aware !

relaxing and interesting. Lots of enormous docile monitor lizards, worth going to just for that. We went on a Sunday, lots of random things to watch: old guys playing an excitable game with counters, some yoga / strength tutorials, tai chi, outdoor gym, cycling. We then sat in the shade and relaxed for several hours.
Nice to walk around. Great place for a break from the noise and chaos of the city. There's a large statue of the king thats quite imposing

Nice relaxing park to take in the views . Very nice and relaxing park to take a stroll through. Saw may lizards and turtles, can't believe how docile they are. Great for taking a jog or brisk walk. Loads of grass banks to take a nap or have a picnic lunch.

Beautiful view of new Bangkok. Such a beautiful place. As we stayed in old town Bangkok we wanted to see a modern Bangkok too. So after visiting Terminal 21 we went to the park. Absolutely beautiful. As it was +36 outside we did got wet after having fun with water sprinkles :) great idea for refreshing yourself on a hot day :) definitely worth a visit if in the area

A small lung in a Big City!. May it be for jogging around or training yourself, enjoying seasonal concerts in the park, breathing some kind of "fresher" air, a small respite from the noise, or wondering in the sometimes festivals... Lumpini Park is one of the only green spot in Bangkok!
Nice park. Nice park in the middle of Bangkok. Its big and nicely maintained. I walk around more than 1 hour. Is natural style.

Lumpini Park - Nice, relaxing walk. Nice, relaxing escape from the urban jungle. Don't expect touristy sights or a zoo or anything. It's a well maintained regular park that is huge, has jogging tracks, public exercise equipment, lots of cats and monitor lizards by the lake. Provides a slice of life experience while you are in Bangkok. Many locals come for a jog or exercise or simply hang around. It is a massive area and will take at least an hour to finish a complete round by walk.
Tranquil place. Lumpini park is a very tranquil place in a very busy city. Early in the morning it is very interesting to watch people do there tai chi. In the ponds you can see turtles and varaans.

A welcome and necessary oasis of tranquillity. Lumpini Park is one of those wonderful oases of tranquillity in the heart of what's really a nightmare of a noisy city. Here, hustle and bustle is replaced by peace and calm.Any time of day is good to visit, but try around 5pm, when hundreds of office workers, on their way home, indulge in synchronised aerobics to music. Also, for the visitor, a curious thing happens every day at 6pm: everyone in the park falls silent as the National Anthem is played through loudspeakers.

Lumpini Park - an oasis in the center of Bangkok. Many long-term expatriate residents of Bangkok say they couldn't survive without their regular visits to the serene quiet of Lumpini Park. The land for this beautiful oasis was donated by King Rama VI in 1925 and he graciously helped finance it's development. Prior to this it was used for hunting by the aristocracy and is the oldest park in the city. Rama VI's statue adorns the plaza in front of the main entrance to the park.The park is busiest early in the morning cool with walkers, joggers, tai chi exponents, and aerobic dancers. It opens at 0430 and there is always a crowd awaiting access! Between 10am and 3pm cyclists are allowed in the park and they have their own dedicated bike lane - stay clear as they take it seriously! The main jogging/cycling pathway is a convenient 2.5 kilometers for one lap and is marked every 100 meters - great for interval training and timing your runs.Besides the lakes, ancient trees and wonderful flower beds is the wildlife. Water monitor lizards are a big attraction for tourists. Some grow as long as 6 feet and if you are lucky may come across one feeding on dead fish or even one of their own young - yes they are cannibalistic. Besides lizards there are turtles, many species of birds, and the odd squirrel may be sighted in the trees or hopping along overhead cables. Buy some fish food from a local vender and feed the fish - quite a frenzied sight. Boats are for hire and two open air gyms usually allow foreign visitors to exercise free. Dogs are not allowed and smoking is prohibited.The park also becomes busy again in the early evening when office workers conduct their exercise and participate in aerobic dance. You can join in for free!There are plenty of toilet facilities around the park and two refreshment stalls to sit and enjoy a coffee or cool drink whilst watching people enjoy this lovely environment.Easily accessible from the Sala Daeng BTS station and the Silom underground MRT station. Entrance is free and open 0430 to 2030 daily.

Park that changes with the time of day. The tranquil oasis (cliche-alert!) that is Lumpini on a weekday morning, where old folk play checkers and water monitors patrol the margins of the lake, is a different Lumpini from the buzzing early evening scene of joggers, cyclists, boaters and mass aerobics. The latter is spectacle I haven't seen anywhere else and in the years I have been visiting Bangkok, it has grown if anything, despite hot, humid condiditions that would make most fitness freaks wilt in about five minutes. Usage of the park is actually pretty intensive, but neverthless it is clean and well-maintained, a much loved breath of (almost) fresh air surrounded by traffic and high-rise office blocks and hotels..

A peaceful haven in a busy city. Wandered through the park on a Sunday morning. Here you locals walking and running around the park performing their fitness activities, along with various Thai Chi groups. A very serene and peaceful place to escape the madness that is glorious Bangkok. Wander around the lake where you will find Monitor Lizards. A great little find.
Lovely day outing. Big, organized and clean. A great place for a few hours outside to relax and stretch the legs. Nice place.
Nice place you have to visit. Nice place you have to visit. Be careful on big lizards. They are everywhere. But it is interesting to see them, good experience.

A piece of nature in the urban jungle. This is paradise for joggers like me or to people who just need a breather from the city.
The place is quiet, calm and the air is fresh because of the trees. Nice for picnic as well or if you just want to sit and chill.

Enjoy Running. The place is a paradise for runners. I just wanted to run in the park every morning. The air very fresh. Complete facilities, from fitness equipment to the toilet. The place is also very strategic and easy to reach. I'm sure to this park again when in Bangkok.

A break from the hustle and bustle. I really enjoyed this park- came here in the morning and had an al fresco breakfast (food bought from nearby Silom Rd shops). The lake is beautiful and had a nice stroll around the park before heading out for a long day of travelling. Most people in the park are locals who are exercising but don't let that put you off!

A Breathing Space. The ideal place to take a breather. Acres of greenery in the centre of town.Look our for the monitor lizards in and around the lake. Great photos to be taken of lake with the Bangkok skyline in the background.Cheap water available at entrance, not very much inside.
Afternoon Peaceful Time in busy city. Easy walk from our hotel, Oriental Residence, pleasant relaxed walk through park and time spent peddallo on lake, feeding fish

A fun place for young and old. Big turtles, giant fish, huge lizzards and a big array of birds are a few of the wild life you can encounter here. For a walk or jogging, some cycling, enjoying the free fitness equipment at your disposal or just lay down in the gras and enjoy nature, this park offers it all. Being surrounded by many busy roads it is amazing how silent it is. A real gem in the concrete jungle.

Bit of nature in a jungle of high rises. Felt good to spend a few hours here and get away from the busy part of town. Nicely kept with lots of flora and fauna to take in, a nice river runs through the park as well.

Green paradise. Any visitor to Bangkok knows it's pretty difficult to find green space in the city. If you're nearby, take some time to walk around this city park. Bring something to eat and sit on a bench by the water. Every morning you'll see different groups of people doing Tai Chi. My visits are mostly during the late afternoon where it feels like any one who is a runner is running on the pathway that circles the park. Where else are you going to run in the city?At about 5:30-6pm, I've seen an aerobic class near the main entrance. The music is blasting and at least 50-100 people are moving to the music which is being led my an instructor. I'm almost certain this is a free class. I've also seen two work-out areas. One is an outside free-weight section. The equipment looks old but people seem to use it. The other is recreational equipment that mimics machines one would use at the gym. These machines use a persons natural body weight to help you work out. Escape the chaos of the city streets and enjoy the calm of this park.

Nice park in downtown Bangkok. We stayed at a hotel nearby and enjoyed the park. In the early morning people come out to exercise. You will see Tai Chi classes, aerobic classes, joggers, walkers, etc.

green space in the middle of a city!. Great green space in the middle of the city! My husband and I ventured out here to get away from the hustle and bustle. Art sculptures, dragons, workout spaces, pond, pavilions, plenty plants.

English garden's like park. Quiet, clean and green park in a city that definitely needs more parks like this. It's big and not that crowded but it's quite far away from any other attractions. Nice views over new side of Bangkok and its skyscrapers. Look out for meters long lizards around the water, there are quite a lot of them!

Relaxing. After a long day may husband and I decided to go and relax in this park. We loved it. It's nice and quiet with people having picnics and just strolling around. You can rent a swan boat and go around a big pond if you want. Park is very clean with some food vendors outside the gate
A Good Place to Jog. Some parts of the park is for construction but it is still a nice sight to see and experience. A picture perfect place for tourists and photographers alike.

Beautiful Park With Limited Food Options. I recently visited Lumpini Park which, as many reviews describe, is a wonderful little green paradise in the middle of the hugely congested and over-populated city of Bangkok.The park is beautiful, with plenty of greenery which is maintained to a high standard. It has a few small lakes where you can take a little boat out and relax on the water. You will almost definitely see some monitor lizards, which I thought was amazing! These large reptiles may look scary for the first time but they are very timid and just wander the park and go for a swim!There is a wonderful monument of King Rama VI in the South-West corner of the park.The only let down is the 'food court'. This is pretty much all closed down and dilapidated. It could be a thriving mini food market but all that's left is a few small fruit stands. If you wanted to go for a nice walk in the park and have a bite to eat then pack your own food as you will need to go for a long walk to find somewhere to grab a bite near the park.(P.S.
