I visited the park at noon on a Saturday afternoon; a time I thought would be perfect to grab some food)

The green lunge of the big mango. I simply love it. Simple, secure, clean, safe, a real pleasure for the eyes, the body and the soul and of course for our ears, far away from the traffic, pollution and noises of the big mango.

Lovely park in the middle of a busy city!. This is a great place to go and relax in the sun and get away from the hustle and bustle of the streets of bangkok. Buddhist little temples are around and you can see a few thai people praying and offering flowers and insense, There are a couple lakes in the middle of the park and along the edges you can see many many very large monitor lizards!! either swimming or sunbathing. they are incredible creatures and its worth going just to see them!

Relax in the city. While getting to beach side for relaxing would not be a viable option in Bangkok, Lumphini park provides an escape inside the town for a short escape. In the morning, may will exercise and jogging around the lake in the park. There is also a small market at the sides. It is good place to see Bangkok city life of both local and expatriate.

Soothing niche in hectic Bangkok. A nice places to take a break from hectic Bangkok. Fortunately the park is located right within Bangkok itself & easily accessible via metro, taxi, tuk tuk or foot. Great for people watching. We brought some snacks & did a whole lot of people watching.

Exercise!. Our hotel was within 15 minutes walk of the park. We tended to go early in the morning when it was cooler and power walk laps around the perimeter. Love the distance stencilled into the pathway so that you can keep track of distances walked or run and keep time. I love playing spot the monitor lizards. Tip, watch them swimming!

LISTEN TO THE QUIET!!. This was a fabulous retreat from the bustle of the busy city. So quiet and peaceful and as we were there during the week not many others were around though I believe the weekends are very busy.

Bring a camera!. Not only is this a beautiful park. It's also the home of water monitors and turtles. We spend a lot of time trying to capture the great moment when this lizard stuck its tongue out. Worth a visit and it's easy accessible with public transport

Nice little thing to do when bored. We came here to work out at the outdoor gym. It was a good place to do so. They also have a track you can walk around or jog! Not the easiest to get to from Khaosan road since theres no metro from there

A lovely public park for any time of the day.. The huge park is located close to Silom and has a lot activity options for excercising or relaxing. There are a lot of aerobics groups in the evenings or can go for a paddle boat ride in the lake. You can also spend the afternoon relaxing under the tree shade in any part of the park. The park is worth a visit.

A green oasis. The entrance of the park is conveniently located next to MRT. Lumphini park is highly popular with locals. Regularly Thai Chi classes, aerobic classes fitness classes will take place for free. In winter every weekend the Bangkok Symphony orchestra will perform in the central pavillion. Furthermore you can rent boats on the small lake. Interesting flora and fauna with a multitude of birds, squirrels, monitor lizards etc..

Lovely escape with fun quirks. My favorite thing about this park are the aerobic sessions that happen in the late afternoon 4-7pm! I've spent many afternoons enjoying my time in Bangkok with a book, and I've witnessed these impromptu (sort of) sessions where one person will bring a stereo and a stage-type-platform, on top of which they will begin doing exercises to upbeat/80s aerobics/techno music. Other people will show up and just follow along, and at the end there is a donation box where people drop change to say, "Great session! I feel the burn!" Open for all ages, very popular with the older generation!I also love feeding the fish! They are ravenous!Or just come to enjoy the greenery with a set of earphones or good book (or both)!
Another wonderful visit and walk around taking photos. First visited in 2015, returned in 2016 and enjoyed taking my time enjoying the vibrancy of this beautiful Park, in Silom.

Wonderful park in bangkok. If you want some peaceful & quite place, lumpini park is the place to go to, a big park to walk and see the thai people relexing as well, a green place at the middle of cehotic bangkok

Nice park - good place to chill out, but nothing special. I spent a hot morning here. That's a nice place to walk and chill out, but nothing special as we could read in guides or as Thai people could tell you. You can walk, buy food and drinks, probably rawing (I didn't try), but I couldn't find a place to rent a bike. People come here with their own bikes (bikers speaking English told me). As you exit from the park, tuk tuk drivers are already waiting for you !!

Nice place to relax. Nice place to relax from noise and chaotic Bangkok. I would not say that this is park should be included in top 10 must see places, but if you are not far from it - just take a walk and watch magnificent lizards.

Best park in the heart of Bangkok. I usually go for a run at Lumpini Park. One round make 2.5 km, small but still one of the biggest park in Bangkok. It's good for family with kids to spend morning or evening walking, picnic, or any activities together.

Lumpini Park. This centrally situated park is a popular meeting place for masses of people, and unfortunately was also the site of violent disturbances leading up to the removal of the last civilian P-M,
Yingluck Shinawatra.

The oasis. Situated next to the Silom MRT station and very close to Sala Denaeng BTS, near busy Patpong area is a green oasis in the middle of the busy and vibrant Bangkok. It is more than strange to stand in the Silom junction and see on one side the entangled concrete transportation network, tall buildings , hundreds of cars running here and there and on the other side the large, quiet, green Lumpini park. Best having a stroll in the park during the late morning to see the young and older people gathering for some physical training
some relaxation in the city. great for a stroll. watch the bangkokians train in 30 deg C! see some varans crawl through the bushes, or maybe even peddle boat on the pond.

It's massive.. Peace and relative quiet in the middle of bustling Bangkok. Lumpini Park is popular with locals and tourists alike. It has big grassy areas with numerous trees offering some respite from the blistering heat. A large lake where you can hire swan shaped peddle boats {they have sun shades} and explore the area and feed the fish. Look for monitor lizards either swimming on the surface or sunning themselves on the bank.

Escape the traffic. A haven of tranquillity amidst the hustle and bustle of Bangkok traffic and the air feels cleaner in the park. It is a very pleasant place to walk around and to look at the various plants and trees growing here.
wonderfull way to relax. wonderfull way to relax your self its give you time to bread air frech its take you away from the busy madniss traffic city bkk

Well worth a walk. Lumpini Park was an easy walk from my accommodation in Bangkok, and is a very pleasant park to walk through if you have the time. The size of the park was a surprise, and many locals use it to walk, run, cycle through, or for exercise. There are multiple buildings, gardens and things to look at, and don't miss seeing one of the local water dragons which flat close to the edge of the water. There are some great city views to be seen from points within the park. Just don't forget the sunscreen, the sun can be very intense if you are not under shelter. Enjoy!

A great place to stop relax and reflect. The park offers just what one might expect...A tranquil place to rest, read a book or take a snooze. There are fish in the lakes along with ducks with people selling bags fo pieces of bread to feed them. There are plenty of benches and some play areas for the kids also.

Relaxing park. Came here to get away from the madness of the city and really enjoyed the break. Even saw a group of monitors wandering around the lake and having a swim. A good place to go if you just need to chill and people watch for a bit.

An oasis in the heart of Bangkok teeming with life. I love Lumpini Park which is an Oasis in what can be an overwhelming City. Located at the top of Silom, it's a great place to unwind and experience being a local. In the evening before it gets dark, the locals come out for running and hiking around the park as well as huge Aerobic sessions and the many open air gyms and it's a great atmosphere. The park is lovely with lakes and quiet areas as well as the busy exercise areas. At 6pm the jogging stops and all activity pauses as the national anthem is played. For a couple of minutes there's total quiet and then it all starts again.

Nice way to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. We spent a couple of hours here relaxing in the shade and watching the giant monitors (one of which had caught a pigeon) . Good for a break from the city and the heat

Central of Bangkok, Well Maintain, Good for Morning Exercise.. For Those who stay in the busy business area like Silom Road., Lumpini Park is really a good place for you to keep your morning walk and exercise, there is also a good food court that start from the early morning like 6am. Overthere you also can see local culture of exercise groups, plenty of big old healthy tree and plants, good to try to visit and you will like it.
Nice place for a Sunday Morning walk. Great Park for a walk. Things to see and do if you are interested in relaxing or exercising, and a few places for food.

This park is a sanctuary near the river. I really liked the feel of this place. There is certainly enough activity going on depending on the time of day that you go there. This is a place you can go to take time out in busy Bangkok, it is great for a walk

The park of wild life!. Beautiful, empty of Thay people is tourists! It's in the middle of the city and by the sky train and metro! We could not understand why there were do few people there! Although we loved to have it all to ourselves! There were all sorts of wild animals including giant lizards that kept us fascinated all the time! They are simple all over the place and particularly in the grass areas near the water. Amazing creatures that we don't normally see in Hyde Park! The trees were unbeliveble and so were the flowers and almost everything in this park fascinated us! Take water with you (toilets are not difficult to find) there are no cafes or many places to buy drinks around, but we got coconut water by the entrance and also had some sacks and bottled water with us!
GREENERY IN THE CENTRE OF BANGKOK. Great place to walk, jog or ride your bicycle, away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Bangkok. Green, airy and offering a good tropical scenery.

Beautiful Park with Paddleboats!. Wonderful green space with a large pond and surprising amount of wildlife for a city park. Close to downtown malls, hotels, embassies, about a 15 minute walk from the BTS public transit stop.

Loved Lumpini Park !!. Had some time before I left for the airprort , I decided to search for attractions near me on tripadvisor. Beautiful park with a great walking and cycling track. The park has a lot of free gym equipment as well. The highlight of the park are the monitor lizards roaming about in the creeks in the park. Great birds as well. Nice way to leave Bangkok !!

Cheap fun. Kids loved it. We spent a lot of time here last week feeding the birds, fish, turtles.Pro tip: guy at front gate sold us old bread scrap bags at 5 bags for 40 baht; other vendors asked 20 per bag... falang price? Who knows.Swan boats 40 baht per half hour plus 40 baht refundable deposit. A half hour is enough to make a quick lap around the lake. It's tight.Playgroud. Not well shaded. Get there before it gets hot or wait till later in the afternoon. Bathroom nearby. Mens room was nightmarish. (but not as bad as the infamous Luang Prabang bowling alley)The most bizarre thing occured. One weekend afternoon we'd just entered the park. Tons of joggers doing the loop. Suddenly the national anthem comes on (6pm); and everybody just stops. Cool, but like something out of a sci fi movie (like the Matrix)On Saturday night we found some good street food in northwest corner (parking lot). But not there on Monday. Go figure. =)

Beautiful park to watch the sunset and stroll around in. Me and my girlfriend visited this park on a whim. We were were staying in Sukhumvit and fancied a walk. Visiting the park was her idea, i have to give her all the credit :)The park itself is lovely, very well kept with a huge lake. Probably best not to visit in the middle of the day though as it's really hot. As the sun sets, the park is transformed into a truly stunning spectacle, reds, pinks and purples reflect off the sky scrapers in the distance. In our opinion, at sunset, it's truly one of the best places to take photos in Bangkok. Worth noting, just before sunset, every Thai person (without exception) who was in the park turned to face one of the sky scrapers and stood in silence whilst (i believe) the national anthem was played on loud speakers. It was a strange, but intriguing experience.

Amazing place in the middle of hustle and bustle. We saw the park as we passed on the sky train and thought we must visit this place, we did and its a lovely place in the middle of Bangkok mayhem. We went twice on the second day it was a huge Rotary event with everything you could think of had a great day out both times.

The green lungs of Bangkok. It's a nice little break away from the traffic and noise of Bangkok. Take a little wander and you'll likely see several large monitor lizards who inhabit the park, and people taking their morning constitutional.It's where many people go to walk and jog, and work out. There are weight stations where you can ogle the body builders pumping weights.Sometimes there are fairs on with stallholders selling their goods, and some years during the Thai winter they screen open air movies.When the mayhem of Bangkok gets too much, it's a haven to retreat to. Just don't venture there at night - t's full of feral cats, and it's a major pick-up spot for the ladies of the night. Make sure you take drinks with you as sometimes it's hard to find vendors.

Beautiful Park. This place is a buzzing in the morning and what a wonderful time to spend your morning or evening in this park filled with people walking or just lazing around. I would recommend bringing your track shoes to run around the park to see the whole area, I love the outdoor gym and occasionally you may spot the komodo dragon munching on a fish beside the lake, but do be careful not to go near them as they bite. Bring some coins for the vending machine if not drink from the fountain tap provided.

Relax and enjoy nature . We weren't expecting to see giant lizards and were given a shock by one that came right up to us. Despite this the park is an extremely relaxing place and I recommend a boat ride for 40 baht. Really nice place.
Take a rest. Just grap some snacks and a book - and stay for some ours in Bangkoks Garden. Really nice. To find it: Take BTS to Sala Daeng an take exit 5.

great day out. visited recently and if in Bangkok a few days would find the time maybe to wander round for a few hours one afternoon.we actually went looking for the reptiles only to find that there was alsorts going on,there is also a fantastic collection of street food there

Great big park with lots of play areas. Really nice, big place to walk around. Visited when our son was one and now again when he's two. Lots to keep them occupied at the park and much older kids having fun too. Plenty of exercise machines for adults and a cycle lane for those with bikes. You can rent pedal boats - we didn't so not sure of the price. Drinks available at the gates to the park. Didn't see anyone selling inside. Shady play area over by the Rama IV/ wireless road side. There's a bigger play area in the centre of the park but pretty out in the sunshine most of the time. We walked around and saw Komodo dragons lazing around. Great for our son who loves all kinds of creatures.

What a surprise!. I only had one night in Bangkok (you are welcome for the ear worm) and was staying in the area near the park. My friend and I were amazed at the work out options within the park and it was great to see the monitor lizards and turtles in the water. A beautiful park in the middle of the city and a great opportunity to take in some natural beauty. Easy to walk a long distance without noticing it. I'd bring some water as it gets very hot.

Great haven from the bustling city. This park is quite serene surrounded by a river and a lake. Many locals go here to do exercise - running, gym and recreational sports. The park is rather large and a great space to relax. Although watch out for the big lizards in the river!

huff and puff. great oasis in the heart of the city. Such a dynamic work out spot for locals - everything from joggers to outdoor elliptical machines. Not sure what they call their version of "zumba" but very energetic and fun.

Good walk. A big park in the middle of the city where you can walk and jog on weekdays and on weekends. Sitting by the lake, resting and reading a book is one of the best way to spend an afternoon here. Just make sure to choose the space where theres no komodo that will bother you.

Peace and quiet in the bustle of the city. It is called the lungs of the city and it gives you a place to unwind and take in the views of all the buildings around. From dawn to dusk there is always something happening but you can just ignore it all and relax by watching tai chi classes or the people on the lake.

Went there for a lazy afternoon with a close friend - and it was perfect. I don't really know what to write about this park. Nothing extra ordinary, but nice to spend a lazy afternoon with someone close, or family, or with a book. You can also go there for a jog if you are staying nearby. Its not Central Park of NYC. It is smaller, but neat and relaxing with greenery and ponds. The landscaping is nice too. And husbands, while your wife is busy shopping nearby, it is not a bad idea for you to just go and lie down there thinking about life.Its a park, and a neat one. You can visit it if you got time, but not a must visit.
Busy. The park is surrounded by some very busy roads. Not ideal if you are looking for a peaceful place.You can simply stroll through it , if you are on foot :)

Great park. We had a lovely walk in the park. And we could see that people came there for severel reasons. Some came to relax, walk, workout, do yoga, pilates, sleep. Very relaxing place in the middle of Bangkok.

Beautiful park in the middle of chaotic Bangkok. This park is a serene break from the crowded streets of Bangkok. Feels like Central Park in NYC with greenery surrounded by tall buildings. Nice to walk or just sit on many benches surrounding the small lake. Swan paddle boats, exercise equipment and a playground complete the scene. Add to that the five foot Monitor lizards running around and eating birds. They don't appear to be a threat to people. Nice place to relax.

Oasis to get away from the traffic. This park is a treasure amidst the traffic of Bangkok. You can reach it via metro, but before you can enjoy it you need to cross the busy street, which makes you appreciate the calm and green atmosphere this parks offers even more. You can walk along pretty lakes, you can also rent a pedalo on the lake, there are plenty of benches to sit and it appears to be safe and clean. Definitely worth a visit and break during busy sightseeing.

Great place to relax and de-stress in the middle of Bangkok near Silom Road. This is a beautiful and peaceful park right in th middle of the city. Reminds me of Central Park back in New York City. There is a lake with row boats and giant lizards which are amazing when you see them. You can get refreshments outside the park entrance near Silom Road when you enter. Catch a nice shady spot and take it easy for a while. Very relaxing expecially in the middle of frenetic Bangkok. There are families, lovers strolling, people reading newspapers, having lunch and oicnics. But do not try to smoke here or you will get a scolding from one of the paro police and maybe even a fine. Respect the tranquility and you will have a very nice experience.
Quiet in the city. Loved walking through the park. There are a lot of locals doing their daily walk, jog, tai chi. Places to sit and relax. Paddle boats for rent. Well maintained and safe.

Peace in the heart of a crowded megacity. My room at the Sofitel overlooked this park. I enjoyed watching the swan boats in the lake, the bikers and joggers, and daily tai chi enthusiasts. Although finding a way to cross these mama busy city streets in fear inducing, the park is worth it.

clean, greenery area in middle of BKK city. this place is perfect for jogging, walking n enjoy the park
its good to have park in middle of hectic city
i spent afternoon walk n sit on d bench for minutes

Great park for exercise lovers. Great park full of people running, jogging & walking in the evenings. There are also numerous exercise machines for people who want a different kind of exercise. Beautiful surroundings and you wouldn't even know you were in a big city. There are good facilities here - toilets & places to buy water & snacks. Really easy to get to (right next to Silom MRT station) and well worth a visit.
nice park. But have not been here since 2008, what I remember there is no restaurang inside. But it is rather large park.
Calm but busy. Went there on a very hot Sunday. Loads of stalls selling clothes and handi crafts and food and drink. Was pretty busy but you could find room to avoid the crowds if you wanted to.
pleasant park. Pleasant park to wander around.very close to main and noisy road, but this is like an oasis in a very busy world.not a lot to see except a break from the madness of bangkok.

Nice getaway from the city. We watched the Bangkok Orchestra perform in the park one Sunday night, which was really nice. Good place to relax or go for a jog in the park. might get a bit crowded some times.Bathrooms not that clean.
Beautiful Place For Walking. Such a peaceful green space right in the middle of a very busy business district of Bangkok. Really enjoyed the paddle boats, too.
Great place to relax. A really nice park in an easy-to-access area. Just catch the BTS! Sit on the grass for a picnic or go for a stroll. The swan boats are awesome too - give them a go for 40 baht!

Calm in a hectic city. An oasis amongst the frantic Bangkok buzz. Despite being a weekend the park was quiet which is a surprise, when you consider how pleasant the area is. Large green areas, a large lake with boats for hire. Feed the ducks and fish, have a snack, use the childrens play area all in an oasis in the middle of a concrete jungle. They also seem to have events in the park as a concert was in the process of setting up during our visit. If you're in Silom area and fancy a little break from your shopping spare a hour to have a drink and ice cream on the grass around the lake - you'll feel refreshed and ready to go for the rest of the day.

Morning jog . We stayed at Sofitel So, next door to the park. We woke up early due to jetlegg. We went there and jogged around the park. Calm, not many people absolutely peaceful! So green and lush! Just perfect!

Great park for families and running. We visited the park many times on our stay in Bangkok. The kids loved the playgrounds (which included a Michelin tyre play area) and adored the swan peddle boats which could be rented for 30mins. It was also great for running round at around 1.4km loop. We saw lizards, turtles and loads of fish - again a great child pleaser. The toilets were very clean too.

Nice relaxing day out. Relatively average as far as parks go.. You can see lots of fish in the creeks and huge monitor lizards wandering around. Nice and shady area, with a little lake and boat remtal.

Great for having a relaxed break. I love this park for having a relaxed break in busy Bangkok. In late afternoon / early evening time you'll see some fitness activities over there which you can join for free. Also the park has some animals around you could enjoy. You can go there very easy with the MRT or BTS.

great space. Lush greenery and great people watching a stones throw from Silom's crowds. No cafe inside, and lots of ants, so take a mat and drinks. Go in the late afternoon to watch the sun set and the locals jogging, dancing and relaxing.

Wow. Amazing. This park was my favorite part about Bangkok. It is beautiful, has nice bike lanes and also a free gym which I made full use of. Also this park has these insanely huge lizards I've never seen before which was really cool.
I don't know why our guidebook suggested this spot.. We made a special trip to the park and I was disappointed. It was dirty and there was lots of garbage.
nice place to walk around. Nice and relaxing place to walk around in.you can also go on the waterboat in the shape of a swan.Very nice

Lovely Park. Lumpini Park is a wonderful peaceful and calm oasis in the middle of Bangkok. The park has many exotic plants and trees. Lovely green lawns. Two lakes with pedal boats for hire. Lots of shady areas with benches and picnic areas. There are children's play areas, an open air gym and exercise machines, an open air swimming pool. If you're looking for a place to escape the hustle and bustle of central Bangkok, take a trip here. You won't be disappointed.

Green oasis. This park is a little oasis amongst all the craziness of Bangkok. Go there for some peace and quiet and take a stroll around the lake. If you want any refreshments buy them from the kiosk at the entrance as there didn't seem to be anywhere inside to buy drinks etc.

Golf lovers. I was staying in a hotel facing this beautiful park . Everyday people who love to play golf , can be find in small groups everywhere in golf section. During the weekends , some other functions like football or other game can be seen .
Nice Park. It is nice park located in good place, it is totally green and big, and it is easy to access by many transportation ways.

Nice wildlife . We enjoyed our walk in the sunshine through this park. It's nice but not especially beautiful, however, there is a lot of wildlife to enjoy. We saw turtles and very big monitor lizards which was nice. Lots of people running and using the gym equipment. Worth a visit if you are staying close by but I wouldn't travel far to see it in our opinion.

A respite from Bkk's concrete jungle. Lumpini Park sits on the crossroads of Silom, Rama IV, Wireless and Rajdamri and is a welcome relief from the noise, heat and bustle of Bangkok. The verdant landscape is cooling to the senses, and in the middle of the the park, it is serene and quiet. In the mornings, Lumpini is filled with walkers, joggers, tai-chi dancers and even some ballroom dancers. Groups of older Chinese-Thais bring their own tea and snacks to have breakfast after their morning strolls. Large monitor lizards crawl out of the pond and sun themselves on the grass, a rather startling sight at first glimpse. In the evenings. Lumpini is also bustling with activity, but in the heat of the day, you may have the park mostly to yourself. Stop by if you need a rest from the city.
One of few green areas for a run. This is one of the few green areas in Bangkok to go for a morning run. Has a nice little circuit for running... and outdoor gym area and a playground. Worth a visit.

Don't go for the playground. Don't go for the playground unless you live there, or have lots of time. The playground is not that great for young kids (under 5). No baby swings. Nothing for my 1 year old to do. My 3 year old got on one of the slides a few times, but there was no swing suitable for him. It was an old, kind of run down play set. The park is nice enough, but nothing worth seeing if you're a tourist on a short trip.
Love Lumpini. Love this park partly because it is where I first met I husband (very food for first date on boat lake) but its also a nice big green space right in downtown.

Lot of activity in this park...it is a must visit.. Huge park in Bangkok...great people watching, lots of walkers and runners as well as an exercise gym in the park. Very well maintained....lots to see...it is free....walk around or have a seat and observe all of the people moving about.
Lovely place. Lovely place to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. I the middle of down town BKK, here you can find a oases of tranquillity.
Really Nice Park. A nice park, a way to escape the hectic of Bangkok. There is a MRT station near the park. Small lakes with fish, picturesque green fields and plants.

A Must for Boxing Fans. This is the venue for Thai boxing and there are boxing night at least once a week. They have reserved seats for tourists which get you very close to the action. Well worth a visit.

One of the best place to get peace of mind and be fit. Great place to relax, organize picnic or spend quiet time. It is peaceful with a lot of greenery to cool the heat of Bangkok. Also there is a playground available for children and even a small pond where you can paddle boat around.If you are a fitness person then this park is filled with enthusiastic joggers in the morning and evening and you can also utilize the fitness equipment available (for free). Also I have noticed a swimming pool and other fitness/gym centers here.
Nice way to let the day slow down.. Quiet park where you cn enjoy scenery. The lizards and turtles are nice to check out as well. They do not like people. Very close to subway stations.

Tranquility in the centre of Bangkok.. A haven of peace surrounded by the chaos that is Bangkok. Great place to eat your picnic or street food and even take a paddle boat or rowing boat around the ornamental lake for 40 baht, less than a pound. There is a moat surrounding the park which contains large iguanas (thought they were crocs at first).At about 4pm, every jogger in Bangkok turns up (hundreds of em) for a run around the park circuit. At 6pm on the dot as in most places in Thailand everything stops for the National Anthem including the runners. Also the biggest outdoor aerobics class I have ever seen was taking place near the entrance gates.
Nice. We liked this park, its really big but in the middle of the city. Next time we come Bangkok will bring jogging shoes, this time we forgot but had a nice walk around.

An oasis of peace and quiet in a hectic city. This beautiful park was created in 1924. No cars or motorbikes are allowed within its walls. There are designated bicycle lanes and bikes can be ridden there between the hours of 10:00am and 3:00 pm. We stayed in the Aetas Lumpini, and took advantage of this delightful oasis multiple times. The Elephant Parade Bangkok was taking place while we were there and we really enjoyed seeing those unique works of art displayed in the park. While you are in the middle of the city, all the trees, lakes and landscaping make you feel you are away from all the hustle and bustle. Definitely worth a visit!

Lumpini Park. This Park has always been the breath of Bang.kok. It is nice to walk through and get some fresh air - before all the High rises started to consume the city. It still is now a relaxing park and in the centre of the busy city you can walk through it and feel like being out of a big Cosmopolitan.

Amazing wildlife . The park itself is okay however the wildlife made this experience worth while - there were so many wild Monitor lizards and turtles everywhere which was amazing! Would recommend for a couple of hours to escape the hustle and bustle of the city - very close to Siam square which is handy.

A bit over developed but none the less an oasis. Lovely green park a great respite from the noise and pollution. Joggers, family groups, tourist all frequent it. Not crowded though and well maintained by small army. Has lakes,rivers and flower shows. My only downer was the amount of buildings encroaching on this green space. I always walked back through it from the BTS station on my way back to the hotel.
Average. For me, it was just a park for relaxing. I don't discover much in this place but it is a park in a city centre of Bangkok.

perfect morning walk.. lumpini park was right opposite to my hotel dusit thani. i used to go there every morning for morning walk and it is high spread park with quite atmosphere in the middle of the city.

Excellent Place To Take A Walk And Enjoy The Scenary. Lumpini Park is a perfect place to go near the business district of Bangkok known as Silom Road as well as Sathorn Road. This is a great place to take a walk and see some nice flower arrangements and a very well groomed park

Little peace in Bangkok. Lumpini park is a great place to come and relax during the day and evenings.
Clean, well maintained, green and quiet park in the heart of Bangkok
Bring blanket or a mat and relax. go for a run, do yoga. take a nap. read a book. listen music, or take your beloved to spend good time
jogging. Lumpini park is a very good place for jogging or can do aerobics classes in the evening (there are always lots of other people so not feel lonely)

Great park for exercising for free. This park is absolutely beautiful. They also have free exercise equipment scattered throughout the park. The machines are mechanical, not electrical, so you can't see time or calories burned, but it definitely beats going to a gym. If you're a runner, the path around the lake has distance markers about every 100m, and one lap is about 1.6mi/2.5km.The park also has colorful elephant statues, a lake, playgrounds, and awesome landscaping.

Green park for relaxing, walking and enjoying the day/early evening. Lumpini Park is a lovely, clean and well maintained green public park with plenty of trees for shade right downtown with easy access and lots to do. Everyday activities/resources include: running paths, bicycles (can be rented just outside the park), small boats (including cute DUCK paddle boats!), playgrounds, basketball courts, and many relaxing sitting areas/benches/gazabos for resting, relaxing and reading. We totally enjoyed just wandering about and enjoying this little bit of nature in the middle of the modern city. The park is also a venue for other city events like:- Sunday nights (5:30-7:30PM) in January the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra hosts a free concert (AWESOME!)- The "elephant parade:" decorated elephants that will be actioned off for charity.At different times there are food vendors by the main gate (south east corner) selling fruit, BBQ, and drinks. We snagged dinner one night at the night market (very small) just outside the west side of the park (yummy grilled fish). There is also a convenient metro stop in the south-west corner. Limited parking available around the outskirts of the park.

Unexpected gem. We walked to Lumpini Park on a Sunday morning and were pleasantly surprised to find a lovely park with things for our young kids to do. We were fortunate that it was a cool morning and we spent a very relaxing time at the park. There were food stalls just outside although we didn't have time to try them out as it had started raining by the time we were done. I'd go back there again.
Lush green oasis in the city. Beautiful park to walk and enjoy. You might even see one of the several big monitor lizards that live near the lake edge.
A peaceful park in the middle of the city. lovely peaceful park with a large lake to stroll around.Look out for the iguanas who live in the park, some are huge.

Getaway in the city-center. Nice place to chill when it's too hot outside (mostly always! haha). A lot of trees and a lake definitely help to forget about all this skyscrapers around. It reminds me of NY's Central Park, but the atmosphere is more exotical. Great place for families as well :)

A delightful Oasis in the Middle of the City. This is Bangkok Central Park , a 5/10 minutes walk from city centre. A 2.5 km running Circuit flanking a large mature forest like park with big trees, intertwining lake, gym, boxing arenas, Chinese temple and children playgrounds. In the late afternoon you have several group activities spread over the Park and you see the Fan or Sword dancers, Tai Chi devotees , Aerobics Enthusiasts . In mid January '16, Thailand launched their Tourism Festival over a 5 day period. The Park was hosting this Event. There was a Big Stage in the middle of the Park that had many different dances and musical performances showing the rich culture of Thailand. There were different Light Installations, Gift Bazaars and Food Stalls. It must have attracted several thousands of people during this time.The Park is a Leisure Centre of Outdoor activities. Quite beautiful and a pleasure to visit.
Very relaxing. Very relaxing park but it can be crowded with too many people still it is big enough for all. Sadly we can't bring out dog for walking with us. but a must go for relaxing.

Oasis in the middle of a bustling city. The day I visited the park there was a festival on, so there was a lot of people, stalls, food and music. I would assume that on a normal day things would be a lot calmer. Take a walk around the park, or sit under a tree by the lake/pond and watch the world go by and just wind down.
Pleasent. Nice getaway from moisture and heat. Nice open gym and place for jogging. Near mrt station, easy to find.
Beautiful park. Great for escaping the business of the city, although, right in the center of the city. Very relaxing, great for jogging.
Nice venue for a morning stroll or a quick cycle. The park has a track to allow you to run or cycle (dependant on the time of day) making it a nice venue to burn some calories.

Lovely place. Nice park in the centre of Bangkok, access to sky train and buses near by, you can walk or cycle few hours. If it's too hot you better stay in with A/C on or if you like me go and see it anyway. not far away from snake farm.

A touch of green in the urban jungle. There's not a lot to say about Lumpini Park except that it provides a welcome respite from the teeming concrete jungle that Bangkok is. I love Bangkok but if you want to have a walk run or cycle, Lumpini is one of the few places you can do so in central Bangkok.
Great. This park is great, have boats to rent on the lake, play park for kids and big (but friendly) lizards to watch.

Fantastic gardens in the middle of Bangkok.. Spread over an enormous area Lumpini Park is a great place to visit simply just to relax or for the athletic ones amongst us to exercise in a great environment. Very beautiful gardens and meticulously maintained.

Beautiful Park!. Lovely park in the center of Bangkok. You can buy food to feed the fish and there lots of different areas for exercise. It is fun for kids and adults alike. One of the best things to do is go and play on the free exercise equipment around the park.

Good park inside the city . Good park to relax inside the city and free to get in. Open 4am-9pm that's good. Many people go there to exercises, relax. If you want to drive there on weekend better go before 4 pm or after 7pm because was crazy traffic.
it worth a visit. we stayed 500m away from park so we took a visit; we were extremely fortunate because there was an ongoing exhibit

Great place to relax. Great place to relax, have picnic, to jog or take a little boat and chill on the lake. There's always something happening there and it's very popular among locals. It used to be a museum and after WW1 it was turned into a park.
Great for kids, families and couples.

Nice green amongst the buildings. A park is a park and I've seen many. But this park does have something a little bit special. I've never been to a park before that has Komodo Dragons walking around free. For this reason its worth an afternoon hunt to get the perfect photo. Watch out for their teeth they are sharp and can move faster that you realise. The swan boats I only see young romantic couples on them but very few are being used.

An oasis of calm in frantic Bangkok. Check out the ballroom dances in early morning hours.. A tree-shaded oasis of calm in frenetic Bangkok. I loved seeing the ballroom dancers doing the waltz, cha-cha, and rumba in early morning hours.

See the skyline, giant lizards and body builders; paddle a canoe; bring your camera!. This good sized park near centre of the city provides wonderful free attractions: especially the large (metre-long) water Monitor lizards (not dangerous, but I wouldn't try to feed them or get too close) swimming and crawling on the grass around the lake. There is a series of outside fitness machines where you can do your gym routine for free, or rent a canoe (or other watercraft). To get some motivation, watch the body builders pump iron in their outdoor gym, or observe the marathoners circling the pavement. Take some time to enjoy the views of skyscrapers from this unique perspective; there's always something to do in this beautiful place.

Quiet park with the occansional music blast. We lived nearby lumpini park ,and decided to take a walk there. IT seems to be a very popular park to exercise in, as there were a lot of joggers. They even had free aerobic sessions scattered over the park! As we were sitting on a bench and eating ice cream, suddenly everything and everyone stopped what they were doing, as they started to play the national anthem! Quite cool to witness.I recommend this as a break from Bangkoks never ending buzz.

Greenery is every where. This is a huge garden, i was staying in Sukhumvit and wanted to visit a near by attraction in my spare time, so when i was looking near by attraction i found out Lumpini Park which about 2-3 Km from Nana Square and its on main road, can walk or by go by taxi

Great elephant art exhibition, kids will enjoy this park. We spent a couple of hours here. There is a lovely outdoor art exhibition of painted elephants and activities such as paint your own elephant until 29 jan. Hired the swan paddle boats and got a bag of fish food. Great feeding catfish, carp etc. also saw tortoise and monitor lizards swimming including a huge one up to 2m long. Combined this with snake farm which is only 5 mins walk away.

Just in time for the festival!. Our second day was just perfect! We went around the town and made our way to Lumpini Park, surprisingly they are celebrating Tourism 2016 and it was just so nice to be there celebrating with the locals and other foreign nationals. Everything you see is what describes Thailand as a country. From the food stalls, to clothing's, to scheduled performances and a lot more would make you even stay longer!

A nice spot for some fresh air. I was staying at the Dusit Thani, right across the street, so I went for a walk one morning in this large urban park. It's quite pleasant and we enjoyed exploring a few sections of the park, as they were setting up for a big Tourism Exhibition. Saw a big , I mean big, monitor lizard lounging in the sun, which was unexpected.
PARK. This is a nice park in the city.A good place to go for a walk in the morning or evenings. Lots of locals here.A pond in the park.

Excellent Thai Exhibition. We went to see the Thai Culture Exhibition last weekend, it was really busy with a lovely atmosphere. We really enjoyed seeing some lovely fabric from different parts of Thailand. Also there was a huge selection of food on offer, well worth a visit. The park itself is lovely, good for a nice walk/jog or find a bench and read a book.
Jogging. I go jogging in Lumpini nearly every evening, there are always lots of other joggers there, which is good for motivation

Saw Thai Salamanders. Great park - tons of locals and foreigners alike out jogging, doing tai chi, etc. Saw some wildlife (Thai Salamander... not sure if that's the real name) and birds. Good place to relax in the middle of a busy city.

Nice to go in the evening. We have been here during the evening, and it was very interesting. Hundreds if not thousands of people doing aerobics or running. We heard that there are huge lizzards here, but did not see any.

A beautiful park in the heart of Bangkok. We were lucky enough to be in Bangkok for the tourism festival at the park. The festival provided all the Thai culture, arts and food you could soak up. We visited the park the day before it started too, and it is a well laid out space where you can have picnics, hire bikes or paddle the swan boats around the lake.

nice green oasis in the middle of the city. It is a surprise to find such well taken park in the middle of bangkok along with all the building , there is a little lake and small river , we loved the peaceful atmosphere and the set up of the area . nice place to stop and refill after so much shopping .
Nice but.... We came here to enjoy some nature, its a nice park but it rained and there was not enough covered places to hide from the rain so we got soaked.

Lungs of the city. I love this green space downtown. Surrounded by traffic and tall buildings its still a lovely retreat, always a few degrees cooler than the surroudings due to the trees and water bodies.

A nice afternoons stroll in pleasant surroundings.. This is a bit like central park in NY in that it is surrounded by the hustle and bustle and skyscappers of Bangkok but is a peacefull island of tranquility.Other reviews have described in detail what is in here so I will simply add that as an escape from the concrete jungle this place is perfect and the best thing is it is free.One tip though to be carefull of - The park is totally smoke free zone. If you are caught smoking inside the park the fine can be as much as 4,000 Thai Baht, nearly 100 Euros.

Central Park of Bangkok. A cute park that is very clean and filled with life in the morning! Walked through it early in the morning after arriving in bangkok jet lagged, and was surprised to see thousands of joggers and yogis doing their thing! There is also a nice market where you can buy some food amongst the locals. If you are into working out, you should definitely join the joggers and use one of the many outdoor exercise machines that are placed throughout the park. Also be warned, there are giant lizards that share the greenery with its human guests haha

best place for the morning run. this park is located in the middile of the city and easy to get there by skytraina and also MRT, the park is opened from 5.00 AM , a nice place for the morning run. 1 round is about 2.5 Km.

Quiet walk. We came here on our last day in Bangkok before leaving for Cha-am.It was great as we managed to walk there from our hotel.Although the BTS station is nearby.Close to the embassy district of Bangkok. It's well worth visiting. In such a large city as bangkok it great just to kick back and enjoy the peace and quiet. It's a huge Park with a lake.Places to sit and plenty of car park spaces. Vendors are outside of park selling ices and cold drinks. It was very hot the day we visited so only stayed a hour or two.Would recommend to visit earlier in day when not too hot.Plenty of seating areas covered /shaded from direct sunlight. But not much to do other than walk around lake at midday as everything was closed.Met plenty of local Thai people who are very friendly and quite happy to stop and chat with you.

A nice break. The park was very close to the hotel we stayed at so we took a stroll through. Was a very welcome break from the business of the city. Lots of places to rest and enjoy the scenery. The views of the city were also impressive. My only disappointment was that I did not see the giant monitor lizards that I heard live in the park! Maybe next time!

this park is entertaining. situated right in the middle of this big city, lumpini park is the oldest and probably the largest public park of bangkok. the landscape and its flora is nothing to talk about. what is the most interesting things here are the people and their activities. here, you will see people doing things that you won't see at the world's major parks anywhere. there are activities such as sword dancing, ballroom dancing, traditional thai takraw playing, karaoke singing. they are doing all these as forms of exercise. besides, the variety of food available at the park especially in the morning is great. come early in the morning, six o'clock is ideal. make sure you stay until eight pm., so you will witness the locals stop completely from their morning activities just to rise and pay respect to the national anthem. this is pretty unique.

Morning Nature of daily life. I did a 5km morning jog in this park as it is near my hotel. What I like about this park is I can see morning activities of daily life. Badminton, Tai-chi, joggnig,lake,waterfall, and many status. I like to experience what the local are doing early in the morning and experience their lifestyle. Glad that I did this jog and capture many beautiful status in the park

Not really an Oasis just a bit of green space. This is a vast expanse of park, but it provides little shade. there are some interesting skyline views of BKK and many Monitor Lizards (I think) roaming about and swimming in the ponds. Not really a destination more a place to people watch and stroll is you need to get away from the chaos

Wonderful Oasis In The Middle Of Bangkok. This is absolutely a beautiful park in the middle of Bangkok. The lakes look well maintained and paddle boats are available for those who want to take a boating of sorts. The park is safe with ample security and has many events throughout the year that one can attend. This is truly a nice place to take a walk and relax. The large monitor lizards that you occasionally see are simply sharing the space with you and mean no harm.

Green space and tranquility in Bankok. We have cycled through the park, walked through and attended a cultural fair last weekend. It is the place to relax after being in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.

Lizards and fish. Nice green area in central Bangkok , good for a nice walk or just to relax.Good to see lizards in the wild. You can buy food to feed the fish. Pleasant place to spend an hour or two.

A nice place to sit and watch the world go by. This park is at the top of the Silom Road. It seems to be the largest public green space in central Bangkok and is well kept. There are paths, areas to sit, a lake, exercise machines and food stalls by the gates. Go at 5pm when they play the National Anthem - but remember to stand up. The runners all stop and stand to attention and is a lovely Bangkok idiosyncrasy.

Awesome park in the middle of the city.. Awesome park in the middle of the city, great place to go and relax, lots of people use this park, visitors and locals for excising or walking around or sitting down and talking, great place for children.

Probably the most beautiful area in Central Bangkok. Here is quiet. You only hear all the birds. Here, the air is much cleaner than elsewhere in Bangkok. Here, you can meet 2m long lizzards, scores of beautiful birds, turtoises, Tai Chi performers, runners, walkers. The park is beeing carefully looked after.We wished we had more time to spend there, after walking around for a few hours.A must visit!

Great place to relax. Bangkok is just a busy city. Lumpini Park is just the opposite: a quiet park, pathways lined by trees and a huge lake to sit or walk along. We took some snacks to sit close to the lake and watched the sunset. During our stay in Bangkok we were quiet a few times in Lumpini Park. Next time I am there I will go back again!

Lizards in the city. Do you like lizards (and/or fish)? Are you in Bangkok? Then this is place to go. Can be quite crowded in the morning, but it was still possible to find somewhat quiet place to watch them. Also great for jog if you are into that. Loved it and hope you will too:) Btw it is right next to the MRT station.

Nice respite . Bangkok can wear you down with all the traffic, noise and heat. This park situated well to the downtown tourist zone is clean and reen making it a nice place to take a break . Granted as some have said, it's just a park, it does offer lakes, small boating and a great place to walk or jog. I wouldn't put it above the more interesting attractions but would keep it in mind as a refuge Inn when you need it.
It's just a park. This is just a park with nothing that distinguishes it from any other park! There are no food or drink stalls just people jogging around.

Strange Place-Watch Out. This is a certainly a green oasis in the city, not sure why the clock tower has a different time on each of its 4 faces? the paddle swans are very old school but I was not going anywhere near the water. Apart from the "Komodo" Dragons of varying sizes that swim in it, I bet the Turtles and giant eel's would be a nasty surprise? a few smelly homeless types in the park but its better enjoyed from your hotel room as the Komodos lurk around and can actually bite

Nice park for running and to relax after a hot day in BKK. Around 5 pm is the perfect time to visit Lumpini Park. You can see some locals doing there running exercises and you can watch big varans lizards crossing the ways. I always enjoy sitting there and relax from a hot and heavy day in Bangkok.
Around 7 or 8pm the local motorcycle guys meet at the entrance. Nice to see.

Green Oasis. Visited between 4 and 6pm, it is a lovely green oasis in the middle of a hectic city. It was getting busy with lots of locals coming after work around the time I was leaving. There were lots of markets stalls to pick up a bite to eat and nice places to sit. Snacks all reasonably priced 40bht for papaya salad etc. While I was there, there was some traditional dancing and also craft stalls.Take the MRT to Lumpini, exit 3 and cross the busy main road, the entrance is right there.

Exercise culture in Thailand. Every morning my husband and I walk this park. We really enjoy seeing everyone walking, doing Tai Chi, biking or working out on all the free exercise equipment. You do need a 5 baht to use the restroom.
The Big park for relaxing. I have been this Park often on my weekend...It is nice place and good for work our or relaxing ..Many people come to do activities

Serene park. I nice green interlude from the urban energy of Bangkok. It's a great place to see the locals going about their lives - which seems to include lots of exercise, as viewed in strolling through the park in the early evening.

A great way to experience local life. We walked to Lumpini park from Sukhumvit. You can take BTS Metro as well. It was a great experience. It was so different from the hustle bustle of the city. There were runners on the trail around the lake and when the national anthem came on at some point, every one stopped and stood still until the end. It was great to see the national pride and respect. At the other end of the park there was some free dance exercize class with several organized participants. My buddy and I decided to join in and it was awesome. You can end your trip at SiLom. There is a night market and some restaurants in the area.
Peace in the middle of the city. Take a gentle stroll through the city centre park. You'd never know you were in the middle of Bangkok, it's so peaceful (once you've found the way in).

A Peaceful Park In the Heart of Bangkok. Lumphini park is a peaceful park in the heart of concrete jungle named Bangkok. To go there, people just need to take MRT to Silom or Lumphini station or BTS.Is it comfortable? Definitely yes. You can take a long walk in the park, seeing elders of Bangkok practising tai chi with real swords, or running with fellow runners. If you really want to be sweaty, you can also do aerobics with electronic tunes in the evening or lifting some weight at the outdoor gym.Is it cheap? Definitely yes, because it's free. It's very suitable for people who like free things like me lah #kiasu, especially if you love nature. The best time to visit the park is in the morning when the sun is not too hot or in the evening when you can do some aerobics.

Pleasant oasis in busy Bangkok!. Stayed just north of the park on this trip and was pleasantly surprised with the beauty and serenity that the park offers in the middle of the mayhem that is Bangkok. The grounds are well maintained and seems to be frequented by both locals and tourist. Great place for a break from the hustle and bustle.

Relax in late afternoon. We visited the park around 6pm, looking at thai people having a gym lesson in the park. also there was a classical music concert starting. good place to relax and watch people passing by
peace and quiet in a busy city. well maintained, clean and peacefull place. Go for a walk in the park and see thai people relax or sport

Terrific early morning walk. This is a beautifully landscaped urban park with water features and several lovely pavillions. In the early morning there are thousands of people enjoying the park, jogging, doing tai chi and yoga, walking and having breakfast on the many picnic tables. If you have arrived in BKK jet-lagged, and your eyes spring open at 5:00 AM and you can't get back to sleep, head to the park before breakfast! Suggest between 6:30 and 8:30 is prime time, before the day gets too warm.

Great for a jog or just an escape. If you are interested in running but have nowhere to put your stuff, you can leave your bag with the restroom attendant (it's better than it sounds) for 5 or 10 baht. They will then give you a tag so you can come get your things later. They have this for sure on the SW corner restroom, I'm not sure about others... If you also need a shower, there's a running/outdoor gear shop across the north side called "Banana2U" that will have showers available (because they're nice like that).
the Central Park of Bangkok. Beautiful park in the middle of central Bangkok. Outdoor gyms and jogging paths, nice walk early in the morning or at sunset, when is not too hot

Great Morning Stroll. My wife and I strolled through the park the morning we arrived in Bangkok. It was a refreshing introduction to city culture in Bangkok. There were multiple joggers and individuals doing Thai exercises that you could watch. There was a market along one end of the park that had fruit/clothing/breakfast/beverages etc. The exercise yard was a flashback to machines of the 1920's and I now understand why Thailand does not do well in the olympics.My highlight of course was seeing the giant lizards around the lake.If you have an hour to spare and are nearby the park it is worth a stroll.
The park in inner Bangkok. This park is in the heart of Bangkok and it's near the business district like the Central Park in New Yor City

Visited there backnin the 1960's. I remember that when I visited Lumpini Park in Bangkok,it was even then a tourist attraction.I have been told that its still a beautiful place to visit and when and if I ever go back to Bangkok I will definately visit the Park.I look forward to doing somin the near future
relax park. i recommend to visit this park to walk and relax at the day time , the only fee is for The boat ride is 80 baht for 1 hour , also you can join the sport music class for free .

Nice park. The entire park is located in the center of the city. An oasis of calm and greenery. Lovely is you have time during your visit of Bangkk and want to be relaxed in a beautiful are. Everything is well organized, clean and easili connected with transportation system (skytrain and metro)
A nice break from the hustle of Bangkok. This park is easily accessible from the skytrain (BTS) and is super peaceful, a really nice retreat from the craziness of Bangkok

Great spot to let kids run before boarding the train!!. We jumped into a taxi to get to Lumpini Park to spend a couple of hours here before our train to Chiang Mai. Our girls aged 6&7 made some friends in the kids play area as we adults took turns to do some moving on the free exercise equipment. Wear bug spray but this was great for all of us to get rid of some energy before the overnight train. It was about 10mins to the train by taxi.
Nice place for a walk or bike ride. I work just near this park and it is very pleasant some days to just go and have a walk around or jog / bike ride etc. Some small shops for drinks & snacks

Good park. Lumpini Park is a very good option to visit in evening specially if you have free time. Very nice & clean park & also Centrally located. A must visit if you really want to spend some quality time here.
Incredible ParK. Concerts in the park every Sunday night at 5:30 are incredible! If you have an extra night, I would go sit with some beers and local street food and listen to the music!
Lovely Park . Took the train there and spend my late afternoon till sunset there. Great to sit and read - there were some exercise classes happening which was quite nice to watch.

Enjoyable-Relaxing. Simply a big park. Reminded me of NY Central or a big city oasis.Ponds, waterways, wide grassy areas, trees, cement paths winding through, play areas for children.One will see joggers, Zumba classes with many Thai participants, bikers, walkers, and people laying around on the grass. Picnics.We went for a Bangkok Symphony concert and the setting was enjoyable and relaxing. Very active park.Nice to be in an oasis in the cement jungle.

Green oasis. Just a few minutes away from busy Silom and Rama 4 Road it is possible to enjoy tropical vegetation and relax in the park. Jogging and open air gym facilities are also an option. Kids also like to feed the fish there.
Clean park. Great park to play basketball, skateboard or exercise...night or day, it's very safe. Not a huge park but nice to even sit and people watch
Stayed banyan tree so walked here, great park. Very well kept area. Locals use it for running etc. Very lush with lake inside. Well worth visiting in contrast of the madness of Bangkok
Lovely to walk around. Nice place to relax, take a boat ride on the lake and see the big lizards. An oasis in the middle of Bangkok.

Simple, pleasant and under construction . The park was nice, a little sanctuary amongst the bustling city. Although it was an overcast day, it was still a beautiful day at the park. There was a lot of construction going on, so I can't wait to see what it looks like in a month or two

simple but surprisingly nice. We were having a rough day and just needed a place to walk quietly or sit for a while, and this place turned out to be just the ticket. There is nothing much to see or do, it is a simple park area with a few walking paths. But, we just walked slowly around the lagoon and then had a short nap on the grass by teh water, which was very nice. Some young local guys were singing nearby, a few older folks were playing what looked like Checkers, etc. It was very relaxing. Afterwards, we took the subway to the area nearby the Snake farm. The entrance to the subway is right at the entrance to the park. Very convenient. I would recommend visiting the park as a nice place to have a lazy afternoon sit-down.

I enjoyed a peaceful walk in the park. Lumphini Park is a very nice and peaceful escape of the city. This beautiful park has ponds, fountains and is a great way to start the day like some of the locals out for a jog, bike ride, karate, yoga, and a children’s playground. There is no vehicle traffic in the park, so one can truly enjoy the natural setting yet still with the high-rises as a back drop. There are pavilions in the park, lots of benches around to relax and there are also canoe and paddle boat rental available. I was quite surprised to see a large lizard swimming in the lake.Life can get very hectic running around the city shopping, dining, checking out the temples and attractions and this park is a nice break from all of these sometime over-whelming and non-stop activities.
GREEN PARK. Visited the park after the breakfast, very good green park with kids & family enjoying their day feeding fishes etc. Kids enjoyed boating.

Staying in area. We walked the park, it is a nice place. There are some homeless hanging there not many. The lizards a huge and interesting. The paddle boat rental was closed so we didn't try that. There is an outdoor free-weight lifting area and also exercise equipment . Bring lots of water to drink, it gets hot. Bike rentals available .

Nice park to relax but nothing special. It is nice park with some lakes and lots of green area but nothing special.You can see some lizards walking by which is nice. Take some bread with you to feed the birds.

Free & a great place to relax or work out!!. Love the basic 2 free gyms within the park.Big enough for a jog/run & a lot of people exercising in the evenings working of the Pad Thai!Love the fact there are chin up bars & dip bars here too, people looking to burn a few calories and work up a sweat will appreciate this park more...Nice to step inside a tranquil attraction within busy Bangkok!
Great place to chill. We loved walking around Lumphini Park and snapping photos of the kimono dragons. Mellow spot to hang.

Worth Evert Visit.. Had several walks around this particular park and was amazed to see so many Large Lizards just roaming around and the size of some fish had to be seen to be believed. So many people doing various forms of exercise all around the park also there is a cycle lane.

Casino bus from Lumphini Park to Poipet (Cambodia). I am writing a new topic just to update this information, which can be so useful. There is a government bus that goes from Mo chit 2 bus station (bangkok) to siem reap and costs 750 baht. This is the simplest option to cross the border but there are just 2 buses everyday (8 and 9 am) and they get fully booked quickly during high season. Second best option is this casino bus.Go to the entrance of Lumpini park in rama IV road. Next to it, there are colorful double decker buses that leave during the morning for the cambodian border city called Poipet. (The bus will be parked across a big HSBC)I had trouble finding the exact times these buses leave bangkok, but I know the first leaves at 5 am and they are more reliable during the morning (since the goal is to take thai gamblers to the casinos soon).Once we got to the park a guy already asked if we were going on the bus. We said "border, poipet" and he said "yes, ok".That's the thing: they are made for casino players but anyone can use them, no problem.So you hop on the bus (air conditioned, they offer you water and some soy milk) and just chill.They stop twice for snacks and toilet during the trip. The guy that monitors the bus asked for everyones passports to make a list for the casino, but said we didn't need to give ours (cause we clearly we not going to gamble).We were the only foreigners on the bus, cuz this is a route not too many people talk about.The trip costed us 300 baht, and the bus is quite comfortable. It used to be 200, but the price has changed (locals paid the same value, we paid attention to that).We left at 7 am and got to the border at 11:30 am. Since we left before all the vans, we got both the thai and cambodian immigration offices empty and managed to do the whole visa and crossing process in less than one hour.Piece of advice: read other websites to get informed about all the touts and scams you have to dodge while crossing. Just be attentive, walk like you know what you are doing and know your stuff, and it will be a piece of cake. :)

Afternoon out. This was a great experience.. it was a lovely afternoon at the park feeding fish looking for the huge lizards.. the park is neat and has a relaxing atmosphere.. great for picnics afternoon strolls and a float with the paddle boat.. the paddle boat lets u het up close with the lizards for better pics
Jogging and cycling. I go Lumpini park often for jogging and cycling, I just wish they would extend the opening time later in the evening for more chance to come here after work.
A green oasis in the middle of bangkok. A great way to spend a few hours. Lush greenery and fun little pedal boats to take out on the lake. Look out for monitor lizards though.
Lots to See. A great park if you like animals: lots of birds, lizards, water monitors, squirrels, turtles, cats and fish to watch.

green park. the largest open area left in Bangkok this park is really nice to walk around - we spent half a day wandering. Plenty of wildlife which may have been herons and monitor lizards. the lizards can climb trees as well as swim.

Peaceful Park. We always visit It via the sky train disembark at the Maboonkrong shopping center stop. Walk down the stairs and across the road to the park -you can see the statue at the entrance from the skytrain stop. The road is busy and dangerous cross with the locals. It is fun to take a paddle boat around the lake.

Peace in the midst of chaos. Bangkok is awesomely busy. After a week of that, it's nice to find a place to just chill for a minute. Lumpini Park was exactly that. We went and hung out for a few hours and just read. There aren't many urban parks in Bangkok. This one was exactly what we needed when we needed it.It's clean, green, and quite with good views of the skyline around you.

Large (mostly empty) park in the middle of the city. We took a stroll along the lake in Lumpini park in the afternoon and found it quite empty, with a few people lounging and napping in the shade of the trees. It was a nice escape from the bustle of the city, and no vendors haggling you which was a nice break. If you walk along the water edge you'll probably spot a monitor lizard in the trees or even the water. If you have the time to walk through the park, it's nice but it's not a "need-to-see" spot of Bangkok.

A good place to rest in a busy city. We came here to just chill out and relax.We walked around the outskirts as joggers and cyclists went by.What we didn't realise is that there are very large lizards wandering around and swimming in the lake. You can hire paddle boats to paddle around the lake however the water looked dodgy as did the condition of the paddle boats.There are lots of grassed areas to relax as well as exercise equipment to be used.A good place to go to get away from the bust Bangkok life.

A tranquil spot in Bangkok. We loved this spot of tranquillity in hectic Bangkok. Go there in the morning for a walk and for a paddleboat tour if you have time. It tends to get too hot mid-day so come back in the evening for an authentic outdoor dinner experience at the Ratchadamri corner. There is a local food market for local people, but the occasional, more daring tourist will find its way there. The food is great but not suited for faint / inexperienced stomachs.
Relaxing and Rejuvenating. Stumbled upon this lovely park on my last day in Bangkok, was an excellent place to unwind and relax. Even spotted a wild monitor lizard in the bushes (it was massive!).

Great place to esvape. One of my favorite places to visit in Bangkok by far, just peace and beauty in the city center, close to the bts. Just be carful of monitor lizards ....a fantastic afternoon or morning.
HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Beautiful, Quiet. A really great, quiet place in the center of Bangkok. City and skyscrapers surround this quiet, peaceful place. A nice walk.
Peaceful park. Lovely peaceful park in Bangkok. The park isn't busy and has great views of some tall buildings across Thailand. Sky train is really close to the park.
Lizards and pedals. Lovely park to get away from the bustle of the city. The lizards are roaming free and super cool. There is a place to hire a boat for 40 baht for 30 mins. Recommended!
An oasis of calm in Center of the city.. A lovely way to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Take a picnic or your exercise mat for the more adventurous.

A nice park. Not wildly exciting but a nice enough park to wander around in the late afternoon and recover from the crowds and an overdose of temples.
Some crazy catfish in the lakes and of course plenty of Molitars

Beautiful park to relax in with a date. Easily located off BTS line it is a huge park with plenty of walking paths and lakes. Be cautious of the Monitor lizards....generally benign but do not provoke them!
nice stroll in the park. Park is open to the public, a nice green place in crazy bangkok. enjoy people working out, jogging, strolling.

A peaceful space. It's a large park with lakes and a range of other activities. There seems to be a well used jogging track within the park and there are paddle boats available to navigate the lakes. Lots of shade so can be a bit of respite from the noise and chaos of the street life.
Worth. It's worth to go there once and especially if your hotel is near like ibis hotel but I think you shall go there at holiday when people and ceremony are hold there

Enjoy. Enjoy this huge park in the middle of Bangkok. We visited the park and had a relaxing stroll around this green area, - with lots of birds, fishes and iguanas. The child/teenagers of our party enjoyed this visit as much as we did.
Higly recommended.
Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.
Watch local life. Lovely park for wandering and people watching, particularly on Sunday's. Close to metro line. Lots of healthy activities. Food and drink outlets.

Feed the cat fish & see the big lizards strutt their stuff. Great place to exercise go for a walk , ride a bike or row a boat in the lake , have a picnic , or just lay under a tree so many activities to do here

Entertaining park. Fun park, lots to see and do. We walked around the park and saw all sorts. Awesome outdoor gym and really cool wildlife; giant lizards, turtles, birds and hundreds of fish.
Great running track and lots of push bikes everywhere.
Relaxing way to spend an hour or two.
Tranquil and beautiful. This was a highlight for my 2 teenage boys and I - so peaceful, beautiful and relaxing right in the middle of bustling Bangkok. Great for jogging too - a must visit!
Perfect for jogging. This is a great park to head to in the morning and watch the sun rise whilst on a fun jog around the park, highly recommend it, lovely area to walk around and explore in Bangkok

Great park. Beautiful park in downtown Bangkok, with lots of little sitting areas. Tip: visit the park at 18:00. When the national anthem starts, everyone in the park stands still as if frozen in place. After two minutes, everything picks up again like nothing happened.
Great place to relax. In the middle of the traffic around siam center, paragon and mbk. Is on walking distance. Nice place for a brake

Beautiful, well-kept, community park for relaxing, reading, paddle boating, or exercising.. If you are in Bangkok, visiting Lumpini Park is a must. Its amazing how green, clean, and serene it is despite being directly in the heart of the busiest city. You will feel like a local, because many business men and women from the city come here for a break, or to exercise, especially in the evening. Its a great place to relax and observe the Thai culture. There is swan paddle boats in the lake, primitive exercise equipment along the walking trails, small temples, and even free aerobics and yoga classes in the evenings. If you want a break from shopping or the craziness of this capital city, pay a visit to Lumpini Park where you are bound to have an up-close encounter with a komodo dragon!

Rest in the midst of a busy city. Very peaceful park with many nice places to sit down. At the same time full of life with students, people doing sport, etc. You can rent a paddle boat (only 40 baht) on the lake, which is relaxing and fun, and you 'meet' the huge lizards being lazy! Great street food too!

Fitness apparatus, running circuit, lizards, and evening concert!. For a lovely few hour pause. Find the locals working out on the outdoor fitness apparatus and running on the circular track. Spot some lizards on the banks or the big fish in the pond. We were lucky enough to enjoy a free classical music concert of the Bangkok orchestra in the park around 6PM among the Thai young and old, sitting on blankets, enjoying their dinner.

Nice area out of the traffic and congestion.. If you need a break from the rush of the city, in the heart of the city, this is the place. It has a bike/running track that circles the park. You can rent a paddle boat on the lake in the middle. Lots a nice large trees and plantings. Great place for a quiet walk. Free to enter. A large food vendor area just outside on Ratchadamri road at lunch time.
Relaxing breath of leafy fresh air. Was great to stroll through the park, though I guess we were there early morning so it wasn't too crowded
Nice local. Nice local city centre park area.Lovely and peaceful area away from the hubbub of the Tuk Tuk and taxis with extended exhausts.I'm sure gets very busy on Sunday's public holidays
Citi great ozone place. Forget the traffic jam of Bangkok, take your breath here. Good for family activities and work out, jogging, running, bicycling...
The best park in the city. As an expat I absolutely love this park. It has a lot of events, especially in November and December.

Ghetto Gym - open from 4am to 9pm... nothing special but fair enough!!! 20 baht per day... 200 baht per month!. If you wanna work out... GREAT BUDGET GYM!!!!!!!!!!!! Meet locals and get your workout done! lumpinee park: 4am - 9pmgreat workout.

Beautiful Park. This is a great park to stroll through. Very quiet & relaxing. Lots of wildlife and flowers. A very large park - can easily spend 2 hours walking end to end. You can rent a peddle boat at the lake as well.
Relaxing. Very relaxing in the somewhat chaotic life in Bangkok, a great place to take a break from city life.
Good views. Great views of all the big hotels and office towers around the park when were walking round, its huge and has boats can rent to ride around the lake.

Green space amidst the chaos. Lumpini park provides much needed access to green space in the heart of bangkok. Surrounded by skyscrapers it increasingly feels like Central Park (albeit with monitor lizards). Safe space to run and cycle or join in the early morning exercise classes.

A good place to relax. every weekend going here to walk and a little jogging
spacious, there mare many foods, too
The lake is good to relax and easy to be accessed by MRT or BTS
Nice park within the city. One would never guess something this tranquil lies within this crazy city. Near Silom/Sala Daeng...it's free and worth chilling, walking, running, you name it.

Biggest and Best. Haven of green in downtown Bangkok. Join locals in their morning jogging or aerobics, take a slow stroll to admire the huge monitor lizards or just come and hang out. This park has two playgrounds for children, various outdoor gyms, and 2.56 long jogging/biking track.
cycling is a must. A very nice park for chilling and relaxing. A friend let us use their bikes so we enjotyed a couple of hours here. Bit of a nightmare getting to though!

Moring exercise.. Early moring exercise, I love to go there in the early morning, to join to many many enthusiastic people to do various kind of exercise and local breakfast, which made from. Soybean in the sweet ginger brooth.

An oasis in the city, lovely ponds and gardens. We stayed at Century Park Hotel so the park was a short walk away, with lots of shopping, markets, Sky Train and Victory Monument close by. Locals frequent, and runners use the trails.
