A great escape from the city . This park is a perfect getaway from the busy city streets. Only half a mile away from the centre, it is a massive park, perfect for families and couples. The park is kept clean and tidy, with some beautiful lakes. There are no longer any food or drink kiosks in this park, so make sure you pack plenty of water. There is a play park for the kids and peddle boats which cost approx 80 baht for 30 minutes. Perfect getaway for some relaxation, just watch out for the water monitors
Lumpini Park. Nice park to visit very peaceful and ,Loy kra tong is celebrated here in November which is really good to enjoy

Respite from the Concrete Jungle of Bangkok. The park is a great location for anyone to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. One can choose to sit around and watch the world goes by or take part in activities such as jogging or exercising in the public gyms. A picnic in the park is also not a bad idea.
Big park. We were surprised to find such a big park in the middle of Bangkok as its famous for being a concrete city, but this park feels really natural and pleasant.

A nice piece of greenery in the concrete jungle. A nice way to spend an hour or two to get away from the concrete and the traffic of Bangkok. We took the paddle boats and got close up views of the monitor lizards. They look like crocodiles. Calling someone a monitor lizard is one of the worst insults you can call a Thai.

A place to keep coming back to. If you are visiting Bangkok for a few days, you might end up missing Lumpini because there is so much else to do. But if you have time (or if you are staying longer), you should definitely go. It's a big oasis in the city and there is always something interesting going on. Whether you want to run or just walk around and see how people in Bangkok hang out on the weekend, Lumpini is great. Make sure to see the monitor lizards swimming around in the little ponds.

Large park with iguana's, water, outdoor activities and gyms. Nice large park that is well maintained and full of activities for families and athletic people. They have workout equipment/stations, an outdoor gym, paths for running/biking, etc. We had the chance to see a very large iguana strolling from the water across the walk path and wandering around the park. It made for amazing photos. Worth a visit if you are in the Siam area.

Calm in the City Centre. The park is calm and peaceful with an incredible number of monitor lizards, turtles, fish and birds mingled through the walkways and water features. It is nice for a relaxing walk away from the traffic and buildings.

Train in the park or walk around. Went here for a look, right in the centre of Bangkok can get the Mrt right to the door step of the park, a place where the locals excercise and walk around, not much to see but worth a look, I went and trained with the locals at the outdoor gym, 20baht and a lot of staring at the only white man, was a fun experience but bring gloves or some good soap to wash the rust of ur hands lol!!

Went for a ride. This place is in the middle of the city, very large park for a nice bike ride. The only problem is that there are too many people, so when riding you must be extra careful.It is quite a busy park but the grounds are fairly well maintained.

A tranquil getaway. With all the hustle and bustle of Bangkok, it's good to find a quiet green area to take some time out, and with plenty of food nearby you can easily make a day of it with a picnic if you just need some time out from the madness of Bangkok

Discovered whilst Geocaching - A nice park.. Our hotel was very nearby so we set off here in search of Geocaches. What we didn't expect to find was a really nice well kept peaceful park with wildlife.To get here by BTS Skytrain the nearest station is SalaDaeng which is only a few minutes away. Nearest underground station is Lumphini.We didn't know what to expect , having never been to a park in Thailand before, but we were pleasantly surprised.The park was well kept with no sign of any weirdos often found in parks back in the UK.At first we thought we saw a Crocodile (nature isn't our strong point) see pic. It turns it that it was a monitor Lizard (we think). We saw many of these on our walk around the park and they didn't seem interested in us, although we still gave them a wide berth. There was lots of birds and other wildlife to look at.The boats looked good but we didn't go on them. It was 2 pm and too hot. I later read on the internet that this park is popular with Thai people early morning and early evening and this is obviously why. Next visit to Bangkok I will be joining them.There is a small shop that sells water etc. and we did find the Geocaches that we were searching for.
Nice place. Nice place to walk ride a bike or run...lots of track and good people there...nice day activity...awesome park to share on Sundays as well...
nice a quiet place in the center of Bangkok. a nice park with a large pond in which you can stroll, bike or just walk. it is a beautiful and peacful spot in the center of a rushing city...

Relaxing Park in the Middle of the Bangkok Bustle. Lumpini Park is a beautifully landscaped park in central Bangkok. It is easily accessible by the BTS- Sala Daeng Station. It is perfect place to catch some fresh air in the morning before the day heats up. It is a great place for runners and walkers, and there are also paddle boats and bikes to rent.

Best park in town.. If you are staying near Rama4 you can take a break by go jogging at Lumpini Park. This park is open for everyone. And not charge any fees to foreigner. You can go by solo or bring family. But be careful because thai culture is not accept to sitting on the grass like in foreign country. Because it will be dirty. You can go running (with sport clothes) or take a break buying some drinks from local seller.And one more thing, the monster is in the lake and always get up on the ground to look for food. So take care your children.
Morning walk. It was nice to walk around the park in the morning. Quiet in the morning and there were some people jogging.
A refuge from noisy BKK. I come here every weekend just to relax and to enjoy a "quiet" BKK. I like watching the Thais play Sepak takraw. They are spectacular at time.
Peaceful park. It reminded me of Ibirapuera Park in São Paulo. Very peaceful, well kept, well located and beautiful!
Quite Area. well most of the embassies are located in this area mainly US,UK Neatherlands,Qatar etc,Not much see expect the park near by
if you need a fresh air come here. It is a good place that you can take a relaxing and breath a good air. You can enjoy jogging and take a boat in the big pool. Easy to go here by BTS and MRT.

Lumpini Park. This large open space is an inviting oasis apart from the mad rush of Bangkok traffic, and was the scene of some of the uprising after the fall of the Prime Minister, Yingluck Shinawatra just two years ago. Can attract crowds of people, especially at weekends !

Nice place to watch or jog.. The park was located near our hotel but is easily accessed by the Skytrain. We walked it and saw people practicing with fans and doing various group exercises. Not overly lush or landscaped but a nice break from the City.

Wonderfully Peaceful Park to Escape the Ceaselessness of Bangkok. I stumbled upon Lumphini park when walking round aimlessly in the city - I'm so glad I did. It's huge, peaceful, and surrounded by sights and sounds not seen in parks I've been to in the US (uncommon birds and lizards mostly). I walked all around the seemingly never-ending park while taking photos and soaking it all in.

A great escape.. If you're looking for a change of scenery without leaving Bangkok, this is the place for you.The tranquil park, along with the features, makeshift gyms and wildlife, offer a relaxing change to the hustle and bustle of the city.It isn't too crowded and is large enough to spend a decent amount of hours exploring or going for a long run.This is a haven for those who need a temporary escape and would advise all tourists and locals to check it out if you haven't done so already!

Beautiful park in heart of city. Bike and jogging paths. In the morning you will find groups doing Tai chi. We walked through the park during the day. There are bathrooms as well as paddle boats you can rent.

Best escape place in Bangkok. Bangkok is always hot,and the best place to visit is Lumpini park, huge park in the middle of the Bustling metro city , try to walk around slowly to feel the charm of the city,sit and overlooking the man made lake is a good things to do after having an around , don't forget buy some bread for the cute doves on the park

Great Park to spend an evening. Its beautiful park fill with life. Nothing as such specific except that if you are tired from day routine you can drop in here and relax under the moonlit late evening/night. Its such green with people busy exercising.

A nice relaxing place in Bangkok. We were here on a Sunday morning and there were many people, young and old, jogging and cycling in the park. There were also old folks who had gathered and having a nice pot luck, as well as foreigners sitting under the shade having a good read.There is a big pond in Lumpini Park, and you can rent paddle boats or boats with oars to paddle around the pond. While paddling, we saw quite a few monitor lizards at the edge of the pond, as well as one sunbathing on the platform. The park is a nice touch to add some greenery in what would be a city with increasingly more tall (and new) buildings in central Bangkok.
good for a morning jog. its better to go early, if you go too late then the sun starts blazing and you don't really have any motive to exercise anymore
Pleasant park. Nice park with wonderful views and the pond is very big. During the evenings it gets cool here despite the fact that bangkok is usually quite hot.

Peace in a Hectic Place. This park was just what we were looking for to take a short break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. It was green and peaceful with benches all around to take a break. There was also a very good food vendor just outside the park gates that had the best Pad Thai I had in all of Thailand.
Great place to spend some time. Great place to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok City for a while, in the weekend a lot of locals come to the park to play games and lay on the grass.

Beautiful oasis in busy city. We walked down to Lumpini Park, as we were staying at a hotel nearby, as dusk. It is beautiful and peaceful to walk along the many pathways around the lawns and lakes. Cats can be seen lazing around freely which was surprizing.
A welcome bit of nature amongst the hustle and bustle of a very busy city.
Coose a cool day. Nice but usually too hot to appreciate. Nice to get away from the main road and not quite get away from the noise of the traffic.

Great in the early mornings. When staying in Bangkok I usually try to get accommodation near Lumpini Park. The city has very few green open spaces and if you like an early morning workout or some tai chi or aerobics this is the place to come.Jogging track of 3 kilometers around the perimeter, gets very crowded from around 6 AM. Large lake in the middle where you can hire peddle boats. Also has several small outlets selling food and drink which mostly operate only in the early mornings. BTS station is at the entrance.Whilst the park is packed in the mornings it's virtually deserted during the heat of the day and comes alive again in the evening.
to rest a moment. We just laid down an hour at park. It's nice, quiet and you can rest around the a small lake where you have a good chance to see fishes, turtles, lezards....

Nice and quiet.... The paarkk itself it...well like a park in the center of a metropoly. Great to relax and regain some "fresh air". There are large lizards laying throughout the park so be aware! :D they dont seem harmful but one of them tried to steal my lunch. Another one was 1,5 meters long and scared me enough as I like too wander around. Nice place though!

fitness buffs. This is a great place to go and do some walking jogging zumba dancing boxing yoga. Most activities are free. while I was living there for some time I would go there to carry out my daily jogging or walking

Nice break from the craziness of Bangkok. I love this park in the middle of Bangkok. Its large, city and the the air just feels cleaner. There are always people relaxing or exercising or playing games. The views of some high rises are beautiful at night and the park is very safe.I really enjoy just walking around the park at night and just getting away from the noise and rush of the busy city. Well worth a visit. Always something interesting happening.

A paradise in a massive city. Lumpini Park is a great place to visit.One can stroll through the park for hours admiring the flowers, the lakes, the fish and the other wildlife.The giant lizards can be seen thoughout the park and generally unperturbed by people.The Park is a great place to relax from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.
big park in the very center of Bangkok. big park in the very center of Bangkok. the park is quite big but not so that nice, it's okay with few street food sellers around.
Jogging. This is good park for jogging, have big path go all the way round and many other joggers in the evening, but difficult to get food or drink water.
Worth a visit. Lumpini Park is a big nice park down town Bangkok. They organize a lot of cultural acitivities. Runs, music festivals etc. Nice place for a run in the morning or just sit and relax.
Great walk at sunset. Thai people come here not before 17-30 as before it is too hot. Everyone jogging, working out, beautiful place to breath after day in the city center.
Lovely space.. Lovely space in a crowded city. I watched a huge monitor lizard playing in a water fountain and ate an ice cream while having a pleasant stroll round the park.

Lovely.... Such a lovely place to be with nature in the center of busy Bangkok. We decided to rent a row boat for the small lake... I had NO idea there were these massive lizard,alligator,snake-like creatures (I don't know their names) roaming about in the water until one of their heads peaked out from the water near our boat! As you could imagine, it freaked me out!! I just knew it was coming for us... but I soon realized they had no interest in me or anyone else in the park! It turned out to be such a cool experience... you wouldn't find anything like that in Los Angeles where I live. But overall, I managed to capture some great pictures of the grounds and was very pleased with my visit to Lumpini park!

Oasis in the mid of chaos. Nice park, with a large enough extension to offer a pleasant, flat and easy path for joggers in town. When you enter the park abandoning the chaotic traffic of the city, you are welcome (at 6.30am) by thousands of people looking to catch the energy of the early lights doing tai-chi, running, meditation or just strolling around. A real oasis in the city

Bangkok's Central Park. The park is centrally located and offers a breath of fresh air in the crowded metropolis. It contains pathways and jogging tracks among extensive gardens and also has a lake where you can go boating. The lake is pretty large and also has an island in the middle.The park is easily accessible through both the BTS and MTR. A monument is located at the Park's main entrance and the park has numerous canals flowing through it. Among other things, the park has a clock tower, performing area, library and a kids playground.Worth a visit if you are in Bangkok.

Nice for a quiet walk. In busy Bangkok it may be nice to spend some hours away of the tragic. One can do that in lumpini park, certainly at the end of the day it will be busy with people working out, this is a nice sight! The park itself is not very exceptional

Wonderful. Beautiful place to be away from city crowd. So relaxing. Many beautiful spots, good pat for jogging, little lake nice for picnic, many bench around. We also so street performers when we were there, I do not know was it regular thing there or we just were lucky to be there that day. We just enjoyed very much a few hours.

What an oasis! Superb. In the middle of manic Bangkok lies this wonderful green open space. Many locals can be seen cycling or jogging or just walking about. The views are wonderful and pretty amazing for the centre of such a bustling city. The boating lake is so relaxing and all for 40THB. Plenty of stalls selling cold drinks and the wild life can be special too.
Nice place in city center !. Lumpini is good opportunity when you are tired of hustle and bustle of city center ! Go there to see nice lizards and big turtle !

Calm and tranquile. If you need to de stress after a day of shopping, a visit to Lumphini will provide you with everything you need. The park is big and clean, with a lot of inviting spots to chill. Just remember to bring a blanket, and you are good to go. You can easy get to the park by the metro, exit on Lumphini or Silom stops.

Lazy Lizards. Can't believe they roam around the park, don;t seem to bother anyone so .. MaiBenRai.. Lovely Park, very tropical lots of water and activities, the evening city skyline in the background is the perfect photo. So many locals in exercise mode around 6pm. Easy to access on the MRT (subway) and a short walk to SiLom restaurants and markets ... all pics and videos in google search bangkok achiever Lumphini Park

Tranquility in a Busy City. We stopped in here as we were staying in the Sofitel across the street. I wouldn't say it is a must see location in Bangkok, but if you have a spare half hour or so, it really is nice to walk around and relax. In a busy city like Bangkok, it is a pretty stark contrast. We saw the swan boats but did not try them this time, but it is on the bucket list for next time.

Very dark at night. walked around this park at night time and it is not very well lit. There are sections where you will find street vendors but in general I would not recommend walking alone in this area.

Lazy beautiful park. Early mornings you'll see Muay Thai fighters from local gyms doing their running. It's a big and beautiful park. Tai chi..yoga..napping! A place to kick back and people watch or nature watch...or both.

serene oasis in BKK. When the chaos of Bangkok gets to me, I visit Lumphini. It is peaceful, pretty, serene oasis in the heart of Bangkok. And when I get hungry, there are a lot of food vendors lining the outskirts of the park.
Loved this park. we went running there on a Sunday morning and first stopped at the market outside the gates - then inside> It is very well kept and really beautiful
Go early!. Wonderful place in the centre of Bangkok. Go early to see families exercising and playing. Good for jogging and shaking off jet lag!

For the right time and reason . As others have said, "it's a park"- not unlike the Boston Commons or Central Park. Not exotic and not necessarily a must for all. But there are two reasons to go: First, take a stroll in the park if you need a break from the urban congestion and noise, as well as pervasive hyper consumerism because it is green and calming. Trees, orchids, fountains and swan or rowboats. Second, if you are a tourist who is interested in the lives of Thai people. This is where many go: couples on blankets, families with children at the playground, bicyclists. And there is a public library and an Elderly Center. A couple of tips: do take water and food as its NOT commercial space; there are public restrooms with a 5 baht charge for paper. Also look for the large water lizards in the ponds.

A lovely park to relax in the shade. A pleasant park but for a tourist with not much time to see every thing and do shopping too, maybe its not such an important place to visit. We walked through it on our way to the shopping area and it is very nice but we had no time to stop.
Nothing great. It is just like any other park. Can go if you just need to relax or spend a quite evening. It is clean and huge. But there are many better things to do in Bangkok!

Lumpini Park is in the heart of Bangkok. The park is a welcome rest stop and a source of family activity in the middle of a large city. The park is a nice retreat and you can enjoy the many pigeons that are pretty tame.

Walk and Relax. We love this park,its an Oasis from the frantic pace of Bangkok, walk around and relax or go jogging. It can be a great cool place in late afternoon with the breeze and the lakes. We hired a boat and went on the water, also places to by food and drinks. They have public toilets in the park, but bring some tissues.
Calm, nice and filled with monitors. This is a soft spot if you want to calm down from Bangkok's hectic vibe. Best option is to go to Sala Deng BTS or MTR Silom or Lumpini.

Nice green spot.. When in Bangkok I always stay in Pratunam and one of things I do to get rid of Jetlag is to spend an hour or two walking round Lumpini Park. It's always green, a biggish lake to help maintain a lower temperature and it's a real change to traffic and rushing about.Works very well for me.
Just like the Boston Commons. This place looks just like the Boston Commons park in the US - none the less, very pretty park to walk around with nice swan boats!

Nice park with Giant Lizards!. Very nice park with giant lizards abound... good place to take a breather away from all the hussle and bussle of Bangkok. There are plenty of places to sit and just people watch. Mosquito repellant might be very good to have here. We felt very safe here.
Great park worth visiting in Bangkok!. Have a go at the swan paddle boats and explore the gorgeous views from the peaceful park in the middle of Bangkok.

A fun morning out of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. We had a great morning out here. The park is a real retreat from the Bangkok city and we enjoyed strolling around, watching the locals do Tai Chi, eating ice creams, riding the paddle boats and escaping the city life. I was told the park gets a bit more sinister at night time and I saw a few warning signs about thieves but we experienced no trouble at all. Worth a visit.
Great place to relax. If you want to escape the hussle and bustle of shops and traffic then it's a great place to relax or even enjoy a pedal boat on the lake.

Peaceful park in central city. Walking distance from our hotel, this lovely parkland was peaceful and relaxing, but has fitness equipment if you desire something more strenuous. The water dragons were a sight to behold, with large fish and turtles visible in the water of the lakes and waterways. Recomended for nature lovers.
relaxed spacious park in middle of the city. Lovely walks by the lake and interesting wildlife - the monitor lizards and wild birds and spaces to sit and relax.
Beautiful Park. A really beautiful spot in Bangkok is Lumpini Park. Grounds are pristine. Get there around 6 p.m. to experience the huge crowd of exercisers.

A green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. If you want a break from the hectic city life, go to Lumpini park, a green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. You can take a walk, run or rent a bike. Eat your breakfast or lunch in a peaceful environment.
Time for Fun. The park is busy and very pleasant at dusk. It is a great place to relax, eat Thai street food and enjoy the ambience. I love to feed the fish.

really nice walk. This is a really nice place to walk around feed the fish see the wild comodo dragons, go for a row on a boat. wild life people in the out door gym walking running of just relaxing its a must place to walk if you have the time to kill a hour or 2.

A quiet haven in the hurly burly of a very busy city....... What a restful place in the middle of a hectic, bustling city. Lots of places to sit, and lots of shady places to allow a weary tourist to rest for a while. Mind the energetic joggers about. If you feel inclined to join in, remember to just run or walk in one direction. Follow the crowd. Lumpini Park must easily be one of the most pleasant and popular parks, and a wonderful escape from the incessant crowds, noise, and pollution of Bangkok's streets.

Come here for an early morning jog. I come here around 5.30 or 6 am in the morning for a morning jog. One lap of the park is around 2.5km, so you can go around a few times and have a good jog.Watch out for the locals exercising to aerobics and tai chi. Watch out also for the resident water monitors who live in the lake.A great start to the morning in Bangkok.

A tranquil haven similar but smaller than Central Park New York. We visited the park for a respite from the clamour and pollution in Bangkok. A lot of locals were there on a Saturday morning practising tai chi and other forms of exercise. There is a boating lake in the park. It can be accessed from the Silom skytrain station. Also nearby is the Silom mall for retail therapy and dining.

Relaxing walk in the park. While having a walk about stumbled on to the park. Walked a bit. A nice respite of nature in the middle of a blustering city. Well groomed plenty of shade. Saw a giant lizard.
Well tended. A great park well tended and used by locals. Very pleasant for a nice ambient stroll and to forget the bustle of the city outside. Many locals exercise and do tai chi here.

a Green lung in the midst of Bangkok!. This was a really pleasant place to go for a morning walk during our short 2 night stay at Bangkok a few days ago. We were surprised at the really large park that was there, and also the number of facilities around. Specially gym equipments- saw a lot of people use it and they appeared to be well kept. There are plenty of walking tracks, pools, even food stores - so it has everything in a very large area. An excellent place for morning walkers or anyone who wants to just go experience a Green place inside Bangkok. Highly recommended!
Beautiful and relaxing. This is al large, beautiful, and right in the heart of the city. You can also rent a boat and ride on the lake.

An oasis in the heart of Bangkok. We love to go to Lumpini Park each time we come to Bangkok. Either we walk upto there or take the train there, usually early morning. Over there we enjoy our morning walk. It's great to see such a huge area of greenery & water in the heart of a metropolis, where people of all ages from all walks of life. Good to see so much life there every morning, friends chatting, so many exercise, aerobics & martial arts groups. A real oasis.

Lovely park, watch for giant monitor lizards in the trees. Park is rather lovely, but it's always so hot in Bangkok that it's difficult to really enjoy a leisurely promenade. Just off the BTS at Sala Daeng.

Beautiful green space in the urban jungle of Bangkok. In a city where it's hard to find peace and quiet, Lumpini Park offers a refreshing retreat from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. It's a hub of activity on the weekends when Bangkok residents take to its trails for walking, jogging, and biking. There are also exercise machines scattered throughout the park if you want to pump some iron among the locals.

A green oasis inside Bangkok. This is a good place to relax, or to do some sports like; running, cycling perhaps. There are food and drink stalls all around and you can rent a mat for 20 baht so you could lay on the ground. Lots of people go there in the afernoon and you could even join a free aerobic class from 5 pm.

Refreshing and full of energy.. We were there on a monday afternoon (around six o'clock) and many people were running and doing exercizes. It was really nice to see so many people doing sports in such a big city when all you see throught he day is traffic. We had a feeling that we would visit this park very often if we would live in Bangkok. It was beautiful.

Peace in the heart of the madness. boating and meditation is possible here yet right near the sky train station. Also a meeting point for demonstrations and public rallies so note the local press for details, I stayed at the dusit over looking the park and music seems a weekly event, but peace can be found here.along with hassle free walking.

A stroll in the park. Wanted to get away from crazy Bangkok and decided to go over to the park. Clean, peaceful with water rides you can do. If you wish to meditate, or simply get away this is the place.

Nice Walk and a Nice Park.. I was feeling 100% so we went for a walk round the entire perimeter. Its a sprawling park like in any other city. There are shaded benches and its peaceful. If you fancy a break from the crowds this is the place. Grab a fruit juice from the vendors and just sit, walk and sit again.

Breath of Fresh Air. If you are in Bangkok and want to have a breath of fresh air drop by Lumpini Park. It is the biggest park in Bangkok. People go there as early as 4.30am....nice place to take a stroll

Something to pass time with.. Interesting park to see locals spending time doing activities. Try to be there for the 6pm National Anthem play.
I'm looking forward to trying the swan boats.

Beautiful big park with average facilities.... The green lungh of BKK offers a 3 km jogging / cycling track to share with pedestrians. Unfortunately very limited offerings on food and beverages, rest rooms and other facilities are dated and no dogs allowed as in any other park in BKK as well...
A green oasis in Bangkok.. If you are looking for somewhere green, this is the place. It's big and you could easy spend an hour or two wandering through it. Keep an eye out for the giant lizards!

Great park. I personally love this park and come here as often as I can. It's great to run/walk around the 2.5km track.I get here early to avoid some of the heat, but I also bring the family on weekends to feed the fish and birds, to see the sometimes huge monitors that roam freely around and to use the playgrounds.There's also places to eat and get drinks from, which you can eat there or find your self a nice shady spot on the grass over looking the lake.From 10-3pm the bikes are allowed on the path, so you need to be a little bit careful especially if you have wandering kids with you.It's easy to get to by MRT or taxi and it's well worth a look.
Good open space. This is a large open space park used by the locals with tree lined walkways. Pleasant to walk in but nothing particularly going on.

Lumping Park. Disappointing park with few facilities for toddlers and a real risk of being knocked down by cyclists who did not stay in their designated area. The swan pedaloes were good and very reasonably priced at only 40baht for 30 mins.

Hot and Sweaty with dirty lake but ok if the weather is cooler. Turtles and fish here to feed with bread from the bread sellers who will most likely hassle you to buy anyway.Watch out for potential hand bag/camera snatchers -you have been warned!!

Great Place in hustling and bustling city. Its great to spent your few time over here after your busy day schedule. Its great to be here always. I have visited here many times but still its always in my priority in Bangkok.

Perfect for a morning run in Bangkok. Right smack in the heart of busy Bangkok, is an oasis of a park. Nearest MRT station is Silom, Lumpini Park is bustling with life early morning - from joggers, to yogis and even a jungle gym. One loop round the park is about 2.5km, with so much to see.

Early Morning Beauty. Visited this park twice during our stay, once in the afternoon and once first thing in the morning. It was much busier in the morning, but in a good way. Almost everyone was doing some type of activity from jogging to tai chi to yoga. Families were already picnicking. The lizards were enjoying the first warming rays of the morning sun. It was spectacular just to take it all in while walking through the park. Great way to start your day in Bangkok!

Great fitness Park . It's great to come here while in Bangkok. Getting away from the traffic and the noise of the city. We are people who like to work out while we are travelling and big gyms in Bangkok are mostly very expensive. In lumpini Park they have three different outdoor gyms and one new indoor gym. Free or ridiculously cheap. Like 20 bath. That's a big plus for us. If you don't feel like lifting weights you can always just go for a walk, jog or bicycle ride. Watching the lizards, turtles, birds and trees.

Great for kids - can recommend the pedal boats on the lake for an hour.... If you have kids, I can recommend hiring one of the pedal boats on the lake. It costs 40 baht (80p) for half an hour so a bargain compared to European prices. There are turtles/terrapins to see but best of all are the huge water lizards that are sunning themselves or in the water. Fab! Downside: crossing the busy roads to get to the park entrance. We stayed at the Aetas Lumpini and had to cross 7 sets of lights to get in. Scary stuff!

Relax location in the middle of Bangkok. Thai people is call short name that 'Suanlum'. It's the relax park and the first park in Bangkok. Everybody can exercise and relax in this. Open & Close time is 04.30 AM to 9.00 PM.
Relaxing. A nice place to walk and jog after a long day after work. Spacious park with so much activities for groups and family such as fish feeding, boat paddle and water bike.

Big park in the city. This is a lung of Bangkok. You hardly find green place in this big city, especially at the city center. Lumpini Park is located at the city center area, close to BTS and MRT. Many people come to exercise, jogging, running during the morning or evening time. During daytime, it can be too hot for outdoor activities.

A RELAXING DAY A MORE INTERESTING NIGHT. Again a world class display of the flowers of Thailand, however after dark nocturnal flowers of the human kind can be seen to emerge, sporting a variety of real bargains on the insides of their respective jackets, coats, skirts, jeans shorts etc. The days although less exciting offer a well managed park facility. I smiled to myself when I saw Lumpini Park pop up, there is never a day "or night" in Thailand where you can't get a laugh at Thai inventiveness.

An ok park but in the middle of traffic with little trees. This park is not really well developped, as are most of the parks in Bangkok. It would be nice to have more trees and a real oasis instead of being able to hear the traffic noise.
beautiful. Great place to pass some time..nice to see green in this big city. There are many things going on and if we had more time, we would have joined in.

An oasis of peace in a big city.. Big city sites are all very nice, but it was pleasant one morning to head out to Lumpini Park. Birds and monitor lizards and trees and grass, a breath of fresh air. We spent a couple of relaxing hours before heading off to the next tourist attraction.

love this park and the lizards!. We've been coming to Bangkok for years and always stay near Lumpini Park. It has a great 5km loop you can walk around and in the middle of the park, you can almost forget that you are in the centre of busy Bangkok. The monitor lizards are huge and amazing. If you go in the morning, more of them are walking around and you can often see them eating fish (which is a sight to behold). There are several food markets in the park as well, all of which offer excellent options, particularly fruit. Definitely worth a visit.

Nice break from the city. This is a great park where you can walk around and see older folks doing TaiChi and hang out with Komodo Dragons (There's one on every corner). It's a nice break from the hustle of the city with a bike path and lake where you can rent paddle boats by the hour.

Perfect recreation. This large park is perfect for a picnic, recreation, jogging or strolling around the lake. It is both open areas and more shaded areas in this park, which is best visited early in the weekdays when there is less people.

A central oasis from the hectic city. When it's really hot outside and you have had your fill of the cantankerous Bangkok city traffic, mere steps from the BTS Sala Daeng Station is this park. it is often quiet, as there are never really too many people here. Bangkok residents are too busy working to take a break and walk in the park. Good vegetation, but needs more benches in the shade.

Nice Park. Nice park with a small like, some boats. Good for exercise: walking, running or - if you have - a bike ride. Close to one of the entrances there is a small market that opens in the morning (6-9am) for breakfast. Good option to pickup breakfast is you stay in one of the hotels in Silom
green green green in city center. Love to walk around the park watching people jogging and dancing. Great place to hide away from the busy traffic.

Relaxing. Enjoyed jogging and relaxing here - it is quite big and towards the middle remarkably peaceful for a city as noisy and crazy as Bangkok. Only improvement would be bike rental shop - there were some rent a bikes available outside the park but we could not work out how the system worked (it was un-manned) and the bikes looked a bit silly anyway.

A green oasis. A very nice park, greenery amongst the grey surrounds of Bangkok. Many flat paths make for easy walking, be on the lookout for the many, and large monitor lizards, they didn't bother us, tending to walk away from us rather than coming towards us. The park is used by many joggers and cyclists, so you need to be aware when walking as some come up quite fast. Paddle boats can be hired for 40 baht for 30 minutes, but you are asked to stay in one area of the lake which effectively stops you from seeing more of the park from the lake. Whether your there to keep fit or just sit in the shade of one of the many trees, this is a nice park to visit.

Great relaxing walk. This is a park in the middle of Bangkok, yet one of the quietest places you will find around Bangkok, very relaxing to walk around this beautiful water park that is full of fish, You have to look around in the more seclude areas for the giant Gecko's near the water inlets ( once you see them youll know what I mean ) and if you are anything like me you will have a great chuckle to yourself looking at the many " Gym Junkies " that get there shirts off and work out in the park There's just something that I find funny about a 4 foot nothing guy that has more muscle than a Big Block Chevy.

A little hideaway in the heart of Bangkok.. So this park it's a huge park, and there's not a whole lot to do at this park, but for what it's worth, it's a nice open green space in the heart of the hustle and bustle in Bangkok. A great place to go to get a change of pace, and get away from the insane traffic. There are paddle boat rentals at Lumpini Park, and walking paths, and it's open to bikes. A nice place to check out, if I lived closer to the city I would utilize this place more.
Amusing Wildlife. Essentially a public [park in the middle of Bangkok this provides great access to large monitor lizards which may be seen stroll along of climbing tress and relaxing in hollows.

Wonderful piece of nature in the middle of busy city. This park is a wonderful piece of nature in the middle of a busy city. It is worth visiting. Varans can be seen walking freely around the lake.. which is kind of scary in the beginning, but you get used to it. The play ground is one of the best in Bangkok!

I love this park.. We have been coming to BKK for over a decade and always stay in Lumpini region. Beautiful park with good opening hours. Always full of people and excellent to go jogging at or work out. Best park in the city.
fantastic park. really nice park in heart of Bangkok many fitness fanatics early evening using the park it is nice to walk through very quiet

These are Bangkok's lungs!. A delightful huge park in the middle of the city. Ideal for quick stroll, a nice break laying in the grass reading or chilling out, a Tai Chi class or a jog. Great mix of people mix who respect each others. Be aware that monitor lizzards live in the lake, they are impressive at first but harmless.

Green space in the middle of the city. We went here to give our kids a chance to run around outdoors and burn off some steam. Kids loved it - nice but fairly basic playground. We didn't go on the boats but would do next time. It's not the kind of place we would have gone without kids but I would recommend it to anyone wanting a bit of outdoor exercise as there was a nice lake to run around and a great selection of exercise equipment (weights, exercycles) to use.

Brilliant Early In Morning. Early morning walks to see a different side to Bangkok that most people do not see, loads of wildlife, people, exercise and characters.Well worth an early start to look around.

Lovely haven away from busy Bangkok streets. Visited due to TripAdvisor recommendations. Not disappointed what a lovely tranquil place surprising in such a busy noisy city!Beautiful grounds with amazing flora and fauna. Big wildlife fan so absolutely loved seeing the water monitors roaming and swimming in the park- fantastic!Recommend doing the swan pedalo in the lake great for viewing the lizards up close, turtles and fish.

Bangkok's main city park, overbuilt and unparklike. Lumpini Park is a uniquely Thai attraction. It is a plot of land in the center of the city, a few blocks worth, nice for a walk, but not very 'park-y', in that it has too many paths, vendors, buildings and the like for this limited area. It is NOT a Central or Hyde Park, by any means. And I suspect the Thais will eventually sell it off, bit by bit, to make malls and condos. But for now, it is the best we got, for getting a bit of nature.

Bike, walk, enjoy the outdoors. This is my favorite park in Bangkok. I love shopping but when your pockets are getting light head over to Lumpini. Taking the subway here is quickest transport as it is a little outside of the city center. I love biking and they have quite a selection of bikes for all ages to rent for the day. I paid 50-100 baht for all day of use on a pretty standard bike. The park itself was a golf course that was transitioned into a park so the paths to walk and bike are really nice and paved. There is also a butterfly garden and large fields for children to run around.
Relaxing. Found the park by accident, what a beautiful and peaceful place after all the madness of Bangkok.Lovely lakes, easy to walk around.

Large Decent City Park Worth Visiting. This downtown park is large and offers a pleasant reprieve fom the surrounding concrete towers and city life. It can be accessed via the BTS and MRT, has multiple bathroom facilities (5B), and a few small food vendors at the entrance. The park has a series of murky water lakes holding plenty of fish that like to be fed by the tourists and locals alike, along with the Monitor Lizards that look like small crocodiles skimming along the surface of the waters. The numerous, wide, concrete pathways (very wheelchair accessible) throughout the whole park lead past an interesting Thai clock tower, some other architecturally interesting buildings, an area with old but usable outdoor gym equipment, two playground areas, and numerous enclaves for people to sit and play games in the shade. Even on a Saturday afternoon, I found the park pleasantly uncrowded, with plenty of room for roaming or finding a quiet place by the water. Of course, in the day time, it seemed like a safe place to wander or loaf and a great place to take a date or family for an afternoon stroll or picnic.One can easily spend a couple of hours walking around the park or enjoy using the excellent designated bike path. Unfortunately, the rental bikes available at the entrance points are junk; so, you decide what suits your mood. The rental paddle boats are amusing to watch, but they too are the traditional slow tourist clunkers. Don't expect any nice kayaks to paddle around - which would be appropriate and nice recreation for the area. Overall, I enjoy the park and like to visit it each time I come to Bangkok. But, it rates only average in my book due to its somewhat run down, over developed environment. For a city park, its a pleasant natural area, but its not gorgeous, nor is it a particularly photogenic place. It's a worthwhile visit though and would be a good daily workout place if one lived close by.

Nice park for a stroll and chill out. A nice place to visit mid morning before it gets too hot. Lots of activity from cyclists, Tai Chi, school children practicing some sort of dance/drama, fish feeding, walkers, joggers etc.Loads of Monitor lizards - swimming and eating turtles. You can hire a little swan boat and paddle around the lake or a row boat. A good park for a stroll and relax and you totally forget you are in busy, noisy Bangkok.

cool park. Lumphini Park (also Lumpini or Lumpinee, hectare (142-acre)) park in Bangkok, Thailand. This park offers rare open public space, trees and playgrounds in the Thai capital and contains an artificial lake where visitors can rent a variety of boats. Paths around the park totalling approximately 2.5 km in length are a popular area for evening joggers. Officially, cycling is only permitted during the day between the times of 10am to 3pm. There is a smoking ban throughout the park, and dogs are not allowed.Lumphini Park was created in the 1920s by King Rama VI on royal property. This place was a museum, where many products and natural resources were shown, then after World War 1. Moreover,A very nice park with a lake in thie middle it is greatarea for picnic in busy city like Bangkok..Also it is great place to walk around or take tour in cycling .
A great place to chill and relax. A very nice park with a lake in the middle. Great for a picnic lunch, a jog or just a little relaxing in the sun.

Bangkok retreat. Having this park literally on my doorstep is fantastic. It is beautifully maintained, and has such a vibrant atmosphere - there is always something to see. Whether you like running, walking, cycling or just chilling with a picnic, I defy anyone not to find this the perfect retreat from day-to-day Bangkok life.

Must see in BKK. A fantastic Park in Bangkok, with a couple of lakes, a bicycle track for training or just cycling around, and check our the lizards ... just amazing. Relaxing place after temples visits.

Fresh air, critters, flowers. Big park with lots of trees & flowers. Excellent for runners - many roads to make turns on, creating an interesting course of your own within the park. The monitor lizards are very cool. Give them space & they won't run away from you.

An oasis in the heart of a hectic crazy city. As said in the title: An oasis in the heart of a hectic crazy city, it really is literally a breath of fresh air and a place to relax away from the crazy traffic chaos of Bangkok.
Like Chatuchak Park, it's a well cared-for park with a lovely lake and plenty of quiet spots to soak up some fresh air.

Great park. If you want a nice park to chill and enjoy the scenery. This is a great park to have a stroll in or even work out on the public gym equipment. You can rent a pedlo out and enjoy the scenery :)

Picnic. Nice place to relax and enjoy the day. Conveniently located right next door to the Chatuchak weekend market. If you plan your visit on the weekend you can get your picnic goodies in the market and enjoy them in the park, that way you don't need to bring anything except your wallet. Great way to spend an afternoon.
Wonderful haven. A fun place to run or walk around where there is no need to worry of being ran over by a car or scooter. This park has a weights set too!

Beautiful oasis in a big city. You would not know you were in Bangkok when you go into this Park, it's like being in the countryside! Very relaxing and quiet, in contrast to the busy city outside A lot of water monitor lizards to look at when you sit down by the water. Absolutely refreshing inside this park.
Good jogging park. If staying on Rama road IV, must visit for morning walk, has a great jogging track and can enjoy fresh air in middle for Bangkok.

Beautiful and peaceful. You forget you are in bangkok in this place, get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and go somewhere that feels you're a million miles away. Could have spent longer than we did here (2 hours) as we had to rush to get a flight back, but from what we heard they do much more in the evenings here than they do in day (excerise classes, yoga etc)

Excellent respite from the hustle. What a fabulous retreat in a central location. Huge grounds with an artificial lake, quiet, picturesque and in the evening a hive of activity for fitness and sports. Gardens and picnic areas, security and eats / drinks available at the gates.

Home of giant fle. Went to the giant flea market that is held on weekends at the park. The market is huge and could not be seen in a single day. The park is easily accessible by Skytrain but the crowds are very large for the market. It is interesting in that the makeup is more locals than tourists which is different from other markets in Bangkok.

Great park for both children and runners/ walking. Beautifully maintained park.Has toilets.Play area for children.Running and walking track.BoatingSnack counters.Nice visit around morning and evening time.
Green park. This is a lovely park, just strolling around and look at the reptiles, some of them are huge!! its free aswell.
Lovely park. Can run, walk or cycle around. An oasis in a crazy city. Watch out for the iguanas that run around near the water and enjoy a pedalo for 80p for half an hour on a massive swan.

Relaxing. In the midst of all the high rising buildings and trains and vehicles, one can come and breath out to rejuvenate at this park. Lovely green, lake, entertainment facilities, boating, exercises, cultural Programme make the park lively. People come and feed the fish or pigeons. Come for morning or evening walk or jogging. Beautiful vast place with wLker's tracks, roads, sidewalks. At the entrance, there are some shops to buy food and drinks or some souvenirs. Loved the walk in the park.

Thank Goodness for Lumpini. I'm very thankful to only live 1 KM away from Lumpini Park which I love visiting in the morning with my daughter, who now brings her bicycle. (Bikes permitted after 10am). One complete circle of the park is 2.5km and there's plenty to see including the resident monitor lizards. In Dec /Jan we always attend the free Sunday afternoon concerts by the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra.
Relaxed park. Really nice park. Too bad that the weather was not good but we walked an hour or so and it was really relaxing.
Park to chill and relax. If I were to live here I'd jog in this place every morning! It makes you feel safe and you will never get tired of the view
a beautiful oosis in the center. we stayed in a hotel close to this park ,it;s really good having it in the city's center,good for walks
Nice walk. Good place to have a walk and enjoy the sun especially on week end, you can head up to the market next door which is HUGE! Chase the squirrels they're fun
Relaxing . The park is big, there are a lot of lizards free in the park, there are groups of runners, tai chi, students.... It's a nice place to spend the day.

A piece of peacefulness in a manic city. Possibly the highlight of my trip to Bangkok! What a great place to spend a lazy afternoon in the sun. Plenty of people doing their own thing, lots of greenery and water. The monitor lizards really do top it off nicely!
Just Great!. Extremely relaxing and beautifully maintained. One shouldn't miss this on a visit to the city.Highly recommend.

What a great place to see outdoor wildlife. I visited here during a visit to Bangkok for a wedding and wasn't disappointed in the wonderful scenery, trees, plants and water life. A great place to relax and stroll without a care in the world

Tranquil park. This park is great for all age groups and activity levels.You can join in group Tai Chi or Zombi, go jogging or cycling around designated paths, hire a swan peddle boat, have a snack or just people or lizard watch.Very tranquil just to sit on the lakeside and enjoy the peace.A real oasis within a few meters of busy roads and skytrain rail but unfortunately it is shut at night.

Amazing Park!. Right in front of our hotel, this is an amazing green area right in the heart of Bangkok where people run, walk, do exercise, take kids to play around! Very good! There are lots of lizards, but hey you are in Thailand!
Best lizards Park. Nice park full of lizards, some bigger then me (1.90 cm). Has lakes, ponds, variety of trees and plants and lovely swan boat rides on the lake.
Nice park. Nice park for jogging or cycling or renting one of the boats on the lake. It would be nice if it opened a little later in the evening.
City escape, from the city.. Go to Lumpini Park for chance to get out of the maddness of Bangkok. See the resident monitor lizards that live there.

5 foot Monitor Lizards on the loose! Loved it!. We read about the monitor lizards, and just as soon as we walked into the park we saw a branch in the moat with 5 turtles on it. As we took a picture 2 five foot monitor lizards popped up looking for food about 4 feet below our feet. Nice Park. Go early to avoid the heat.

Peace and quiet in a big bustling city. You wouldn't know you were in a big city when you go into Lumpini Park, it's like being in the countryside!We wandered through and sat down by the water for a bit which was extremely relaxing. The park is beautifully maintained. We were slightly confused by the "no eating and drinking" rule since there seemed to be tables in the park but maybe I was misunderstanding something.A Thai gentleman pointed out to us that there were some animals, "like crocodiles but not crocodiles" round the corner which my husband knew to be monitor lizards. They really did look like crocodiles to me, but were not at all bothered by us taking photos of them.

Great park attractions. The park in the midst of the City of Bangkok is a large green land of a boating lake complete with peddle boats in the shape of swans and real live very large lizards. The populace seem to enjoy the many activities together with a few tourists who have discovered this oasis with many areas dedicated to open air Tai Chi exercise classes sponsored by the Government and delivered free of charge by professional paid instructors. There are several outdoor gyms with good weight lifting equipment and assault courses. The park also caters for the not so energetic with acres of grass and flower beds.
A good jogging / cycling place. The largest breathing lung of Bangkok. Greenery and calm in the centre of a very busy city. Good for walk, good for bicycles - refreshing...

Love to come here if it is not too hot. . It's a lovely park in the heart of BKK. The have all sorts of things here, outdoor pool, outdoor gym, gym, pond, jogging track and so on. It really hols something for everyone.

People Watching at its Finest. People running, walking, doing tai chi with fans. Water Monitor Lizards. Places to sit and people watch. This park has everything, and great scenery too! It's definitely worth a visit, especially in the morning when people are out doing their activities. You can rent pedal bikes if it's not too hot and you feel up to it :)

Great place to run in Bangkok (middle distance). In Bangkok for work for a week, this park saved the day when I needed a place traffic free to run early in the morning. I visited Bangkok in June and even by 6 or 6:30 am the roads were filling up, so while you can run early, it's not ideal. Lumpini park has one large loop that is about 1.3 miles (maybe 1.5) with several smaller loops and a few shaded places with some weights and other equipment. There's restaurants inside the park where you can get some water or other snacks (or even have breakfast). There's easy access to the park by cab or by BTS sky train. It's very near to many of the fancier hotels. There's also tai chi groups in the morning as well as aerobics.

Wish I'd had my work out gear with me at 6 pm. Everybody is busy jogging and working out until 6 pm when everything stops for the National Anthem. There must have been about 80-100 in the aerobics class - it was huge. Pity I couldn't join in.

Early morning attraction. We try to visit early morning to see people excersing, tai chi, dancing etc plus I like to see the massive dragon lizards in the lake. The first time we saw these we thought they were crocodiles but they live quite happy with the public in the park
Just a wlak in the park. Quite a nice and large park in the middle of the city. Couple of lakes to walk around. Big but harmless lizards in the lake.
You have to go there. Great place to exercise or to chill out. Great atmosphere. Close to all the embassies and does not cost anything

A lovely place day or night. Love this place. During the day it's so tranquil. Lots of wildlife (fish, turtles, monitor lizards, birds etc.) just roaming around freely allowing for some great photos. During the night it comes alive with lots of fitness classes going on throughout which seems very popular with the locals. Closes at 9 pm so be wary that you can't walk through but have to go around it......a long way.

Nice, free day out. Only have to pay for sky train.. Nice size park, perfect for filling a couple of hours on a sunny day. Massive lizards roaming and swimming around. Plenty of places to stop for a breather if you need a moment to stop and take it in, and areas with shelter if you get caught in the rain.
Great park in a busy city. Great park in a busy city, one of the most enjoyable things I did in Bangkok. It's very popular with runners so it is fun to sit down and people watch.

Nice park. Lumpini Park is nice and big. They have paddle boats and sell fish food so you can feed the fish from the paddle boat. There are multiple playground areas and plenty of people exercising in the park. Food and drinks are available for purchase. This park as well as all of Bangkok's parks is not dog friendly.
Beautiful Park. A good visit to escape the bustle of Bangkok for a short time. I enjoyed walking around watching the lizards and turtles. Then took a paddle boat on the lake to feed the fish.

Great place to shelter in a thunderstorm taking in the nature around us. We took a walk to the park for some peace and quiet away from the busy city; lovely lakes, plenty of shade from the trees - just felt cooler with all the greenery around. Young families were at the play park, teenagers practising basketball shots, joggers, a group of young people preparing a dance routine etc.... Then the rain started, and got heavier, and heavier......then the thunder and lightening.....we were sheltered under a large sunshade next to the lake for well over an hour where we were able to watch monitor lizards swimming, then taking a stroll right by us. Most were small, then one enormous one, well over two metres, ambled by, crossed the road and headed to the middle of the park.... We also saw a few turtles and fish leaping out of the water. In spite of our shelter we were soaked through but had a thoroughly relaxing and enjoyable couple of hours.There were boats on the lake and gym equipment too, but no one using them in the rain...A lovely tranquil way to while away an hour or two in the city, regardless of the weather...

Tranquil park in the middle of Bangkok. This park is located across the street from my hotel, and not far from Patpong market. Beautiful little park, always peaceful, with plenty of shade trees scattered around to sit under to escape the worst of the heat. Cute little lake is also there with an option to ride boats if desired. There is a snack bar for drinks if interested.
spend a morning here. a really nice park,.. a bit small,... but very green with lots of places to sit,... transforms to a lake when it is raining,...

A beautiful tranquil place.. In spite of visiting Bangkok many times, amazingly this was the first time we had visited Lumpini Park. And it is beautiful. This is a free attraction which also has a large lake with boats that you can hire and self paddle around, and there is also an area which has a selection of free weights for those who wish to keep fit. Quite incredibly, especially when you remember its location, it is very peaceful. There are also cycle lanes and jog lanes for the active and benches ( some shaded ) for the less active ( i.e. Mrs. Electric and myself !!! ). What an incredible place to escape the hustle and bustle of our ( still ) favourite city for a while. Just a little handy tip...do remember to carry water with you. The sun in this part of the world is fierce.

A peaceful and interesting place to exercise.. I go to Bangkok twice a year and always stay in a hotel near Lumpini Park. While staying in Bangkok I try to go to the park almost every day, My visits there are almost always enjoyable. The wide, well-maintained "road" running around the edge of the park (on the inside) is a great place to walk. I have never seen a car on the road, only people walking or jogging. There is interesting wildlife in Lumpini. The park has many large (up to three meters) water monitor lizards that can always be seen swimming, walking on the banks of the ponds or "sunbathing." It must also be emphasized that these lizards pose no threat to anybody. If you leave them alone they will leave you alone. In Lumpini you can also see squirrels, fish and many species of birds. The park also has at least one outdoor "gym" where you can work out for just a little over a dollar. You can also rent paddle boats and take them out on the pond. The best time to go is in the morning when it is cool and there are fewer people.
Relaxing or exercising. A green place in the heart of Bankok where one can enjoy a stroll, a Chi Quong class or jogging through this park

The window of Bangkok . My hobby is running I do running many times per month my favorite place is Lumpini park the air very clean and many people are there and it has many activities suck as yoga running and fitness I love this place

Beautiful Park!. We stayed only a few steps away from this gorgeous park! Who knew there was such a lovely place to step away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. There were beautiful fountains and there were bicycles to rent and ice cream to purchase.

Beautiful oasis in the heart of the city. The central park of Bangkok, with the only difference here being that you will see massive water lizards roaming around along with terrapins. This is an absolute haven away from the hustle and bustle of overwhelming bangkok, and the park is just a beautiful place to sit back and relax. There is an artificial lake in the park, and you can rent a swan pedalo which is 40 baht with a 40 baht deposit. That's for 30 mins and it's lovely to just pedal around the lake and see the downtown skyscrapers looming over the trees. A must visit when in Bangkok, especially if you want to escape the rush of the city.

Dragons in the park. A beautiful park right in the heart of downtown Bangkok. There be dragons here and you'll see them everywhere while you walk along. Also turtles and fish and other wildlife can be seen if you keep your eyes open. The locals come here for running and aerobic dance exercise. I consider it a must see for first time visitors to Bangkok. A lot of Bangkok culture happens right here.

A big park in the city centre. This park is located in the city centre, and very close to MRT Silom station and BTS Sala Daeng station. Better go there in the morning or in the afternoon so that the temperature is not so high.
calerful night market, good food and easy to reach.. station of MRT-lumini,the "night market" exit.many good for sell ,food market tasty,public entertament on big stage.
Worth visiting. Nice park to go for a run or just chill out on the lawn specially if you're staying in the lang suan area which is full of hotels ( I guess 20 min walking, tops).

A nice afternoon at lumpini park. A great place for a nice walk or a little run. Plenty of activity. Big enough to keep you entertained for a couple of hours. Its also walking distance from the snake farm and if you missed your workout session you can always work out at the makeshift gym in the park. A bit rusty but i'tl get the job done! Oh and dont forget your camera. There are big lizards cats and crows that are all over the park!

Superb for an early morning run. With a well marked jogging track, trees all around, and ample distance to cover all over, this was the perfect place for me burn more than a few calories in the morning.. Despite being a hot september morning (when i went there), one would hardly feel the sun due to the cover of the trees around.. The only disadvantage (maybe not for all) was that there were so many people there.. at times i had to weave my path out through the other runners at times when I encountered groups.. Otherwise, it was a fabulous place to breathe fresh air and exercise..

A nice reprieve from Bangkok proper. This little sanctuary of green foliage and marauding monitor dragons is a breath of fresh air in the city. A nice little library is there as well if you gotta hit the books/wifi.

Nice retreat!. The park is visited by several people daily and shows why the general public is maintaining good health.The park is free to visit and a lovely place to spend 2 to 3 hours away from the hustle and bustle.

A little piece of Tranquility. Very close to the City centre and a good place to visit. Quiet peaceful and spacious, the Park is a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of the City. There are a number of quiet walks around the Park, some local animal attractions - Lizards, fish in the lake. On a sunny day yopu could quite easily loose all track of time just wandering around and enjoying the beauty of the Park,

Lumpini Park- Getaway from the city Hustle and Bustle. I stayed at Hotel Dusit Thani, Silom and Lumpini park was just opposite my hotel. I went there one morning and it was really a pleasant place with lots of greenery and I was even fortunate to see one monitor lizard that came out from the lake inside the park and was enjoying the morning sun :). eally peaceful place if you happen to be in silom, must visit
The big park in the heart of Bangkok. Good place in the best location! The park is quite big and clean. There are many activities there such as music in the park, yoga, joking and many more !

visit on a spare afternoon. A nice big public park to visit on a cloudy day (no wind movement and can get very hot) big lake in the middle and often this park is used for public shows, music etc: nice to visit with children.And every day late afternoon the park is used for health runners and arrobics.
Central haven. Amid the mayhem of Bangkok traffic Lumpini offers a range of options for those seeking solace. The concerts are also worth catching if the time is right for you.

Well worth a visit, if you are there at 18:00hrs an amazing experience. This park like all parks in Bangkok is a must to visit. You need to visit and be in the park at 18:00hrs what happens blew me away the first time I saw it. The monitor lizards are a marvel to see. The out door aerobics, and many other classes are amazing, the sheer amount of people that attend. The out door gym equipment which is free to use. All in all worth a visit.

A MUST see. If you want to see Monitor Lizards of all sizes, including HUGE...this is the place. They are everywhere and not dangerous. Also a great place to relax, walk, exercise, etc, while in the city. A great birding site for the birdwatcher who only has an hour or two and no time to hit the real hot spots in Thailand. Lumphini Park is well worth a visit!

Lovely leafy Park. Lovely, tranquil park in the centre of Bangkok. Like a mini central park. We went during the day when it was quiet (and hot!) so morning/evening would be better for activities. Old gym that we had read about online didnt seem to exist and has been replaced with an outdoor machine based gym that isn't very good. Keep an eye out for the monitor lizards! We saw loads - wont come near you but a good photo opportunity! Nice road for cycling/rollerblading around and plenty people were doing this.

Great escape from the Concrete Jungle. Great escape from the Concrete Jungle where you are inundated minute to minute by noise of traffic and polluted air. Great to go to this seemingly endless park to chill out and watch the unexpected.

There be dragons.... even when its hot, I have found shade - it may have been minimal. Lumpini is a bit of an oasis in a crazy frenetic place. When work has not been going well a walk along to some shade, a conversation with the water dragons always gives me a lift. I have stopped trying to count these beautiful creatures - I worry as some seem now to be so big, I might be their lunch if I dozed off...
Lucky Lumpini. very nice park in the middle of Bangkok - some time ago there was talk about building more highrises in this lokation, but luckilly this plan was scrapped
Amazing place to chill, run, cycle or work out. Just love this park - clean and well maintained - perfect place to picnic or exercise - right in the middle of Bangkok.

an oasis in Bkk. away from the traffic and crowds, you will find this park in the center of Bangkok. A blanket, water and refreshments and you can spend a few hours here.
Easy to reach by BTS or MRT
Chill time if you can afford to. If you fancy a bit of tranquility and rest your feet after all the shopping and sightseeing then is is a good place to relax

Where to relax your mind from the chaos of Bangkok. Visit Lumpini Park at least once during your stay in Bangkok. Go late in the afternoon to witness the healthy side of Thai people. You will find people jogging, dancing Zumba, stretching, feeding the doves, boating and simply relaxing. From BTS line, alight at Saladaeng stn or from MRT, Silom stn and just cross the street to the park.

Lovely park, worth a visit if you are in Bangkok for a few days. This is a really lovely park and my favourite in Bangkok. It has great views of the city especially if you rent a swan to peddle in the lake in the middle. The views show off how modern Bangkok is with all sort of corporate buildings in view.There is also some wildlife to be found if you take the time to look around and be patient, we spotted a couple of monitors bobbing around whilst we were in the swan boat along with some turtles by the side of the lake who were chasing each other round. We went to the park at around 4 and stayed til about 5/5.30. Before we left we heard some very loud music playing and noticed quite literally hundreds of people exercising around us, whilst all watching some people at the front leading them. It really is quite a sight to see, watching hundreds of people all doing the same dance routine / exercise routine. I'm not sure whether this is a nightly thing or not but we enjoyed seeing this and taking pictures and videos of the experience.
very worth it. it is nice to go there around 5 pm, once the heat is not that strong. it is a wonderful park, full of people exercising, defenately worth going for a walk to break with the city!

Great park!. Great park! I read about the monitor lizards, and we decided to go check out the park as a break from the traffic and hecticness of Bangkok. Very cool place- free roaming monitor lizards (some are huge!), very cheap paddleboats (40B for 30 minutes), and locals doing aerobics classes. Cute outing, and couples well with the nearby snake farm.
Great park. Great park with good running track going all the way round the outside, aerobic group dancing in the evening and boats to rent on nice lake.

Beautiful!. One of our favourite evening activities in Bangkok is to go for a walk around Lumpini at twilight. It is so tranquil and we love to watch all the different activities going on around us. There's so many paths to choose from. Every time we go we select a different way and always come across something new like a sculpture, building or group of people indulging in some form of healthy excercise.You must see this beautiful park at least once if you have the time.
Great for Morning jog. Smacked in the city. Great for morning jogs though can get very warm and humid. Better to jog in group of two persons unless you are very familiar with the park.

Beautiful City Park in Heart Of City. I was staying in Sukhumvit, and i am a habutial morning jogger, so i found out this is the only and best park for joggers and walkers , i went there and to by surprise it was truly beautiful. its about three km jogging track sorrounded by lush green trees , evening you can go there and listen to live performance .Beautiful place.
the great park on Bkk. The Lumpini Park is one of the most beautiful park in bangkok. It is situated in silom road. is good for exercises and relaxing.

Nice city park.. A nice relaxing place to while away a few hours away from the crazy traffic of Bangkok.The peddle boats are really good value for money too at 40baht(about 80p)for half an hour.lots of birds to be seen,and reptiles,if you are lucky you might see some of the bigger ones .The park is also home to a lot of cats,but they are all very friendly.free gym too .we were there at lunch time when the food sellers seemed to be having a break themselfs .but plenty of street food just outside the park.

Lumpini Park Bangkok. Vast open space is what this Park really offers wlong with its trees and playgrounds.there is an artificial lake where visitors can rent a variety of boats.Paths around the huge park are a popular area for morning and evening joggers.Cycling is also permitted between 10 am and 3pm.there is a smoking ban throughout the Park.since it is a multipurpose park,there are many attractions within the Park.the King Rama 6 statue,the Bird watching activity,Smiling Sun ground is a place for activities designed for disabled people.Bangkok elder citizen club is also here.Homeless children are also given place in the Home of Hope here.

a 2.5km loop. the 2.5km loop gets rather boring to do long runs. no doubt it's a lovely place with like minded walkers, joggers n runners n gives u that peace of mind away from the busy streets of bangkok.. plenty of restrooms (spread throughout the loop), outdoor gym equipment, stretching points as well as little kiosks to buy water n hydration liquids. oh yes, u cud even try an aerobics class while u are at it!as for my long runs, i try to do atleast 10k out on the roads, n run my way into Lumpini park n spend an hour in the loop (4 rounds or so), buy some more water for ur return run home n then hit back home!

An experience!. Wonderful wonderful place!In the heart of the chaotic Bangkok you will find this jewel : a quiet place full of shade and ponds and lawns where you can relax before diving back into the chaotic city.You really won't believe how much this park is big and beatiful.You can sit or take walk around or rent the little boats and just enjoy the tranquility of the place.

Beautiful instead of buildings. Gorgeous park to escape all the high rise buildings - we stayed in the dusit thani just across from lumpini park and got amazing views of it. Great for a stroll late evening and the entrance is all lit up and then short stroll down to the shops

Real break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.. When you think of Bangkok there are many different things that come to mind but relaxing is not one of them, Lumpini park is a break from the hustle and bustle of the craziness. It's big enough to walk around and forget about what's outside its boundaries. Lizards walk around freely and people go about their exercise routines. When the city gets too busy it's the perfect break.
Lovely park. Had a great time walking around this park. Very scenic and beautiful. Not far from Lumpini MTR station.

Monitor Lizards, peaceful lagoons, street vendors, and Buddhist shrines.. Very cool peaceful park near the Hotel Muse. Check it out and then go to the rooftop bar at the Hotel Muse for a drink and light fare/tapas. Super deluxe!

Best Park in Bangkok. Right in the middle of the city is the perfect park to exercise, to go for a stroll or for a date. The running perimeter is 2.5km every evening at 6 there are free aerobic classes and many other activities.

best place ever. oh my god!!! i had sooo much fun with my friend at lumpini park, we sat in the boat and peddled around the park for ages and fed the fish and saw so many monitor lizards! best experience there

Green relief from crazy traffic and hot dusty city. A lovely respite from the crazy traffic, hot busy streets and high pitched buzz of Bangkok city life. Has lakes, ponds, variety of trees and plants and lovely swan boat rides on the lake.

Recommended if you are staying nearby and staying long term. Simple, not so beautiful park with many interesting local people doing their park-ish things. The park is gated and the gates are sometimes at inconvenient locations.

Relaxing park in busy Bangkok. Great place to walk or run and take in the activities of locals exercising, eating or just enjoying the outdoor space. The water dragons are special and can be found sunning themselves around the water. Nice spot to join in tai chi or the outdoor gym

Time best spent elsewhere. We rode a tuk tuk to this park as I like to take a walk in a pretty park or garden. This park although there were plenty of gardeners was below par, probably the worst park or garden I've ever visited anywhere yet. If you veer off the tourist parts of the park it is very unkempt. Save your time in Bangkok for something else....

A retreat center capital. Tired of walking and visiting the city on Sukhumvit Road. To Silom Road.Stayed at the park. A place that has a good sniff. There are those who exercise in the evening. I spent three hours here when I tired to continue. But be careful with valuables. Please leave this place before 18.00 PM.

Peace and quiet, sort of. A haven surrounded by the bustling streets of Bangkok. Nice ponds and lakes with plenty of fish to feed. Great for a stroll or if you're feeling more energetic, join in one of the many keep fit classes in the park in the evening. Just a nice place to go for a break from the hustle and bustle.

Oldest park in the City is still a great find. I don't know if this is the largest, but Lumpini Park is definitely one of the oldest parks in the City. It is in a central location- walking distance from Sala Deang BTS and the connecting MRT station, as well as close to many large hotels, including Dusit-Thani. There are plenty of walking/ jogging paths inside as well as a small lake where you can rent paddle boats. On Thursday mornings there is an outdoor market. Most days there are many small vendors around the outside of the park who serve a quick breakfast or lunch. If you're new to the area, you can buy a good Thai-style meal for just a couple of dollars- 50-60 Baht. There are several neighborhoods close by where you can find sit-down restaurants, if you prefer.
Nice park. I love to come here once in a while to relax. The park itself is nice and clean. You can work out, rent a bike, do a boat paddling.

Nice and peaceful in a busy city . The park is definitely worth a visit to chill out and relax. Lovely well kept land with various buildings and pieces of art to view. Great Lakes that you can rent a boat on. All of which are overlooked by the towering city sky scrapers. One could easily spend a few hours here. Take a break from the city and check it out.
