Clean air and monitor lizards!. A lovely place to walk, read, enjoy a bit of nature during a busy Bangkok holiday. Be sure to look for the monitor lizards in the streams and ponds. They grow to large size and are fun to watch. Nice birds, too.

Nice green space get away. This was the first location my friend and I hit up when we got to Bangkok as it was a short distance from our hotel. In a city where space is at a premium, it's nice to relax and stretch out in this park. Aside from the different wildlife (you can spot Komodo Dragons around the water), locals use the park for walking, resting, and even lifting weights. A great place to get a run in - believe me, much safer than the streets - as cars are not allowed in. Small shrines can be found and the Southwest entrance boasts a huge shrine to King Rama VI. Also a great place to catch some shade on a hot Bangkok day.
Green Park. One of the heart park in Bangkok, near Silom rd. It is good way to relax here, Exercise, Tai Chi. Dont come at the night. Morning is good time to visit. MRT Silom.

An oasis of peace .. with a bot of traffic noise of course, this is Bangkok !!. Lumpini Park is a great place to escape the madness and craziness of Bangkok. I has a track around the path that allows bike riding, running, a few outdoor exercise machines as well as a lake in the middle with various water activities.A great place to take a picnic and escape for a few hours.Don't forget that if you are running at 6pm and everybody suddenly stops.. it is the National Anthem of Thailand being played so make sure that you stop out of courtesy and respect...

sun damaged. not really worth a visit. grass sun damaged and not looked after very well. ok if you need a short sit down for a drink and sandwich. suppose its nice to have a little bit of greenery in the midst of the city. visit 2001
great park. lovely park in the middle of the city and well organised for fitness training or just a stroll. peaceful and welcoming.
Nice respite from shopping. I come here whenever I am in Bangkok, to walk around at get some exercise. I really like that they have these green spaces in the otherwise pretty built up city.

The park to visit.. For all the serious joggers or walkers, or even to take a break and relax away from the traffic.this is it.Great spot to read a book,relax or even do some people watching.Very easy to reach and conveniently located.

Great retreat when wanting to take a retreat from the big city life. This park is just great to go to if you cannot get out of the city for a longer trip. On weekends or during weeks, this park is open and always a nice change from the busy and bustling city of Bangkok with all its traffic. Here you can feed fish, take walks, run, swim, do Yoga and do a lot of people watching. Do yourself the favor to go here and explore the park with its massive size.

Delightful walk around the park. Not particularily a big park but big enough for a walk around it for exercise, relaxation and some fresh air (??). Good to see public aerobic exercises about with good attendance. We have been to many beautiful parks in major cities and this one does not stand out to impress us much, I'm afraid. Pretty average only.
Great recreational park in centre of Bangkok. Went for a very enjoyable two hour walk around this very interesting park.an oasis in the centre of Bangkok well worth the visit
Best free venue in Bangkok. Tip go at dawn. . Best free venue in Bangkok. Tip go at dawn and join in to ballroom dance or aerobic. Look under bridges for monsters. Stand still for 6pm anthem.

A Great Park. I have visited this place before on previous visits but really did not spend a lot of time there. This trip I decided to take the sky train from my hotel to the park to run. There is a pretty good evening crowd that runs around the park. The park itself is really a nice place to relax and/or exercise. They have a decent indoor gym with a pool that you can join quite reasonably if you are visiting. There is also a pretty serious outside gym for the really serious weightlifters. I do not know what cost is for that one. There is also a very nice lake in the park. Duck boat rentals are available there.
Central Park of Bangkok. If you jog, walk, practice yoga or need a green space this is the place to go. Easy to reach via Sky train. A retreat is sometimes needed in the big bustling city of Bangkok.

Loved it. Goregous place.. A fab park. A little bit of quiet hidden in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Several stunning lakes where you can take little boat rides with lots of quaint houses etc and other pieces of architecture to sit in. Watch out though if you go during Thai new year...... we got soaked. Lots of Thais everywhere with water pistols.

Have a round to burn callories. I had a evening visit to this park with my local Thai & Indian friends. We started and kept on talking and walking. The complete round may be approx 2 km but we could not believe that as the surrounding is good, you feek you are close to nature and visa versa, even though the park is at center of Bangkok city. At the end of round, we were more charged than start. We really enjoyed!

Lumpini Park. I never miss the opportunity to make a getaway to the park when I am in Bangkok. Lumpini Park is one of the few green islands that Bangkok has , also made it the subject of special care. The activities are numerous and high attendance. All ages go there and find their happiness. The landscapers make many effort to offer the impression of being in a huge garden in the leafy vegetation. For some time there are more and more water-monitors and you must be careful because they can be aggressive if you approach too close ,,, Nice park

Lovely Park. It was nice to walk and to be surrounded by trees for a couple of hours away from the chaos of the city even though the Park itself is in the heart of the city but just don't go during noon time as it is really hot and humid.
for sport, nature lovers and families with kids. if you want to relax it's oasis in the city center! perfect for families, sport and nature lovers...

A very nice place for relaxation in the middle of the city :). A significantly spacious area with lakes, fountains in the middle of the lakes, and some canals filled with water apart from the lakes, this park is truly an "urban oasis" in the middle of a bustling area of the city (right beside Rama IV Road). The presence of a fairly grand clock tower just inside the entrance from Rama IV near Lumphini MRT Station and a tall statue of Rama VI on the other end of the park along the same road speak to the fact that this is no ordinary park, and indeed it has some history of being the first public park of Bangkok decreed by the king (Rama VI) himself.Be sure not to miss some things that can easily be overlooked in the park such as the turtle egg shells (stones really) with horoscopic signs near the Clock Tower, the little square-shaped pavilion on a grass area, the Buddha shrine at some inside area of the park, and yes you might even catch a glimpse of a big lizard crossing your path or beside it!The park is just a few minutes' walk from Lumphini MRT (just cross Rama IV after exiting the station and then just on your left is the park entrance), and actually Silom MRT is also right across the park further down on Rama IV, but I'm not sure if there's a proper entrance to the park near that station, so I would suggest taking the MRT to Lumphini.There are small food vendors in the park, but I guess you could also bring food from outside for picnicking and such, and there are swan boats for pleasure peddling in the lakes available.
Lovely Park. Take a walk round the lake and see how many lizards you can spot. Some of them are huge! You can also spot them from the pedalos.

Good open park in the middle of Bangkok. A lovely park surrounded by almost all the Embassies of the world, great to relax in.The surrounding buildings represent a snapshot of Bangkoks Manhattan feel as the buildings get larger and taller

Favourite park in Bangkok. Was only able to visit here once on this trip, but it is still one of my favourite places in Bangkok. Terrific place to get some excel isle while holidaying. Met a very friendly local as well, so that was a pleasant bonus.
nice getaway. a nice getaway in the middle of bangkok. it's silent and you see a lot of locals jogging or biking. it is nice

A beautiful park. Lumping park is a very large and serene park in the heart of Bangkok. It provides an island of peace and quiet away from the snarl of the traffic. Nice place for a walk and visit with the family
relax time. nice to walk around ,can use to training if is not too hot outside if you want realx and feel nature must go~~~~~

Pleasant Surprise in the heart of Bangkok. We stayed in a Hotel near here and went for a walk one afternoon, with out our cameras/phones.Take your camera!! Lovely park used by many locals to run, walk and bike. Lovely play areas, great stationary exercise equipment around the park too! But what we did not know about were the giant Monitor Lizards roaming about!! Wow was a very cool surprise! Returned the next day with cameras. Take note insect repellent is a good idea here, a few mosquitos around with the large lakes and canals, I did get munched on quite badly.

A place where all of Bangkok exercises. Lovely park with no car traffic, bike lanes and a lot of locals doing their morning routine. The main park loop is around 2.5km, accessible through several gates. Go early to avoid the heat and don't forget to stop when the national anthem is played at 8am!

Lumpini Park. . Trying to find somewhere away from noise and hussle in bangkok must be almost impossible. I visited the park one evening and loud music was playing for people to join in and keep fit, however, we had a lovely paddle around the lake for 30 minutes and we did see a large monitor lizard swimming past. Green yes and did offer some escape from the city. Probably better to visit at a different time if you want to relax away from the noise. The park can be a dangerous place at night. (Like any city).

A great park close to BTS and MRT. Lumpini Park is good for running. It is located closed to BTS and MRT trains. After running or exercising in the park, you can go for some nice food stalls in Silom.Toilets are available in the park. If you forget your water bottle, do not worry. There is a kiosk selling bottled water at reasonable price.

Not your usual park wildlife!. This park has swan pedalos, grass and pigeons. As any good park should. But here the pigeons also have a predator. What sets this park apart is the lizards that inhabit the bank. They're pretty fearsome looking- more so given the first one I saw snuck up on a group of pigeons and grabbed one for a 3pm afternoon tea. Amazing to watch, but didn't fancy getting too close, especially given I was wearing flip-flops

Nature at the heart of Bangkok!. Went here on our last day in Thailand for an early morning jog. This is the best place to jog in Bangkok. Very lush greens everywhere, could be a perfect place to meditate. The entire park is so huge. Many tourists come here for their morning walk and coffee. While jogging, we saw some monitor lizards, a lot of them, which was quite surprising! You should definitely visit here, and its FREE!

Greenhouse among bustling Bangkok. Lumpini park is a lovely green oasis and a welcome escape from the chaos of Bangkok and a day of shopping The park has shaded paths for walking, bike trails and exercise equipment.Take a early morning stroll or jog or watch the local doing Tai Chi. Great park to relax or take photos.
Green lung of BKK. Nice to stroll around in early morning, avoiding the heat. Watch people doing their morning routines. Prepare for a busy day.
An oasis. A beautiful oasis in otherwise heavily urbanised area of Bangkok. A bit hard to reach walking, involving crossing some heavily trafficked roads.

FAV PARK. I travel to BKK every year for business and never miss a trip to this beautiful park - pack a little snack and some refreshments and kick back and people watch it always clears my mind and I really enjoy the visit

A wonderful place to jog, relax, and all!. Lumpini Park is one of the few green spaces we have in Bangkok. I often go jogging here in the evening, when the park becomes vibrant (and much cooler). For those looking for a bit of exercises there are up to three open-air aerobics where you can join and leave as you feel like (around 5-6 p.m.) -- it is fun and free of charge. No needs to wear aerobic clothing. Otherwise you can go for a run on the jogging route, play with the resident cats along the way, and if you are lucky enough, spot the monitor lizards. Alternatively, you can also sit back and relax by the ponds. My favourite activity is feeding the hungry fishes and the turtles. You can buy the fish food and bread from sellers at 10THB per pack. Watching the fish gobble up all the bread is a fun and rewarding experience.
Highlight of Bangkok. I loved this place. Not a big park fan as such but this was great. Loved the lizards walking around and the turtles etc. Lovely safe place to stroll and chill out

A lovely day out. We have had some lovely walks in Lumpini Park. It is so large that it never seems crowded. If you go early morning, you can see the locals doing Tai Chi. The lake is lovely and you can hire boats. We like the huge monitor lizards (up to 2 metres in length) that you see either in the water or on the grass banks.
Tranquil oasis. Beautiful park and you must look out for the massive monitor lizards. You can also buy food from various people around the park and feed the catfish and carp.
Chill Out. Lumpini is our retreat when the city gets to much. A nice place to just chill and relax and now really easy to get to via the BTS skytrain.

Expected more. Green park with Komodo dragons. Despite years ago we saw on TV that there were some big komodo dragons we only saw a few dragons not add big as expected, around 1 meter long.It's easy to get there by BTS
Have a Good Walk. Lumpini Park offers a peaceful setting in the middle of the City where you and walk, exercise or just relax on a bench.

Fabulous, quiet and fun. Walk around on the grass, take a boat on the lake, play in the outdoor gym, marvel at the surprising wildlife or simply sit on the grass and relax. In the middle of the city this place is fabulous :)

Love this Park. Bang in the centre of Bangkok, lots of activities to do in the park such at walking, cycling and light jogging. Lots of people there every night and a pleasant way to spend a few hours getting away from the madness that is Sukhumvit. Worth a few hours (if it's not raining)

Morning Fun!. Spent a few hours here in the morning, had a lovely walk around the lake, not too long so the kids enjoyed it, despite the heat.Plenty of places to buy bottled water, which was essential.Ended with half an hour on the pedaloes on the lake, always good for a laugh.Nice morning, worth doing just for a change of scene.
Tranquil and peaceful.. What a beautiful park to have a stroll around. For joggers and walkers alike. Bring a bottle of water and just chill out for an hour or so in the middle of Bangkok city.

a calm haven. this is a relaxing place to visit in the middle of Bangkok.it is especially interesting in the dawn and dusk times as there are large groups of locals doing their exercises which is a joy to watch.there are free range lizards and turtles to watch too.sometimes there are markets to look around.

An oasis spot in the middle of concrete urban living. As I mentioned above, Lumpini park is right in the middle of downtown Bangkok. For those who like to exercise in the morning or after work in the afternoon. This park is not very big , one can easily stroll around. In the morning ,there are always a lot activities and one could freely join in like aerobic dance, Taichi, Chinese sword exercise, Yoga etc. On top of that! there is also a rather nice food court located within the ground, with all sort of food and drinks. I highly recomend a stroll in the morning, and after .....a nice break for breakfast in the food court ...You will love this escapade indeed...Have fun ....
Sitback & relax. Good place to relax from the heat & crowd of Bangkok, however gets crowded after 6 pm. Very close to Lumpini metro station, lush green with water ways. A good place for workout.

A place to relax after the hustle and bustle of the city!. After shopping and lunch we headed to Lumpini park to sit and relax for a while. It was just about sunset time and the greenery, lake and cool breeze was very welcoming. This park is huge and well maintained- a nice place to sit down by the lake and watch the sun go down the sky-scraping buildings of Bangkok.You can also do boating in the lake or feed the birds. Do visit for a few hours to relax.

In need of serious TLC. I am still a fan of Lumpini because of its rarity, (one of the few green spaces in the sprawling metropolis). However, it is now well over a year since it was cleared of protesters whose presence caused much damage and destruction.Sadly, whoever has responsibility for taking care of the park has made very little effort to properly restore broken and damaged areas, (albeit not solely as a result of the aforementioned encampment, but some an accumulation of years of neglect). The variety of rubbish bins in various states of disrepair are themselves an eyesore. These are in addition to the decaying bridges, pathways and signage. Is it not possible to have an effective plan to restore this wonderful space to something truly special in Bangkok - primarily for its residents?New lavatories were built a few years ago, but now these have been made into semi residential areas for the attendants and their hangers on, and the insides, with decrepit facilities and wet floors, are as horrible as anyone could fear. Outside all manner of rubbish defeats any beauty that was fleetingly visible before they were colonised as hangouts for the attendants. And what's the point of the park security? Does anyone ever supervise them or any of the employees at the park?Please can this park be restored to its full potential of a place of beauty?

Lovely Park to enjoy. What I liked about this park is that you can have a picnic with your family or friends. Do a bit of sports whether by walking or using the machines provided in the park. You can hub into the Swans boats and do a bit of exercise as well . It's a lovely place to go to that you can enjoy even if you are alone.
Large park. A big park with some old play stuff for the kids, i was personally not impressed. You can rent a boat to go on the water, i would not do that in the midday as it gets very hot.
Relaxing stroll in the park. Lumping park in the middle of the stressful city gives you a nice oasis for relaxation just stroll around or sit at one of the seated areas and observe people walking by.

Very serene. Such a nice place to be at no matter what the time :) a little breather from all the walking/heat of bangkok. Kids can have fun feeding fishes and pigeons. Though i doubt anyone can get tired or bored there! Aerobic open air started at about 5:20

Take a deep breathe at the middle of concrete jungle. Hard to believe that place like this can exist in megalopolis like a Bangkok. When you feel that you going crazy because of noise - go in Lumpini. Feel yourself like somewhere far away. And giant varans is something incredible. Chinese gymnastics or powerlifting, temples or sports fields - you can find everything there.

Lumpini Park, Bangkok.. This park almost in the the centre of Bangkok, is a favourite meeting place for all nationalities, now well away from the troubles during the uprising two years ago. Spacious, tree lined yet a major open space in the city surrounded by skyscrapers and business buildings, it nevertheless attracts crowds of both locals and tourists, who can sit on the grass or near the water, picnic or just arrange to meet up. Jogging in the heat and humidity there would take a stronger man than me !
Good for a morning run. I like to go early mornings around 5 to 6am. Clear BKK air and see the city coming alive with all young and old exercising or simply take a stroll.

Great park for the kids. As the title dictates, it's a great park to bring the kids and have a play around with. Though, it's really nothing special. If you're looking for somewhere to relax for the day, I'd recommend Lumpini Park. You'll be able to spend the whole day here as the giant trees give plenty of shade.

Stunning. As lover's of the outdoors the family loved this park.
Beautiful lush green oasis in the heart of this great city
Good place for a walk. If you are in Bangkok and need a walk not on the busiest streets, the Lumpini Park is a nice place to walk and have some quiet moments in central Bangkok.

A Green Oasis in BKK. A very green oasis in a central part of the city. It is a really nice stroll around the park, enjoy the runners, joggers, and bikers. Now that the tents have been cleared out after the sit-ins of a few years ago, it is back to being a great place.

Beautiful Park...Relax in Nature. Lumpini Park is a very big park for tourist and locals to relax after their tiring day. You can paddle the boat in the small lake in the park and in the morning or evening you can stretch your body to be fit. It is very Beautiful Park.
Relaxing spot in Bkk. Usually empty in middle of the day.Very good for relaxing and unvinding after exploring the city.Leave no later than 6 p.m. as the mosquito comes out for a bite.

Superb city center park. Even in the tropical heat Lumpini Park is an oasis where you can stroll and even find shade to relax in. Braver souls than ours use the park for their jogging, mostly in the early mornings and evenings. The nearby night market is a delight that comes to life at sunset when cooler temperatures attract a wide range of Thais and tourists to sample the food stalls and shopping. A fun place to visit.

WONDERFUL SPOT. Peaceful spot in the middle of a bustling city. Dragons abound by the lake and so can see plenty of them. Watch locals having their picnics and other striving to get fitter cycling around this venue. The lake has padelo's on it in the shape of a swan if you are keen.

Yes you need to visit here.. Loved this place. Its an oasis in a concrete jungle. I wished I had visited earlier in my many trips to Bangkok. There are lots a interesting critters around and some are rather large. Keep an eye out for them as they blend in well. Its very quiet there and a good place to chill out.
Large park. Great park for strolling around as it is huge and easy to navigate. Close to BTS and MRT so easy to access.

A must see to watch over one hundred locals do aerobics. It's a beautiful park to get away from all the city buzzing, even though it is right in the center of lots of action around it. I took the rail and there is an underground walkway so to avoid having to cross a huge street. I find this park a must see due to over one hundred people exercising in the evening. They jog or do aerobics. They put on load music, have some aerobic leaders and everyone does their best. Quite amazing to witness. Then the presidential hymn plays and everyone stops to give honor. This happens every day, I believe it was either at 5:30pm or later. Also, they have little boats for rent at the park. This place was one of my highlights.

Excellent and quite green park in center of Bangkok. Very nice park for family time and jogging.It has a lake in central area. Big green open spaces. Everything is clean and accurate. Very quite and beautiful urban park with attractions for tourists: pedal water boat, feeding fishes, dragons and turtles.

Welcome to central park I mean Lumpini. . It's pretty beautiful and very refreshing if like me you have spent the past three hours walking down Street after Street. Beware the snake lizards that love to surprise you. They're harmless I'm sure...
Nice evening. Gardens are always mine choice for spending evenings. Lumpini park is quite big. The main attraction is exercise. And paddling boat. Nothing more

Nice bit of green in the middle of the city.. It was nice to walk around some open green space in the middle of Bangkok. It is large enough that you don't feel crowded and we were passed by many joggers. It seems very secure with lots of CCTV and guards, but we were still harassed a couple of times by fortune tellers wanting our money. There were some quirky interesting sculptures and statues as well.

A walk in the park.. Lovely place to walk. Been there more than a hundred times. Fantastic healthy food in the morning, early. Two outdoor gyms. Lots of wildlife to see. Paddle boats. Swimming facilities and tennis.

Eerie. A busy and well used park. Go there either at 5 am to see the Hundreds of Chinese Thai doing Tai Chi or at 6pm to experience the National Anthem. The pedalos are well maintained and very inexpensive.

Great getaway in Bangkok. Lumpini Park is a green oasis in the middle of Bangkok. It is well maintained and you can rent a boat on the lake. Very relaxing place. Birds and wildlife inside the park, I once spotted a lizard passing just in front of me. Must have been at least 1 meter long, maybe 1,5. Go there for a "break" from Bangkok.
The best to walk in Bangkok. Walk, bike, dance to your hearts content here. What a beautiful park in the center of Bangkok. It is very similar to New York's Central Park as an oasis of sorts.

Nice. Nice place, good view and a lot of trees. U can enjoyed and get good feel it here. Use slow life in here it too be good one i think. When u came here don't forget to visit this place... Have fun 😀

A park in the middle of the hustle and bustle - nice get away. One must at least visit this place while in Bangkok. its a haven in the middle of the big city and while inside you can relax with peace and quite. The views of the towering buildings through the trees is a photographs dream. Rent a swan paddle boat and sail the lake. The park is easily access via BTS Sala Denag or MRT Lumpini or Silom station.
a lot of trees. Nice park area with a lot of trees. A good place for sport and running but also for other activities.

beautiful park. lovely park in the middle of bangkok metropolis nice to just wander around or sit and watch the birds or just watch the world go by. mrt is near by should you want to get there cheaply
relaxing green. Nice and quiet. Wonderfull green and river. Hardly seen any monitor lizards :-( but still a nice place for taking a stroll.

There are better parks to visit in BKK. I think this park gets so many high marks just because of the location. As far as a park is concerned there are several in Bangkok(and in other parts of Thailand) that are easily better than this.First and foremost this park is often used for political demonstrations. It has the highest number of homeless of any park in Bangkok. People get mugged and there have been murders here. I also find that it isn't really manicured as well as other parks in the city. If you live around here I'm not saying don't go. What I am saying is if you are looking for great parks try Rama IX Park, Chaktujak Park, or Queens Park at Phrom Phong. These parks are part of the Thai Royal Organization and they are much better looked after and free of some of the sleazy stuff I wrote about above.

'Must see' park. A relaxing, peaceful experience. The lungs of the city. Must see in Bangkok. Easy to access by BTS or MRT (or tuk-tuk or taxi). Take a walk through the park. Feed the fishes. Take a paddle boat. Meet and talk to locals. Take a picnic basket with you. Free fun. You can't be disappointed!

Green Oasis. Lumpini park is a lovely green oasis and a welcome escape from the chaos of Bangkok. The park has shaded paths for walking, bike trails and exercise equipment. We enjoyed walking around and seeing the myriad types of physical activities. Watch out for the giant (but quite docile) lizards sunning themselves on the grass. No entry fee.

Amazing. When we looked at all the photos on Tripadvisor showing the Monitor Lizards we really did not think we would really, actually see any, how wrong we were. They were everywhere! They are spectacular, within 5 mins of entering the park we had seen one, nearly stepped on a turtle and observed a giant millipede. We spent about 30mins in the park, it was like a safari. The lizards are amazing, quite tame to so you get close to them for photos etc. We also hired a paddle boat to go out onto the lake for pennies! Highly recommended and a highlight of our time in Bangkok!
Green lung of Bangkok. A green lung in the center of the city which is a good respite from the heat and hectic pace of life of the city. Lovely to walk around and mingle with the locals.

A nice place to spend some time. We have always wanted to visit Lumpini Parka and finally got there. It is a nice park to sit and watch the world go by. We would have loved to do the paddle boats, but we both had sore legs from climbing too many stairs the day before! Would suggest visiting here if you would like some downtime.

Centrally Located... green cover. It can be said as the Central Park of Bangkok. Large and green, It provides a welcomed open space amid the skyscrapers.You can have a picnic here and relax with family...
Must visit. Spend sometime in the park to enjoy the greenery and the silence. During my visit, we ended up spending 2+ hours in the park, just roaming around and enjoying the nature.

Quiet Place in the middle of the busy city. Buy some take-away food & come here to have a quiet pleasent lunch. Get a chance to watch idle monitor lizards strolling around & enjoy the beauty of nature in the middle of megapolis.

Very cool. This park was like no other I have seen. Very interesting and such a mixture of culture on display here. Was definitely worth a look. Had a great run and met some lovely locals. Was good escape from the crazy city buzz

Central Park of BKK. Central Park of Bangkok. Situated next to Sala Daeng BTS station, easy to access and beautiful. There many places where you can buy a snack or a bottle of water for TBH 10.00. A very peaceful place, perfect for weekend picnics :)

A welcome escape from the hist le and buste of Bangkok.. During our stay in Bangkok we were mighty grateful for this lovely park which was a real escape from the frenetic city life.A great place to walk, run and even take part in an aerobic flash mob!We also spotted komodore lizards and turtles in the lake as well as some beautiful trees in bloom.I felt as though my batteries were recharged after ambling there!
Nice little oasis. A nice little green oasis in the city. A lovely walk round, clean loo's. A good opportunity for a bit of a breather from the mania that is bangkok.

great place to chill out or work out. good open space in the heart of Bangkok, it had some great public exercise contrptions, and loads of locals were working out on them. a peaceful friendly place. some of the kids play appratice could be done with being replaced.look out for the monitor lizards that roam the park, they are great for a photo. we were lucky enough to watch one catch a large fish..

A decent park, tropical, not the best in Bangkok. I just visited this park last week. It's not bad, definitely tropical, spacious, lots of open space and water, but aside from all that nothing so special. Suan Luang / Rama 9 park is better, more interesting designed natural areas, better plant development, shadier, but then that park is way out of city center, probably not worth a trip for a tourist. Rot Fai park--not far from Chatuchak Park and the Mo Chit BTS station--is about as good, also more out of the way. For me the Dusit Zoo is as good as a park, and much better for kids, because it has a lot more mature plant growth, plenty of space, a zoo, and options like a tram, lots of food alternatives, a seal show, etc. It's nice that it's right in the city but then you get some road noise on the edges too. Those monitor lizards are all over the place in Bangkok, and they are cool.
Great for Outdoor Running/Yoga/Tai Chi. Great for jogging, running, yoga, Tai Chi, and outdoor exercises.The place could get a bit crowded though. I love running here.
Breath of fresh air. A lovely park in the centre of BKK, not far from Sukumvit Rd. and close to BTS stn. Lots of things for kids to do &/or makes for a very pleasant morning or evening wander.

Lovely. Really beautiful. A green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. Observe the daily routine of the bangkok people, big chilled lizards and other animals. So relaxing and a nice break from busy bangkok. But don't come to late if you want to see the lizards sun bathing ;)

Beautiful park with wildlife!. I read nothing about this park before going so I had no idea what to expect (or see). The park itself is beautiful and a great way to escape the hustle and bustle or the city.Sitting at the pond we saw tons of fish, birds, and turtles. All of a sudden a massive thing starts coming out of the water and walking towards us. I am not afraid of animals but this certainly started me. Apparently these are called water monitors and are frequently seen around the park. They are normally harmless, but I wouldn't get too close. It was very cool though!

Monitor lizard park. Great escape from the hustle and bustle. This big park has plenty of animals which is unique for a big city. Saw many water monitors, Ravens, herons, egrets, squirrels and other birds. Kids would love it. Has plenty of big trees to shade you from the tropical heat.

Chill out and watch the city run by. Want to take a rest from the fast pace of the city, come down to the park and chill out and breath in the atmosphere.Into fitness great place for a jog.Want a good place for the young family just bring them here
Quiet.. Nice park for a quiet walk in the middle of Bkk. Go and see the lizards, they can be found all over the park. Interesting, especially for the kids.

An oasis in the city. I love to walk through the park and just relax. There are great walking paths and plenty of natural scenery and beauty to enjoy. I highly recommend going on a Sunday at 5:30 for the concert in the park with the Bangkok Symphony!

Go Chill!!. I would never say a place like Lumpini Park is a must see whilst you are in Bangkok. But if you are in this wonderful city and have time on your hands. Then I can recommend a visit to Lumpini. Once in the park you forget about the hustle and bustle of the surrounding city. Perfect for the joggers and fitness fanatics. There is exercise equipment and weights for all to use. Plus a swimming pool. You may want to take some food with you and just chill next to one of the lakes. Enjoy.

Large Park > Great Widlife > Park Looking a Little Tired. Lumpini Park had always been somewhere thta I had wanted to visit. Especially to see the wild Water Monitor Lizrads in their own habitat. The Lizards were easy enough to find - almost anywhere where ther eis water in the park! The park is extensive and you should allow at least 1 hour for walking through or around the perimeter. Many of the out buildings look a little tired, however they do offer a little relief from the sun in the middle of the day. There are public toilets dotted through the park available for the princely sum of just 2 Baht.

Nice place for walking . If u nearby don't miss it, nice park with big open spaces for alot of activities, play ground for kids, track for bicycles or running, you will see also alot of animals such as turtles, big amphibious lizards and so many fish as well

The Green Lung of Bangkok. Come early in the morning when its coolest and take a run around the park or watch some of the activities going on around you. Can get here by MRT or BTS so its very convenient.

Gorgeous Park for a Picnic. This was a truly lovely park in the heart of Bangkok. They had some interesting fitness machines and lots of runners and cyclists. There were paddle swans and a nice area next to the lake for a picnic. I really loved the orange flowering trees.

Green Paradise in the heart of the city. We stayed near Saladaeng station and Lumpini Park turned out to be the biggest stress reliever for us. The park has beautiful green lawns, water ponds, running tracks, free aerobics classes and much more. It s a beautiful place to spend your mornings and evenings.
A Great Park to Run. A great place to go for a run in the morning and to meet local Thais from all ages, elderly practicing sword and taichi, families with children.
Visit if nearby. Our hotel sat almost on the park so easy for us to walk around. Not the greatest park ever but interesting especially with children as lots of very large water bound lizards.

Lumphini Park . . . Nice. This park is worth the time to stroll through it. I loved walking this park and seeing all the people making use of it. It's large, clean, well landscaped. I enjoyed sitting in the park Sunday morning and watching so many people jogging and exercising at 7:45am! At 8:00am as everywhere in Thailand the National Anthem is played over loudspeakers. Everyone stops what they're doing, stands, and waits for the music to end. The first time I experienced this was at a bus station in Chiang Rai and was amused by it because the dogs were howling with the music. The second time, I stood and showed my respect.

A relaxing park in the heart of Bangkok. Every time I go to Bangkok I make sure to spend some hours at Lumpini Park. It is so relaxing to be surrounded by green gardens, beautiful plants and flowers. So nice to be, all of a sudden, far away from the noise and pollution of Bangkok crazy traffic. You can go any time but, in my opinion, the best is at sunset. Quite moving, at 6:00 pm, when the national anthem is played, seeing everybody standing in silent and paying respect to the King.
big park in central BKK. wanna go footing n the afternoon with lots of people running together , that's your park ,,,, very few foreginers though

Lovely place to read a book!. I love to come and relax at the park with all the hustle and bustle going on outside the park its so relaxing next to waters edge. Personal favourite of mine are the monitor lizard but they are not everyones cup of tea. For friends visiting thailand for the first time i always enjoy taking them here for the national anthem when the park comes to a stand still to pay respect, very surreal for most people to see for the first time.

An oasis in the center of busy Bangkok. It was my last day in Bangkok city and I still had one place yet to be marked off my check list, Lumpini Park. Lumpini Park located in the heart of the business district of on the north of Rama IV road. It was quite peaceful to see the lots of locals especially senior citizens carrying out the morning exercise routines in the traditional thai style, with slow and graceful movements.The park has some small lakes as well and ample of benches to relax. And yes, I was lucky enough to spot the famed monetary lizard, that is known to be a feature in this park.A must visit to relax and take back the tranquility with you before you fly back to your busy lives.Cheers

A Little Humdrum For a Park. I love parks and living so close to Gardens by the Bay in Singapore, I'd say it's a little tough to find something so dramatically beautiful, even if man-made, elsewhere in Asia. Having said that, I must admit I wasn't completely taken with Lumpini Park. Although I think it does a good job of providing a lovely patch of greenery to residents and visitors in Bangkok, for when pollution and crowd fatigue syndrome gets a little too overwhelming. The park itself is quite big and nice enough for a stroll, jog, or leisure cycling. We particularly like the lake in the middle of the park and you can rent a small boat/duck boat for 40 Bht for a 30-minute spin around the lake. It's very relaxing to just be floating away in the water, especially on a hot day/afternoon. Look out for the big lizards lazing on the banks or swimming across the water. I was a bit scared because some of them look like baby crocodiles! There are drinks/snack stalls just outside the park so make sure you buy a bottle of water - or two - if you intend to stay in the park for more than an hour. The park can get pretty crowded in the late afternoon towards early evening so picking out a spot to just sit and ruminate might be challenging. In this case, you're better off taking a stroll or a slow jog - both good exercises for the heart.

An oasis in the city. We were really happy to find out about this park just 5-10 minutes walk from where we were staying. There is something for everyone with lots of pathways over a very large distance if you are there for exercise, also many exercise machines. Couple of kids playgrounds, the swan paddle boat things & the occasional small shop where you can get a drink or icy pole. In the lake there are gigantic fish and around the edge you find big monitor lizards doing a spot of fishing so it is nice from a wildlife perspective. And it's great for a spot of people watching, the outdoor gym in the middle was an interesting spot! Nice for a family activity.

Not that overwhelming. Not as exceptional as thought. The park was quite and peaceful, but there are some people who wanted to show us a big reptile and immediately afterwards one of them took my hand and wanted to give me a massage, but when I said no he was immediately frustrated and took off.

Nice and quiet hide-away in BKK city center but nothing spectacular . We like Lumphini Park in Bangkok because it is very green and not very crowded (can only judge weekdays). There is lots of shadow due to many trees, and it is perfect for your own picnic because there are so many stone tables and benches under trees where you can sit down and eat or drink (attention: no alcohol allowed in the park!). See pictures for an impression. There are also two quite nice playgrounds. Otherwise, the park is not spectacular. For example, no flowers or something that would amaze one...
No pets allowed (. Good park, but for my sorrow no dogs allowed inside, so we had to leave this place fast. However the park is very green and the people do jogging.
Perfect for a stroll. Perfect for a stroll and taking a break from the busy city. It´s fantastic to walk here and not being reminded of the city all the time. It´s quiet and beautiful.

Fantastic oasis in the concrete jungle. With so few green spaces in Bangkok Lumphini is a treat. It's easily accessed from the BTS and easier from the MRT. Grab your bottle of water on the way in and spend a few hours here. Relax by the pond, take selfies with the water monitors, watch the runners and the bodybuilders, try out the free exercise activities and the kids will love the playgrounds. As with everywhere in BKK there's plenty of weirdness and eccentricity to be found. Bring a picnic and your sun cream.
An oasis in the city. Easy access via the Lumpini MRT station.This is a good spot for a bit of "time-out" from the bustle & rush of Bangkok.
Chill zone. Just the nicest place to chill out in the heat of the day.Buy som food from a vendor few cold beers and relax.

A lovely park with beautiful landscaping. Fountains and ornate waterfalls compliment the park.. The biggest park in Bangkok. The park is well maintained with plenty of shops for refreshments.A boat park where you can paddle around the lake.

Peaceful retreat from the bustling city. It was so nice to stroll through Lumpini Park after an afternoon walking through the busy streets of Bangkok. We arrived just before sunset and were surprised that when the National Anthem was played all activity stopped. Runners stood still and anyone who was seated stood up out of respect. When the song was over, all activity resumed. So interesting to see Komodo dragons walking through the park as well.

AN OASIS IN THE METROPOLIS. A stroll in the park might not be high up on your list of things to do in Bangkok but believe me its well worth it. Sometimes its nice to slow down and let the world recharge your batteries. Lumpini is a Royal Park and you do feel very special as it surrounds you. The noise of bustling Bangkok disappears as you stroll through the spectacular vegetation. Take a boat out on the lake and be at one with yourself .....Bangkok is not just all Bars and brashness. Take time out for yourself and enjoy a relaxing few hours in peace and tranquillity.

Large Park. Lumpini is located central to office, hotel and restaurants. We strolled thru the park on our way to a variety of events. There were always interesting activities in the park. Of particular interest was the night market across the street, well worth the visit.

An oasis in the midst of the buslting city. Lumpini Park is the Central Park of Bangkok. Large and green with a water feature that you can paddle a canoe on. It provides a welcomed green space amid the skyscrapers and city sprawl.During the year free concerts occur usually on a Sunday where you can grab a picnic basket and drinks and relax and listen to contemporary and classical music. A must visit!
the Hotel has to be the best every thing provided so quiet as well. I would recommend this Hotel for a quiet stay You have all shops close byRestaurants some cheap/expensiveTrips all over Bangkok

There are good times to visit. The best time to visit Lumpini Park his at 6.30am in the morning at this time you can find a little soup stall selling soup then settle down to your stop and watch the many Chinese/Thai office workers in the park practicing Tai Chi it is an amazing sight.
Nice park for cycling. We take our cycles to Lumpini every weekend, its a great cycle track in a nice setting.Times are 10:00 to 15:00 for cyclists
Chilling. Brilliant location, good for chilling and and for some exercise is in center where u can take a BTS to saladeang station and walk a bit up site

A break from busy Bangkok. Although this park isn't as grand as those you'll find in other big cities, it provides restbite from the dirty, busy and polluted streets of the city. It is also full of monitor lizards and terrapins for you to spot too. I recommend hiring a pedalo for 40b, getting on the water and enjoying the wildlife. This park feels like an oasis of calm.

Wildlife, people watching and picnics.. Having visited Thailand before, I wanted to avoid the typical tourist spots and see somewhere new. I was really delighted to discover this park. There are great walking trails, beautiful wildlife, and superb for people watching. I saw a concert rehearsal, a university graduation photo being taken and listened to the older people play a game similar to backgammon, I think. Couldn't work out the rules. There was opportunities to feed the fish, or hire a paddle boat. I spent a couple of hours walking around, picking up some food from a stall just outside and having a picnic near one of the lakes.

A quiet relaxing spot in the middle of a concrete jungle. After getting our Myanmar Visas sorted we walked the short distance to Lumpini Park. Once inside the park you forget about the city traffic and noise and just zone out to the sounds of the fountains turning on and off. Find a shady spot to relax and while away the hours. I literally sat for 3 hours reading my kindle before realising 3 hours had past by. The park is huge and has excellent pathways to walk on or ride a bicycle if you wish.

Relax here or take a jog. This little oasis within the madness of Bangkok is a perfect spot to relax and lie around in the shade or to grab one of the pedal boats to cruise on one of the mini-lakes. The grounds are very well maintained and the park provides enough diversity to make a walk interesting enough. Come here if you want to take a jog and need a space to do so, as there were plenty of joggers out between 6 and 7 pm when we were there.
good sunset. Park is so amazing.not a good idea to go i day.good for evening and early morning.Good view of sunset with lake view.

Average park in the middle of Bangkok . We walked to this in 35 degree heat. It's an OK park. Nice calm in the middle of a hectic city. If you miss this, you're not missing out on a lot but it is nice if you stumble upon it :)

Peaceful. We went for a walk around the park and it was a polar spot for locals and tourists. there is not a lot to see but it nice to be out of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok for a while. the park is very peaceful

Green Park in the heart of bangkok. the hotel we stayed in is just steps away from this park.. Big green and good for walking and rest.. we been here during the day but im sure it is better to visit the park at night

Lazy look around. Little tough during the day with the heat, certainly go early or best is the evening to see the sunset across the lake and people out and enjoying, nice walk through the gardens, small bridges and the likes

Beautiful Spacious Park. This is where the city park clean and very spacious in Bangkok. Many facilities are available here, as well as some penginggalan history. For a refreshing, this place is more than adequate. Beautiful, green, nice Bangkok views and comfortable.

Great Park for a relaxing walk in the centre of Bangkok. Quiet and Idyllic. Just as you take a seat to watch the turtles basking on the lake don't be surprised when a four foot monitor lizard suddenly appears and starts to walk towards you. :)

It's all right if you're in the neighbourhood . Decent park in the middle of busy Bangkok. The missus and I walked around the paved roads and enjoyed the relatively fresh but hot air in the park. It's ok for an hour or so...
Great place for spending a lazy weekend. Great place to spend a lazy afternoon or exercising in the early morning hours away from all the city chaos
Green , shady and nice views.. Lovely lush, green park . plenty of shady trees to sit under and admire the views, even the walking paths were in good condition, unlike any others in Bangkok.
Great breakfast. There is great breakfast to be had here from street stalls if you come here early in the morning for exercise.

Check out the open air concerts. Otherwise, not a place to especially visit.. There are few green and open places in Bangkok so it can be a joy to get away from the noise, crowds and pollution. The park also puts on concerts in certain seasons which can be culturally interesting - bring a picnic, something to sit on and plenty of insect repellant, and you can enjoy a local open air concert of music dancing or both. However, a typical european park this is not. The grass can be scorched - or non-existent - and there will always be biting insects. The facilities are poor and frankly, it's not a beautiful, well planted or relaxing space. It is though a relatively green and open space away from Bangkok's crowded streets - and if taken as brief respite, or for an open air concert, it can be enjoyed. Not a place to go out of your way to visit, but if you are in the area, it's an alternative to the busy streets.

Excellent walking park. An oasis in the middle of Bangkok, well worth a visit to the park, walk around the lake, sit under the shady trees, take in the sites, early morning you see all the Tai Chi advocates there, just a great place to visit
Great escape from Bangkok mayhem. We walked through the park and ended up near wireless road where there are great food stalls and street food. Would highly recommend doing both when in the area.

Huge garden at the center of Bangkok. It is close to BTS Sala Daeng or MRT Silom or MRT Luphini or BTS Rachadambri.A lot of fun for all age people.Swimming pool.Boating,Cycling,running and exercising facilities are there.Car parking avail too.

large park hot and nice. on the way in to the park, buy all your drinks and snack that you need, as there is not that much to buy inside the park (there is some food inside, but the park is huge, and if you are in a different area there is nothing), buy some bread to feed the fishes, or the crows.. they have boats for hire, and you can have your lunch on the grass. there are two main playgrounds for kids, both are quite nice, but the largest one do not have much shade, so it gets hot.

Lumpini. Whilst staying in Ibis Sathorn in Bangkok, Lumpini used to be my nearest attraction. Amazing! Different non venomous reptiles all around in ponds, the main lake, on the grass, hundreds of local and tourist joggers, really nice oasis in the middle of Bangkok where pollution is strictly prohibited, respect expected. Amazing place to relax, even get gym and swimming pool membership, park is full of wild life. Had only one horrible experience, in petrified of centipedes, so I was reading my book once in shade on a bench having realised only hours later a family of centipedes sleeping in shade under my bench LOL

Take your camera. Typically used for exercise this park is definitely worth a walk around. Nice place with boats for hire and play areas for the kids. You can buy lunch from the street vendors outside and take it into the park. There's always a table free and its a nice change to eat outside in such pleasant surroundings.Take a camera because they also have some interesting wild life including turtles and quite large lizards.

Great park, very relaxing. This park is great. There is a food market on the entrance where you can buy food and enjoy it in some bench. There is a pond and you can rent pedal boats to go around. There is an opain air gym and when we went there some old ladies were practising king fu with swords! Very nice for a stroll to take a break from the crazy city.

Love it. Such a nice park with monitor lizards lounging by. Last time in Bangkok i went to this park every day. Bought often some good snacks from a foodcourt and enjoyed it in the tranquility of this park. People doing tai chi, exercising, having a picnic. Just so relaxing!Dont worry about the monitors, they are very docile and wont bug you if you dont bug them.And yes they can be big..

Central Park of BKK. I have lived in Bangkok for so many years but I had never been to Lumpini Park until last week. The park is so peaceful and quiet. I can really take a deep breath and feel the relief that I would feel when I am out of the city. It's just a great place to stop by and relax. I went there thinking nothing but to let my head go and see people around me. It's just like the same feeling I had when I was in the Central Park in Manhattan (the difference is just Bangkok is so hot hahaha)

Good for exersice or a walk. Wonderful park where you can observe turtles, lizards,fish or various birds while taking a walk. They have specific hours for cycling from 10h to 15h to prevent accidents between joggers and cyclists. After 15h the park roads who are very well maintained are for joggers and pedestrians only. Great place for a pick nick.

My weekly running venue. The park is an excellent place to walk or run to get some exercise. We walk there every Sunday morning and do a couple of laps around the park. I believe its about a 2.5klm round. There is a lot of morning activity to be seen with many Thai elders performing their exercises, sword dances, thai chi or just sitting around with friends having a good morning chat. A nice and easy place to relax with water views towards the city.
Quiet. Massive park in the centre of chaos, calming if you want to relax for a few hours,, easy to access off of sky train , was only a short walk fro hotel for us

Peaceful and funny. We loved looking for the lizards and turtles! Feeding the voracious fishes from the boats and looking at the thaï kids having a snack on their way home after school. Perfect visit!
Peaceful setting. i enjoyed the quiet and peaceful setting of this lovely park in the heart of Bangkok. Well worth a visit.

Nice and pastoralic. If you are tired of the concrete and cemet vire of the city, go to lumpini park at Lumpini silom line BTS station.Green park with lakes and ducks and etc.Good place to chill out or maybe jog, take photos or ride a bicycle.

Water Dragons abound!. This is a nice park in the middle of a massive city. It's not the greatest park ever but it's nice and you can avoid the bustle of the street for a couple of hours by walking around it. We decided to ride the duck boats for 30 minutes. In the heat of Bangkok that was enough. There are many water dragons in the lake and a couple of them are at least 2m long. Other than that there isn't much to do.
A good pause. A great place to relax and get a pause from crazy and noisy Bangkok. Some wild life around too - take care and watch your step!

The green lung of Bangkok. This beautiful park is worth a visit to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown Bangkok. Guarded by a statue of King Rama V (it may have been a different number, I'm not sure), the park features beautifully manicured lawns, jogging paths and a lake. If you're lucky, you may see one of the monitor lizards that roam through this area and if you come at sunrise or sunset you will see a free aerobics class at the entrance. All in all, this is a great way to while away a few pleasant hours in Bangkok.

A peaceful and beautiful place to rest from the heat.. Lumpini Park is in my view a must see in Bangkok; not only is the pond an idyllic place for a picnic but there is also a host of wildlife to discover - from huge iguanas slithering through the water to small turtles and birds. I went at both the weekend and during the week and would advise to go for the weekdays as it is much quieter. If you're a runner, this is also probably the best place to go for your evening or morning jog.

The lungs of the capital. Lumpini Park is a great place to have a wander. If for no other reason, just to observe the way locals use this green space. It is filled with joggers, cyclists, tai chi practitioners, and a lot more. The park also provides a short cut to the city if you are walking towards the Silom area or back towards Chidlom. The lake is a feature that is worth a wander around. Before you cop a squat, look up, as there are small green snakes that live in the trees.

Big Park centrally located in the middle of Bangkok. The park is nice for jogging and biking. Lots of people coming in the morning and evening. Sometimes it is very nice that she has composed concert and some show frequently. Apart from that it is very nice place to just have a seat and enjoy the green area.

An enjoyable place to spend an afternoon or morning.. This is quite a nice park. Good if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. For a few baht you can take a swan boat out onto the lake and see the monitor lizards, turtles and fish swimming around. Make sure you buy some bread from the sellers to feed the fish, they're greedy and will leap out of the water to get it.There's an outdoor gym here too if the weather isn't too hot and there always seems to be some kind of activity going on.

We got to see the park in the rain!!!. We arrived at the park at around 0630pm and just some minutes after it started raining quite hard and it was so beautiful to see the park in the rain. It was a really beautiful park and an ideal place to jog.

The warm breeze at park. Seems this place is always hit by burning sun, which is nice in a way. It's easy just to chill out here and enjoy life as it is. Birds will keep you company as well, so you don't need to feel lonely even if you're just chilling alone.Toilet facilities I went to were in bad shape, not horrible. Would add a lot to have improved toilets. It was nice that there even was toilets anyhow.Bring your own picnic foods in and enjoy.

Absolutely gorgeous, place to take the kids. The park used to be my main place to go ride bikes or run and use up some energy as a kid. The pathways are well paved and sized. There is a playground for the young kids to play at. Unlike other parks in Bangkok, this one is very large and the pathway has curves and turns in it which makes it more fun to follow. The park has a really nice set up, with grass and trees throughout the park. There are some stands that sell well priced drinks, snacks, and ice cream. As of now the only drawback I can think of is that it does not really allow pets (at least not when I was a child many years ago). I had a small toy poodle-cup mix that was super friendly but they would only alow us in if we carried her. Which is understandable as a lot of people in Thailand are afraid of dogs and not many owners pick up after their dogs.

Great for a green walk in the city!. The green lung of Bangkok is waiting for you to spend some time walking there, enjoying the fishes and the other animals and the green trees and plants all over the place.

An Oasis in Bangkok!. Last year, during the demonstrations, I was unable to visit the park due to demonstrators occupying it. It didn't feel safe and I was disappointed. This year (2015) was a different story. I spent several lovely mornings and evenings in the park. There is so much to do and great people watching! There are also a great many birds, monitor lizards, turtles, boats for rent, bikes for rent, beautiful buildings as well as people exercising, doing tai chi, aerobics and walking. Lovely!
The perfect escape in busy bangkok.. I love this park especially around late morning time it's quiet and relaxing for a run or jog. Must visit in Bangkok
heaven like!. it is really like heaven! in the crowded busy, this park is needed! as you can see there is lake, lots of long tree and birds and pedal's boat and ...!be careful about your children!
Lumpini Park. That place should be made arboretum. So that people can study and relax.It is a Public Park Full of Varieties of Plants and Suitable for Recreayionl Activies.

Good place to relax and exercise. It was located in front of our hotel (dusit thani hotel). We went there at 4pm, there was a lot of people running, jogging, some have dance class and gymnastic. They have indoor and outdoor gym and swimming pool. I wish I have this kind of park in Jakarta. No entrance fee. Good for a morning walk if you stay nearby.
a must to do here. Really nice place, it is a minute of peace in the middle of Bangkok´s jungle. I totally recommend to visit it, and is one of the unique places here where smoke is forbidden!!

Liked the Paddle boat. Good For..1) Jogging2) Relaxing under the shade3) Creative work for thinkers and Writers4) Photography of city scape ( only at certain spots-near the lake)5) Paddle Boat Ride ( around 20 or 25 THB - not sure though)6) Small group events ( might require prior permission depending on the group size)7) Un official Meetings8) Cycling ( & learning too) - Of course - you need to bring yours9) Children's Play Park - Not so big though10) Entry is freeThe Not so Goods ..1) Parking slots are sufficient - but at peak timings ; it gets horrible2) Wont find snacks / vendors at every corner - you need to carry or walk all the way back to grab something3) Not all areas are well maintained -some are secluded and deserted. you need to stay on the main areas
so nice green oase in big city. When you stay long in bangkok and need to relax away from the busy city these place is nice to go, green and quiet.

Best location for a morning run in Bangkok. One loop is 2.5km and after your run there are some great Thai / Chinese breakfast options in the food court, congee and other great choices. Lots of regulars of all age groups come here. If you want a quiet run, you won't get one unless it is around noon to 3pm. Mornings and evenings are very full.

Time out for the hustle and bustle. If your in Bangkok for a few days or a few weeks, Lumpini Park is somewhere you must go. Set aside at least a few hours. Its a place you go to wonder, chill out, and just relax by the lake. Grab an icecream at the entrance (there are no food places inside) and enjoy watching people on paddleboats, outdoor aerobics, the giant lizards (their don't bite, as far as I know). The park is pretty big for being in the middle of town and you could easily spend a day here. Easy to get to from the Skytrain and only about 10 minutes including the train and a short walk from the main CBD.

Nice spot to try & beat the heat!!. We took a side trip through the park on our way back to our hostel and enjoyed the hour or so it took to wander through the gardens, watch the locals play board games, see children feeding fish and marvel at the nutters who were jogging laps in the heat!! Would definitely return for more exploration at a cooler time. It was lovely to sit under the trees and just relax away from the traffic and noise.
a quiet place in the middle of bankok. Very green, quiet, many people doing sports, you can make a picnic near the lagoon, breath and have a quiet day in the middle of crazy bangkok

An oasis in Bangkok. A 10 minute walk from our hotel and we discovered Lumpini Park. Plenty of trees and shade surrounding the lake so that one can sit and relax. We hired a paddle boat for 1/2 an hour (40 baht for use and 40 baht deposit, refundable on return) and went around the lake. Was fun
Go and join for an after work sportmoment. Go and join the locals for a workout when they just get out of work the park fills up with people doing some training all together.
amongst nature. Nature amongst the backdrop of d city . Shud go if ur thru with the city life of bangkok .. Serene time spent around calm waters .

always good for a refreshing stroll or people watching. Great place to get some fresh air. Lots to see. Free exercise classes (tai chi, yoga, etc.). Monitor lizards, turtles, fish to feed, etc. A very relaxing place to escape the occasional suffocation you might feel living in or visiting Bangkok.

Nice for a stroll.. Nice park of decent size. Lovely to get off the busy streets and away from traffic, but it was sooo hot midday. The park was almost empty of other people, everyone had fled the heat.The most fun for us was to discover the large lizards that lived in the ponds. They were HUGE. There is also possibilities to hire a cycle boat and paddle leisurely around.
Muay thai. Nice and popular place to enjoy the local muay thai fightWe had ring side ticket which is good value for moneyNice fights and great ambiance
Central Park of Bangkok. Perfect place for afternoon stroll, away from the busy city life. Great place for running if you're into sports. Safe and clean.

Interesting park in downtown Bangkok. The park was walking distance from my hotel and made for a nice morning activity. It gets hot very quickly so take some water with you (or money to purchase in the park)Enjoy watching locals make the most of this great facility in the city. And in addition the wildlife is interesting too (Monitor lizards swimming in the ponds!)There are muscle men using the free weights, and plenty of older folks enjoying group activities. We really enjoyed our trip to the park. If I had stayed longer in Bangkok I would have gone every morning :)

Awesome!. The wildlife alone makes it worth a trip to this park. We went early in the morning and there were people doing tai chi, cycling, walking and picnicking. And there were large (2-3 foot) dragon-like lizards walking around and swimming in the ponds. Small lizards also and great birds as well! Very cool park in the heart of Bangkok!

Monitor lizards. A really cool park in the middle of the city. It has a large pond in the middle and there are all sorts of animals that live in the this park, like monitor lizards! They're pretty shy so they'll run away the moment you go near them so don't be afraid of them.

Best city park in Asia. This is a wonderful park! It is for people to enjoy, but it does not look stiff and false like some of the parks in Shanghai and Singapore.Quiet for mid-morning to mid-afternoon walks. Busy after work hours (great for people watching). Lots of wild life (watch out for the huge lizards on the north west area).Clean, safe, well kept, lovely water features and some small temples. Clean public toilets.There is a swimming pool and 2 out door gyms (small charge for entrance, or you can get a pass)Highly recommended for a work out or just a relaxing stroll.

Sea of Green in a city of concrete. Lumpini Park is a wonderful sea of green in the concrete jungle of Bangkok. Great place to take a relaxing stroll away from the traffic and the vendors. A place to see wildlife in Bangkok - Egrets, crows (lots of crows), monitor lizards, turtles. There are swan paddle boats to rent on the pond in the park, an enjoyable way to see the egrets and turtles. When you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the city this is a place to relax. Enjoy!

Large Park to Relax. A well-maintained and large park to wander or run around, with organised exercise classes in the evenings, paddle boats available for hire, and lots of scultpures to see, as well as some lakes. There's also a population of monitor lizards living in and around the lakes.

Great place for excercising. It was a really nice green place in the middle of Bangkok to escape from the craziness. It is definitelly NOT a must if you are staying in Bangkok only for a couple of days, but if you have a longer stay, this could be a relaxing place to be.

A nice park. Lumpini park is a nice little respite in Bangkok. This is a good place to pack a lunch and have a picnic by the water or to rent a paddleboat and hang out. You may also get to see the giant lizard that hangs around here as well.

Relaxation within a busy city. Nice green space to relax while visiting a busy city like Bangkok. Take a stoll or join others exercising. It covers a large area so you won't be bored quickly. I've been to Bangkok several times and it is a nice place to just get away from the hussle bussel.

Go early......... best time to go there is in the morning before 8am.If not at the evening.You can experience locals perform traditional chinese excersise to the music played.Good for jogging or walking.
Great place for relaxation. Great place to relax and go for a stroll with your family....the greenery has a calming effect on your body!

Haven within the city. A great little escape within the craziness of BKK. If you are nearby, do take a stroll or run around the park. You will feel refreshed with new oxygen before heading back out into the polluted city!
Hail hail to the Lumpini Park zone˜!!!

Great for exercise and relaxation. A large, restful oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of the Silom/Sathorn area. Great opportunities for serious exercise, gentle or power walking or plain relaxation.

A pleasant stroll in the middle of Bangkok.. While the park itself offers an oasis from the mayhem of the city it has many short comings. We visited in February 2015 - no food/drink facilities open. The general grass areas were unkempt and points of interest not clearly marked.Beware the large Monitors which walk freely around the park.
an oasis in Busy bangkok. a little oasis in Bangkok, pleasant to walk around in a stones throw from the busy hustle and bustle

Amazing Park in the middle of Downtown. Lumpini Park is the Central Park of Bangkok. Amazing park in the middle of Downtown Bangkok. Worth a visit and stay in any hotel facing the park one of the best city views of Bangkok. We stayed at Grand Centre Point Pathumwan which overlooks the park. One of our best stays in Bangkok.... A must stay and visit with family for sure...

an oasis in the middle of town. a greenery in the middle of busy bangkok. an oasis after a hard and long day visiting all the interesting places. conveniently located to major tourist spots and nightlife, eat near by and enjoy life

Amazing park! We loved it!. The park has a large lake with fountains and we were fascinated by the large water monitor lizards, turtles and catfish. The whole park was alive with fitness workouts and music and there was even a free show with dancers! Great atmosphere.
Love the run there!. Perfect place to have a work-out now and then. I visited the park when I needed some nice nature + a hard road to run on. The Lumpini Park is the perfect place for that!

awesome ppace for a jog, work out or relax. Feels like a complete break from busy Bangkok. Free too. Have free exercise equipment in the park in good condition. Rent a pedal boat to sail the lake, or join in early eve activities such as aerobics. Not many actual food places in the day time (I hear they have breakfast, but I have never made it! :)) so bring own food. (alcohol not allowed in the park)

green oase. this park was only several steps away from my office, and it was like an oase, a place where you can rest away from a hectic urban area.i simply love to sit in the bench, under the trees, with books and snacks. This place was somehow crowded in the evening and during weekend. So better try to find an empty space to enjoy the serenity

A bit of green in the heart of the city. Great place to go for a walk and see some of the monitor lizards that call this park home. Easy to get to from the MRT and every taxi in the city knows where it is. I prefer the "King's Park" but this one is more convenient if you're near the city center.

If your staying near by great place for a jog or a worl out. Nice place to relax or go for a jog, you will also see some free roaming wild life. Various routes for different distances. to use the public swimming pool you need a health certificate. double check

Vibrant Park that Impresses. Lumpini Park is located in the middle of vibrant Bangkok, and is full of life almost any time of the day. People walk around the park, some jog, and there are also sports being played here. A huge statue of a former king is at the entrance.

Alright for a quick walk. We went here for a morning and ended up walking around in an hour. A few things to look at but some parts of the park looked unkempt. There were seats to sit on but no drink / food vendors. There was a gym in the park which was interesting though! Saw some iguanas (I think) too! I'd only suggest going if you have a lot of spare time.

Large, quiet, good people watching. Well manicured, fairly varied vegetation. Pretty standard Thai park style with lots of grass, big lake, flowering shrubs for borders. Lots of people walking, jogging or early tai chi. Moderately interesting small sculptures, fountains, clock tower. Easy to spend 1-2 hours. Avoid the hottest hours as a lot is exposed. Not the easiest place to get to, suggest a taxi ride.
Love it. Love this park. The boats are amazing.The plants and trees are sooo peacefull. A good way to espace the busy city for some time.
One of the few green place of Bangkok. Nice place to run and relax. Many activities and sport inside the park. Still possible to see some wildlife with the monitor lizard.
best park in bangkok. green ozone for bangkokians. locals enjoy exercising, relaxing over there. sundays during cool season (dec-feb), there are free concerts.

Largest Park In Bangkok. This place situated right near Rama 4 & Silom road is a must see. The park itself is HUGE and you feel like you are not in Bangkok while inside! Great place to go for a walk,run or have a picnic.

Nice escape from busy Bangkok. The park was opposite our hotel (Sofitel so) and looked really relaxing from our window so we went in for a walk round.
Very calm,chilled out atmosphere.
We even went on a peddle boat which was really nice-although we did see quite a few lizards.
Lots of people running and having relaxed bike rides!!

A lovely amble through a green space in the heart of Bangkok. Lumpini is like "central park" in the meaning thats its smack bang in the heart of this beautiful battling noisy hot city.You can amble around the lake or take a picnic and sit watching Bangkok go by, there is also a running track and cycling track so at weekends there is a lot more life in the park, if you go early you can see the locals running and doing Tai Chi which i am also fascinated just watching this! The park can get busy at weekends and public holidays but usually you can find a small piece of peace there

Meet the Monitor lizards in the city. Our main reason to come here was to see the Monitorlizards directly in the city which is just great. Nice park to take a walk and relax of Bangkok. Watch the lizards, turtles, fish, cats and dogs and forget the busy city for a few hours. Many people do workouts in the park, so there are groups of people running or making other sport activities together, even a gym can be used, but it looked pretty bad.

You can see Komodo dragon in the park!. Near to Sala Daeng BTS or Silom, Lumphini MRT station, easy to reach. A place to relax but most funny part are those large lizard live freely in the park! It is not difficult to find them. Go near to the pond, they always stay near the water. Read those news on the web, they are the relatives of Komodo Dragon. But it seems that they are not harmful. Otherwise, I don't think the government will let them stay here. Just wonder will some of them once leave the park and appear in somewhere else!

Clean place to exercise. The park while does not have much amenities, is clean and safe for walking, biking, and visiting with friends. There was a police or park ranger station at the entrance and some uniformed persons in the park. I gather that they are officers of the park. I saw mostly older folks in groups for Tai Chi and other activities such as Ma Jong and tea drinking. I saw a few young men and women running and biking. Family with younger children playing kite and biking. The lake is calm but I did not see anyone in it for water sports or floats. Outside the park, there are food hawkers. The foods look delicious although I never tried for sanitary concern.

Nice escape from busy Bangkok. We walked around Lumpini park on our first day in Bangkok. We enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere and quiet setting compared to the city centre. There are some beautiful lakes and we liked the contrast between the trees and the surrounding sky scrappers. On one side of the park you can pick up street food and catch the bus. However beware, we were scammed just outside the park by a tuk tuk driver and his accomplice. The scam was the usual tuk tuk suit shop scam but just watch out for friendly strangers! This is probably good advice for Bangkok in general.

Lumpini Park is Spectacular!. Lumpini Park is one of the great city parks in the world. It is not overly large but has a little bit of everything. Water dragons roaming the park are about as shocking as anything. People exercising, musical concerts of a wide variety, gatherings, dance classes, exercise classes surrounded by beautiful flowers, trees, bushes, monuments, trails. It's lovely.I now live by Lumpini Park and exercise there 5 days a week so I thoroughly LOVE Lumpini Park.

Bangkok hideaway. We took a stroll along the Lumpini Park one afternoon. It is located in the central of Bangkok surrounded by office buildings and Bangkok's chaotic traffic. It is a very peaceful and serene park, perfect for an afternoon stroll or jog. There is a track around the park for those who want to job. There's also water bicycling. We saw people doing tai chi and aerobics lessons as well. The only unpleasant part of this park is that we saw some monitor lizards crawling in the park.

Real nature in Bangkok. Adjacent to Silom, one of the most crowded business area in Bangkok, Lumpini Park is full of trees, ponds and oxygen. I can breathe deeply here. Every morning and evening, many people come here to walk, jog, ride and do many recreation activities including yoga, dance and music listening.
Good. I can't explain why this park is good. It's because this place has plenty of peaceful environment.
