Escape the city!. This place is an urban jungle with a variety of birds & reptiles to view. Don't be surprised to get a glimpse of huge monitor lizards parading around the grounds. The park offers a retreat from the city hustle & a perfect place to regain your strengths before tackling the next adventure. The access is convenient with skytrain & metro nearbye.

A breath of quietness in the heart of bangkok. Although quite busy, this park is a real relaxing place for people who wants to play sports, relax, or have a great time with the family. Really nice and well maintain park. Got this ducks for rental on the lake quite fun as well. And don't mind the big lizards they are running away or just sleeping around , not dangerous. !

Best place yo rejuvinate. A huge park with lush green surroundings is all what makes Lumphini park so attractive. Its spread oevr a large area and is very calm and peaceful park. It feels like resting in the lap of nature. You can be here from early morning to late evening and at any time of the day you may find it full of people either excercising, running, meditating, playing etc. and making the enviornment more cheerfull. They have few ponds in mid of the park which add to the beauty of the park. There is a open stage at the centre most of park where youcan relish soulfoul music or various kinds of performances as per their scehdules. I personally enjoyed live singing by a few people and their band in the evening. You can reach there by MRT station Si lom, although there is one more station call Lumphini. Its advisable not to get down at Lumphini station for Lumphini park as you may have to walk a lot from there to reach the park. So best way is to get down at Si lom station and as you exit right infront of you is entry to Lumphini park. Its a must visit place if you feel to renew your senses and replinish yourself.

Nice place to relax. If you stay around silom area its a nice park to relax or unwind your self from hectic work schedule or hectic holiday trip.There is little lake where you can hire paddle boat for your self or if you are family with little children, they will love to enjoy the paddle boat. Also you will find turtle and large lizard in or around the lake, which me and my wife surprised to see it first time such a large lizard in the parkThis park also equipped with free gym equipment for fitness enthusiast, I never find such free gym facillity any where else in world, as far as I travel in many countries.Thumbs up !

Relaxation....... Wonder venue for a leisurely walk, a run or just people watching. Lots and lots of activity by locals. We have always felt safe but be aware of your surroundings at all times anywhere in the city just to be double sure of your safety.

Peace even with the protestors . We visited the park during the height of the protesting and was very surprised at how peaceful it was even during such unrest all around there was millions of tents strewn across the park from all the protesters but we still had a fantastic day trying out the boats on the lake feeding the fish and looking at the amazing wildlife on offer definitely worth a visit I will be going back again when I'm in Bangkok next

A great respite from the throng. This is a place that puts the balance in Bangkok which can quite often seem like it is going at 100mph constantly. Here you are truly able to relax, watch some water monitors, go from a duck boat ride and admire the fantastic city that Bangkok is. Definitely recommended.

Reminded me of Hyde Park. Every city needs a park like this - a place of calm and quiet where you can regain your sanity!It is more of less central and is obviously the place where residents come to stroll, catch a cooling breeze, exercise, picnic or just watch the fish in the canal which runs around the park. There is a road inside the perimetre where cyclists, roller skaters, joggers etc all keep fit and area for those who like to exercise in public. There are plenty of benches and shelters from the sun for the less energetic and you sit quietly, near the canal or the lake you will almost certainly see squirrels,lizards, terrapins, herons and thousands of fish (which you can buy food to feed them with).Lovely relaxing place, away from all that scorching concrete!

An oasis in the bruising city. What an oasis of rest just in between the hectic life of Bangkok ! Just walk around enjoy the nature, relax and take the time to feed the fish. Or enjoy the paddle with the boat on the lake.Deffinitely worth a stop for 1-2 hours !

The fresh air of Bangkok. Lumpini. Pretty much in the centre of Bangkok. Many acres of grass, lakes and running/cycling track. A nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle. Lots of trees and plants to admire. Sunday night in "winter" (I think that is from November until March).enjoy a free concert by the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra starts at 5.30. There are other concerts after BSO finish in March. Don't go too near the water monitor lizards as they can bite or swish you with their tale although they do look slow and docile. A close relative of the Komodo Dragon.

kind of central park NY. very nice park in day time. but after 7-8PM. around have a lot of hookers. selling dirty things. one night stand girls. and park next to lumpini police station. why police cannot control this dirty people ?

Bangkok's version of NYC Central Park. Lumpini Park is worth spending some time at. It is very important to the Thai population. Visit early in the morning (5-6 AM) and you will see an amazing number of locals doing Various forms of exercise. During the day there are many attractions (a lake with boat rental), various food and merchandise stands around the perimeter, and you are likely to encounter various political activities and other curiosities. The calm and gardens in the middle of this busy megatropolis is rewarding.If you go be sure to go across Rama IV Road and up a short distance to visit Wat Hua Lumphong. Since I am married into a Thai family I visit countless Wats, and this is my favorite of all. It is a Wat "for the people" dedicated to the King. There is a wonderful shed full of Kwai (water buffalo) that are rescued from slaughter. Put 20 baht into the box by the shed, open the chest and take a bundle of greens to feed the Kwai. They will appreciate it and you will get in touch with these wonderful animals. Then go past the main Temple to the right and you will see an administrative looking structure. Walk in there and you will see a table with 3-4 ladies selling certificates. For 500 baht or so (donor determines the amount) you will get a pink slip with your name on it and a receipt (all written in Thai). Take the pink slip to the large adjoining room and you will see a vast stack of inexpensive coffins. Paste jars are sitting around so that you can paste your pink slip to a coffin of your choice. These coffins will be used in cremation services for the poor (with your slip attached). Now follow the crowd to another room where a fire pit awaits your receipt. Monks will be chanting and hammering a large gong.I find this whole experience a good way to share something of great importance to the Thai people. You will not see many Farang (foreigners) here but be bold - observe that actions of others and show respect. It is one or two hours well spent and unique in Thailand as to size and scale. There are lots of taxis around Lumpini Park so is you are not familiar with MTR (one subway stop from Lumpini to Sam Yan Station) take a taxi so you don't get lost.These are "Thai attractions and really not tourist attractions". Get in touch with the Thai people and check this out.
A nice place to Relax. Worth a stop when you are out and about to sit down and relax a bit. Find a nice shady area if you visit in April.

A great escape. Easy to get to by metro, Lumpini is an oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Lots of trees, many ornamental flower beds, easy to navigate trails, lots of benches, and refreshments available at two entrances. A fair variety of bird life as well as plentiful monitor lizards in the ponds.

Tranquility in the hustle & bustle.. This was a fantastic place to visit. It a little bit of tranquility in the vibrant city of Bangkok. The day I visited was hot, humid and noisy. The park was cool and far less noisy with a lot of wildlife to be seen. You can walk around, cycle, run or just picnic or lay quietly. The highlight of the day was seeing the iguana's wandering around without a care in the world. This is a must visit park and to me rates as one of the best in the world.

An oasis in the city. We loved our time here, we took some takeaway food and had a picnic. Lots of catfish, Komodo dragons and ofcourse cats around the park. We really enjoyed having a relaxing stroll and also using the swan pedalos which were tacky but fun, and getting a different perspective of the skyline. Definitely recommend, lovely place to slow the pace.

Peaceful in the middle of Bangkok. Lumpini is a great place to go calm down from the humid weather of Bangkok. Locals love this area to meet for a picnic, walk, bike or just relax. Avoid going at night as the appeal isn't there.

A nice green space in the middle of the metropolis. I found this park very enjoyable after spending many days traveling around metropolitan Bangkok visiting the temples and the shopping. It is very well maintained and large. I was told by a friend that there are komodo dragons here (and have seen pictures) but they must have been sleeping under some rocks.There are a few things to do here: rent a pedal boat, some playground equipment. But I would say it is mostly a nice place for a run (in 30C weather!) or a nice walk as a change of pace.Because it is not a normal "tourist attraction" for the most part, it appeared to be mostly locals making use of the park - lunching, walking, playing. There were enough interesting architectural features that I took a good number of pictures, but I am a bit obsessive about taking pictures. I'm not attaching them because they wouldn't really give you any sense of the actual park, just architectural details.So, if you need a break just to relax in the open air, I very much recommend it. If you are on vacation with limited time, you probably won't spend too many hours here, unless you've got a squirmy kid that needs to run around like crazy for a while. Either way, enjoyable.

The first public park in Bangkok. Many varans living in park (from half meter till 1.5 meter length), turtles, cats, birds. In water you may find many fishes - bring some food to feed them. Great place for a walk and sport. Beautiful sunsets.

I have to give it 5 stars. I proposed to my wife here.. This is a lovely park to have a walk or a jog in. You can meet a lot of young and friendly Thai people here who are happy to exchange a warm smile, of a short chat. There's often entertainment and vendors selling food and all sort of odds and ends. You'll also see large lizards (water monitors) walking and swimming about, as well as many species of birds.

wow, what a park!!!. This is simply amazing. It's the man made oasis for the busy bangkok. Never forget to visit this place, you will see why the hookers, taxis and pimps is not bangkok. Be there whether it's the morning, day or evening it is equally beautiful. Just be there. Please.

Great escape. Well.
This is not our first trip to BKK but this the first time we decided to visit the Lumpini.
Totally worth it. Clean air to breathe in crazy busy bkk, wonderful nature and we met some new friends, the dragons.
We went there really early, around 8 i the lorning, it was empty and delightful.

Great running venue. Get there early 5amish. Lovely clean park with 2.5km running track. Watch the locals doing yoga aerobics and even playing some traditional music. A great cultural experience even if you dont run.

An oasis of peace!. A beautiful park to escape the madness of Bangkok, lots of green and shady spots, well-watered. The boating lake has swan pedalos if you're feeling energetic. DO check out the street food by the monument entrance - the papaya salad is to die for and he will make it mai pet if you are a wuss like me and don't want it too spicy.

Family day out on a Sunday. Lumphini Park has really improved over the past 2 decades. We liked it so much. So many things to do and see in there. It is not allowed to ride bikes but inline skaters of our kids were ok. There are other facilities such as a gym and swimming pool. Some sacred Buddha images are found among the flora and fauna. There are lakes where people can rent boats. Very nice!

Nice morning walk. We enjoyed a nice walk in the park. You will see many large lizards that are not interested in people and live in harmony with the visitors of the park. You will see people cycling through the park and working out. There is a full outdoor gym with weights in the park. The park is surrounded by a nice lake. There is also the option to do boating on the lake in the park. We enjoyed our morning walk in the park.

Positively surprised. After many times in Bangkok. I finally went. It was well kept and there was quite a wide range of animals. There were some huge lizards in the water, many birds. and it had a calm, tranquill feel to it all around.All food stalls and such are kept outside, so it's very nice to walk around the area without getting obstructed like walking on the sidewalks in BKK in general. I'll go there again and spend more time next time in BKK. A nice get away from the loud city.
A good place to spent evening. Its is a good place to Spent the Evening or go jogging .There is a beautiful lake which gives a nice view .
fun nature break in the city. this beautiful park was a fun nature break for us and our kids really enjoyed it here; especially the pedal boats.

A Jogger's Paradise. A lush park great for joggers and pedestrians trying to avoid the crowded streets. Fitness amenities, small Buddhist pagodas, pigeons and alike, you'll like it, especially in the evening.

A peacefull island of sanity in the heart of Krung Thep. 'One night in Bangkok can make a hard man humble' Lumpini Park was my spot for therapy way back around the same time Murray Head penned the tune from 'Chess' penned the song.A pal of mine does a form of 'Tai Chi' there starting when its dark around 5am in the morning.Put on you running shoes and go for a jog to help your self get in pace with Bangkok life and your own life line.
Nice park. Lovely park in central Bangkok, with its lack of beaches this is a great place to chill out and do some sunbathing in. Not much else there though

A green space in Bangkok. Always try and visit Lumpini Park when in Bangkok.Lots going on, people doing exercises and having picnics.Spotted large monitor lizards wandering about.A tranquil spot to spend a few hours.

A place to jogging. This park is located in the downtown, can be accessed both by MRT or skytrain. If you like to jogging, just try to visit this park in the morning or afternoon. Inside the park, there is also a big pond with some birds beside.

Good for a relax. Nothing much to look though. Just the trees and lake. Nice to go for a jogging and to relax, or even to watch what locals do:-) We went for boat paddling which was quite nice. Can spend some peaceful time here

Good to relax. Many trees for you to relax your eyes. If you stay close to this park you may come for jogging but watch out for bicycles, there are a lot of them too.There is lake, you can rent paddle boat to ride.

Beautiful park. HUGE lizards!. A beautiful place to hang out! There are free outdoor workout machines, swan paddle boat rides, fantastically maintained gardens and places to relax and enjoy the balmy weather. If you like wildlife, there are many species of birds, turtles, fish, and...lizards! There are a huge number of monitor lizards in the park that range in size from less than 1 foot to over 3 feet long, and they roam freely! They won't come near you, but don't get too close, that's just my opinion.
Great park with spectacular animals. It is an beautiful park in the middle of a big city. You can do some fitness, walk around, lay down or watch the goanna who live there free.

A nice big park with terrific monitor lizards. Like most Asian cities, Bangkok has not set aside nearly enough green space amidst the rampant development. So we must be thankful for what still exists. Lumpini is a big park with large ponds right in the heart of the city. If you are an animal lover you will enjoy the big monitor lizards that live freely there.

Green retreat. This little park in the center of town is so easy to reach by sky train. Of course it is hot so go in the moning . The plantings are lovely and the wildlife unexpected. Good stop on the way to Victoria monument where crowded space will replace open space.

Lumpini - Silence in a Metropole. When your Hotel is close by to Lumpini, what is better then walk through the Park to Thanon Silom. You will meet runners, mothers strolling with their kids, and during season the Concert in the Park on Sundays at 5. Look for the Summer schedule when you are in Krunghtep or in English Bangkok !!

Just perfect. Its nice to get away from the busy city life u will b surrounded by green trees everywhere n alot of locals joggin n playin sports and a nice lake view n u get to feed the fishes in the lake
It is a good place to spend somtime away from the city

nice break from the hectic fun..... We enjoyed an hour and a half strolling thru the park. Saw locals doing Tai Chi and stumbled across several Monitors. We didn't know about them so were shocked! It was super cool to see them but I wasn't going to get very close! If you have the time in Bangkok, worth stopping by.

Place of Respite. We spent a morning relaxing in this very pleasant oasis in the middle of a very busy city. There are a many walking trails around small ponds and benches everywhere for people watching. A nice place to go to collect yourself.

nice and calm. locate in the middle of city. you can take btw and get off at saladaeng. walk a little bit and you will be there. have duck boat for you to rent, kinda romantic. open really early for people to go jogging and close around 9 pm if i remember correctly
A small greenery inside bangkok city. A nice park to spend half day from your busy schedule. I must recommend to visit this place and relax just beneath of tree shed.

Great place to spend a half day. Anyone who's had enough of sightseeing and shopping could do a lot worse than spend some time here, away from the perpetual traffic jams of central Bangkok. The gardens are well tended with lots of interesting plants and trees, playgrounds, boating lake and some lovely walkways past well laid out flowerbeds. There's also a surprisingly wide variety of birdlife and lots of squirrels, not to mention lots of turtles in the lake. Oh, and it's got monitor lizards. Loads of them. We counted 35 before we got bored with counting. They range in size from small youngsters a couple of feet long to fully grown ones over seven feet long from nose to tail. They're perfectly safe, (although I wouldn't advise parents to let their kids get too close) and fascinating creatures, which, lets face it, you don't often end up sharing a park with!

Running park for in the city. There is a set path around the park that is 2.5 km in length for running. The path has markings every 200 meters and an indicator of the distance run. Cyclists also have a separate track next to the runners.While running around the park I noticed there were a selection of free to use resistance machines. Park workers were also installing more of the machines, which are often seen around city parks in Asia. Perfect if you fancy a quick resistance workout after your run.

Beautiful gardens. I walked through here on a Sunday morning. There were many people there exercising. The gardens were attractive. We walked to the clock tower. We had a difficult time finding our way out. Finally we exited the same way that we entered. There were some amazingly large lizard looking reptiles walking around freely. It was easy to get to taking the subway.

Tranquil with a twist. Lumpini park is an oasis right in the he heart of Bangkok.. It has walking tracks, playgounds, a lake with paddle boats, huge water monitors (dragons) and a lot of greenery.It also has the best value for money sporting club/gym etc. I have ever seen.You just need a copy of your passport, a passport photo along with the up front annual payment of 40 baht ..... Yes 40 baht......You need a medical certificate if you want to use the pool facility ..The club has a large well equipped gym, 25 meter swimming pool, basket ball court with nets on the rings , two tennis courts, a table tennis room with three good quality tables and a music room with guitars and keyboards .. If you are staying in Bangok for even a week or two and need your sporting fix , just do it.Getting there is easy.. Either take the BTS Silom line to Sala Daeng and take the 600ish meter walk to the park or take the MRT and exit at the Silom station in which.case the escalator will deliver you to the front gate of the park ..Walk in , stay to your right and the club is a 150 meters on the right ... You also receive an I.D. card for access ...Good luck...

What a wonderful park. We really enjoyed it in this park. The activities all around the park just want to make you put one your running shoes and join them.
We saw the monitor lizards, birds, cats , fish and tortoises.
A must visit if you are in the area

Great place to enjoy greenery in the city . Like an oasis in the desert, lumpini park is like having nature in the hustle and bustle of the city...Great time to go would be in the morning or evening, when the sun isn't really too hot.. The air is fresher and cooler in the mornings though..Do check out the monitor lizards... They could be either be slithering along the waterside or be climbing up the huge trees to take a nap!

A Great Oasis in Bangkok. A great park for some early am exercise while observing water monitors. There are different hiking trails and boats for rent, picnic places and plenty of benches to sit on. The grounds are well kept. Only a 15 minute walk from Chateau de Bangkok. A nice oasis in the middle of Bangkok.

Water Monitors. Went here mainly to see the water monitors. Found one and got some cool pictures. Nice park to walk around in, but very busy when we went (a festival of sorts going on). Not the prettiest park, but worth checking out.

Be suprised by a Dragon or two.... Whilst you walk around in the serial atmosphere of Lumpini park with busy buildings and roads all around you, a sense of relief is bestowed upon you. The Water Dragons are all around looking for their next feed and with some other unusual animals in this park you will not be bored.Take your time, there is no rush.

Oasis from a hustle-bustle of BKK streets; good for jog/free aerobics, strolling and a short break on lazy afternoon. A joggers' mecca as well as for Taichi/Chinese martial arts' enthusiasts almost around the clock (open as early as 4:30am to 9:00pm) everyday, in addition to free aerobics offered every 7:00am and evening which attracts substantial number of participants. Almost every weekend some kind of races (5-10k, fun run early morning hours)/social activities are going on, w/nearby open market of fresh produces and food stalls frequented by the locals, who make the Park - the breezy woody parts thereof - a good pick-nick site.

A good park in a great location. . We visited here as we were walking through due to our hotel being close and it was recommended by a friend. We tool a stroll through and it's nicely maintained, plenty of flora and fauna and things to look at including some awesome statues. The main reason we went was for the big lizards, and sure enough we saw two big ones in the moat around the park. Made it worth while. The only bad side? Cyclists need to stick to the (amble) cycle paths, and not use the pedestrian ones! We had to jump out the way a few times.

Big open area with lovely lake!. The park was quiet, the lakes were abdundant with fish, monitor lizards and terapins, the facilites in the park eg gym, toilets, basketball courts were of a great standard. Well worth it for a relaxing day in Bangkok

A big, wide open space in the middle of Bangkok. I visited Lumphini for the first time in February although I've stayed in Bangkok many times. I stay on Sukhumvit so it is only three stops away on the MRT and costs 21 bahts. The park is clinically managed, not what I personally prefer. I like more wild places, more areas of trees and undergrowth for wildlife, which are lacking in this park. There are plenty of big trees, paths, canals, a lake, short grass and cycle ways. The toilet facilities are clean and well managed and there are stalls to buy cold drinks and snacks from. It was very hot when I walked through the park, around 37c, but there was enough shade to make it pleasant.If you like a big open manicured space that lacks a little character, then you will enjoy a stroll through Lumphini Park. Just make sure you don't miss the entrances which are towards the corners of the park. I ended up walking all the way down the outside before I found an entrance and it was a long way down a busy road!

Enjoy this nice park. This is a nice park in the centre of Bangkok. Enjoy a walk or the iguanas here. Your children will be excited finding iguanas in different sizes almost everywhere in the park. If you like jogging, this is the place.

A green oasis. We went to Lumpini park in the afternoon by Skytrain and it was a great place to cool off from the heat by relaxing in the shadow. If you've been to Central Park in New York you'll notice a lot of similarities. Very nice.

Green in the midst of BKK Bustle. The park is a fun place for families or if you want to chase your athletic pursuits. Our kids enjoyed walking around and playing on many playgrounds and swings. They also enjoyed searching for wildlife. We watched the fish, monitor lizards, and a couple turtles. For the athletic, the road is used well by cyclists and runners. There are basketball courts, Futsal pitches, exercise equipment, morning aerobics and more! I went running a few years ago in the park. At 8am & 6pm they played the Kings anthem - very cool! What I figured out very quickly was that everyone pauses and stands while the music plays. Keep an eye on your babies, the crows are big enough to carry them away!Enjoy the green space in the Bangkok bustle

Serenity. Nobody loves Bangkok more than me,with all the noisy traffic,the smells ,the hustle and bustle of it all its great.However there are times we all need a little bit of peace and quiet, and one day out on my own i decided to get of the sky train a couple of stops before my destination at Lumphini park.I am so glad i did, what a wonderful place just to stroll around and watch the world go by in some one else's country.Their you will find all sorts to occupy your mind and entertain you, from the many old make shift gymnasiums to the jugglers and martial artists,and many other things that go on in a Bangkok park.You can also hire a small boat and just paddle aimlessly around in the huge pond they have untill your time is up.I walked and sat around for nearly 3 hours , i was stunned to find how the time had past so quickly, i almost forgot to have lunch.

WHAT A NICE PLACE TO VISIT IN MIDDLE OF BUSY BANGKOK. What a nice, clean place to visit. to get out of the noise and traffic and have some quiet time in the middle of a major city is good. the lake is nice and quiet feel to it, can rent some paddleboats, and taske a nice stroll around the park, lots of green areas to sit and meditate and be quiet

It's a wonderful place. . I have been coming here for most of two decades. It's changed in that time - the loss of suan lim for starters - but over all it has retained its charm. And that charm is the oasis of calm and green in a sea of smog and traffic and noise. Tai chi is all the rage on the morning and there are paddle boats to take on the lake. It has wildlife (birds, iguanas and countless others. It's a great place.

Nice greenery in the heart of Bangkok. Lumpini Park is a wonderful park in Bangkok with a lake in. It is a hub of activity early morning (5-7am) and early evening (5-7pm) where young and old meet to run, cycle, do aerobics, Tai Chi etc etc. It takes about 30 mins to walk around the lake, and is a refreshing change from the crowded streets and shops of Bangkok.

Nice place to go if you enjoy something leisure yet exciting with kids. You can see some big lizards swimming or sunbathing on the grass. It is a nice experience to be close to them as it is impossible for those who live in a concrete jungle to see such animals walking around. You don't need to spend money, just make sure you get enough water to drink. Stay alert as they can be hiding somewhere close to you. The biggest we saw is about the size of a 7-year-old. There is a playground for kids with swings that made of Michelin tyres. My kids had good time there. The entrance is on the opposite side of the lumpini station. It is too big that we only walked part of it.

Wonderful morning run. Take an early morning run in Lumpini with the locals jogging or doing thaichi gym some even with swords. Dont step on the large lizzards that feed on fish from the ponds. But be very very careful when you cross the roads in the morming traffic on your way to the park.

Concert in the Park. The Park is very nice but we where very lucky as we saw the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra performing their last concert of the season. This usually is in January but due to some bad weather earlier they extended the season. Fantastic performance with a great MC and a very funny Conductor. Yes a bit like the last night at the Proms. They performed some classical as well as some pop and had also a few guest musicians. A violinist from Jakarta who performed some parts of a Chinese Opera. Very enjoyable. Superb.

Must visit in Bangkok. Yes, this is a must do, more so than some of the temples, jim thompson...and...its free! Great park, really tropical. There is a section with incredible palm trees, with some benches to sit and relax. You can buy coconuts and fried chicken, take a leisurely stroll and just bring a book and watch local bangkok residents do their thing--exersize, stretch, dance, gossip, tai chi. Really cool, and look out for the lizards that pop out of the water, incredible!

Bkk Symphony orchestra free concert. Last sunday 22.2 we enjoyed a nice concert in the park, you hire mats, buy picnic and listen to the Bangkok symphony orchestra giving free concert abt. twice per month on sundays. Sala Deng, enter big entrance in the corner walk straight 300 m

AN OASIS IN THE CHAOS OF BANGKOK. If you need a break from the hustle and noise of Bangkok City then Lumpini Park is worth a visit.A short walk from Sala Daeng Station, the Park features many lakes and quiet walks where you will see a wide variety of birds and monitor lizards. If you are quiet and walk slowly you can approach within 5 metres of some very large (around 3 metres) lizards warming themselves on the banks of the lakes. There are also fish in the lakes, squirrels and large crows who will come close for a piece of bread or nuts. The more energetic will find the park ideal for a jog or cycle ride and there are exercise apparatus dotted around that you can use free of charge.

large park to relax. I could not wait to see this park as I had read so much about its beauty. I was a bit taken aback when I saw it. Yes it is big but it has rubbish scattered at various sites around it. There is weights and exercise equipment along one side and concrete path to run along or push a pram. Has a lake in the middle. It would be a good place to have a sit down lunch or relax with the children and let them chill out. I expected more but it will not disappoint. There are toilets within the park

Oasis in the City. This is a better park than most people give it credit for. It's green and quiet and not too crowded. It offers trees, flowers, water, walk and bike paths, and a bit of quiet. Free concerts in the park on Sundays during the winter are really great. There are also some pick up basketball games and some free gym equipment. And it's easy to get to - right on both the Skytrain and Subway. It's worth wandering around.

Dear Park Fiends,. Located off the Silom MRT or Sala Daeng BTS this park is ideal for a leisurely stroll, a refreshing jog, or an evening shooting photos of gorgeous landscapes and people taking selfies.

Lungs of Bangkok. Lumpini Park is maybe the best place in downtown Bangkok where you can get some fresh air and relax after a hard day at work or a mind-blowing shopping spree in the malls.We went to the park because we happened to be in the area. Many places to seat and relax, jogging trails, pond where you can hire paddleboats (30 baht for 30 mins). Big lizards come out of the pond and walk freely - they are quite big and some of them are the size of a small crocodile!It was in April 2014 when we visited the park and there were street protesters living in tents in the park. I didn't know what to expect and got a little nervous as I was with my wife and son but everybody was very nice and friendly and they didn't interfere with the people who were there to relax.

Park in the middle of the city. The park isn't very hard to find. Just take a BTS to Sala Daeng and then take a little walk. There are many directions so you will be okay. The park is quite big. I don't even explore the whole park. I just strolling around the food hawker in front of the gate. There are also so many merchant and I do a little shop. The park is worth visited after daily activities in the middle of traffic.

Very enjoyable Great Street Photo opportunities. Walked around the park this morning. Plenty of people running and cycling, and general mingling. Great opportunities for street photography of the many vendors around the park and the foods and products they have to offer. After sheltering during a brief storm, all activities resumed, a very pleasant mornings activity.

Ok for a walk. We live closeby and were told that we can go with our mini chi there for a nice walk. The moment we entered, a security guard ran up to us and started waving his hands around and saying that the dog can't walk there ( what was he going to do? Further down we saw 4 stray dogs that no one minded). Mind you the park has only paved jogging paths that you can walk on and it's not really a refuge for a hot day under the sun. Disappointed.

Lumphini Park. We have just spent the morning walking around Lumphini Park and it was lovely. You wouldn't believe you were in the middle of the city and the most amazing thing I saw was the monitor lizards by the lakes... Some were little and quite colourful and there were some very large ones over 1.2 metres. They let you look at them quite happily but if you went too close they just walked away or went back in the water... Fabulous.

Great to walk around and they have concerts for free. We went to see the Bangkok Symphonic orchrestra and getting to the park was easy and it was clean and toilets close by. Lots of paths and there is a swan boat rides too. Very sixties.

Nice park in the middle of it all. . My wife and I visited this park today as a change to more travelling around the city and shops. It was a welcome break and a chance to slow down a bit and relax. There are plenty of well surfaced tracks and roads through the park with segregation between cyclists and walkers / joggers. There are public loos and security guys at regular intervals so all feels very safe. The monitor lizards were interesting to watch as a novel, as were the locals exercising all around. There's plenty of seats if you need a break and the odd stall for drinks and snacks. We arrived by MRT to Silom station and using the correct exit meant no big roads to cross - result!Give it a go if you need a break from the hussle of the city.

A gem, not to be missed. My first visit and it will not be my last. I live in BKK and cannot believe that this unique and beautiful park has escaped my attention. It was my girlfriend that suggested we go. Its large, has amazing trees, a 'lake' where one can rent water craft, jogging trails, an open air gym, similar to Venice Beach in California, and many public bathrooms. Also a play area for children. Hard to believe that the dynamic city of Bangkok is just outside its walls. Afterwards exit on Wireless Road and check out the US Embassy, The Netherlands Embassy and the home of the US Ambassador, among the numerous other embassies in the immediate area.

Look out for the wildlife. This place offers tranquility right in the city centre. Watch out for the cyclists that use it as a circuit. When we were leaving by one of the exits we saw a lot of what we thought were small kimodo dragons that is surreal. Really pretty place well worth the visit.

Good Greens in Middle of the City. Lumpini Park is situated in Pathumwan area in Bangkok. I was staying in Sukhumvit and had been to Siam Paragon in the morning. But overall because Bangkok has huge traffic and therefor noisy (although honking is not heard off), thought of just spending some time at a quiet place, with my partner in tow. Hence, headed this way. From Siam, we hired a Tuk Tuk, that cost us some 70 THB. Must be around 10 minutes' distance without traffic. Lumpini is a huge park, very well maintained. Roads within the park are well constructed, vehicles are not allowed beyond the designated parking slots. The fountains are nice, boating is also in there. Nice overall place for some quick photo sessions as well. The waters in there has some very big lizards, they are very scary. The scarier part is that the canals / water-ways that passes through, within this park has no fencing, meaning that the lizards can come out of the water and rest adjacent to you on the lawns. All the best then !Washroom facility is available. But then, looking at a bigger picture, a park is a park. How much will the boys really enjoy ??? Girls like it more ! But nice for a quiet stroll. Regards,Shaunak MarulkarPune (India)
Loved it!. A breath of ' fresh air ' in Bangkok.- well, almost :-).But it was a great place for me to sit, relax and read a book. I will definitely go again.Great for running as well.

Go in the Morning. t is best to visit the park first thing in the morning before it gets too hot (this goes for any time of year). The best thing to do is to follow the jogging/walking/biking path that goes around the park (2.54 KM around). This allows you to watch the locals exercising and doing Tai Chi as well as see the monitor lizards, the lake and to stop off at the King Rama VI statue. Or if you are not in the mood to walk, bring a picnic breakfast or lunch and just sit by the lake in the shade and enjoy this oasis in the city....
loved the local residents. went especially to see the local fauna. those lizzards were enormous and worth a view. it is such a wonderful walking park. grab a cold drink and take a stroll

Huge city center. Lumpini is a huge park right in the center of the city. It is well set out we lot's of interesting routes to walk around and nice places to relax, although it didn't seem to be as perfectly maintained or cleaned.

A Leisurely Stroll . This is a place that takes you away from it all for a little while. Be mindful of the lizards who will not bother you but if you are not aware of them will scare the s..t out of you

Worth a visit if you're in the area . Nice park in the midst of all the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Scenic and fairly large, this park seems to be a popular spot for locals and tourist alike. That being said I never felt crowded and there were plenty of places to sit down and relax in piece and quiet. The park seems to host festivals from time to time, I had just missed one as I saw people cleaning up( bummer). I was told there were large lizards but didnt see any ( bummer again). There are places to rent boats to paddle along the lake. Places to buy food and drink by the entrances. Plenty of shaded places to sit whether under a tree or a beautifully designed pavilion. Its right by the bts so getting there isnt hard.If I were a local loving nearby I would be at this park everyday.
Nice park. The Lumpini Park is a haven of calm in this bustling city. Large green space with pleasant gardens. Nice

A nice place to chill inside a hectic BKK. We have seen a few parks in the world, but this is definitely one in the Top 3. Very neat, spacious and well kept. We had a very felaxing 2 hours before jumping back into the big Mango.

Peaceful. If you want to get away from the bustle of the shopping complexes etc go here to spend a few peaceful hours. The best fun is looking out for the monitor lizards you can spot by the lakeside along with the terrapins and Heron's There are some interesting statues and sculptures dotted about and well maintained gardens. I took the metro to get there so cheap morning out. If you go early enough you may see the thai 's practicing tai chi, look out for the cycle lanes as the cyclists speed along and get annoyed if you walk along the cycle paths

Peaceful location in the bustling city. The paddle boats and feeding the fishes was the best part. The lake in the park is literally full of medium sized fish and even a small piece of bread brings them rushing to the top - it's quite relaxing to get away from the noise of the city for a while. Great for a stroll, a jog, for the little kids, for activities or just to relax.
A very dull place to visit. I was quite disappointed. The park is small, nothing special. My friend didn't like it either. It seems like there are not enough people looking after the park.

What a park. Worth the visit to find a little green and peace,check the fish in the lake.People sell cheap bread to feed the fish,Check out the Lumpini markets for food stallsCan't believe how nice this park is in the middle off bangkok.

Great green spot. Nice big green spot to relax, workout , cycle , jog , paddle boat , do yoga . WatchBirds , monitor lizard large & small. Water bodies are great just to watch & feel cool. In a hot & humid place like Bankok these Parks & open spaces are a blessing . There is an open gymnasium too . Hire bikes at the gate & go around . Get a picnic basket & spend the day , with friends and family.
The Hyde Park of the East. Spectacular and Huge patch of green right in middle of Bangkok. I would highly recommend this place for visit. we went in the morning for a stroll
Lumpini Park. Lumpini Park is a quiet park, it has many trees and a huge lake. I think the good time to go is in the morning, it's fresh and peaceful.

A nice place to unwind. Checked out the park to kill some time over the weekend. I was there during a Thai festival so there were many stalls offering a variety of food, products, entertainment etc. The park is huge and I saw people fishing, exercising and there's even an outdoor gym there which was impressive. Of course you wouldn't expect state of the art gym equipment being left outdoors but it's nice that they had the facility there for those who'd like to work out. It's a nice place for a walk if you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok's busy streets

Great Park Space in Centre of City. Lumpini Park is one of the few green parklands located in the. Centre of Bangkok.You can really get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and relax in lovely surroundings. The park has several paths that you can wander around whilst dodging the cyclists and joggers. The boating lake is a fun place to hire paddle boats and enjoy the surroundings.You can also get a chance to see largest monitor lizards and if you are quiet and take slow movements you can get quite close to them.

A nice surprise. It is only lately that I went back to run and exercise in the park after...12 years or so. The park itself is still the same but the facilities have vastly improved and prove more and more popular even at 6am it is busy. groups of Tai Chi, aerobic, different outdoor exercise spots with a variety of equipments and even an air condition gym! Foodwise it is not an address to be remembered unfortunately but to relax and exercise it is more than pleasant it is nice.

So much to see & do at this huge city park!. I decided to stop at this park to kill some time before catching a night train at nearby Hua Lamphong station. What luck! This park was so much fun to wander around! In addition to being quite large, it offers a variety of amenities, including a swimming pool, outdoor fitness area, indoor full service gym, playground, running trail, lots of green space, paddle boats, and more. You'll also find group exercise classes in the evening and sunbathers in the afternoon. If you're lucky you may even seen the monitor (?) lizards rustling around. So glad I stumbled onto this little known (to tourists) gem.

Great place for some exercise. In a city where walking can be a hazard on the pavements its nice to find somewhere for some calm walking or jogging in a relatively tranquil setting.At one time it was full of political protestors but now they have gone its much nicer

Nice place not just to walk to see the giants lizards. We love animals, and we saw on TV that there are a lot of giants lizards. The same family of the Comodo Dragon.Once we arrive there are a lot of, you only have to look very carefully where the river isBut if you only want to go to have a walk, it is a very nice place to do it. You will see funny things…Be ready to stop your walk when you listen to music, because they do.And take care with the mosquitos!!!

Calm oasis. This used to be the location of a famous night market. Not anymore which is a shame. however if you arrive at dawn you can watch hundreds of people go through their early morning workouts. Great photographic opportunities are there as the mist slowly disappears. A number of festivals are held there throughout the year so do check what is happening there before you travel.Otherwise an Oasis of calm in the madness of Bangkok.

Go for a run . In a densely populated city like Bangkok with very few parks for true R&R, Lumphini Park is an oasis. Located in the city center with MRT and BTS access, the park is loved by joggers, elderly gatherings and Tai Chi enthusiasts. There are shops but not enough to distract you from running in peace or for a simple picnic on the lawns. This is a park to enjoy some down time so do not expect beautiful buildings and lovely gardens. Go early in the morning to avoid crowds. Ideal for people already staying at a hotel downtown.
Free Aerobics. Lots of fun dancing to the free aerobics, kept me very fit and had a real laugh.Much more fun than any public park in the UK.

A welcome oasis from Bangkok bustle. Lumpini Park is an oasis of greenery and calm nestled among some of Bangkok's busiest streets. It is at the mid point between the central shopping region on Rama 1 and Phloen Chit roads and the commercial and financial centre on Silom and Sathorn roads.It serves a similar function to Central Park in New York and Hyde Parks in London and Sydney. It is not as good as the parks in those other cities but it is still a great place to relax and escape the concrete canyons and the snarled traffic.

An oasis in the chaos!. Lumpini Park in Silom is a beautiful park for taking a stroll in the bustling city of Bangkok. However I take advantage of the distance marked walking/running paths. With all of the many others there exercising, you'll be inspired to challenge yourself. The water features and manicured gardens create a tranquil oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.

A Beautiful Park In The Heart Of The City. If you are in the Bangkok city centre I recommend you visit the Lumpini Park.The scenery can be best described as awesome and relaxing.The best time to visit the park is early morning ( before 8.00am) where you can witness joggers as well as people exercising. As there is a food court within the compounds of Lumpini Park you can enjoy your breakfast there after your morning walk
Great place to run. A large and scenic park great for running and cycling. There is also an outdoor gym (50 baht for foreigners) along the running route with weights and some machines.

Great Place to Spend An Afternoon.. Great place to get away from the bustling city. A piece of nature right in the heart of Bangkok.Free entry to the park and you're free to wander or find a spot and just watch the world go by.undoubtedly the most interesting part of the park is the number of large Monitor Lizards roaming free and paying little attention to the humans passing by.Pedalo's are available to hire for 40 Bhat per 30 minutes and are a great way to see the park and good photo oppertunity from the middle of the lake.

The central park of Bangkok. This is such a lovely park to walk, jog, bike. When you come on the week end, you see elderly people doing their Chinese excerise. The man made lakes you may see big lizards, and crocodiles. There's also a tennis courts, gym, play ground, and when you think you have shed some grams from your body weight, on week- end you can join the locals with their local and delicious cuisines. Every morning before the entrance from Rajdamri Road, across the Chulalongkurn hospital, you can get your fresh veggies and fruits, even fish and shrimps, dried food in this place. At night, all the would be chefs of star Michelin sets up their table and you can enjoy the best noodles.

In Love!. The roar of Bangkok (as is true for any major city) can be a bit trying on occasion. That's why more places like this are urgently needed! It has a lovely serene atmosphere. Some surprising wildlife (giant lizzards or whatever they're called.) A clearly marked 2.543km running route which put me in mind of the even more spectacular tempelhofer park in Berlin. But I digress. The main point is thus, if you want to see Bangkok (and who wouldn't) but wish to have some "escape", book a room near here! The only thing wanting (badly!) is a beer garden with a sneaky cig option.

Nice location, enjoyable environment. Lumpini Park (or Suan Lum as the locals call it) is a nice place to relax, go for a walk or enjoy a short jogging round. The park is used a lot by local Thai families strolling around and also for people doing tai-chi or other types of physical training. Check out the wildlife in the small streams, and do not miss the Sunday afternoon concerts. They start at around 5.30 PM and the repertoire by the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra (BSO) is widespread - from Tchaikovsky, over Thai pop songs to the Beatles. Enjoyable listening to good music while the sun sets. The venue of the concert is near the Sarasin entrance.

Nice space for a break - it's just a park though. We went here for an afternoon stroll on one of our 3 days in Bangkok. Really nice to just get away from the traffic and bustle. But there's nothing more than nice trees and grass, some giant lizards in the lake, pedaloes, some outdoor gym equipment and some public toilets. Seemed to be a lot of building work going on.

Nice park next to the stress. First time I'm in Bangkok and thought overall it's a pretty stressful city, lived near this park and found the very first day.+ an oasis in an otherwise heated environment.+ beautiful setting and they even have tortoises and iguanas in the water!-minus is perhaps that it costs little to go to the bathroom, unnecessary.

Nice oasis. A peaceful calm place in a big noisy city. Beautiful park with lots of big shade trees and benches. A lovely lake and pathways for jogging or riding a bike. There is also a nice childrens playground.

Spot of freshness in hot Bangkok. Do not expect anything spectacular, anything special to see or do. It is just a park, but it is a lovely one. It is huge and was empty in the morning, just a few people jogging or practicing tai chi. Was fresh and cool, with good views, nice paths, functioning toilets... There is an outdoor gym, but not sure of the costs.

Lovely Lumpini Park. We walked to Lampini Park (approx one hour) from our hotel. The Park is large with lakes and pathways. We spent a few hours here walking around it all. We saw lots of Monitor Lizard’s which we are fascinated by. It is a lovely peaceful park with lots of people walking, running, cycling and just enjoying themselves.

Could be a great park. The Lumpini Park has the potential to be a great park which means in my opinion of view it is not as of today. The park is not too small, and probably if the city can somehow figure out expanded it a bit would be even better, but the management of the park is basically Thai style, too lay back, ground is not well maintained and not probably organized. Get a professional please!

Great place to run. With my belly growing from too much New Years celebrations,I was on the look out for somewhere safe to run out of the traffic. I found this park only about 2 minutes away from my hotel.Lots of other runners. Nice peaceful place away from Bangkok crowds.

Great park to rest. After our Sunday mass at the nearby Redemptorist Catholic Church, we walked around the park and even slept on the grass for a little while fronting the lagoon. Families were having picnics , senior citizens playing games , teenagers playing badminton and children feeding the birds and fishes with what seemed to be slices of bread. Overall, it was a beautiful ,serene place where babies were being feed and sleeping caressed by the light breeze. Bangkok seems to have a perfectly cool weather in December and January.

Big Park. This big park is an oasis after you tired of Bangkok's traffic.You can bike or jogging around 2 big ponds.Many Thai people doing exercise, aerobic, or just tai chi together in this park.Interesting place.
Don't understand the hype about this park. Not really interesting ... nothung to see or do. Wasn't even clean or worth the stroll through.only thing remotely interesting was the outdoor gym

Very nice. I accidentally stumbled upon this today, and I'm glad I did. Turns out there was free music in the park concert tonight. So I returned at 530 tonight (Sunday) and saw the Bangkok Orchestra put on a wonderful 2 hour show. Aside from that, the park is a nice relaxing place with lots of bikers and runners. It's a great place to lie down in the grass and enjoy the sun and green spaces. Highly recommended.

Great park in busy Bangkok. Lumpini park is centrally located in Bangkok between Silom and Siam, with the Silom MRT metro station right next to it.The park covers a large area with lots of trees and open grass spaces amidst lakes and ponds, all in all very scenic.Definitely a change in pace to the usual hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Very much recommended if you want to get away from the noise of the city for a while.

Beautiful Park in the Middle of Bangkok!. Great place for jogging either morning, after or evening. Very relaxing park, can sit and read, have lunch and just watch the people go by. It is a very safe park, patrolled by guards on bicycles and also some on foot. There activities going there around the lake areas. You can boat and use your bicycle there as well. The park is connected to the underground station, Known as the MRT, so there is no issues for transport. Very close to the Dusit Thani Hotel and Silom Road. Across from the park is the very famous Chulalongkorn Hospital, The Re Cross headquarters and many other sites you can visit, walking distance. Bangkok is a great walking city.There is also a public swimming pool area, if you needed it.I visit the park often to take in my walking exercise. So I am not new to the PARK, but I have never reviewed it, its time now. People don't realize we have such a beautiful place to visit. Just a word of advise, if you go to the park at just about 6pm, please stand up for the national anthem like everybody else does, not walk or sit until it is over, just 2 minutes or so.  So have fun and enjoy your stay here!
refreshing. good size park for kids to explore lots of areas for adults to rtelax as well its also an enjoyable place to walk around

Public Green Lung of Bangkok. A calming park that is as tranquil as one can get in electrifying Bangkok.Tai-chi workouts, yoga enthusiasts, joggers, dancers, birdwatchers, cycling nuts - they are all here.... as are paddle boats in the lakes.Aptly named The Home of Hope, opened from 10am to pm daily is a haven for homeless children.I am told that education, counselling to help homeless children are provided.Less necessary, perhaps, but more iconic ... is the landmark statue of King Rama VI.A favourite place for tourists and locals alike to breath in nature.

Nice place to relax in city. This park is a nice place to relax in heart of the city, if you don't have any other activities or places to visit, this could be your better choice, we loved the fried quail eggs (7 eggs - 20THB) sold by the road side shop at main entry gate. The following are the major activities in the park and Kids will really enjoy it. My 3 year kid was not interested to leave the place.* Watch swimming lizards in the ponds* Fish feeding* Kids play area* Swan self pedalled boat ride* Walking, Jogging and Cycling* Sit and relax in large lawn area

Alex Dunnin. Great chillax spot in central Bangkok. If you're looking for an area to unwind in the city and see some trees and grass this is where to go. So easy to get to thanks to the BTS and SkyRail too.

Refreshing!. This park might have nothing specific to offer or anything out of the ordinary but it's such a perfect place to have some rest! Went in the morning and it was quiet and refreshing before another day battling Bangkok's crowds. We also saw a large lizard creature crawl out of the lake!!

Sculpted Greenery in a Concrete Jungle. I took my two 6 year old daughters' there to have a play in the park - I was very surprised at how beautiful it was. Sculpted gardens, little lake with paddling boats on it, playgrounds and to finish it all off, a free concert in the park afterwards. Every Sunday at 5.30pm there is a concert with some little venders selling popcorn and drinks. We saw the Bangkok Symphony Orchestra which was a real treat. All up it's a great place to visit to get away from the concrete jungle that is Bangkok. Only downside we couldn't find a toilet and a place to buy some water before the concert.
Relaxing time. A place to rest with tranquil environment.Free admission.Take MRT to Lumpini or Silom. Early morning many athletes and joggers can be seen.

Peaceful rest. Nice clean park. The day we wnt it was a cool wind so sitting in the shadowy areas was quite comfortable. Food and drink for sale outside and inside. Bring a picknic basket and stay all day, that,
escape from bangkok madness. want to escape from Bangkok madness. A walk in Lumpini park is just the way to do it. We even got a massage in the peaceful green open air.

great park.tennis.gym.swimming pool. youth centre located inside the park with 2 tennis courts, swimming pool,gym and a petanque ground . membership is 40 baht/year. bring id with you to register. for the use of the pool you need a doctor's note. tennis court hire is 35 baht/hour. the service is friendly and if you are a cat lover, say hello to the resident cat, usually sleeping on the mat outside the entrance door.MRT is lumping park station.ps: tennis court are available mon-frid 7am-8pm, except between 4pm-6pm and lunch break is 12pm-1pmno singlets allowed and swimmers must wear speedos

Bangkok pure. You haven't visit Bangkok if you haven't visit Suan Lum (Lumpini Park) Especially early in the morning. Everywhere are people walking, running, biking and everywhere are classes, like Dance classes, yoga, Tai chi, sword fighting, Chinese opera etc etc. Also a lot of people just meet here and gather to have a tea and chatting about the daily news. At precisely 08:00 h. the whole park freezes and comes to a complete standstill. This is because the national anthem is played and can be heard through the loudspeakers in every corner of the park.Do you fancy a nice paddleboat tour on the small lake, then come back in the afternoon.Tip - walk the park in both directions and you will notice the differences, enjoy !!

Oasis of beauty in Bangkok. I stumbled into Lumpini Park and was enchanted by the place. In the middle of the city, people rode bikes (safely) around the internal roads, exotic trees and flowers abounded, and at least two huge Monitor Lizards stared at trees, oblivious to me. If I lived in Bangkok, this place would be a savior from the bustle and a great place to ride. Take the time and stroll through it.

Relax. If you have a little time on your hands you could come here.A little bit of green in the middle of all that concrete.You can go on the pedalos if you can stand the heat & watch the turtles as they bob up.There are also some big monitor lizards.To get here you can catch the skytrain to saladeng & walk through the subway station,it's signposted.

date or meditate... go for it.. We came in on a Saturday so there were plenty of people doing their morning exercise… jogging, taichi & zumba at the main entrance. It’s a fairly large park so there were different folks doing their thing. Some folks had color-coded shirts for group identification & each group had its table & chair set up so after their exercise they can enjoy coffee, noodles & the view. There's a duck head boat rental to cruise around the man-made lake. The park also teemed with different types of birds like doves, pigeons, egret & black crows. There were squirrels, too. Here you can also find the memorial for the people who have contracted HIV. A sound system was being set up during the day as they usually have a concert in the park in the evenings. The whole area was donated by King Rama. You can find his monument at the main entrance of the park. That’s at the corner of Rama & Ratchaburri road & across Dusit Thani. Don’t worry; you don’t need an overpass to cross the street if you’re on the other side. There’s a pedestrian lane. Since we stayed at Silom Street it was our first destination for the morning then the Erawan Shrine (see separate review). At 8am they have a flag ceremony which is prompted by the park patrollers by blowing their whistles at the start & at the end. To get away from traffic, Lumpini can be reached either by MRT (subway) then you get off at Lumpini station or BTS (skytrain) then get off again at Sala Daeng Station.

Great place to run and people watch in Bangkok. 1.5 mile course around the park, through the trees and over bridges, makes this a great area to run. Tons of people out and about all the time, many of them running, making it feel like you are always in an organized event. Just don't forget to stop and stand still when the national anthem plays throughout the loudspeakers in the park (just follow what everyone else is doing!!).
Good to visit.. The lumbini park is good to visit. Try to reach by 4.00 PM for moderate climate and good view. Good for nature lovers.

Too hot to enjoy. We decided to visit this park and just relax but it was too hot to even enjoy the nice walk, the park was deserted with only a few street kids/people and a few bike riders. There was a heavy presence of military around, the water looks green and smells disgusting birds were not even swimming in it. You couldn't even ride on the swan pedal boats. More seating areas with shade would be really nice and maybe a park store to buy cold drinks and some food, but I have to say I wouldn't even recommend any one come.
Wide open spaces. Great to find a place with wide open spaces for the family to relax while in Bangkok. Water, bike rentals, nice walks, friendly people. Go there whenever we can

Pleasant locals' park best in the evening. This park is bigger than we thought. We picked the wrong time to visit (mid-afternoon) and it was far too warm and not much in the way of people-watching. There was only 1 street vendor at that time, but I’m sure there are more offerings in the evening. We know better for next time!The lake is a nice feature that anchors the park. Lots of seating and picnic areas with benches and expanses of green grass. We were delighted to find free, public exercise machines (Saigon in Vietnam has similar offerings in their parks). Overall it appeared safe and clean, though I thought Benjakiti Park is even more so.
A green oasis. This is a large green oasis in the middle of a busy metropolis. Alleys, a nice lake, etc., as one expects to find in any city park, but no benches to sit down and rest!

Lots of green, totally free and clean air.. Quite a large park. Has a lake in the middle which allows boating for solo or family. Open till very late hours. Very safe with people walking, exercising, playing games, jogging, or just sitting on benches. Not much to eat so carry some food or drinks if you stay for long. Good for kids who want to play. Not for tourists for very short trips.

Nice experience. Lumpini park is really interesting and exciting with mostly locals. It's like a huge gym with running and walking routes gym equipment and a lake most of all free.In the morning qigong and tai chi in the afternoon peaceful and calm and in the evening it seems that whole Bangkok is working out in this park.Absolute worth the visit.

Island of peace and nature but some food would be great!. A great park to bike, walk, run and even take a boat ride. You will meet locals, tourists and the inevitable lizard (some are up to a meter or even longer)! There are a few playgrounds for kids that are pretty well maintained - our kids had a great time - and the pathways and lake area are nice to relax by.Biggest issue for us is the lack of any food at all. Please bring on a few local food carts!

Go around 18:00. It looks like whole Bangkok is working out in this park. Most of them running, but you can also see people lifting weights, swimming and playing basketball. Around 18:00 they played the national anthem (for the King I suppose) and all runners suddenly stood still. Very surreal and fun to experience.

Urban oasis. Great place to walk around see the locals and enjoy some sights. I liked the lake with the various fountains and the fact that the path circling the lake has markings to indicate distance for runners/walkers. Its a bit far from the BTS but worth the walk.

Tranquility in Bangkok. The park is very popular with local Thai's who gather to jog and work out in the evening . It's great to just sit and watch the locals taking time out of their busy lives . There are street vendors selling a variety of food in the area and take your camera has there is some local wildlife and scenically it's quite pretty . Worth a visit if you in the area and want a break from the hustle and bustle of the city

Fresh air and refresh yourself. If you visit the park in the early morning, you will met a lot of exercise groups of senior citizens, tai chi, aerobic, yoga and etc. If you visit the park in afternoon, you will met a peaceful and quietly park. You can row a boat in the lake or ride a bicycle. However, if you come here in the evening, the road will be full of runners who jogging after work.

Nice Park. Lumphini park is such a big park it is ideal for people who wants to jog, walk or simply just want to grasp a breath of fresh air. Ideal time for going there is around 6 am and 5pm. We also tried the food stalls outside the park and it's good. It's so relaxing going there.

during the uprising. there was sevral tousen people ,protesters against the goverment, friendly people. thay keept it clean, there was national symbols forsale every where.1000 of smal tentsl came back in july, with my bycycle, the atmosfere hat shanget ant it was back to normal people relax jogging an bycycling in the shadows of the nice park. snaks ,bear and soft drings for sale

Peaceful and Green. A very nice park located right next to the Lumpini MRT station in downtown Bangkok. It's a lovely place to go for a walk or for a jog. At 5:30pm, hundreds of people gather for a synchronized workout . Entrance is free of charge.

A bit of freshness in Bangkok. Lumpini Park is one of the ideal area to go jogging in a green environment . If you run in the evening be aware that the national anthem will be played at 6:00pm and then everyone is expected to stand up ,stay still, and quiet . The park also offers many possibilities : fitness, swimming pool, pedalos on the lake , aerobics in the evening , etc

Great park to walk around and have a look. Lumpini park has a lot of history about it. It is well looked after and it is frequently used by Thai locals. There are a lot of large lizards (dragons) around the park, in the water, on the banks and in the trees! There are also tonnes of fish in the waterway so bring some bread and feed them. It is quite a large park so it does take some time to walk right around it. It was really hot the day that we went so bring some water or there are a few small shops on the way around that sell drinks and snack food. Worth a look for something different.

Nice, just be careful who you talk to.. Beautiful place for a walk or bike ride..Lots going on. Be wary if you take an evening stroll as it's a popular male pick up spot. Unless that's your thing of course. Judge not less Ye be judged.

Very big park. The park is full of stunning wildlife, including the much adored Water Monitor. Friendly dragons that are so used to people and tourists, that they almost pose for photos and don't seem to fussed with you walking by.

Huge Park, perfect place for jog, run or other exercise. Lumphini is the biggest park in Bangkok. Located near MRT Lumphini Park. If you stay at Silom or Sathorn area, it is easy to access. You can just walk to the park or use MRT / BTS. Stop at Lumphini Park (MRT) or Silom (BTS). This park is perfect for jog, run, aerobic or other physical excercise. The track is around 2,5 km and you can use it for free, no entrance fee. Inside the park you can find other facilities like sport hall, tennis court, swimming pool, and some gym tools. Some of them are paid facilities.

Cool breeze. Opposite the Dusit Thani Hotel is this lovely park in the middle of Bangkok where you can take time out to walk at leisure. There are pedestrian/traffic lights to cross the road safely. Even on the hottest day there is a cool breeze coming off the lake where swan shaped pedal boats move aimlessly. We were approached by 'a Thai boxing maseuse' who gave my husband a head neck and shoulder massage and me a foot massage for 100B each! We established the price first! An old woman also approached and watched our massage, then offered to tell our fortune. We declined- her English was practically non existent! Food stalls are outside the park and a drink and ice cream stall inside.

Really the green lung of Bangkok. Bangkok has a very poluted air. So it is very important to have large green Areas in the City Center. It is very interesting to observe the animals there and it takes about one hour to walk around the Lumpini Park. You also feel very safe there because the security Service is always there. It is very calm and tidy and a good place to go after a day of work or sigthseeing in Bangkok
An oasis. This gorgeous park and lake is great refresher away from the hectic pace of the city. It's lush and green, well kept and tidy. The best thing is a stroll here is free.

A place for the body and the mind. Dancing and doing aerobics in the late afternoon with a group gave me an exhilarating feeling. Some friendly exercise buffs chatted and made friends with me instantly! The serene view of the lake and the beautiful surroundings relaxed my tired mind and freed me temporarily from the cares of day-to-day living.

Good Park. Went here to join the Run for the King, 11km marathon open for all. I'm visiting Bangkok for the 3rd time and this year I was able to join this marathon in honor for the King's birthday. It's such a nice way to see and experience thai culture thru this event. And using Lumpini Park as a venue is a good thing. It's in the city center, and the view is relaxing and just awesome to sit and see people passing by after a tiresome run.
Nice and relaxing place. Very good place for just relaxing or exercise ,its a calm and nice place with many people who do the exercise,recommend it as highest,the big lizards are nice to

Lumpini Park- beautiful park in bangkok center. It is very easy to find and get to this park. It's the end of Silom road under saladeng BTS train station. This entry free, the park has a lake and it is possible to rent a boat for a short time. The park has a giant lizards go free especially close to the water. (See pictures I took). There are also lots of beautiful green gardens and seating areas to rest. A great place for two hours of relaxation.

Very pleasant well looked after. We enjoyed our stroll round here. Pleasant breeze, lots of care and attention to the park. Big monitor lizards and the odd terrapin liven things up. In crazy Bangkok a calm and restful place.

Beautiful park in the middle of the city. Big park with lots of big trees, a large pond, and greenery all around. It is a nice little escape in the middle of the city. p.s. there are lots of monitor lizards roaming around in the park - do not disturb them and they won't disturb you.
Good for a walk or jog. very tranquil park full of wildlife, lots of people exercising and lovely scenery. very accessible being next to a metro station

Pleasant experience. This is a nice place to visit if you feel you would like to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.Situated in the city itself, it's a very large park area with a lake in the middle.The lake is home not only to fish but also some good size water lizards that often come up onto the bank of the lake to check things out.
Quite place to play with children. Quite and shadow: a pleasure in the middle of the city!The animals, the water around : all for the pleasure to rest!
A stroll in the park. Nice and big park with all kind of things to do, jogging , walking , sitting on a bech watching the world go by...fantastic
Quiet and tranquil. Pros-free attractiveQuiet and tranquil-a great place to chill after first few days' hectic sight seeing Cons-Hot...

Just wonderful. This oasis amidst the business of Bangkok is wonderful. What fun to rediscover your childhood by taking a paddle boat out for a ride. The parking is always a sight to behold. It is quiet and refreshing. A great escape from city life.

Good place for recharge. Big park in the middle of the business district. This is the place where people recharge theirself from a long day of working. Lockers are available. Come to visit the park at the evening time, if you want to see bangkok's lifestyle.

Quiet oasis. Lumpini park is truly a beautiful, quiet oasis in the middle of Bangkok. Take some time to rent a paddle boat walk through the park and enjoy people watching. Don't forget to bring your camera.

Park in the Middle of the City. This review is quite late. The Lumpini Park is conveniently located along Rama IV Road which is close to Sathorn and Silom areas. This large park is a popular spot for locals doing their early morning exercises. Food and drinks are available here.
my favorite place to relax and exercise. I really like it and usually go there. very appretiated for nature around you. recommend to this place when you come to bangkok.

Morning Run. Great place for a quick cardio work out with a flat run route 2.5km. The sights, sounds and smells are amazing too. We saw retirees speaking Teochew, mass aerobic workouts and a few expats too. There's a mini market and several food stalls just in case you're hungry in Bangkok?!!

Peaceful Place. Lumpini Park is My Favorite Place To Go When I Need Sometimes On My Own. This Place Is Stunning. It has Library Inside So You Can Enjoy Reading Lots Of Book. Around 1600hrs, You Will See Lots Of People Come For Running, Exercise And Some Students Are Gathering To Do Some Activities. The View Is Spectacular Especially When You Sit By The Lake. I, MyselfWould Rate This Park The No.2 Park Of Bangkok. I Love This Place.

Wonderful park in Bangkok. I went here to have a look around and found this park to have a look to look at and also relax too. At night you get a lot of the locals exercising or doing keep fit to music which makes you want to join and no one has an issue with it.Lovely lakes and lots of greenery makes this place a small paradise. Also got to see some lizards too which was great.

Green oasis in central Bangkok. A very pleasant park in Silom next to Silom metro station and 5 minutes walk from Sala Daeng skytrain station. Large park comprising many trees, grass, footpaths and a large lake. Amenities include public toilets, library, swimming pool, playpark, bandstand much seating. Very popular with locals who come to relax, jog, exercise and participate in aerobics late afternoon to early evening. Park comes to a standstill for a few minutes at 6pm each evening when national anthem is broadcast. There is a food and drink stand just inside main entrance while additional streetfood vendors congrgate outside each entrance. A great place to relax for a couple of hours.

A very nice and quiet experience in cacophonic Bangkok. Visited Lumpini park today. Great experience! After walking the streets of noisy Bangkok it was bliss to enter the park (no entrance fee) and find shade under the trees. The lake in Lumpini is surrounded by a walkway, and you will find benches under the trees and green areas to sit on in the shade everywhere. To see Lumpini Park with the highrises of Bangkok city in the background was very special. This was a new experience for us, having been i Bangkok quite a few times. We even got to meet a fat, gorgeous 2 meter long water monitor hunting along one of the smaller streams in the park. Rather scary sight if you ask me, but great. I you need a day off the noise and people and just relax under a tree with a book and soak up nature in the middle of Bangkok City, this is the place to visit! It's a very short walk from the Silom Line SkyTrain.

Great to forget the hustle of Bangkok . Had a lovely walk through the park rather than walking along the road to get the the sky train from our hotel. You can quite easily forget you are in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok with all the greenery around. Lovely place for a relaxing walk and sit down. If you go early you can see some tai chi. Ps look out for some huge lizard things, they are pretty cool.

Time to sit, reflect, meandour, even some morning cardio. Lovely Park in bustling Bangkok, tai chi class early mornings public welcome. Lots of shade and benches to sit, close to public transport. Some nearby hotels hold cycling classes through the Park. Worth a visit if your hotel is nearby! Metro station is Lumpini and skyway station is Silom.Note: The park is also used for public demonstrations, best to avoid or be diligent about your personal safety when there is political unrest in Bangkok.

Very Pleasant Park. HiI visited here on a Saturday early afternoon, very nice park to spend some time in, walking around or jogging if feeling energetic.It was not crowded at the time of my visit.2 maybe 3 lakes within the grounds, nice just relaxing looking out to them, you can rent a peddle boat on the largest one, quite cheap.Worth a couple hours of time.
