There were many places that we could take photos and i would recommend for jogging and cycling at the park on daily basis. It's great space in the center of the city.

Nice place to escape noisy Bangkok. Nice place to visit to give yourself a break from neon lights, busy shopping malls and noisy streets.
Given the heat in BKK, it would have been nice to have some wading pools or fountains to cool off. And a coffee place would be nice too.
Park. Very good place for relaxing . Family outing with children's, good jogging place, can go hand have picnic too. Very huge area of park.

Look out for the Monitor Lizards!. Went here for a Sunday stroll with my Wife. Really enjoyed walking around the park and people watching. The Lizards are huge and there are loads of them.
Great place to visit . Only problem was crossing the road from the Crowne Plaza!

Oasis of green. If you like running, this is the place to go - flat 5km loop around lush greenery and lakes (with giant lizards to watch out for). Just go early to beat the heat. Other times, Lumpini is always good for a stroll and a green respite from bustling Bangkok

Lions and Tigers and Lizards oh my!. This is a beautiful, busy and well used downtown park. There are lots of places were monitor lizards are found along the river that runs through the park. There was a large "occupy" area with tents, food shelters and a meeting hall where lots of politics were being delivered. Good spot to see in the morning or early evening, might be hard to see the monitors at night!
Oasis in the big city. 6am Tai Chi with the locals or a gentle jog, its a safe clean park, well worth a visit. Centrally located near Silom area in Lumpini.
Great place to chill out. A great respite from the heat, noise, traffic etc Sit on the grass with a book. Across the road from the Metro

water dragons ..Relaxing walks and well laid out. The walks are not set out in squares like most parks in Asia so you can meander around and cover similar areas in a circuit but not cover old ground. Not too busy either during the late morning. Water dragons abound and it is great to watch them in and out of the water.
bull of air. located in the middle of Bangkok. nice place to recover from the hectic city. excellent for the sportifs.

Massive, Interesting. I stumbled upon Lumpini Park in the late afternoon, right when they started what I found out later to be a daily ritual of exercise/stretching/yoga. There were over 400 people joining in and at least that time, no tourists. There are several ponds across the park and offer many great places to sit, reflect, and/or plan your next stop on your journey through Bangkok. As a side note, its one of the few open places in town where you can get a good view of the city that surrounds you (cool buildings, railway, etc.).
Central park. This is the main park to walk about with a lovely water feature. You can hire a peddle boat to see more.

A place to rest. I choosed Lumpini Park to relax and get away from the noise of Bangkok. That's so cool. Lumpini Park is a quiet park, it has many trees and a huge lake. I think the good time to go is in the morning, it's fresh and peace. You also take part in aerobic classes at cheap price. Lumpini Park is a place you rest on your journey.
Lumphini Park in November 2013. It is a nice park with lots of trees and a big pond. I saw a lizard swimming and a shore bird ( like an egret)

A million miles away from the other side of the road. It's hard to believe that this place exists in such a busy and bustling city. I can safely say, that this was my favourite part of Bangkok. Ideal place to sit for lunch and just watch life go by. The park is full of stunning wildlife, including the much adored Water Monitor. Friendly dragons that are so used to people and tourists, that they almost pose for photos and don't seem to fussed with you walking by.

A nice getaway.. Lumpini Park is a nice, big, green area to take a walk to clear your head or get away from the bustle of town. Conviently located off of the MRT(underground train) line and a 10 minute walk from the BTS(elevated train) line, easy to visit. Right now, the park is about 25% occupied by demonstators against the current PM but they keep to themselves and are not threatening in any way or manner. I think it just adds to the charm of the park. There are bike rentals, boat rentals, people practicing tai-chi, fitness enthusiasts and benches galore so it's very easy to spend several hours walking around or just taking life easy.

Fun way to spend afternoon. The park is a good break from the hustle of the city. There is a nice lake that you can sit and enjoy a picnic with beautiful birds all around. The park is bicycle friendly and has great running trails.

Peace in the City. We spent 3 hours strolling around this Park which has been the centre of protest rallies against the Thaksinites. At mid-day the park was peaceful presumably because "they foam at the mouth and run, But Mad Dogs and Englishmen (and Scotsmen) go out in the Mid-day Sun".We saw Asian birds and a number of monitors who were enjoying the sunshine as much as we were. We were impressed by the free exercise centres in the park although 2 mins on a press up machine in that heat defeated me. We saw the central venue which had a few demonstrators waiting for the evening anti-Thaksin event and the fast food stalls being set up to cater for it. Everyone we met was friendly but very much against the government amnesty proposal. Good luck to them!
amazing water lizards!. A lovely place to relax, wander and spot the water lizards, which are huge, and so used to people that they completely ignore their adoring fans.

Green Relaxing with boat ride. You gets to see swan and its a must visit place. Long walk between the green trees and grasses. With a nice and wonderful lake with swans. There are also tricycling boat rides. Reasonable price but gives you real peace in there. Last but not the least, its HUGE.
Beautiful park. If you want to escape the noise and traffic in Bangkok head to this beautiful park. Great place just to chill out and relax.
Enjoy morning. It is a park suitable for walk, walking, all the jogging. Because there are some entrances, please be careful. The walk of the park of the morning is really comfortable.
Outdoor gym. Payment of 50 baht required to use gym facilities that are custom-welded home-made equipment. Industrial but functional.
good!. It is good park in center of Bangkok city! if i have chance to come to Thailand with my family i will come again, with my family.

Great break from the craziness of the city. Go there for 5pm for the outdoors aerobics classes, even if you just sit in the park and do some people watching while its going on.They have some breaks in the evening, i guess they break down the classes in sessions, and when they stop when they are about to play the national anthem over the parks loud speakers, so if you see 100 or 200 people in exercise gear just standing around, hang around for a few minutes and they will start up again.

Great to run, slow. I ran in the park a few times early morning and in the evening, a route beautifully shaded by mature trees. More a jog than a run very few pick up a pace. Run anti-clockwise to take in a marked 2.5km route around the perimeter of the park. In the mornings (7am) there were groups doing Tai Chi and Yoga, and in the evening mass aerobics (100+ people) frenetically bouncing around to hi-nrg music. Apparently free - people just turn up, find a space, and join in. Be aware that if you're in the park at 6pm you'll hear a whistle blow and the national anthem play over speakers. You should also spot that everyone stops what they're doing to show respect to the King. Another whistle and everything starts up again and people take up what they were doing.If you fancy floating around in a plastic swan this is the place for you. Beautifully kitch. Plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. At the time of our visit a settlement for anti government protest was very active but no threat or danger and the park was in use as normal.

Great and quiet space in a busy city. This is a great place to have a wander around when the noise and bustles of Bangkok gets too much. We walked around for an hour or so which was nice, although it was pretty hot out. Keep an eye out on the water for the lizards!

Lovely Park. If you come early morning or late afternoon you'll see hundreds of locals of all ages exercising together to music.There is a huge lake and there are sometimes shows and productions held here.Park is large and well kept, there are little exercise things to go on as you go round and lots of friendly cats.Suan Lum night market is next door and definately worth a visit too.

dont bring your dog. In need of some greenery in the concrete and traffic of bkk I went here for a walk with my german shepard, however I was accosted by armed police and told to leave. I had a poop bag being a responsible pet owner and pointed out to the soilders that there were feral "temple" dogs here and there, but they were not impressed.I found out later that parks usually do not allow dogs on leash but tolerate mongrel dogs.Wellcome to Thailand :-)

I like the paddleboats. We only went cause I heard there were paddle boats. Very cheap and good for a look. We didn't look around the rest of the park because I think there was something going on there were tents and people everywhere but the paddleboats were empty so that was a plus.

Oasis in the City. Had a lovely morning walking around the park, watching all sorts of activities being undertaken by local people. Nice to get out of the busy city into such a pretty, calm park. Nothing in the way of snacks available there though

A nice park. Lumpini Park is a nice park to escape to if you are in the area, away from the hustle and bustle of shopping and traffic. All of Bangkok's many parks are lovely and Lumpini Park is just one of them, therefore not worth making a special trip just to visit the Park. Visit any park in Bangkok and all are just as relaxing and a haven to escape to.
walking the Thai relaxing..... If you re in Bkk and feel like a change of pace and watching Thai in a variety of activities then this is the place to go - apart from it being a pleasant park....
Nice park in crowded BKK. Refreshing/clean Park to get away from the thousands of people rushing by you every minute in Bangkok.

Great running in bkk. Bkk is ok for running, but the traffic, combined with the heat makes it often very difficult. Lumpini offers a safer option. I like to run at lumpini because there are many other people doing exercises here too, so you feel like you are part of a global community of healthy people.

Pedalo. The pedalos are worth 30 mins of your time and 40 baht of your wallet. We saw monitor lizards, turtles, carnivorous fish and storks, all on the lake in the middle of a city. The park is a nice way to while away a couple of hours.

The Highlight of our stay. We went here on a Saturday after having had enough of tourist placesThere are many pavilions and dedicated areas where people gather as groups or families to enjoy sports, nature, picnics, peddle boats, music, practice martial arts, or just relax. There was a partially fenced area with a parcourse or fitness trail, no cars but joggers and walkers around the outer rim. It was Saturday and a clear day so many were outAs we entered a young man was hitting a tennis ball against a building. He was still there when we left a few hours later. I trust he took a break! There were tennis courts near him. There are also badminton courts, swimming, a gym and more.There are also areas of just beauty where one can relax and let stress drain away.It was a welcome change for us
Joggers Park. Its a fine joogers park. I never wonder how good it could be but its fine to see nature beauty in center of city.

a walk in the park. This is a nice place to see, just for the stillness and size of the park. Many people come here to relax and do nothing. Great for walking and getting exercise and jogging. This is in the heart of the city.

Nothing much, just a big park.... As the title says it, its just a park in the middle of the city and nothing much about it. There are no special attractions in the park itself, except for the fact that there are lotsa of pigeons flying around and people sitting by the lake.

Can give it a miss. I traveled to Bangkok four times before I visited this park. I was curious about it. A park in the middle of the city similar to Central Park perhaps?The park is ok, just clean enough. If you are nearby and want to chill out it's ok to visit but it's just a park with gardens and a couple of lakes
Nice and BIG park. Very big park in the center of town - great place to get some respite from the madness and noise but we felt it was lacking in dining options.

Great place for excercising. Lumpini park is quite a big place. It is, along with Chatujak park and Benjasiri park the perfect place to jog or to do outdoor exercises!They have a swimming pool that you can access for a mere 20 baht ( you can ask for member card too)There is also an open air training and workout facility open the whole day. I dont really know about the fee, I usually go there and train for free but I heard that some people need to pay everytime they train...well the amount of money is probably ridicilous anyway ^_-A good time to go is in the morning, if you are brave enough around 6-7 am.Plenty of people doing aérobics, stretching, jogging etc...You can also participate to thai chi or yoga classes for very cheap.If you are hungry there is a kind of open-air foodcourt serving great Thai-Chinese dishes: great dumplings, red pork bun (sarapao moo daeng) and noodle soup with crab! Perfect to refill after training!

Green Heart of Bangkok. Spacious green park in central Bangkok. I like to join aerobic dancing near MRT entrance in the weekend. Aerobic class starts from 6 am and have many trainer rotation during 6-8 am. Besides, aerobic dancing, u can join Taichi, jogging,water cycling,fitness, playing tennis, swimming...etc. After excercise, I always have breakfast near exit to Rama4 Road there is a small place like open canteen.Outside have a market near Ratchadamri Rd., this market close on Monday.

Mid City Oasis. Living in Bangkok has its downside for people that love the countryside and small city living. Lumpini Park was a small oasis to escape to where you could escape from most of the sounds of the traffic and if you focussed on the trees and flowers (and huge lizards) you could almost forget you were in the middle of a large bustling city.

Mixed Feelings. I had read how beautiful and tranquil this park was so we eagerly set off for a peaceful Sunday in the park.....so not happening. Upon entering the park from the MRT, you are greeted by dozens of tents filled with people protesting various political issues, along with what appear to be homeless people camped out and sleeping on the park benches.Further into the park it becomes more quiet and family oriented, but the gardens are not as well maintained as they could be and it didn't have that well kept, full of pride and beauty that one sort of expects from Thailand. However....when we go the island and discovered the monitor lizards, this review gained a couple more points (it was a total 'skip this place' review before the lizards appeared) Loved seeing them roam around at will, and they pose beautifully for picture! All in all, I would go to see the lizards and skip the rest of the park

A nice place to run. I love waking up early and getting a run/work out in at Lumpini. Especially because there are tons of other people of all ages doing the same. Free aerobics classes also and random work out equipment (bars, bikes, etc) are also in the park. It gets a bit crowded so the earlier the better. Watch out for the huge lizards though.

Tranquility in the middle of Bangkok. Clean, green and fairly quiet - even in the middle of the day. We visited last trip and found Lumpini Park a great respite from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. The MRT will take you there and it is a great place to people watch, feed carp or work out on the adult exercise equipment. If you need a temporary escape from the chaos, this is it
morning trip. this place is my morning trip. i will see people dancing. running. setting. good environment. and i ate rice gruel here
Quiet place to relax. It’s a good place for a tourist, as you tend to walk a lot, and then suddenly find this park, where you sit and have time to ponder.

An Oasis in the middle of hte city. In several past trips to Bangkok we have said that we should visit this park. Until this trip we had not done so. It was a great experience. The park itself is wonderful with a lake and both row boats and paddle boats that can be hired. The greenery of the park makes it a cool and refreshing place to visit and indeed spend some time - - it would be wonderful for a family - - lots of open space and things to do. It is easy to get to on the Sky train although it is quite a walk from Ratchadamri station - - it may be closer from Si Lom and walk back (this is they way we travelled on our return).We entered the park from Gate 6 (down the side road) and this was beneficial for us. You enter the park without the grand entrance at the front but you are immediately in the park. - - From the front gates you are confronted by the protest tent city on your arrival and this could be off putting (although I am advised that the tent city will be returning to Govt. House as soon as the Chinese President terminates his visit to Bangkok.As stated the park is a delight and a refuge from the heat - - well worth a visit.

A temporary escape from the BKK madness. Nice place to unwind or relax. Take a stroll or jog. Or people watch.Clean and well maintained.It seems like a safe and family friendly place. There are benches where you can sit down and do whatever you want to relax. As always in any large city, safeguard your valuables and use common sense and you should be ok.

Lumpini Park. We were disappointed when we arrived as the park is really very small, but when we began to see the monitor lizards we were quite enthralment! They really are the most fascinating creatures and so amazing to see them living wild in a city park! It is a well kept and well loved haven in the middle of the city.
Green and water!. Opportunity to cool down a bit from the heat and humidity of Bangkok. Close to the main shopping areas of Silom and close to Erawan shrine (20 min walk)

A true Bangkok landmark. Very clean with daily replaced flowers and trees, this place will make you feel better. A clean and quite retreat in the middle of one of the noisiest and most polluted place on the planet.

Good Place to jogging and waliking. Its really a good place to jogging and walking all day long. I like the scenario of the kind of animals there like the komodo dragon that i feed a lot of bread.. the blossom green trees and i have a good mind settings

Real fighting. I am not a muay tay fun but I enjoyed the 9 fights. The stadium was full of local people, tourists were mostly at ring side. Everybody excited , fighters strong and rapid. No violence outside the ring, I felt safer tan in a soccer stadium

Good for a quiet afternoon. Best bet to get here is to take the MRT to Lumphini station, the BTS leaves you a good walk away. Nothing much to see or do here but it's a nice way of just switching off in Bangkok for an hour or so, the park is well patrolled so be careful with litter and no smoking allowed either. Worth a trip if you're tired of the BKK chaos.

Relax with the locals. Lumpini is a big park with a few lakes and views of the nearby big business skyline. On weekends local people use the park to practice traditional dancing on the open air stage, do their Tai Chi and sword dancing practice, play some strange game of boule and generally relax under the many trees. Beware of the many cyclists and runners though. It's an oasis of quiet in the capital worth a visit.

Walk Pass Through It. We were staying at the Sofitel So opposite the Lumpini Park and decided to walk through it on the way to Rajadamri on the way to Four Seasons Hotel - it is very convenient and good - there is a lake inside which you can enjoy

Favorite thing to do in early morning. As the sun is coming up, the park is full of seemingly thousands of people exercising, particularly the elderly, many in groups of 10-100, like soldiers in front of drill seargents some doing tai chi, some yogi, fan dancing, Zumba, and more. Plus people walking, running... No bikes until 10 am keeps the paths safe. See the monitor lizards in the waters. An urban oasis surrounded by skyscrapers, more being added every day.
Tranquility in the heart of the city. the greeneries, the public gym, ponds with fishes and birds on the lawns. a slice of Thai life in one place.

Pleasant park in city centre. Pleasant landscaped park in city centre , ideal for an hour away from the business of Bangkok. Nice lakes to walk aroundEasy to reach on MRT (underground) to Silom not Lumpini station.
Great for strolling and people watching.. This huge park is a haven of peace in a busy modern metropolis.It takes you from Lumpinee/Sathon right up to Silom.

Pleasant green space in the city. Well worth escaping the bustling city to have a walk around Lumpini Park. We saw squirrels, kingfishers and the giant monitor lizards. Plenty of trees for shade. Its a nice walk and an insight into the leisure options available to office workers in Bangkok.

Big park area Lumpini. Lumpini park is pretty nice park area where locals like to spend time aftrer work. It's a bit difficult to get there if you don't sleep near park. I think it's not anything special but if you are near it it's deffinetely worth of visiting. It's better choose cloudy day because if the weather is hot you can't enjoy walking around! Of course you can just relax and lay on the lawn but remember to get food and water with you or you won't get far. There is a highway around the Lumpini park so it'll take a while to actually get enjoy the park area. It looks like golf course where have placed benches and tables. There is also lakes where you can find small lizards.

nice park in the heart area. it is very near to city mostly parks are away from city and the reflected the city impact but this is quiet different to see greens.. natural ... very spaciest.. u can enjoy .. to reach this area is also very easy and source are very good indeed.

monitor lizard. I brought the kids here to get away from the big city hustle of Bangkok. We really enjoyed our time and played frisbee. We also got to see a really big monitor lizard which the kids loved.
nice park well maintained. this is the green lung of bkk. It is in a central position spanning from sala daeng sky train and subway station to the wireless road on the other side

Lapped up the atmosphere. A sea of tranquility in the midst of a seriously deranged city, all sorts of slow exercise, tai chi maybe going on, quite mystical really. Beautiful grounds, ordered and maintained, a contrast to the mayhem awaiting outside the patk
Bangkok's Lungs. Lumpini makes a nice break from the hustle and bustle of modern Bangkok. Watch out for the cute body builders.

peaceful and huge. went there twice and loved it both times. its the largest park in bangkok i believe. its has a children's play area, a large lake and is green. saw a few monitor lizards along the banks of the lake. our kid thoroughly enjoyed the place. visit if you have time.

Nice lush park. When you are really tired with your Bangkok madness and want to feel one with the nature, Lumpini park is the place to be. situated just opposite to the Lumpini MRT and surrounded by consulates it is a delight to walk in the park. The entrance is free, you can have a romantic boat ride. There are gym equipment planted in the park , so if you wish to workout you know you can without paying a penny. You do see a lot of doves, sparrow and other birds too, and if you are lucky like us may encounter komodo dragon.
Nice/cool. Loved the open air gym in this park. Great time to go is early morning, before the heat of the day!Watch out for the giant lizards !!

Beautiful escape. I loved this peaceful but happening place, where people gather to excercise or just meander at a quiet leisurely pace, lovely gardens , statues and lake. Even saw a cheeky Water Monitor, gave me a fright :)

Average park. This place is not a must-see if you don't have much time in Bangkok. The best time to go there is in the morning when most of the attractions in Bangkok are closed but you necessarily want to see something. In Lumpini Park I spotted monitor lizards and enjoyed nice lake. This place is probably supposed to be relaxing, but it actually wasn't during my visit due to a kind of event for Thais with really terrible loud music. Furthermore, I was accosted by a stranger calling himself a boxer. I liked the Benjasiri Park more.

Very local with a lake, paddle boats Mosquitos and monitor lizards. We had a good time visiting the park. It is right off the sky train and quite accessible. When we visited, we saw wild monitor lizards strolling around along with turtles, Thai's lunching and a few foreigners like us strolling the park. It is rainy season, so it was also a good place to put on some mosquito repellent. We were finished relatively quickly, but enjoyed the visit. It is not a must see spot, but it was an added bonus to our trip.

Fantastic for jogging with the locals. The park features a 3.5km running track which is a very nice way to see local life and keep fit in the concrete jungle of Bangkok. Best go early in the day when the air is fresher and be surprised about the vibrant life around you!

Great little Oasis. I go here most mornings for a walk to clear my head before my day starts. Bangkok can be a mad place and very busy but as soon as you step into this park a peace and tranquility descends upon you. Great place to go and clear your head. If you go in the morning you will see alot of older people practicing Tai Chi and in the evenings hundreds of younger people literally dancing in the street. Watch out for the Lizards (harmless!)
LUMPINI PARK. We stayed near Lumpini Park. We visited the Lumpini Park and like the place very much. my family enjoyed there whole day. We love to come again there.

Hey, free Tai Chi, Meditation, games !!!. Must go on weekend: grab your picnic bag and go early morning (about 7-8am the best). The cleanest park in the heart of Bangkok, nice and very pleasant people, quite a lot of activities and no snobs, every one welcomes every one. The best place to spend a very tranquil day. Can sleep on the grass, can rent a bike, even can join Hare Krishna folks or some Bible studies. Love that place.

Meh. Its a park with vendors and a lake. O, those vendors. I think some of them sleep there in their tents. It looked like a tent city. Park is nothing special at all. It's not beatifull, it's just a piece of land with a small lake and grass.

It's like you aren't even in Bangkok!. realazing and quiet, who wouldnt believe you are still in the city never mind in the heart of it. little lake area were you can rent a swan and pretend you're at home, it make seem boring at first buttt we spotted huge water monitors, was great trying to follow them, worth the visit just for that alone! and for some peace and quiet either on the grass or the Thai gazebos. its lovely
Limpini Island of Bangkok. You could for a minute escape and forget that you are in Bangkok.Nice park . Well maintained. You can exercise or find a quiet spot to relax.

Nice place to relax in the middle of busy Bangkok. This public park was right across the hotel we stayed in, so I decided to spend an afternoon here. I'm glad I did. I just wish i brought blanket and picnic basket or book with me. Perhaps i'll do that when I am back in Bangkok and i have a few hours to spare. The grassy area by the man-made lake is a good spot to lie down and relax.

Go Early In The Morning. Lumpini Park is awesome. Running the outside loop is about 1.5 miles but if you want shortcuts, there are a few places where you can chose the inner loop instead. Cool things to see include monitor lizards, 100's of people doing Tai Chi in the morning and a massive morning aerobic routine. Bring a little money with you to enjoy the vendors and in case you need a potty break.

Thai central Park. We thought the park here was great - large - well kept, plenty of things going on reminded me a lot of a Thai version of central park - except there were giant lizards roaming around. No-one seemed to mind but we were a little unnerved by this, and kept our children very close

A quiet oasis. If you need a break from all the commotion of Bangkok, go to Lumpini and enjoy the nature. Be warned that if you are easily scared (like me) you need to prepare yourself for crossing roads with the free-roaming monitor lizards in the park.

Great to see monitor lizards. Bangkok's answer to central park, its great to stroll around and enjoy the trees and flowers and wildlife ... the monitor lizards are so cool to see! I would recommend everyone to stop here for a few hours to enjoy a stroll around and chill out in the heart of the big city.

Great place to explore or exercise in during the day. I real breath of tranquility during the day in the heart of the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Lots of wide walk ways to use and lakes to hire bots on. Great for families , couples or individuals just wanting to get out. Great place to exercise.

A Great Day Out. Walk, run, ride- whatever takes your fancy. Get here early and see local Thais living life, doing their daily exercises, meeting up, drinking. Sit on the bank of the lake and watch the water lizards- scary looking things that are fascinating to watch. Play areas for kids, quiet bench to read a book.This is a great day out with something for everyone.

A quite place in the heart of bangkok. This is the place where to go to relax in Bangkok. Here it exists the silence and the opportunity to read a book outdoor without to feel too much hot. The park is neat and clean, inside tha park there is a nice clock tower and a wonderful lake. If you like to play sports here is the perfect place for the run.

Nice, calm and relaxing park. Park is really clean. I really enjoyed spending time there seeing palms, lizards , people jogging, beautiful architecture and flowers I've never seen in my country. I'd just relax on a bench and watch this picturesque view all day.

Great place to lose yourself for a while. My first night in Bangkok i went for what shoulde been a little jog around the park. It ended up as a mini marathon. This place is green, lush and has such an incredible vibe to it. From the mass of people doing aerobics to finding a quiet path to jog on, you will not be dissapointed. Running along in this island of calm you see the towering buildings all around and if you go at sunset will see these buildings transform into towering stuctures of light and glass and steel. A must do!

oxygen in bangkok. Very large and beautyfull park,with sport center or many facilities for outside sport.It begin from lumpini station to silom station.there was a big event with free vegetarian food for everyone :-) i think it was political event .

Lots of Monitor Lizards. A quiet park which is nice to stroll around to see the lizards, turtles and fish. We tried to hire a swan boat, but were declared too big by the Thai lady in the booth, even the kids were said to be too big, so I don't know who rents them! - Actually I don't think she could be bothered looking up from her phone!We bought water (10bt) in one of the little stalls and sat whilst our kids enjoyed the playground and ourdoor workout zone.
Stay away from Traffic. It is in the center of Bangkok, free admission, quiet. If you want to go away from the noise, go to this place. Running is good for your health.
Green park. Green park in the heart of busy bangkok,nice park to make a joging in the morning while enjoying the music from your iphone.
Very relaxing. Take a walk in the morning at this park. It is really very relaxing.Away from street noise. Plenty of people jogs and exercise in this park.

Love it. The park is beautiful and very well maintained. You could spend hours here. We went for a ride on the paddle boats which was fun and only cost a few dollars. It is entertaining seeing people work out at the outdoor gym, we also saw a couple ballroom dancing in a gazebo. Love the monitor lizards! There is also a playground for kids.

Lovely big park. There is a surprising amount of green space in Bangkok really and this park is a highlight. It's lovely and very popular. Obviously early morning and early evening are better cos it gets seriously hot in the day. There's always plenty of interesting activity there.

How Bangkok Starts its day. This is the place to be in during early mornings. While jogging around the 2.5 km or so track, you encounter so many communities that have made Bangkok their home. Its amazing to see the old Chinese practice Tai Chi in groups, or to see young Thai s jogging around or find so many expats cycling around. Not surprisingly many Indians who have made Silom their home can be found doing their morning walks while chit chatting with their group friends.Not only can you catch a lungful of fresh air, but get some wholesome Thai or Chinese breakfast on offer on many stalls.
Refreshing. Large...spacious...wonderful green park. Best place to take a morning walk or jog. You really dont need a company, all you need is a music player and start :-)

Peaceful Place. What a surprise to find such a beautiful peaceful park in the heart of such an amazingly busy city. Was great to find this park and just take a couple hours to walk around and escape from the hustle and bustle of the great city.
Funny. NIce and very big park in the middel of buildings but very bad smells. No body, no dring and food. When hot don't forget tyo take water with you.
A nice oasis!. A great green park in the middle of Bangkok. I found it a nice and serene place for a walk or a jog in the evening and never felt unsafe walking by myself.

Nice place. It's a nice place to relax a while in the middle of the city. It's no too bis so after a while you have seen everything, but it's good to stay there ore have some brake out of the main traffic...
Nice bit of peace and quite in a mad city. Was a nice bit of green in a massive city and great area (near all the embassy's) to feel safe for a relaxing stroll through a nice park.
Good morning walk. This park was right near our hotel and we really enjoy the morning exercise of fresh air and good food.

Nice park in the middle of the city. Lumpini Park is a nice park in the middle of the city . If you need to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city just go into the park and enjoy the tranquility early morning walk in the park is so refreshing
Very enjoyable morning walk. We came to this park real early in the morning for an exercise. The air was fresh and the park was very close to our hotel.
Very Impressive, beautiful place to visit!. Loved everything about this beautiful park. I was so impressed and will visit each time I am back in BKK. It is a must see.
Home to huge Monitor Lizzards. Nice relaxing park in the middle of busy Bangkok. Huge lizards roaming around the place and loads of locals exercising

Very nice.... For those who want to rest your head from the bustle of Bangkok, I recommend a stroll through the park.
Can rent a bike to park rangers and ride a bit.
Very nice ...

Lumpini park. This park looks great by day time but when sunset it looks unsafe as no security guard at all time. Park looks nice with tree and lake. I saw the birds that I've seen before in this park too.
You can do anything to enjoy a leisure life in t he city. Riding boat, jogging, cycling, doing gyms exercises, feeding fish, sleeping on grass field are all your choices.

Lumpini Park. Beautiful and big park.
Features:
- more spaces for funny or enjoy
- more spaces for relax
- more water spaces to visit and see the park from centre of artificial lake
- interesting for the animals (water monitors lizard or other tropical animals) that live in liberty inside the park. No dangerous.

Average park but cool creatures. Park is nothing to special they do have swan boat rides but the waters pretty gross the cool thing about this place is the giant water dragons turtles and fish in the water

loving this spot.. Quite and calm park with lots of fish , crocodile (sort of) , turtle and birds (crows). Since my hotel located, across the street,i decided to walk around the park to find some quietness and peace from the city madness. Turns out i had a good time & i also ride on a duck boat, and it cost me about 200 bath for 30 minutes. It also has a jogging track and GYM.. yes open aired GYM. Saw bunch of youngster and senior citizen train their washboards..ckckck and some of them only sitting & gossiping around...If u happen to be around and into nature, please do check this spot out.
Good walk around to escape the mad life outside. Nice quiet park with funny crocodile looking creatures walking round, a bit of piece & quiet in Bangkok & near to the city too

Nice park. Good chance to get away from the city.. Nice big park. Good for a run, or to get away from the city.
If you're lucky, you might have a chance to see a "protest." I did in August. One of the most peaceful protests I've ever seen. very intersting.

great park for a walk, run, or bike. lumpini park is right in the heart of Bangkok and is glorious in the fact it is a bit of green in the concrete jungle. I like that the city circles it and you can have a bit of traffic freedom and just walk, run, or bike around the park. enjoy

Not really a tourist spot. Early morning sees this park filled with walkers, tai chi, badminton, gym and fitness enthusiasts, elderly people at various picnic stations.
We did manage to spot the monitor lizards here. They are quite amazing!
Overall an ordinary place to chill and soak in what the local population enjoys.

An interesting experience. I love to visit this park every time I'm in Bangkok.You should get there at around 7 am and see the different groups of dancers, people who train various sports, walk silently through the trees and small lakes and wait till they play the national anthem at 8 to see everyone stop what they were doing and stand at attention ....

Dirty?. I read some of the reviews and really don't know why they say it is dirty. Wwe spent a lot of time there and my daughter played in the playground. It looked pretty clean and the toys had a lot of variety to keep kids entertained (for free). We loved the lake and went on the boat. Saw lots of wild life and plenty of local people enjoying the afternoon sun.

Must Visit. if you get hectic of Bangkok, you will find fresh air at Lumpini park!! very huge and there is a lake on the middle so it's good to escape there and if you lucky you will find Thai masseur just pay 150 baht and they are good very recommended.

Very good.... The playgrounds are a bit dirty but Lumpini Park is an excellent place for walking or jogging...There is boats for hire and you can buy bread to feed the fishesThe space is very big and it is a great spot to exercise!

In the heart of the city. Passed this place on our tour to the Grand palace. A large park open to the public for various activities including boat rides in the lake in the park. It's an ok place to spend sometime.

Dirty. In a town of no open space, Lumpini Park is a great space, but the playgrounds a filthy. I have a 2 year old who wants to ride slides and swings all day long, but Lumpini Park is not kept up to a high standard. If you just want a nice walk in a park, Lumpini Park is great, but not for much else.

Spent some great time here. Always something going on. You can rent boats. Go to an outdoor gym. Always people running/biking. Often people doing aerobics etc classes. Lots of green spaces, benches, water, little bridges etc. Can easily spend a hours here. No cost to enter. Can buy drink, food etc there.Sunday there's a market. Sometimes there are concerts etc.

Amazin place from lizards to a library in a park!!. a lake, a library, a gymnasium, a childrens' playground, rowing boats, hire cycles are just some of the amenities found in lumphini park the more up market area of Bangkok where the celebrities and premier league, la liga football teams reside on pre season tours located just near enough to th National stadium to limit the travelling time to the football stadium etcWorth a visit... wildlife so varied!!

Keep your body in shape. Great size. Almost 2 and a half kilometer of perimeter path for jogging or brisk walking. A lot of trees and two huge lake in the middle not to mention it has rental boats where you can pedal the boat to move as a form of exercise and relaxation. Sometimes I come here also just to get fresh air in the early mornings. Meditate and recharge for another week of urban living.

Great place to get away from the grit and grime of Silom. This park has some great things to see. One of my favorite is the giant lizards wondering around<Careful they do bite and they are very toxic> Its also a great place to people watch not to mention watching the Thai version of Vollyball Sepak Takraw this sport is amazing they use their feet and play on concrete courts. The main road along this part will bring you right into Sukumvit and Silom.
Another must see. Best seen at dawn or dusk. Beautiful in its own right but especially so at these times when. Do so visit and be surprised and delighted.

Peace and quiet in the middle of bustling Bangkok. If you can avoid getting trampled by the local running enthusiasts, take a stroll through Bangkok's own "Central Park". Hire a paddlewheeler and check out the city skyline from the water, chuckle at the meat heads beefing themselves up at the super old school outdoor gym and take photos of the largest monitor lizards you're likely to see outside of a zoo (just don't get too close!).
Nice place for sport and bicycles. This is very nice and calm park, you can sail catamarans on the lake, there are a lot of "locals" such as huge monitor lizards all over. Watch out!

Super place to unwind after a busy day in BKK. I loved this park and went back twice! It is big and there is lots to do. You can play on the exercise machines or cycle around or paddle on the lake or just sit and people-watch. Definately recommended!

Green Lung. For residents who live close by, Lumpinee is a wonderful secret oasis in a city with a serious case of ADD. Although it is not pristine - some areas of the park and landscaping are in need of repair, the overall impression is of a delightful, (and large) area in which to walk, run or cycle, through its maze of pathways which intersect lakes. Apart from the beautiful old trees there are giant water lizards, and a variety of flora and fauna. It may not be the ideal destination for visitors, but if you were accustomed to visiting Hyde Park in London, or Central Park in New York, you'd enjoy this one too.

Jogging every day. When I visit Bangkok every month I always go jogging in Lumpini Park. At 8.00 am and 6.00 pm a whistle blows and every one stands to attention for the National anthem. Hundreds of people jog, do exercise classes, ball room dancing, martial arts or just stroll with friends. A great place to feel a real part of Bangkok.

Oasis in Bangkok. Lumpini Park is very special. It compares to Central Park, New York in terms of events. The Park is occupied the whole day with all kinds of events. Most spectacular is the Concerts in the Park on Sunday afternoons. It's also a kind of Picnic for the Bangkokians.

a quiet green respite form the hectic urban sprawl of BKK. easily accessible by the BTS (Sala Daeng Station), MRT (Dusit Station) or taxi, Lumpini Park is a vast green space in central BKK that affords everyone a respite from the city's hustle and grind ... walking and biking paths wind their way through the park and the vast lawn spaces afford the visitor a bit of nature among the towers of glass and steel ... in the late afternoon their are free public aerobics classes and many of BKK's older inhabitants meet in the park to practice Tai Chi ... around the perimeter are small Thai style cafes where cool beverages, fresh fruit, and Thai food are available at reasonable prices ... in the evenings right outside the park are more food stalls that open until late at night.

Lumpini Park. Very central to most hotels and connected by MRT subway. Despite the number of trees most of the walk ways are so wide there is little shade so bring hat and water as most of the vendors of water etc. are located outside the park and the gates take some time to walk to from all the interesting places of the park - which are all located in the middle.

Paddle Boats!. We went on the paddle boats! 1/2 hour is 40 baht.. If you want to relax and enjoy for longer, just 40 baht per hour. It was fun to get bread and feed the crazy catfish. Watch out for the Komodo Dragons!!!

Lumpini Park an Oasis in the city. Lumpini park is a green oasis in the middle of the city. It is beautiful to look at from above in the nearby hotels and is great for an afternoon/evening walk. The park is quite large and has beautiful lakes and shade trees. In the evenings there are many different groups doing exercises as well.There are quite large monitor lizards in the lakes and even smaller ones can be seen climbing up and around the trees. These can be quite scary the first time you run into these but they seem to want to avoid people for the most part.I found myself returning to the city time and again. I highly recommend a visit.

Lumpini park is green hideaway in the city. Lovely quiet gardens and lake in the middle of the city. No other attractions there other than to enjoy a short break away from the hectic pace of Bangkok. Definitely worth a quiet stroll in between shopping centres.

Great for walkers. We were so happy to discover Lumphini Park close by our hotel, the Oriental Residences. The park is a star attraction for local walkers, tai chi and yoga classes and some days zumba. It also has a range of adult exercise equipment and a centre for the elderly and a couple of gyms. A circuit of the park walking takes under an hour and there were many, many locals there every day as well as some foreigners. The park was apparently a gift to the people of Bangkok from the king and it is certainly appreciated by the many daily users, including a number of groups having daily picnic breakfasts. We loved the fact that at 8am the national anthem is played and everybody stops what they are doing for its duration.There is playground equipment in the park and paddle boats on its lake. A great place to visit for some exercise and to see where the fit Thais exercise. It's also full of beautiful tropical plantings.

An Oasis. Very large park with several small ponds full of fish, turtles and large lizards. A great place to unwind and sit under a shaded tree to watch the birds and lizards, the locals and the young people playing their style of volley ball using only their feet.We had our two grandchildren with us and they could not get over the numbers, size and action of the lizards

Nice park in the middle of BKK. Nice and relatively quiet place in the middle of Bangkok, there's small paths and pavements to follow. We saw some Komodo Varans as well. Yuo will have some nice views of the city from the park.

Alligators? No Lizards!. Lumpini park is the green lung of BKK, go there for walking, running, dancing or just watching other people do something!But be careful of the huge Monitor Lizards living in the ponds

Family fun. It' a great place for a family as it got kids playgrounds and lot of people running or jogging n walking in the park n you can watch lots of people in all ages doing aerobics with music out loud.But the best part is when is 6 o'clock n the park plays the king anthem everyone has to stop n stand to attention to pat respect.

tranquil and quiet. to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok, relax in this park, buy a mat from a vendor, lie back and relax. there are locals coming round selling cold drinks, ice creams, snacks all the time, but they never intrude

Nice park for a relaxing walk. Park is good to reach by BTS train. It is a beautiful and clean park and one of the green lungs of Bangkok. I was there with a business partner for a walk in the early morning during the weekend. I assume it will be very hot and hence unconvenient during the day time. For security reasons I would not recommend to go alone after nightfall.

Some room for breathing (and Tai Chi). In the middle of the city away from the noise and pollution, you find a little place for breathing a little deeper and a spot where you don't have to worry about motorcycles running you over (even on the sidewalks). You can use it to jog earlier in the day when it's not too hot or simply stroll around to watch the locals do their thing, be it tai chi, yoga or any other synchronized activity. But my favorite thing to do every time I visit is to spot the big monitor lizards that sometimes just casually walk in front of you going from one body of water to another. Best place to see them is on the Floating Island and also along the banks on the Wireless Rd (Witthayu).

healthy place and fresh. Though, a little hot in the morning, but I enjoyed my trip. I didn’t see much, but love the fact that the park was really big, and has a lot of open spaces. It’s good if you have kids along with you.

A real Thai experience....for free !. Lumpini Park is a major public space in downtown Bangkok just a short walk from some of the best shopping in Asia. As always in Thailand, the park is hemmed by food stalls of myriad variety. The inner park offers a variety of recreational possibilities from play equipment for the kids, exercise equipment, jogging tracks and plenty of places to enjoy a picnic or a rare quiet moment in the capital. There's lots of water, so ensure you take repellent. We went there early on a Tuesday morning to be fascinated by a kind of festival of martial arts including tai chi and any number of twirling swords, sticks and batons. Your children will thank you for this simple but absorbing gree space.
best place to observe shy Monitor Lizards that are free to roam. This is an amazing and beautiful park. It is very large and conveniently located. There is no admission charge.

Nice bit of greenery in a grey city.. We accidentally ended up here after a tut-tut who offered to take us to the reclining Buddha blatantly ripped us off and lied. However it was nice to relax and sit down somewhere scenic and not overrun with tourists.

Breath of fresh air in a bustling city. We decided to head to Lumpini park because we have a 22 month old son and heard that the park was good for children. It proved to be a great find because my son enjoyed the playground, where the equipment was plastic on sandpits and looked relatively new without any rusty parts. The playgrounds are suitable for both young children and older kids. We also enjoyed taking him for a paddle on the lake on the swan boat, which was only 40bht for half an hour. The swan boat is relatively safe even for a young child (but only if there are two accompanying adults) because the seat for the child is situated between two adult seats and life jackets can be provided. My son had fun because we managed to spot turtles and fish in the lake. The lady at the booth selling tickets for the swan boat was also very friendly, even giving him a small banana as a snack after we were done with the paddle! The park, however, is huge and if you are travelling with young children, you are likely to only be able to explore a limited area before they get tired. It is also a nice place to have a picnic. The playground and the lake are walking distance from the gate where there is a carpark.
great for a lazy stroll. nice park for a lazy stroll. peaceful. we were on a non - sunny day so strolling around the park was awesome. paddle boat was nice.

Great place for a day. It is a greeat place for anyone wanting to spend a day walkingaround mulling and golliwogging. this will give you a great atmosphere while you are there go and head over to the kickboxing arena and enjoy the evening.

Please visit Bangkoks beautiful lumphini park.. Hello Trip advisors buffs Another marvellous bangkok must see and explore is Lumphini park. Situated in the silom area of bangkok it is very easy to find and get to lumphini park. By BTS skytrain hop on and take the silom line stopping at sala deang station. You can see the park from the station. Just exit walk down cross the road and your there. lumphini is beautifully planted out and cared for by the gardeners. It has many pretty flower beds and minature hedges. The park is large with varied types of palm and other tropical trees and plants. You will see a few bridges aswell which are ideal to watch the fish from and the huge monitor lizards which live in the park. If you love reptiles then this is the place for you. The park has many monitor lizards both young and old plus a few types of turtles. You can spot the lizards under bridges cooling off or swimming along side the lake sides. These lizards can grow to 4 and 5ft long and are large. They can startle you if you are unaware of their presence. Watch out for the fish also including catfish, carp, bream, and very big wels. You can buy fish pellets from woman in the park or bring your own bread. Keep a close eye out for the white crane birds as they are very secretive. You will not have too look very hard to see the 100s of crows as you will hear them first. Not the most pretty birds, they are the same as UK crows black and noisey. Lumphini had a very good running/jogging road which is used also by cyclists. A great way to get excercise and feel good. You can also go to the out door gym or play chess under a shady tree.  Take a paddle on the lake in one of the big pedlo swans, you can find many lizards if you paddle accross to the bridge opposite the hire station for the pedlos. After running cycling or the gym you can take a shower at the opposite end of the park in the toilet shower rooms. You can also buy snacks like tea coffee crisps and cool drinks from the small shops at each end of the park. Visit early in the morning to see the thai chinese doing tai chi exercise (6.30am) 100s of people do this before their work. In the evening when the sun begins to go down you can join and aerobics class at the sala daeng BTS side. If you want to escape the busy bangkok streets then lumphini park is the answer.  Hire a mat and sleep relax by the water. I rate lumphini 8 out of 10. Please contact me if you have any questions. spigs
Nice park, Lot's of Water Monitors!. Well worth a walk around. Do the Paddle boats if possible only 40 Baht! Lot's of Water Monitors around which is impressive if you have just arrived in Bangkok.

oooh!. This is a nice parc on bangkok, you feel a little bit like in central park in new york because there is building all arround. The most amazing thing in this parc is the varan that you can see walking just next you!

Stay fit in Bankok. We went to Lumpini park on our way to the train station. We spent 2 hours walking around, using the rusty exercise equipment and watching people practice tai chi. It was cool here and there was plenty to do. People watching is a must.

Peaceful clean and full of giant lizards. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the park. I took my family there to see if we could find any giant lizards hat we saw on TV. I was looking and looking and then bam we saw a huge lizard about 100+lbs or sow on the side of the lake.

Lovely place to relax, do sports and eat!. THis park took me a good hour and a half to get around and has lots of gorgeous bandstands in all different styles. There are two massive lakes that have fish, turtles, and monitor lizards. You can rent swan boats if you wish to have a leisurely sail. There are people doing Thai Chi, running and cycling, and also there is a swimming pool, tennis, and basket ball courts for the taking. Out of the Ratchadamri road exit of an evening there are many stalls set up with tables for food and drink, i suggest sitting at the pink tables and having the papaya salad, or anything from their menu!

Lumpini Park. My hotel was just across the street so I thought I would take a walk over. The entrance is grand, and some of the gardens are very nice, but for the most part it was pretty much like any city park you see in any major city. Lots of people laying around in the grass and I see a large light green snake (which I was told was a male cobra) roaming the park as well.

best park. actually most people dont know there are some very good parks in bangkok. lumpini is the best by far and i highly recommend for anyone who wants to get some fresh air while in this smoggy city!

Bangkok oasis. Great place to avoid the heat and noise of the bustling capitol. Quite large with plenty of shade, lush green grass and a large pond where I enjoyed the company of a 2M iguana (or some other swimming reptile - check photos). I enjoyed a nice few afternoon hours here. Close to metro.
Good non tourist sight. Good to go as quiet and peaceful,amazing huge lizards,saw about 10 whilst there and was a nice break from hectic city!

The Bangkok "Central Park", with an outdoor bodybuilding club!. Lumpini park it is a little bit to Bangkok what Central Park is to New York city.Surrounded by skycrapers, this place is a real oasis of vegetation and peace in the middle of the Bangkok. There is a large and clean lake, green trees and grass... perfect for a walk.It is also the very perfect spot for a morning or late evening jogging... and there is an very good outdoor bodybuilding club with a decent choice of free weight for heavy workouts!

Dawn jogging in the middle of Bangkok. Opening early morning this large park in down town Bangkok is its own social melting pot of Bangkok. You will see old and young participating in everything to Tai Chi to mass aerobics as well as thousands jogging around the parks 2.5 km pathways. The "venice beach" type weights areas, strange food stalls and of course many characters that go there every day are part of the Bangkok experience.
green oasis. lovely green city centre park. Look out for the huge lizzards and terrapins in the ponds. Close to the main shopping areas so easy to walk to for a break in a busy day

Nice bit of green in the middle of traffic chaos. We walked through on our way to the snake farm. It's pleasant and green. It was Monday lunchtime so to too busy. I imagine at the weekend it is chock-a-block with locals.
Great thai boxing. Loved it here, great boxing. Was worried that it was going to be fake boxing, but boy, how wrong was I. Lots of real blood, was GREAT!!!!

Good to get out. We take the family to lumpini regularly as its one of the better places in central Bangkok to stretch your legs and watch the kids run around in a safe environment. Fantastic to see lots of locals congregating with thai chi, chess, tea meetings or feeding the fish.

A SEE OF GREEN IN MIDDLE OF BANGKOK. Lumpini is such a great place. Its so wonderful seeing so many people of all aged groups exercising every morning and evening.Beautifully kept grounds, lovely big lake...great place to relax, walk and unwind.

Great park for a lazy day. I stayed in a hotel very close to the park. Loved walking round here it was so relaxing, and the park is so well used. From keep fit fanatics, to people studying, holidaymakers and locals. There is always something going on. Love it!

Pleasant rather than special. If I were living in Bangkok I believe that Lumpini Park would be a favourite place to escape the city bustle or to take some exercise. If you are a tourist (like me) then I am not sure that it is special enough to make the detour as there are far better parks to experience around the world. Still if you do have an hour to spare then it is a clean and well maintained area and the giant lizards that laze around the lakes and canals are an interesting sight.The park is situated about 10 minutes walk from the BTS station at Sala Daeng most of which you can do on the walkway apart from crossing the main road just before the entrance. I visited the park mid morning on a Monday when it was very quiet. It is meant to be a popular spot for locals to exercise but probably early morning and after dusk. I was hoping to get something to eat at the Food Court but this was deserted with nothing being served and judging by the signs it is only open early morning. There was a small kiosk near Gate 4, however, that served drinks and snacks.

Nice green space in the city. It's always great to find a nice great space in a concrete jungle anywhere in the world and this is no exception. If you're staying at a hotel nearby, take advantage of an early morning walk around the lake and/or jump in on a yoga or tai chi session. Or simply settle in to people and lizard watch for a while!

leaping lizards. I've been to the big city parks of the world, Hyde Park in London, Golden Gate in San Francisco and Central Park in NYC. Lumphini Park doesn't measure up in sf but it makes for a nice walk around the lake and seeing the monitor lizards floating around and walking about is pretty cool in an urban environment.

Beautiful Park. This park is big and has a very good view. There were some stray cats and dogs which were very cute. Also, near the Lumpini pond, there were some group of birds. OMG! I love this park. You can come to this park for a jog or just to sightseeing. It's a must visit park while you're in Bangkok. I would love to come to this park again to relax and read a book!How to get there?You need to go by sky train (BTS) to Sala Daeng station - leave via Exit 6 - walk across Rama IV Road to the memorial statue of King Rama VI. Be careful while you're crossing the road. There was no pedestrian crossing signals.

Excellent Way to connect to real Bangkok. I have been to Lumpini Park for countless time over the years and yet, I look forward to come "home" in every visit to Bangkok. Crowd starts streaming in as early as 5am may be and there is different group of people doing different exercise. You cana) join the super big group aerobic. just follow the music and stepsb) run/jog along with thousands of running enthusiast around the world.c) take a stroll and see all the different groups of exercise like yoga, people walking backward!,children running around, gymmer training, and many othersd) after your walk go the the food hawker inside the park for your breakfast. excellent freshly made juices and soy milk and noodle and rice and etcLumpini park to me is like the heartbeat of Bangkok. It captures both the old and the new generations of Thais and visitors around the world. p/s : just like anywhere in Thailand - National Anthem is sung 8AM everyday. Just stand still like the local and enjoy the Song http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OBDKah2nnvw

Fascinating. This is a lovely park in a very central location. The lizards that sit on the waters edge are enormous and quite a shock to see them. Nice to see the Thai people doing there daily exercise routines.we. Visited in the afternoon and was disappointed that we could not buy any drinks or food.
A must. Love the big open park in the centre of BangkokGorgeous landscaped gardens...People watching going about there day to day exercise and leisurely walks.. A must visit!

Pretty!!. WE fell in love with this park...so pretty right in the middle of the city, we walked around the whole park was such a nice day, people were out and about was great. we went to the hilton roof top bar at night and you could look down and see the park was beautiful.

Bangkok Oasis. Noise, traffic, fumes, crowds, rush getting to ya in Bangkok? If you find yerself in the Silom area it's just a suicidal hop across an intersection to get into Lumpini Park. Wide open space, greenery and serene quietness waits for you there!It's good to stroll, wind down and relax in the park. Around the center where the walkway crosses a bridge over a stream i was surprised to see a giant monitor lizard. As i approached it slowly slinked back into the water.Marvelous place!
Fresh air and Local life. Refreshing to wander the shaded paths on a sunny day, watching and possibly interacting with the locals who often flock to the park.
Nice running place. My hotel was just 600 meters away and I got up early to runn two rounds of the park. Busy place with plenty of food stalls to try variety of local food.

A Great Morning Rush. I visit Thailand in January and February and find the morning walk to Lumpini Park to be a refreshing experience. Join in the many Yoga, Tai Chi and other exercise programs. Be a people watcher, walk around the park, stop and have breakfast, sit on a bench and watch the world go by, escape the madness of Bangkok! It is a wonderful place early in the morning.

Lush Greenery in The Center of Bangkok !. I have been coming to Bangkok for years and always planned to come to this park and just never getting there. It is a perfect break from the city, right in the city. I walked around, just watching people getting their daily exercise, in such cool green surroundings there are gorgeous trees and plants, and beautiful lakes and fountains. it is easy to walk about and is open for everyone, with no charge.

Find the big lizards!. Nice park to relax, watch (or join in!) the Thai people doing their exercise, Tai Chi or just keeping your eyes out for the huge lizards! We saw one in the pond there so keep your eyes peeled!

Muay Thai heaven. Not the park - the stadium. This THE center for kick boxing. If you ever want to go to a match of anything in Thailand go to Lumpini for a kick boxing evening. Worth every penny. Terrible old decrepit stadium but the spectator betting has to be seen to be believed. Go for the cheapest third class area - it is a must - Tuesday is the big night

Worth a visit. Did a 1 hour walk around the very large park. Water feature/lake in the centre. Wild life and gardens plentiful. A statue of King Rama V at the edge of the park. Close to Metro subway station to get access to the centre of Bangkok. Popular for cyclists and lots of food vendors for the locals on the surrounding streets. Best to go before 10.00am or after 4.00pm. I was there at around 11.30am and it was hot in the open area however there is lots of shade. Easy access for anyone with a disability as totally flat. Enjoy.

take a picnic and relax. take a picnic and relax with friends or family after looking around at the palace and museums and temples etc. It is a great place to get away from the hussle and bussle of bangkok, and if it is your first visit to bangkok can sometimes be overwhelming , so take a break at this huge park , under a shady tree and relax. Also if you live or are staying close by, it is great for a morning walk or run around :)

If you need to relax. If you need to get away from noise and all the people, buy some snacks and go the park for some hours. People are relaxed here and seem to enjoy the green spot.Its possible to rent small boats and to see many big komodo dragons.

Good place to relax. There are quit a few parks in Bangkok but this is one of the better ones. Close to Silom and very spacious so you can always find a good spot to sit and relax. There are a lot of monitor lizards in the park. Whether that's a good thing or not, that's up to you. I like them!

relax. My favourite place to relax in Bangkok after a long days shopping/temple seeing. Great to be able to walk bare feet on the grass and spend time relaxing/reading next to the lake. Spent half an hour in the swan peddle boats on the river and that was pretty nice to. The giant water monitors are incredible to see.

Ozone in Bangkok. Great place for jogging in Bangkok. Lumpini park is the best and the largest park in central of Bangkok with all matured trees, large pond, and a few play grounds for children. Crowded in morning and late afternoon with various group of exercise activity. Very safe and clean. Also, many excellent food stalls on the street side on the north side of the park.

Nice place to chill. Lumpini Park is in the centre of Bangkok and a really nice place to chill out in the sun. It's easy to get to on the Metro and there's various things to see and do in the surrounding areas. Noce place to visit.
Some peace in Bangkok. Lovely oasis of quiet in Bangkok, great place to work out, do some jogging or have a picknick. Easy to get to with MRT or skytrain
Nice park early morning, sundown. Never a dull moment - form the giant Lizards to the synchronsied aerobics, from the symphony to the roller balders

Peaceful. This little oasis in the middle of Bangkok is a must see. Here there is a large lake, complete with paddle boats. You can watch the locals performing their morning exercises, walk around the perfectly manicured gardens, or just sit & enjoy the peaceful surroundings

Nice park. nice simple park, but watch out for the cyclists who are racing round at mad speeds and not always in the cycle lane, one almost hit my son.
spot the lizards is good. park passes an hour to get away from hassle of BK.

Take a breather here. This is a good park to chill. Find a shady spot and watch all the locals do their thing. Kids playing and various activities. Easy to get to via public transportation. Have a picnic and chill or take a run.

Beautiful respite in the city. Lumpini Park is right at the end of Silom Road, and in the middle of the city, but when you're there, the only reminder of the city, is the beatiful city view. There is a little lake, which you can rent duck boats to foot peddle around in, there is a pool, an exercise facility, and more! I love to go just walk about and relax. One quirky thing I loved about this park are the komodo dragons that live there! Random! They are there in the water and lounging on the grass, which I just thought was great!
Get away from it all. Really nice for a bit of breathing space and to watch the Thai families, picknicking and cycling and exercising of course!

Go see the green of Bangkok. A wonderful green space in an intensely urban city, I would highly recommend either going at dawn or at dusk, when you'll see the locals enjoying a range of different sports and exercises and see some lovely trees.

A green oasis for runners, fitness fanatics and just those seeking to wander about!. On a somewhat overcast yet sultry summer afternoon the taxi dropped me nearby Lumpini Park. As soon as I entered the large gates I was greeted with the sight of hundreds of runners in fighting fit shape going around the track. The green of the lush foliage was further saturated by the overcast skies. Soon after what sounded like the warning bells of an ice cream truck everyone came to a standstill. I had not heard it before but I assumed the national anthem had started right after that and every walker, runner and visitor froze for a few moments as the loudspeaker played the song. It was quite a unique sight. As soon as it was over everyone went promptly back to what they had been doing. On the other side large groups of aerobic dancers practiced their moves to boom box music and under the direction of fitness trainers. The Park reminds me partly of Central Park in Manhattan and somewhat of similar expanses in the cities of Taiwan. A large lake is equipped with paddle boats and a library offers a reading experience as well. The local metro train and city traffic go right by the park which is located quite centrally in Bangkok and a welcome break from the tuk tuk taxi hustle bustle of the city.

Park of BKK. We spent our last Sunday at this park, the only green site you will find in BKK. Beautiful park and there were some side activities. You ll find most people are exercising and walking around the park in circles. If you have spare time spend few hours here.

Good park. This park is a breath of fresh air compared to the busy city just across the street. People participate in organized aerobics, run, and meditate. There are also free weights for exercise if you do not want to pay for the indoor gym in the park. The plants are quite pretty and there are boats for rent. For those of you using public transportation there is even a metro stop in the park.
Oxigen in the city. A good place to take a rest and be out of the noisy city. You can take a free gym class or take a boat in the "lagoon".

Like a desert Oasis of Green, Clean & Tranquility. I only visited during the day to escape the hustle,bustle and noise of the thriving city. It worked like magic. I left feeling invigourated and energised. There's a gym, pool, waterways full of turtles, fish and other increadible National wildlife. You can even get a relaxing massage if you want. The Thai Kingdom has provided plenty of discreet security so I felt really safe there. Lot's of joggers, excercise and general chilling out happening. NOT a place to hang out and loiter, or party for that matter, it's more serene and tranquil. A1. The Air is cooler and cleaner, probably because of the delightful lack of concrete, and the sculptures are inspirational. Great place for the family, the kids, the elderly and everyone inbetween.Faultless.

Yea!. I live right near here and it's such a haven. Come here and see the real Bangkok with real Thais away from Sukhumvit. Be aware that at 6pm the King's song plays and EVERYone stops. I thought I was losing my nugget when it first happened to me and 150 people all froze into position. Wow!

Great for runners and all. This is a great park with a 2.5km loop for running. The atmosphere is fascinating with lush gardens, ponds and animal. Groups of dancers, exercises, diners, socializers, and lots of tai chi. The only downside is that the playgrounds are dirty and smell of urine!

A great place to relax and escape the hustle of Bangkok. Bangkok is an incredible city, but every now and then you need a place to escape to - and Lumpini is a great place to go! There's lots of green space, in the mornings and evenings huge dance and aerobic classes, there's outdoor gyms, and even a 25 metre swimming pool! (though to join you need a medical certificate, copy of your passport and 40 baht)If you're in the city, and looking to escape - this is the place to come!W
an oasis of calm in the chaos. just a nice place to take a break and get away from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok city i was fortunate enough to see a couple of water monitors as well

A nice park. A nice park, full of winding long paths and lots of birds. I saw 3 monitor lizards throughout my walk around the edge of the park. It is my personal opinion that the park could have been a little cleaner, but it is worth it to have a quick stroll around the park if you are in that area of Bangkok.

Beautiful, relaxing park in the middle of a thriving city.. Bangkok is so busy, most people at first get a bit overwhelmed at just how big and busy this Asian city is. But take a break and get to the Lumpini park, it is very large and has a great boating lake as well as many other water features. Taxi's are so cheap in town that you can always escape there even if it is for an hour or so.
Great park for BKK. We live close, so it's easy to get here for us. Great for family walks, ample amount of shade and open space to play/picnic. Nice water ponds and generally well kept grounds.
Oasis of Calm. This is a nice place to visit around sunset. It's one of the few green spaces in Bangkok. People come to stroll and relax at the end of the day. It's a good place to recharge.

Serene. I spent several hours taking pictures in/around Lumpini Park and would recommend anyone considering a visit to the park plan to take a morning stroll early in the morning there. It is full of people running, walking, doing Tai Chi, socializing, and meditating. It was quite the serene experience in the middle of Bangkok.

Well maintained Park!. I took my wife and son to the Lumpini Park one afternoon and spent a couple of hours working out. I thought the park was well maintained, and people of different nationalities were walking, jogging, and simply sitting down and talking. It was a very pleasant break from the busy Bangkok streets, and the greenery of the park was extremely helpful for relaxing. The park is conveniently located and one can take a taxi or use the MRT or the Sky Train to go there considering the location of one's hotel. Highly recommended for tourists who want to continue with their work out even when they are travelling abroad.

Amazing! Definitely worth a visit!. My boyfriend and I practically stumbled on this park and absolutely loved it! A little gem in the city! So much to see! A beautiful park with large lakes and wildlife! We saw quite a few Monitor Lizards which are massive! a tortoise and a variety of birds. Lovely for a walk and relax.
Watch Out For The Dragons. Well kept park with Giant Water Lizards basking in the sun. Nice place to sit in the shade and chill, and just a short walk form some shopping areas

Great Park in the Middle of Bangkok City. Great attraction for a morning visit. I was there at 630am for a quick RUN around the park. My first time there and realize that this park is bustling with activities in the early morning.Stalls outside the park selling all sorts of stuff from vegetables to beverages and clothes.Inside you will see groups of people running, yoga sessions and groups of people doing Tai Chi.Nice lake in the middle where you can either rent a paddle boat or just sit by it and enjoy the view. Many monuments around the park with sculptures worth just stopping to take a look and read the artistic descriptions.I ran the two rounds around the park on the organized running route, total of about 2.5KM per round.Park security is safe and here you will see the most helpful policeman in the world helping the elderly into taxi and opening the doors to help them out of the cab.Now for the great surprise, there is a amazing food court (hawker centre in Singaporean terms) in the park near the Rama 4 entrance. So local that I enjoyed every bit of it.Have a selection of congee with a great selection of local chinese accompaniment dishes. Or have a plate of Roast pork rice or grab few spring rolls for a quick snack. Definitely not touristy. Highly recommended for a cheap and good breakfast. But do not go too late as food runs out by 9am-10am.Overall, a great morning for me with a run and a a great breakfast.

Green patch for sore eyes amidst concrete jungle. I visited the park as it was right across my hotel. At 6 am, There were lot of locals performing exercise at different corners with music ongoing. Senior people were performing fine movements and doing it slowly; while younger generation was jumping all the time to different beats. One of the favourite that was played many times was "gangnam style". Few were silently jogging. This time of year, it was very humid and i was drained after i round across the lake. I saw catfish/ mudskippers [fish with whiskers] near shallow area of pond. While, I was sitting on a bench, a beautiful monitor lizard came up close [I almost thought it was Komodo dragon; but then gathered myself as Komodo's are in indonesia (thanks animal planet)].
