I got some nice pictures, but as i moved closer, the lizard shyed away into dark green water of lake from where it was difficult to capture in photograph. Park is open from early morning to late evening, and there is no entrance fee.

Clean open green space in a busy city. A refreshing place to walk or run around. Look for the Komodo Dragons in the water. We saw one catching a fix and eating it on the shore. Lots of people exercising. A great palce to people watch.

park in the middle of city. A very beautiful park in the middle of the busy city was nice to take a walk around one afternoon just to leave the hustle and bustle behind. What a great contrast of the park in the middle of the city surrounded by sky scrappers. it was a very interesting and extremely well cared for by what seemed to be an army of gardeners.
no Lumpini nightmarket anymore. Unfortunately there is no night market anymore at Lumpini market. It has moved to Asiatique, which is nice but very American way and that is a pity.

Sonkran. We arrived at Bangkok on the last day of Sonkran. Lumpini Park was busy like you have never seen before. It was so much fun and the people were so friendly when they were making sure you were wet.!!! A great atmosphere. Street food fantastic
Peace in The city. A great place for a nice walk in the city . Try buying some bread and feed the fish. Millions of them :-)

This is where I shoot hoops!. I love this park. It is ideal for exercise, chilling, playing basketball, and relaxing. I have been to Lumphini Park in 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, and this past March 2013. The Sky Train, and the MRT will take you right there.

A green oasis in a bustling city. If for no other reason go to the park just to see the amazing Water Monitor Lizards that live in and around the lakes and waterways of the park. The food court is no longer in use so make sure you take ample water and snacks for your visit. Take a couple of hours out of a busy day to wander around the lovely park and to relax on the grass in a nice shaded spot.

healthy park. Tai Chi, aerobic dance, kungfu, lots of healthy exercises apart from jogging to experience :)in the morning, there'll be tons of people doing lots of things so as well in the evening.in front of it, there's also Silom road which is a heavy business area of Bangkok. It's just bizarre to see how the two different world are right be each other within only a few minutes walking

A little oasis in the heart of the city chaos. Ran to the park just after 6am and was stunned at how many people were already there - yet there was still plenty of space to run and relax. I trotted around enjoying all the early morning activities that everyone was up to....tai chi, open air aerobics (would have had over 100 young and old working out), people walking,(strangely everyone seemed to be going in an anti clockwise direction) talking, reading the paper, walking AND reading...it was wonderful. Park was clean and pretty with several small lakes. Definitely worth a visit. At the main entrance there is a small fresh produce, fish and cooked food market...also very entertaining!

Peaceful..... Very peaceful place, good for a walk or jog or simply sit and relax. There's an open air gym too! And a lake for boating. Good place to watch common birds while the Water Monitor Lizards are the star attraction! Better to visit in the early morning.

Nice park!. We had a nice stroll around Lumpini park on our second day in Bangkok. It's a really nice place, quiet and picturesque in the middle of Bangkok.We went on the peddle boats on the lake which is was nice, especially as they had shade to cool us down.There are a few monitor lizards around and some of them are huge, they like posing for the camera!

A nice change from the high rise city. My fiancée and I took a walk around here early in the morning the day we where flying back home and I wish we took the time to do it every morning. It was a nice change to see so much greenery in a very built up city and a very peaceful experience in a place that is very packed and very rushed. If you think you would like this then it's worth doing, if you don't think a peaceful walk around nature is your idea of funny probably give it a miss

Great experience. Love the park. We went early in the morning and loved seeing the people going through there normal routine. Monitor Lizards are really cool and interesting to see. After awhile of walking through the park with our teen daughter and 6 year old daughter we started to realize that we were more of an attraction to the older people eating and exercising at the park then the park itself. Some of the older people loved our younger daughter and wated to see her and take picture with her. This was one of our first days in Thailand so it was new to us but this was certainly a theme throughout our trip.

Big and empty - good place to watch comodo dragons. The park was nice, big and very empty. The highlight was the comodo dragon we saw at the lake. Watch out for them near by the "Ducky lovers" paddle boat hire.

Very busy place. We arrived in Bangkok early in the morning, too early to check into the Hotel. Took a walk to Lumpini park and found a park full of activities. A out door gym, Locals practising Tai Chi, Joggers and generally a lot of excitement for that early in the morning! Saw a huge water monitor drinking from the lake. Overall a lovely experience in the middle of Bangkok.
Where the life is!. I love this park, for running, walking, people-watching, and monitor-spying. A definite must-see if you're visiting Bangkok!

A nice place to visit. Try to go early in the morning and you can see locals doing yoga, exercise classes and dance classes. They actually encourage you to join in with them. Otherwise, it is nice to stroll around the park and take in all the gardens and parklands.

Go green. It is really a lung of Bangkok. During the crazy traffic jam in Bangkok, thanks that they have a big green park in the central of Bangkok. I live near Lumpini park, so I went there to exercise sometimes. There are lots of activities here. People go there for running, walking, doing Gang fu or Yoga and some martial arts. It is really interesting just to walk across Lumpini park from one side to another side. I met 2 lovely turtles last time. There are also the water monitor here too, so be prepared :) They also have little booth to sell drinks and snacks, and outside the gate, there are some streetfood as well.

A bit of green!. Lovely to walk through as no hawkers or street sellers allowed it seems. Take water with you. The giant monitor lizards are worth seeing at the lake. Also feeding the catfish is popular.

A little run down, but sure is popular!!. I went for an early morning walk, and it was already 32C at 7 am, with humidity in the stratosphere (of course, I'm used to Australian outback type humidity, so that's not saying much). The park is pleasant for walking through but the grass was unkempt, and there was plenty of maintenance opportunity. This is a great community park, and this was evidenced by the numerous groups doing Taichi, the morning meal picnics going on throughout the park, and the high level of activity. On that basis alone, that made the park an interesting visit.
Lungs of Bangkok. Go early just after it opens and see the Thais exercising en masse , the ball room dancing and the hoards of walkers. Very entertaining

It has become a nice park. new landscaping all over has greatly contributed to the nice experience overall,. Just avoid the 6-7pm terrible music in the middle of the park where people are dancing in front of loud loudspeakers spoiling the experience!

Get here early - it's worth it.... Come to Lumpini at 7am. It's really worth it. You'll see people exercising, dancing, singing, sword and fan dancing, feeding the cats and birds, walking their relatives in wheelchairs, breakfasting with friends. You'll see herons, huge monitor lizards (and I mean HUGE), dozens of cats, terrapins - some enormous, beautiful flowers. Maybe a flutist. Oh - I could go on and on. But - you must get there at 7am. By 8.15am it's already too hot to be any fun and everyone's moved on - to their home, office, shady spot, deep water resting place, leafy tree. See you there one morning?

A breath of fresh air in the middle of a chaotic city. A great place to go for a walk, see the local residents congregating and the highlight is checking out the Monitor Lizards that live in the lake!
Great place for a run or walk. Exciting place to be. Different kinds of exercise groups early. Saw water monitors and many birds.Get a taste of Thai culture and beauty.

Thai urban way of life. Looks more American than Thai, but it is really very pleasant to spend some time in this big park.
In the morning many people are having their daily gym, during the day always a lot of happy Thai families and in the night some street food as everywhere in Bangkok.
Excellent area between Siam and South Sathorn.

Authentic Bangkok life- visit early before it gets hot out. During a recent conference in Bangkok I stayed close enough to go down to Lumpini park. It's been years since my work has taken me to this part of town so I took advantage of the close proximity and went down to the park every morning to walk before starting work.If you're staying anywhere near Lumpini Park during your trip to Bangkok it's worth the trip to visit, but I recommend going early before the sun comes up and the sweltering heat of the day takes over. At 6am you can join the open aerobics group on the SW side of the park right near the Si Lom MRT station. I suppose you could join one of the many groups of older folks doing tai chi, but you'd have to know the moves in advance. Of course you can add to the large numbers of those walking or jogging around the well marked 2.5 kg loop that circles the perimeter of the park. If you're into weight lifting two free weight gyms are set up under the trees alongside the jogging path. I imagine there's a small fee to use the equipment although there was no sign. If you do decide to come down later in the day you can rent a swan shaped paddle boat or a canoe, both of which are 40 baht for half an hour. You can also pick up picnic food/snacks from the dozens of street vendors outside the park and have a picnic in one of the gazebos/shelters. The children's playground area was large with multiple slides, swings and pieces of climbing equipment.For a big city I really enjoyed the wildlife sightings in Lumpini- grey squirrels with bushy white tails, long legged white shore birds feeding next to the water aerators in the ponds and dozens of other bird species. Especially liked the awesome Hia's freely roaming about -i.e. the giant gila monsters which are about 2 meters long nose to tail. The park is so large I lost sight of the city in some places. What a cool place to enjoy authentic Bangkok life early in the morning.

Great escape. We were staying across the road at the Dusit Thani hotel and decided to brave crossing the road to visit this wonderful park. We visited in the early evening, maybe around 5pm, and the park was alive! Joggers everywhere going round the excellent jogging track. Nearly 500 people doing jazzercise in the middle of the park with really enthusiastic leaders. We stopped and bought a big bag of fish food at the entrance, took a pedal boat out for only 40 Bhat (+40 bhat deposit) for half an hour and had a lovely time feeding fish and turtles from the boat. Definitely recommend doing this as it is really tranquil. We saw loads of huge monitor lizards roaming around the park, as well as large variety of beautiful birds, some cranes even! The flora was fantastic, loads to stop and see. We got taught how to offer a prayer at a buddhist shrine by a lovely older lady who didnt speak a word of english! That was an expereince, then as we were walking back towards the entrance, everyone stopped , joggers, jazzercisers, everyone, while the national anthem played, then they all just carried on! It was very interesting to see. If you're in the area, take a visit, it's a beautiful park.
so beautiful. it is hard to believe you are in the same city when you enjoy Lumpini. Truly one of my favorite places in Bangkok. Such lovely gardens!
Fun cycling through. Very pretty park , cycled through. must see the old fashion gym in it ...... some people take it seriously in walking or exercising

A nice place for a stroll. We walked all around the park and liked it. It's not the biggest or most spectacular I've seen but it's a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of bangkok. There are a number of sculptures and plants to admire and many cats and monitor lizards which I love.

Tranquility. I went jogging here early morning and ended up getting distracted with all of the activity... Just breathe and take it all in this Urnan Oasis.... Lye by the lake and just people and wildlife walk...

Oasis in a big city. We are lucky enough not live within walking distance of lumpini park. There is free swimming pool, fitness areas etc it is wonderful. It is much bigger than you think so make sure you take note of the exit you enter in though.

Best place in Bangkok for a morning Run and a lot of Thai everyday culture. Lumphini Park is a large park in the middle of Bangkok, and walking distance from Silom, Sathorn and Suhkumvit. There is no other comparable or practical place to run, walk in Bangkok. Lumphini Park has a large lake in the middle, and small canals that weave through the park. There is 2.5km paved and maintained, tree lined path that circles the inside of the park and is popular in the mornings with runners and walkers starting about 5:30am. In the mornings the park is busy with local Thais doing yoga, tai chi, exercising, rollerblading, aerobics etc etc.During the day, there is rental boating (great for kids), food, tennis courts, pool (new), exercise facility (new), picnic tables, lots of shade, etc.
Peace in the city. Lumpini Park is a great green space in the middle of Bangkok. Look out for the statues throughout the park and the monitor lizzards close to the river at the edge of the park

Good for time pass. This is very big and very good park. You can pass your time for hours! It was very neat and clean. You can go for boating in the lake. In the evening you can find so many people for jogging.

A quiet oasis from hustle bustle of BKK city life. We visited on 28/4/13 Sunday morning (10:30amish) & it was pretty quiet, therefore a nice change from the chaotic hustle bustle we had experienced all week. Great statue at entrance with a place to see Thai ppl pray & ask for blessings. Nice lake with swan shape paddle boat for hire & lots of setting to sit & relax & take in peaceful surrounds. Saw large water monitor lizards walking around & locals offer straw mats to buy to lie down on grass for a snooze lol. You can hire bikes to ride around & see tourists getting in their fitness run. Street vendors at entrance for cool drink or snack & close to BTS. We took BTS from Chong Nonsi & got off at Sala Deng then walked about 5 mins. Have to cross large road which was a little scary but wait for red light (don't trust traffic though lol & cross at the pedestrian crossing :)

Think laid back central park. Lots of wildlife, extremely easy to get to (we used the train system), cheap, various activites, friendly locals. I do recommend feeding the catfish and finding water dragons which roam the park freely.

Great place to run or just people watch. I love early mornings at Lumpini! Great running loop with plenty of runners, people doing aerobics, and thai chi. There are stands selling water, etc. Easy access from MRT. Just make sure to listen for the King's Song at 8am and/or stop when others stop.

Great place for a run. You can easily do a lap of the outer and inner paths to make a 5k and enjoy a little nature in the middle of the city. Plenty of street food outside the gates and cold drinks available in the park as well.

Relaxing escape from the city. This well placed park is suitable for gentle strolls in the sun. It was quiet when I was there and I'm guessing it always this peaceful from day to day (when there are no festivals or events planned). You'll no doubt see some monitor lizards roaming around. They are pretty impressive in terms of size. I'm glad somebody pre-warned me that they were in there, otherwise I'd have had a shock, especially as they can look statue-like at times! But anyway they tend to avoid any kind of interaction with humans, you can't get close enough for them to feel threatened or for them to harm you, they keep their distance from people and therefore I don't think they're a danger.I was living in Surasak which is only two stops away on the Skytrain, so definitely worth going if you're close by. I enjoyed 'dodging' the sprinklers on one very hot summers day in the park ;)

Great park, monitor lizards!. Lovely landscaped park in the middle of the city - it's like an oasis! Nice to see the wildlife; turtles and monitor lizards and various birds. Shame that a few electrical cables were dangling and drooping in large puddles, but that's fairly standard for Thailand, where health and safety must be a swear word!
great place. it was loke an air bubble , with the rest of city having smog , was great to go and have all the trees and fresh air , very much a big place and relaxing
Open Space. I don't have idea for this place. I thinks, they don't have anything on it Just try to see inside, any open space and see trees

Want a breather, go to Lumphini Park. The Lumphini Park is a great place to hang out if you have time in hand. The artificial lake and the city skyline beyond offers a lovely backdrop to the park. The children's playground is large with enough stuff to keep small kids preoccupied for some time. The coconut trees planted all over lends charm to the park. It was fun to watch locals work out en mass.The grounds could be better maintained though.
Relaxing. Not the most "must see" location, but a nice break from the city and great to feed the fish and watch the lizards
Fresh Air. Like the big lizards and the shade. Where are the food stalls though? Bangkok should have more parks like that

Nice park. Nothing much to see, very big park situated in the middle of Bangkokand not far from tourism attraction, you can either sky Train or metro to reach directly, the park take a huge area of land so it's good for jogging or relaxing, there's also Gym inside it.

Relax, Invigorate, De-Stress Between Meetings!. As a regular visitor to Bangkok, I appreciate the presence of Lumphini Park as a truly relaxing place to go. Other of the world's urban parks (and even other of Bangkok's parks) have more to offer by way of fountains, or food, or attractions, but Lumphini is my favorite urban park worldwide for de-stressing between meetings. It is so well maintained that you feel clean and comfortable there..far better maintained than any other of the dozens of nternationally famous urban parks I've seen. But it is also wild enough to have animal life suited to anyone's taste. Egrets and fifteen or twenty other bird species will be found there regularly, Tokays, turtles and Monitors head the non-bird list of interesting life. The lawns are lovely, the ponds nice, the atmosphere always relaxing. Early mornings bring many exercise classes to watch, dusk brings many strolling couples to watch, and mid day gives you your choice of sunburn or shade, brisk walk or barefoot romp, nap or meeting note preparation. It is a uniquely relaxing place in the world's most invigorating city. Take advantage of it

A bit underwhelming. Having lived in Canada, New York and London, we expected more from Bangkok's main park. Sprawling fields and beautiful fountains do NOT abound, but it's worth taking a stroll to see the juxtaposition between the skyscrapers and pretty pond. You can even rent a little swan boat to ride in. The playground is quite small and very hot with little to no shade. There are a couple of public bathrooms, but you'll have to pay for them.
Green Oasis in a big city.... Lovely green park with morning yoga classes and you can hire a Swan boat to paddle across. Take a bicycle and explore.

Oasis in the city. This park is a little oasis in the city of Bangkok takes you away from the hustle and bustle for a while. Many people walking, jogging, exercising etc. You can hire a boat to paddle on the lake if you like. When we visited there was a mass of people doing outdoor group exercise - interesting to watch! The park has restrooms (ladies you will pay for tissue paper). Lumpini Park is about a 15 minute walk from nearest MRT station and we found it ok to visit.
A great reprieve. This park is a gem in the middle of the big city. A great place for a nice walk and a picnic and a quick "getaway" from the streets of Bangkok

Bangkok's answer to New York's Grand Central Park. Lovely spacious well kept grounds right in the heart of Bangkok. A relaxing oasis to regain your equilibrium in this busy city. Lumpini is great to walk, jog or simply sit on a park bench and watch Bangkokians doing their Thai Chi movements in the morning and see the squirrels racing up and down trees.

easy to get to - respite from the heat of the day!. We had a lovely couple of hours strolling round this park, watching the locals and the lizards! There was a welcome breeze and plenty shade. There's a kiosk to buy iced drinks and you could quite easily take a rug and spend several hours here.
Stroll around the park. I spent a hour or so in the park it is beautiful and lots of people wlaking and or excising went by myself and felt safe it was very peaceful

An oasis in the middle of a huge hectic city!. What a lovely park! It is 146 acres of trails, ponds, grassy areas, all kinds of plants, and GREAT BIG LIZARDS! They were cool. Ponds are full of large catfish. Someone out front sells fish food...best 10 baht spent all day! In a city where things can get expensive...FREE is a welcome alternative! Take a walk around and power down! Or a great place to get your run in!
dragons. the sight of 2metre monsters walking across the path awesome, tai chi, yoga, beautiful gardens, take a picnic or buy lunch at the entrance

Central Park in the center of Bangkok. Wake up early before the mid day heat and head out for a run/ walk through Lumpini park. Lumpini park is situated in the heart of downtown Bangkok and it's reminiscent of central park. It is a wonderful escape from the hussle and bustle of a large bustling city, but it isn't a secret. You'll be joined by locals out for a stroll or getting their daily calisthenics in. Don't worry, there is plenty of space for everyone and on the way out, you can grab some refreshing sliced fruit. It's worth the trip.

Oasis of Tranquility. Lumpini park interested me at first because of its name. Buddha was born in Lumpini gardens in present day Nepal so I was interested in seeing it. While not what I would call a tourist attraction, it is still an interesting place to visit especially in the cool, early morning hours. You will see people who don't seem to be in a rush, who seem to be health conscious and who take time out to enjoy many outdoor activities.Camera bugs should find it quite a good spot for candid shots of Tai Chi practitioners, bike riders, joggers or even vendors. It was great to see groups of friends simply enjoying each other's company. You get the sense that the local residents love this place.It is safe to visit. I went alone early in the morning and with my large SLR. you will not feel inconspicuous. Easy to reach by cabI believe that Mueythai boxing is also held here, but I did not make that venue.

An oasis in Bangkok. I loved this park, in the middle of the (fabulous) madness that is Bangkok. It's a huge space and a great place to walk, sit down with a book or just people-watch. I went for a ride on the lake in one of those amazing pedal swan boats- my teen boys loved that as well. Look out for the many monitor lizards that roam the grounds and the little turtles that bob to the surface of the lake every now and then.

Fauna and Flora in Bangkok. Great place to relax and walk around, enjoy looking at flowers and check out the lizards which are really quite big! We went early in the morning, it's was quiet, we could see working gardeners and people practising Tai - Chi.

Much better than years ago. I started to come back for a jogging at Lumpini Park after seeing some good improvement lately. The park looks greener, cleanlier, and in better condition than before. Lumpini park has many locomotion on the go, in the morning you will see many seniors come in for Tai-Chi exercise, social get together and food shopping (yes!!). In the evening you wll see several groups of office people, students run, jog, walk, or aerobics all around the park. Lumpini park is located in a convenient location it just sit right in the corner of the busy Rama 4, Wireless, Lung Suan and Rachadamri Road,it may not as pretty ot well maintained as the Parks somewhere else but at least a good huge playground for Bangkokians and visitors in the heart of Bangkok.

such a nice place to relax. Why not enjoy a day away from the cars and city traffic and lay down in this park for a pic nic ,with a good book. Many locals are spending their day off work there as well so you can observe the entire family and make some friends

Beautiful oasis. Regulars come here to jog and practise taiji in the mornings and evenings. Wonderful place to soak in the locals' healthy vibe.
Too hot in the day time; not much happening either.

Big Park. Big Park with sporting facilities, a big lake to chill and take a small boat around 16-17 o'clock.
Watch out for the big leguan, he eats turtles :)
no smoking in the park

Runner's Oasis and Family Fun. As a runner, this centrally located park is the place to be. The outer loop is 2.54km around and there is a lot of shade. They have 2 well placed concession stands and a food court inside. The park is maintained well and you don't have to worry about traffic, noise or soi dogs. It is fun to watch all the different runners, walkers and exercise classes as you make your loops.As a father, the park is great fun to bring the family. We come and feed fish and check out the huge monitor lizards roaming free. There are 2 playgrounds and space to ride bike between 10am and 3pm. In December they have music in the park every Sunday night for free. An oasis in the city.

the green heart of Bangkok. Go there to enjoy a great, long and smog-free walk under some treens.The lakes are large an nice to look at. Don´t be surprised when you meet the local wildlife - something that looks like a mni Alligator. Lots of them around, 50cm to 1 m long. They are friendly - don´t be afraid.
oasis in the concrete jungle. lots of grassed areas and nice water features and big tress a very relaxing place although can be noisy at times, just be-careful of the HUGE monitor lizards
The park. Try to go early on a weekend to see the locals enjoying dancing and loads of sports and recreational pastimes. Get there on the sky train.

Go to see thais exercising. We liked very much Lumpini, it's a break in the middle of busy Bangkok, good to exercise or (what we did) just observe thais exercising and walking around. The place isn't big and on weekdays, around 5 PM, there's dance class and aerobics for everyone, for free.
a nice park for an early morning walk. a nice park for an early morning walk or run, go there enjoy the morning breeze and have some coffee in your wayback

A little oasis. We were fortunate to have the park just over the road from our hotel and it made for a delightful alternative to hacking round attractions and markets. It truly is a little oasis – lots of green round a large lake with boats to hire or just watch.You have a sense that this is for the natives not the tourists. Joggers jog. And others do a nice slow-motion impression of the karate kid. There’s a children’s play area too.If you fancy an hour just strolling with pleasent views and a cool breeze it is well worth a try.

Awesome Muay Thai Fights!. We were able to get ringside seats for 2000 baht each. Seemed a little steep, but it was well worth it - we watched ten fights and all were awesome to watch. Because we got ring side seats, we also got to take a free picture with the champ of the main event. The food available was cheap too so it wasn't too bad compared to watching any sporting event back home. The only other downside is that the stadium was fairly old, so the air ventilation wasn't great but it was expected.All in all, a very good experience for us :)

Quiet Haven in Bangkok!. I like to visit Lumpini Park when I stay in Bangkok, an afternoon stroll through the well tended gardens is a welcome relief from the hustle & bustle of busy Bangkok. It's a good place to see Thai people enjoying their time away from work, you can see the Thai Boxers training in the park most days, there are some very very large water dragon lizards in thepark so be careful near the waters edge. Lumpini is a great place to unwind away from all the stress & strain of work / travel in Bangkok.

Fairly standard park. We were staying close by the park and we had a walk around it the day after we arrived. It was midweek so it was quiet and nothing was going on. It's an OK park for a stroll away from the relentless Bangkok traffic but nothing to get excited about.To be fair we were not there at the weekend when I understand that there are lots of organised events taking place so it is worth a visit.

Giant Lizards!. I went here soley to see the huge monitor lizards roaming around. I wasn't disappointed...there are so many of them and the largest is nearly 2 metres long. The roads between the park and the metro station are extremely busy and on some roads we were waiting nearly 10 minutes to cross!

Amazing place to chill out in the afternoon!. Quiet, fresha and paradising! Amazing spot in the middle of the crazy and dusty city to chill-out and relax seating on the grass. Have met few giant lezards meanwhile. But there is no cafe or bar inside of the park, so take your own drinks with, if you dont want to spend too much time looking for a fresh bottle of water.

Green and amazing people. go in the early morning - around 7am - and you'll find a range of Thai chi exercises going on, dancing, groups, it's an amazing sight. there are more people at weekends and the park is a refreshing change after the heat of the city.

Place to relax. After our tiring day, we hopped off at Sala Daeng station(silom line) of Skytrain. From there started walking towards MRT Silom as Sala Daeng is interchanging station between Skytrain and MRT. Just follow the directions and you will reach Dusit Thani Hotel,walk down the exit stairs,cross the main road and here you are at Lumpini Park. By the time we reached it was already dark ...so i just sat on a bench near the lake...aerobic class was going on in far distance.People were jogging ,walking,cycling behind me.My hubby wandered away for few pics.It was very relaxing just sitting there and enjoying the quietness.i would love to go again, just to relax.

Nice place to relax. First of all, parking is free on Sundays. :)This is a big park in the center of the center of Bangkok. If you feel like spending some relaxing time in Bangkok (which is very hard to get in this overcrowded city), then come here for a nice lazy walk. You can rent boats, jogging... or even sit on one of the benches and watch monitor lizards crawl by...It's free, by the way ;)

Quiet park, not many extras. We went for a walk here during mid day, and it was pretty quiet and not too much people here at this time. The park is very basic with not too many extra attractions inside (not too many flowers, statues etc to look at), but with some fun wildlife with turtles an lizards by the ponds
A nice walk.. Great place to while away a couple of hours. You can rent boats for 40 baht (half hour) on the lake then laugh at the outdoor aerobics!
Nice, but small. Hard to believe this is the largest park of huge Bangkok. Incredibly crowded when joggers come out after sunset

Stop at 6 pm !. Every evening at 6pm the loud speakers in Lumphini Park play the national anthem and EVERYONE stops and stands silently. Don't get caught out! Then you can join in the group aerobics around the park for free, or stand and watch. Take your Badminton racquet and challenge someone, or sit by the lake and relax. Great place to see people in Bangkok relax and it's free.

A place of tranquility in the midle of Bangkok. We went for a walk through this oark. It was so peaceful and interesting. It was hard to believe we were on the middle of a busy city. We saw a monitor lizard eating, in one go, a whole fish. The locals were doing circuits of the oartk on their bikes and jogging and the park wardens were all friendly.
Lumpini park. Park is very big, has a lot of opportunities ,just have picknic or use gym or run with another Thai people in the evening ! toilets are also available.

An unknown treasure. Lumpini Park would have to be one of Bangkok's most unknown tourist spots. It's a vast area of lush green park that offers a relaxing stroll. You can escape the hustle or the city and before too long you can't hear the traffic or smell the smog. No one hassles you and you can just walk and enjoy the well kept lawns and gardens and watch locals exercise. Anytime is a great time but late afternoon is an ideal time.
Go in the late afternoon.... ... before 6pm and go for a nice walk. Watch everyone exercising on the walkways and little "outdoor gyms".

Nice park in downtown BKK. Great place for walk especially in the early morning or evening away from the hustling and bustling of the city. Nice place for 'people watch'. Have an enjoyable and quiet time if you chance upon the place.

Huge yet maintained park. Its walking distance from Conrad. The park in on a huge area. There is greenery everywhere. One can find my cyclists practising there. A good place for morning or evening walks

Join the throg for an early morning workout.. When I stay at the nearby Pinnacle Lumpini Hotel i set the alarm for an early morning walk to Lumpini Park before the sun comes up to avoid the heat of the day.Without fail there will always be several hundred others there all walking laps of the paths which are marked with Kilometre Distances so you will know how far you have walked.There are also groupd doing Yoga, Tai Chi, Weightlifting etc.and often the nearby hospital has a setup to do free blood pressure tests.The atmosphere is really lovely with an excellent community spirit from both the locals and foreigners alike.PLEASE NOTE: The Ferris Wheel shown in the picture is no longer there.
Nice Park. Great place for a walk in the afternoon, beautiful surroundings and in the middle of downtown bangkok. Would reccomend anyone to go here for a chilled afternoon!
Ride a white swan. Ride a white swan in Lumpini park and chill for a few hours outside the madness of central and all of its shopping and markets.

Compare it to Hyde Park London. Its a very high end park with jogging tracks and lakes. Well manicured large gardens and some children area with swings and slides. Its right in the city center and i feel its few shades above Hyde Park London

green oasis in the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Lumpini Park is a beautiful park in central Bangkok. It has lush green lawns, gardens, a lake, walking tracks and is a welcome haven from the pollution and gryness of the city.Visit during the heat of the day and you will be almost on your own, but early in the morning, or in the evenings you will find yourself milling around with thousands......In the mornings, street markets line the surrounding footpaths and there are an array of activities taking place.Tai Chi, swords, aerobics, jogging, walking, badminton playing, children on playgrounds. It is a sight to behold. You can hire little boats on the lake for someting more romantic if you wish, or just walk around and take in the whole feel of the place. A welcome retreat and respite from the city.

walk row or people watch.. What a treat to go to this park any time of the day. I especially like to go very early in the morning. old folks are doing stretching, ti-chi or drinking tea. there are exercise stations that are always being used. our town could take a lesson for a park well done, in the middle of Bangkok.

Not bad but not great. Parts of it are under reconstruction but the rest is a pleasant place to take a walk and get away from the congestion, If your hotel is near or you are addicted to "a walk in the park" then it's not bad but not special. Don't go there excpecting Central Park or a lot of flowers. They have little swan shaped boats you can rent to go out onto the medium sized lake they have.
Hot!. It's to hot to go there in daytime but nightime a nice place.A few places to buy drink and basic food.
Great park near the center. Many animals if you take the time to visit, or have a rest. Very crowded on Saturdays, joggers, families, etc.
Bangkok is not the place to come for parks. But this is the city's biggest. It can be nice enough walking around and sitting on one of the benches. Keep in mind the heat.

Great place to get away from congestion in Bangkok. After hours in traffic and crowds you can always come here. It was right near my hotel. I enjoyed taking pictures of the monitor lizards, and loved to watch the Aerobics just before sundown. There are paddle boats to rent, and food vendors at SE corner gate and other places.BTS and MRT stop there. Good people watching too. Gotta go at least once! Dont worry the monitor lizards, that get up to 2 meters long do not attack people if you respect them. Often they shy away or jump in the water. They can stay underwater awhile too.

WOW You gotta see it. After 15 years of traveling to Thailand I have never seen or been here untill now. I will now make it my first stop when in Bangkok. There is so much to see and do here, outdoor gym, swan love paddle boats, what look like Zumba thai style, heaps of eateries or just sit back and watch it all go by, Ah nothing at all. If it's good enough for the locals it's good enough for me! Check it out, you won't be dissapointed unless you get scared of the rather big water dragons, but they won't bit you.....

watch out for the water lizards!. It was just a regular park, a little rundown in certain areas. The thing that made it special for me was all the huge water lizards (think kimono dragons) that were lounging around the water. some were huge!! it was fun trying to get close to get some good pics.
Great Escape. Worth too just get off the streets away from everything. Peaceful and relaxing. Watch out for the large lizards :P

away from it all. a quick hop on the skytrain, 5 mins stroll and we arrive at Lumpini Park - beautiful on a hot day with blue skies. Snack stalls are on the outskirts of the park, with has 2 huge boating lakes. Highly recommended for a quiet afternoon in bangkok
Finally the smell of greenery in bangkok. When in bangkok, u can't smell much of greenery. Only in lumpini park u get a little fresh air. And a whiff of fresh air and smell of grass

An oasis in the middle of the City madness!. This is a beautiful park, grounds are extensive and lots of different areas to explore. All manner of activities happen here, a great way to enjoy some quiet time with the family - you can exercise or rest! It might be an idea to take a drink and some food with you, a small snack bar but limited otherwise.

An Oasis in the middle of Bangkok. If you find yourself in Bangkok & wish to get away for a little peace & quiet as well as beautiful scenery, then be sure to visit Lumpini Park in the Sathorn district ... For an early morning walk or exercise before it gets hot, this is the place to do it. A beautiful lake, very nice landscaping & super friendly people.Not to be missed if you have a few hours to just relax.

Big, but green could be bigger. This is a big park. I wished the green areas would be bigger, as during the hot season, you walk mainly on hot asphalt. Closes early (I believe 10 p.m)., so not possible to enjoy the mild temperatures in the park.

Nice stroll, for 3 hours!!!. The night market. About the same as those on sukhumvit or patpong, but here you can get pictures without butterfly-ladies in the background. also a lot of food to be found.

Beautiful oasis of calm in the midst of the busy city..... We visited Lumpini Park for an early morning walk and were happily surprised by the peace and serenity in such an unexpected location! We took many photos of the monitor lizards patrolling the banks and enjoyed seeing the tai chi practitioners going through their graceful poses. People were running, walking, biking, rollerblading, playing badminton and basketball, in the intense humid heat and there were many charming scenes of elderly gentlemen engaged in passionate chess matches....Well worth a visit for some exercise and peace of mind while staying in this crazily wonderful city!

Love this place great break from the hustle and bustle. One of the first things we went to when we reached bangkok. This park was beautiful as I was i a bit if shock from all the peak hour traffic and heat. I had a lot of fun my girlfriend and I rented a paddle boat swan for 40baht for 1/2 and hour and paddled around and saw all the lizards and turtles swimming in the water and got chased by cheeky kids trying to ram us on a paddle boat with massive grins on thier face . They were only joking and it was a great laugh I love this place will deffinatly go back again !

Little heaven in a bustle city of Bangkok. Really great park. Many foreigner are here for a great jog or run, while the locals are practicing taichi (something like taichi with a very relaxing chinese music).
Should I visit Bangkok again, i will spend my morning every day here
Lovely park.. I went to Lumpini to see the giant lizards & wasn't disappointed. The park is massive and there are food, drink & clean toilet facilities. Worth a look to kill an hour or two.

A quiet slice of Bangkok. People strolling around, feeding the fish, lifting ancient barbells, running, walking, cycling, laughing. A calmness is felt as soon as you enter the large park filled with watercourses, tall trees and exercise areas. A nice reprieve from the bustle of the big city.

Lovely peaceful park - keep an eye out for the wildlife. The park makes a peaceful, refreshing break from the bustle of Bangkok. It is spacious and well-maintained - clean, but still with character. There are boats for hire on the lake, childrens' play areas with modern equipment, picnic tables and places to buy snacks, and toilets watched over by attendants. Some interesting sculptures are scattered around the park. There is plenty of shade. But best of all is the uncrowded green space, and the flora and fauna - keep your eyes open for the wildlife, especially the huge monitor lizards lazing near the water. The park is particularly atmospheric first thing in the morning, when people of all ages come to practice tai chi, aerobics and other keep-fit activities. For info, there is no big wheel in or near Lumpini Park, and the Suan Lum night market which was next to the park is long closed. So the main photo currently accompanying this attraction is misleading. The park is easily reached from Lumpini station (MRT) or Sala Daeng (Skytrain).

Beautiful!. A little bit of serenity in a city of constant chaos....Surrounded by high rises is the heart of the city...this beautiful park has a lake, exercise areas, boats, joggers,small temples, walkers and swans.

Huge, well-maintained park in Bangkok. Lumpini Park is the largest park in the city of Bangkok. Public spaces here are rare. There are walking paths, a small lake where one can rent a boat, statues of Thai royalty, groups practicing Chi Gung and such. There are vendors that sell cold drinks and snacks.Cycling is limited from 10:00 to 15:00 and smoking is banned.It is in a hot, tropical environment, joggers usually jog in the evening. An outdoor gym is available. There is much rare indigenous flora, a forest area and a few monitor lizards The nearby Sala Daeng Skytrain and Lumpino MRT station are the best way to get there.The adjoining Sanum Luang Night Bazaar is sadly gone.
Peaceful oasis in busy Bangkok. We strolled through the park and enjoyed the scenery. There are plenty of shady tables and seating for picnics.

Popular park near Silom area. There are 3 ways to access the park. 1. BTS skytrain and exit at the Sala Daeng station. 2. MRT subway and exit at the Lumphini station. 3. MRT and exit at the Silom station. It is a large park with a lake and you may rent bicycles and paddle boats. There are multiple food stations and you can buy food for the fish. The walkway is a little confusing with many forks. Probably the best way to navigate the park is to try to walk around the lake. Beware of the komino dragon lizards around the lake. They are huge and roam freely. It is a nice park to stroll or jog and exercise. Personally, I prefer Benjakitti Park to Lumpini Park.

even the saturday it's quiet !. i did photo shooting there a saturday afternoon with a nice girl model with heels shoes, people are very kind, one thai amator photographer took some pics behind me lol, when i put them on facebook anyone believe i took them in Lumpini Park with many people around because this park is the most popular in middle of Bangkok ! ;)

Nice for a morning stroll. An easy walk before breakfast from the Dusit Thani across the road, the park is peaceful and we enjoyed seeing the locals doing their morning exercise, or chatting over breakfast. Well worth a visit.

A refuge from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok.. Don't miss the opportunity to see Lumpini Park while visiting Bangkok. We went on a Sunday and it was quite busy with joggers, bicycle riders, photographers, people practicing martial arts and Tai Chi. We saw several large monitor lizards walking about, but they are afraid of people and slithered into the lake when we tried to get close.
Very nice park!. Very nice park in middle of Bangkok. They were running a footrace, when we visited. A pleasant respite in a bustling metropolis.

Beautiful park with lots going on. This is a lovely park with a number of entrances with food and drink stalls at each. There are people exercising [tai chi, ballroom dancing, jogging, weight lifting and so on], there's women's groups and mens groups, just sitting round chatting. All very relaxed. There's a food court which emits wonderful smells that make you hungry even if you weren't previously! It's a nice way to spend the morning and take in another kind of life in Bangkok.
Relaxing Place. Great place to relax and walk around the park in the middle of the city. Very spacious and open and a good place to clear the mind.
Oasis in BKK. We were impressed how well maintained and beautiful this place is. Many people walking, exercising and cycling there in the morning. A nice quiet retreat in this busy city.

Some green & fresh air in the chaotic Bangkok. The park is 15 min. away from Metropolitan Bangkok, so we spent an hour or so before our departure. It's an alright park with many trees and grass field, it's good to go with children who's looking for a run. A nice alternative after a couple of days at the shopping malls.

Peaceful oasis. After hours strolling by Sala Daeng, this is a great green space to relax and get away from the noise day to day Bangkok's street, people are exercising, is a gym, a pool, a senior center with salsa classes, very clean and safe, also is a food court with traditional Thai food and all the fruits that you can imagine, you most go just for the walking experience, away from the tuk-tuk's and motorcycles. You can have mediate, just seat a people watch or just walk around and see all the different buildings.

Cool tranquil respite from the mayhem!. Lots of activities from aerobics, walking, jogging and even salsa dancing take place here. We rode our bicycles through here and enjoyed the snapshot of leisure pastimes. There is a designated jogging/walikng track which cyclists must avoid at certain times. The policeman moved us on! At 6pm we stood for the national anthem,and all activities stopped for this event.

Favorite place in Bangkok. I love Lumpini park. You get free concerts, can enjoy playing Basketball with local and visiting guys or enjoy the 2,5km jogging, walking and biking track. Free aerobics in the morning and evening or some Tai Chi. Great atmosphere and a wonderful place to enjoy Bangkok from another side.

Beautiful Green Space. The city can be quite smoggy from car pollution, but this park is like an oasis for a tired tourist. I would recommend going there for a break and/or to go for a workout or jog if you like working out. You can never get rid off the air pollution, but in this park you can at least try to forget it.The park has a nice walking track, and even a "Muscle Beach" type of area. It is a good place for your kids to expend their energy.

A peace from the Madding Crowd. If your want respite from the chaos, noise and pollution of Bangkok's crazy streets, why not head for a rest and maybe a picnic lunch, to the tranquillity of Lumpini Park. Easilly found by BTS 'Skytrain', bus, taxi or God Forbid, by foot ! Lumpini Park is a wonderful place to Chill out.

Concert in the Park. We went to the evening concert by the Bangkok Philharmonic Orchestra. We took rugs to sit on with a Thai food picnic and the music and song were terrific. The park was packed and it was a great night out.
Disappointing. Not much to do - has a boating lake with the swan pedaloes in but not much else to see or do. not really worth a visit unless you have kids with you to let off steam

nice place to rest. nice place to take a rest in the big city of Bangkok. quiet and green.in the evening or early morning good to do jogging or some sport. I like it to be there at early evening andf to enjoy the time and look to the skyline of Bangkok. Interesting are the big Warans which are in the lakes there

Super relaxing. In the middle of the hustle & bustle of Bangkok is the very peaceful Lumpini Park, went for a wander round there today instead of aimlessly meandering around Bangkok getting harassed & was surprised as to how nice & quiet the place is.Lots of nicely landscaped gardens & places to sit & relax there's even Bangkok's version of Muscle Beach form Venice! Whilst walking towards the lake noticed something fairly large swimming towards the shore & on closer inspection was a 4/5 foot Monitor Lizard, that didn't seem too fussed with me getting close enough to take a few pictures!Sat on a big rock under a tree to catch some shade as was a blazing day & wondered how something so quiet & serene could be in the middle of the sprawling metropolis that is Bangkok!

Take a stroll around the park near Silom in Bangkok. There are many folk, both Thai and foreignors who excercise around this park in the mornings. There is about a 2 km jogging route around the park and at certain times you can cycle on this route as well. There is also a small 25m pool but you can only use it between 7am and 8am. Annual membership is 40 baht and 15 baht every time you swim. Wear a cap and goggles.The park is lush and green and well kept. There are a number of ponds that you can hire peddle boats on.
Most relaxing. Pleasant park and a nice area to get away from the traffic for a short while. Look out for the monitor lizards in the water ways, on the grassy banks and even in the trees.

Big Park. Huge park. Went there in between waiting for the shows at the Queen Savorbha Snake Farm. We did see one of the fabled moniter lizards peek up from the river water - my friend freaked out haha. Strange sight: a Caucasian man lying face down in the grass in the hot 1-2pm sun with a bandaged foot... He was definitely alive (he moved while sleeping) but why he choose to sleep there I cannot fathom for the life of me... The sprinklers turned on about an hour later and made the surroundings a little bit cooler!

Monitor lizards!. We visited Lumpini specially to find the monitor lizardsWe didn't have to search long, along the banks of the lake you see them quickly.They are huge large animals that are running fast. It was extraordinary to watch these animals in a busy city.You can also see many joggers and people who relax in the park.

good place to take some rest. I explore this place after long time of training in Bangkok. This place is really beautiful. Even there is some renovation work happen in the area.You can see groups of people doing sports, tai chi, aerobic, etc. There is also boat you can rent with a good price to explore the lake.if you come near 18.00, then just wait, at 18.00 there will be Thailand national anthem played from the sound system, and the security guard will blow whistle, and all people will stand for honoring (even its not a must for foreigner, but most people just do like the Thai people do and its a great experience). After the song finished, you will hear whistle blown again, and everybody start to move again.This isnt happened only in Lumpini, but also happened in BTS station (more interesting to see this in Lumpini, because in BTS some foreigner that dont notice still make movement ).

Busy night market, all you can buy and eat.... We went to the Lumpini night market and it's surely one to reccomend. Foodstalls line the massive foodcourt, a big podium with local bands and singers and anything you could buy. From animals to tourist stuff, bags, t-shirts, insence etc. A fun night out!

A real green space in the middle of CITY OF ANGELS. For a tad bit of fresh air,away from the traffic,a lovely green space to walk around,exercise in,use the playground,take a boat ride.Even had a live orcestra when i was there.

A gem in the middle of a big city. This park was one of my favorite parts of Bangkok...also seemed like a break from the pollution.
Make sure to go in the morning as there are so many people doing so many different things.
A fun way to relax and get away from the hustle and bussle.

Oasis in bangkok. If you want to get away from it all in bangkok, head here.
Once in the park I is peaceful with plenty of people jogging and cycling

Lush Park Oasis in the middle of buslting Bangkok. When you need to get your sweat on or even for a leisurely stroll Lumpini Park is the largest green area in congested polluted bangkok so do yourself a favor and go there.

Lumpini Park. This is an oasis within the City. Very relaxing , I love spending hours in this park Just strolling around and exploring, taking pictures.You can see lizards walking around, I little scary; but they won't harm you unless maybe if you do something that'll harm them.You can even ride a paddle boat and just enjoy the sunIt's just a few steps away from the Hotel I stayed in so it's very convenient And near the station It's a huge park to explore but you won't go hungry or thirsty coz you can easily find vendors that's sells food and drinks Been here August 2009

A Sanctuary. i just love spending hours in this lovely Park , the wild life after a night with the Silom wild life, serious it is nice to explore look at the Lizards moving around, all the bird life, and just people watching, I often walk from Silom via the underground through the Park and back to my hotel and just spend 2 hours hereMake it a point visit lumpini Park as outside the gates life is Crazy
Try Sunday nights. A lovely oasis. Take a a paddle boat out to feed the voracious cat fish or watch a monitor lizard of turtle sunbathing. Lovely Sunday evening orchestra concerts.

Its fine for Joogers. Just be carefully of fasinating Monitor Lizard.. This Lizard are large in size and don't trouble them, else they can trouble you. They just pass by from my side and suddenly make scare. If you go on grass area, you need to check it properly if any small monitor lizard is around you or not. But mostly they be in water, so its fine. Next about this place is good and near to nature. You can listen birds - but i find only crows and sparrows. Lake in center is good for relaxation.

an oasis in a busy city. I loved the wild life, monitor lizards, iguanas, cat fish that try to beat the turtles for the food. Squirrels. Everything is protected in the park so the wild life is flourishing.....if only in the park. I also had a superb headm neck and foot massage.......

Quiet place to relax. First of all, this park is huge! I wasnt sure where the entrance was coming from Lumpini train stop. You can just simply miss it. Took a while to actually find the entrance. Would help if they could put signs pointing to the right direction. The park was really nice and very quiet - away from the chaos of bangkok. One could simply walk, cycle and run without the massive crowds or have a picnic with the nice concrete table and benches around the park. I think they should put in more trash cans. Children would love this place as there are playgrounds, duck feeding, boat rides and looking at lizards swimming in the lake.
Beautiful park right in the heart of Bangkok. Very beautiful & tranquil park to escape to in the hectic capital, especially liked the huge lizards wandering around, some exceeding a meter long !

green space in bangkok. great playground filled with sand ground, great for our 17 month old, even though it says it is for 5+, he loved it all the same and older kids love to play with the younger ones
Quite disappointing. We expected the park to be a beautiful lounge in the city. We where quite disappointed about the park and thought it was dirty.
The Park. We went to Lumpini park to have a Thai Chi lesson for an hour.It was early morning many Thai people there doing exercise.Nice park to visit

Gets a 5* rating when the free open air concerts are on. Ok, there are more spectacular parks in the world but Lumpini is pretty and a lovely break from the mayhem of the surrounding city streets. Where it shines is in Jan - Feb when the Bangkok Philharmonic come out and play a free concert on Sunday evenings. Take along a blanket and a picnic for a charming and peaceful evening out, right in the bustle of this hectic city.

A quiet oasis in the middle of a busy city. What a nice way to spend a morning - walk through this large park and see the locals enjoy the morning breeze while they have a picnic breakfast, walk the dog, jog and cycle or even practise tai chi.

An interesting insight on life. Not one of the world's best kept parks, but certainly one of the most interesting. Take an early morning stroll and watch joggers and walkers side by side with ballroom dancers, and groups calmly practicing tai chi or sword dancing. When the bell tower strikes 8am, the national anthem is played over the tannoy and everyone stops in respect.

average urban park. Probably a nice place to go if you live there but as a tourist, it just seemed like a typical urban park - nothing really special about it. If you are itching for some greenery, may be worth a visit, but otherwise spend your time on all the other amazing, unique activities that bangkok has to offer.
One of the nicest parks. It truly is a must visit when here in Bangkok. Go twice before dawn and at sunset to see the two faces of Lumpinin or Suan Lum as it is locally known.

morning walk. early morning entertainment is a walk round lumpini park,one of the few places you can walk freely as pavements in this city are not designed for perambulation.There's all the usual park scenes runners and walkers of various seriousness plus fan exercising and ballroom dancing.worth while and good for you too

Not well maintained, but a peaceful place. Could be better maintained. Grass was very sparse. The lake was nice...particularly interesting was seeing 6 ft monitor lizard swimming across the lake. Monitor lizards are abundant...though you have to look for them as they easily blend into the environment. For me this was the most interesting part of the park. I suppose, like alligators in Florida, one shouldn't get too close. But interesting to see them just roaming around. Nice place for a run.

Only for the monitor lizards!. Not worth a visit, there is not so much to see, except the huge lizards living there. The vegetation is rather poor. The access is difficult, with very busy roads all around the park.

Green park in an otherwise grey concrete jungle. Lumpini isn't the nicest public park in the world, or even in Bangkok. But its location makes a nice diversion from the chaos of its surroundings. Near everything in central Bangkok, Lumpini is the local's choice for recreation or peace. Find seniors practicing Tai Chi, kids playing basketball, adults jogging and walking at all times of the day in Lumpini. But the highlight has to be the large monitor lizards that call the ponds in Lumpini home.

Just when you think there is nog green are.... Aha, a park! I arrived here at sunset, hoping to see some thai-chi but quickly I was aware that thai-chi is a morning event while at the evening you see a lot of people doing some aerobics. Just sit and relax and admire the Thai people (and some tourists) who come direct from their work and perform their exercises at modern Asian music. There is also a very nice lake in the middle of the park where you can rent a boat to discover it. The park is located between the lumpini boxing stadium and the commercial district with its big shopping malls.

Nice quiet park. I stopped by this park for a bit to check it out. Its a very calm and quiet place. Which is very unusual in Bangkok. We did see a few monitor lizards as we walked around. I didn't get to explore it fully but its worth a visit.
Thai boxing. If you like Thai boxing then you have to visit Lumpini stadium. I have been coming here for years and always been entertained with great fights. Its hot inside so be prepared,
A nice piece of greenery in busy Bangkok. A great place to go and chill, walk or play games in the large grassed areas and a welcome break from the busy city.
A great place to run/exercise in the middle of the city. full of runners, walkers, tai chi, and zoomba, this park was a welcome place to run...a difficult thing to do in many large asian cities.
relaxing. Beautiful way to spend a quiet day. Lots to see and a very large park....love the flowers and trees. Wish we could have been there for the Sunday music in the park
Lovely place sad the markets have gone. It is a lovely place to get away from some of the hussle and bussle of Bangkok. I wll miss the night markets when we reutrn though

Interesting park. Takes on a different ambience depending what time of day you visit.
Check out the outdoor gym, ancient equipment but plenty of people using it. Tai chi and aerobics on mass, boating lake, play equipment for the children, great inner city park
park and relax. a very clean and quite park,its fun to watch the monitor lizards walikg so near to you,a nice place to relax and have a picnic

Sometimes a nice retreat, sometimes as sticky as the rest.. Always beautiful and relaxing though. Nice pictures to be taken, kids can play in a good playground or the paddleboats, not much eating to be found but there are a few consessionstands. If you bring your own food; there is sittingspace for thousands of people...

great place to relax. great place to relax from the vanity of Bangkok
big territory for walking and nice pond where you can feed fishes and turtles
Perfect to hang out. Big recommendation if you want to relax and let your mind flow. There are some food courts and possibilities to work out.

An oasis in the middle of Bangkok. There is everything here - walking and running tracks, tennis and basketball courts, outdoor gym and swimming pool. Also boats for hire. No smoking which is a bonus for me. The highlight is watching locals play trakraw, a massive sport in Asia. A bit like volleyball but unable to use your hands like football. Their acrobatics are fantastic.

Usually too hot or too wet. It's nice near the banks of the pond in the shadow of a tree. You can watch the monitor lizards crawl by your feet but don't get too close. There is a play garden fro young children.

Great way to walk off jet lag. We got in late but were determined to be up and about.
Lumping park was perfect for that
We found a Komodo dragon under a bridge, happily swimming off
People doing martial arts
Open air markets
And it really helped to stretch our legs

Perfect for a morning run. It is so active....Tai Chi, joggers, basketball. I did it all. The best was running along and having a huge lizard swimming in the pond. Completely unexpected but something I don't see every day in Chicago.

Awesome Oasis in the city!. This park was a real treat early in the morning for tourists to get to see locals enjoying their park and enjoy it with them was really special! ...the elderly doing their morning rituals the young strolling through the park or on their way to work, having a tea or something to eat from a vendor just outside the park fence.Beautiful well kept park to enjoy for a stroll or a jog.

a waste of time. We spent a fair bit of money and time getting from the main Bangkok tourist area of Khao San to Lumpini park and were definitely underwhelmed. Most taxi and tuk tuk drivers were not even interested in going that far across town.Sure, it is a fairly large park with a lake and some trees and a food stall area, but nothing out of the ordinary and quite plain. I expected a huge city like BKK to have a much nicer public park.Sure, if you are only in Bangkok and want to relax a bit, then it would be fine, but if your holiday includes going to smaller towns around Thailand then you will see FAR nicer scenery and park like surroundings elsewhere. Give this place a miss.The main thing of interest we saw at this park was the bodybuilding gym / workout area. Unusual to see Thai bodybuilders.
must for martial artists. if you into martial arts, make sure that you have time to go and visit the stadium and watch few fights. they are free and run 3 times a week

Delightful Park. We had a few hours to kill before heading tot he airport & we took an interesting stroll through this park. My husband & a friend inline skated through here in the morning. The path is quite nice for skating. Our walk took us by swan boats, people lounging, its a very popular place with the locals, we saw a few dragons, not sure what kind, they are about 5-6feet long & were both swimming in the canal & on the dry land. A little disconcerting. For 10 baht we bought a bag of puffed corn & fed it to the fish gathered for this purpose. The fish were huge & we even saw a turtle. There is a Chines section, and an outdoor area where men were lifting weights. Very interesting park.

great park in the middle of the city. Although this is not a place you would put on the must visit sights, if you are on a long business trip and want to jog and catch a bit of fresh air then of course its a great place to be. There is a splendid lake (maybe man made) and usually some sort of gig in the evening. Wear your sneakers and burn some calories, that's what Lumpini park is about.Ratachadamari BTS would be the closest to this.

A must in Bangkok. If you are in Bangkok with your family or alone, this place is must in evening or morning. Approach is very convenient as Silom MRT exit is on park itself. It has a very good kids zone and lots of green and beautiful strolling zones. In late evening surroundings appear very beautiful from park.
look for the monitor lizards. good park in the middle of bangkok we wentmainly to see the monitor lizards its a good way to spend a afternoon escape the hussle ofbangkok

Place to relax or exercise in the middle of the city. The park itself is nothing great, but any green space in this sprawling city is a nice experience. One of the really good perks of it is during the winter months, they have music in the park every Sunday. Also if you're looking for a place to stretch your legs for a nice run, this is your spot.

An Oasis of Calm. A very large park that is well used by business people for the lunch hour. There are small streams and a boating lake so you can sit by the riverbank with your Fried Noodle Seafood and ice cold coke just watching the river turtles swimming lazily through the calm clear waters ...... Aaaahh

Nice to visit early in the morning. If you need axwecise, here is a park which is only 300 meters away. Great food for breakfast. you meet all kinds of people and can even join one of those excercise sessions for free.
Just ok. It was just OK. but have seen far better ..Don't give it any priority over other plans. No special memories.... Not even a trace!!!
great gem. Close to my hotel. I had the opportunity to walk just a block and see a great park right in the city.
park in the middle of city. take a stroll around the park,in the city,lovely grounds,turtles, lizards.nice and peaceful from the hussle and bussle of Bangkok

A bit of traquility in the metropolis. When you want to get away from the traffic etc, head here for some piece an quiet.
The park has a running circuit (2.5K) maked out if you want to partake.
Also keep an eye out for the monitor lizards (there are some biggies) by the lake side.

Watch out for the snakes. We went to see the water monitors but saw a bit more wildlife than we were expecting. We strayed off the path walking around the lake and disturbed a snake having a quick sunbathe on the grass. I don't know if it was dangerous as it, and we, didn't hang about to find out. Apart from this the park is a nice relaxing place to go to get away from the hussle and bussle of the city. It's a surprisingly large and quiet park but if you want somewhere to sit take a blanket for the grass as most of the seating areas are occupied by locals taking a morning/afternoon/early evening snooze

Nothing extraordinary, but relaxing. Wherever I travel I usually look out for the parks and gardens when I want a break from the city life. Lumpini Park does not stand out as one of my favourites, yet I still spent a pleasant time there.Lots of joggers and people striving to keep fit, which is something I like to see.Watch out for the dragons! They can roam freely around the park and will sometimes move out of the water... which will make you feel as though you are watching some kind of science fiction movie! I thought these were Komodo dragons but realised that they were smaller. Actually the species is called "water monitor" and they are cousins of the Komodo dragon. This creature is a protected species in Thailand and is native to the region.Tip: If you are going there by public transit, don't let yourself be misled by the name. Don't get at Lumpini station but at Si Lom MRT which is one stop awat.

Escape from City Within the City!. Loved it here!Wandering with my husband was amazing! Came here after we were exhausted by the crowds at the Palace.We didn't but i would recommend bringing some picnic stuff as there are a couple people that sell mats to sit on (only people selling things, its mostly locals resting and workingout here).

Gave me faith in humanity!. I showed up at dawn to go for a run in the park thinking I'd be alone. Not the case. Lumpini park was alive with people doing zumba, tai-chi, yoga, sword fighting, weight lifting, and running. It was neat to see everyone out enjoying the open space. I brought my wife the next morning and we both enjoyed exercising there.
Thai amusement. It is a great park for a stroll, let your kids run around or enjoy the Thai people in the evening. It is popular with Thai and tourists.

Perfect for jogging. It is a very big park, and every year when i come to Bangkok I especially choose a hotel near Lumphinee park. Closest hotels are in silom, sathorn area. Early in the morning is the best time to see Thai Chi practitioners, and normal Bangkok people. Sundays are very crowded. You can see giant monitor lizards all about, I can say this place is the only oxygen source of Bangkok, it is such a dirty city. I would recommend Bandara Suites near the area. You can take sky train and get off Sala daeng station and walk to Lumpinee park. There are proper hotels around the area and Silom is a very lively place where Patbong and night market is. Bus number 15 and 47 go to khoasan road area. For MBK and Siam Square take the sky train to "national stadium" direction.

Calm in Bangkok. While the heat is omnipresent in the chaos and craziness that is BKK thankfully there is the massive green area. You fly into either of the airports and the smog and haze obliterates all, and no wonder. Traffic madness, vehicles spewing fumes, and a complete lack of any awareness of climate change....and then there is this!Walking running biking and the two highlights .... The lizards which are huge and either the aerobics or cheer leading classes which are a trip.There is no Ferris wheel. Located in dead center of commercial area BTS to Sala Daeng or Ratchadmri 3-4 minute walk or MRT to Lumphini. If you can bear the heat and just want to walk without the street madness (or run) this is the place.
A green oasis in centre of city. A welcome break from the streets of Bangkok. Good walking and cycling paths, lakes for boating, benches for resting or picinicing and don't miss the giant lizards.
Great place in a City of few parks. Nice oasis in BKK. Look out for the large lizards in the ponds. No dogs allowed (i guess understandable).

A delight in the heart of the city. A wonderful green break in the midst of the chaos, pavement and traffic of Bangkok. Well designed, and well mantained. Includes a swimming pool, a food court, and a couple of lakes where you can rent boats.
Little bit of green in a city of Grey. I think my title says it all really. A nice park in downtown Bangkok. Great place to jog and an even better place to people watch especially at 6pm.

Best park in Bangkok, and MONITOR LIZARDS!. Lumphini is huge, and there's a ton of stuff to explore. There are massive aerobics classes in the evening (100+ people exercising in public...it's a sigh to behold)... really pretty lakes, good running trails, and it's easily accessible from both the Skytrain and MRT. Also, keep your eye out for gigantic monitor lizards.... it's a totally random thing, but for some reason they're hanging out there!

A Great Place to find a semblance of tranquility. Take a break from the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and make your way to Lumpini Park. You will find visitors jogging, walking or just relaxing. It is a place that provides some peace and solace from the maze which is Bangkok. Admittedly the Lumpini area is much more peaceful than some of Bangkok's other areas, but all the same, the park provides a different experience even from that which exists immediately outside of its perimeter. Go and experience some peace and quiet.
Dragons. The dragons make the park worth the visit. It is a nice big green area in a concrete city. The Dragons are huge but tend to shy away from humans.

good place to chill out in the morning. we went there when we were tired of touring around , it was sooooooo nice place to get a break morning away from the crowded city of bangkok ( however it is located in the heart of the city still ) but was so nice and relaxing inside , we could see the comodo dragon just walking around and we were about to scream before we notice that they are everywhere and people are just walking around them ( never try to touch or get too close to them ) just stay away and if you have kids be sure they stay away enough from them becuase they are able to kill a kid and drag him away .the park has even a work out area , you can find all wieghts and not the best in the world but they are enough to make you sweat and jogging there is quite nice too .at the end it worth to visit when you want to take a break morning away from all busy tours days

Biggest Park. I couldn't believe the size of this park and it's in the center of Bangkok. 500,000 Sq. meters with a number of various activities and food vendors to keep you bust. Not a great place at night.

Misleading titlepicture!. Your title picture shows a ferris wheel that was operated outside the perimeters of Lumpini Park at the now defunct Suan Lum Night Bazar! The wheel was dismantled many years ago and the Suam Lum shopping/entertainment arcade shut down as well. So all the subjects in your title pic have absolutely nothing to do with Lumpini Park, nor are they anywhere near. I lived in BKK for several years after the Millennium and have witnessed myself the opening and final day of said attractions.The Lumpini Park is a recreational area, mainly used by joggers in the P.M. hours - as it is free of motorized traffic and boasts large lawns and a few ponds. Monitor lizards of gigantic dimensions (up to 180 cm long) made this there habitat. They can be photographed easily here. The park is completely fenced in and gates are locked at night. Admission is free to all. Paddle boats on the ponds and bicycles can be rented on site cheaply.

out of business. for your not the Lumpini park shopping arcade has gone out of business and therefore no longer relevant in your listings a part from a few shops - usually gun runners (I'm not kidding) most people use it as a car parking lot

Oasis of calm. This is a great place to spend a quiet moment in the heart of Bangkok. Street vendors are outside the park and offer food and drinks. The park itself has well tended flower beds and lakes in which pedalos are available.
Can be damn hot and humid during the day. Park closes earlywatch the traffic getting across the road hereBread sellers are in here and sometimes otehr hawkers selling mats to sit on.

Oasis of Calm. Lovely quiet place to walk around and escape the hustle of the city.We spent time sitting on the lake edges feeding the fish with breadcrust that you can buy at the gates. There are also huge monitors around that you spot occasionally.Lots of locals jogging, loads of places to pick up snacks and drinks, and the opportunity to take a rowing boat or pedalo out on the water.Lovely place.
The Biggest Park. I would probably think this Lumpini is the largest park in Bangkok covered with lakes and old trees. You can even see big lizards walking around. Good place to relax

"Relaxing place to go". You will surely love this park after torturing yourself to a day or two day visit to all the temples around the city. This park is huge and is located near MRT or BTS Station. I saw Thais coming here to jog, run and some are doing aerobics. I did some walking around with my best friend , took pictures and then rest under the tall trees .Since I’m a nature lover, I must say that this park is a very relaxing place to go.

Best park in Bangkok?. Probably the only park that tourists will visit, it is a bit tired looking and doesn't really have any real attractions apart from the paddle boats, moronic karaoke and a jogging track. They did try to introduce a few fairs and exhibits there but they were a bit flat in my opinion. It is close to Silom, the Subway and Lumpini kick boxing so I suppose it could break up a trip.

Nice enough park with plenty to see. I took a walk around the park one Saturday morning. Nice water features and a number of statues and buildings to see. Certainly a nice haven within the hustle and bustle of the city.

a quiet place in the heart of bangkok.
