Lumpini´s Park is near Patpong night market,and bts sala daeng,in ratchadamri rd.,near Silom subway station in Rama IV rd.The park is a lung in the centre of town,is a good place to walk or making footing,etc,it´s used for many thai people to practice diferent sports.There you can see families making picnic on its grass,above all in week end,there are lakes in wich you can enjoy hiring a boat,in this lakes are lisards,turtles and fish which are feeded by people.YOu have many diferent types of trees,many palms tree .In short, a place to rest and disconnect from the hustle of the great city.

An Oasis in Concrete Jungle of Bangkok. Can get there taking BTS (Sky Train) or MRT (Subway). Park is big. Lot's actvities going on. In winter they have free outdoor symphony. Chidrens park and lots of sports arena as well. If you are looking for a break from all the hustle bustle and chill this may be an option.

too many roads. I liked walking around. There are a lot of monitor lizards swimming and giant catfish in the ponds. Its a bit too covered with roads cris-crossing everywhere. I think there could be more grass!!

A quiet place in the middle of a bustling city. The park is large and thus you can jog or walk for quite some time. The park is a peaceful place to get away from the hectic life of Bangkok, yet is close to everything you need (and close to our hotel- Four Seasons Bangkok).

Green lung of Krungtep. Don't expect a tourist attraction when you take a visit. I love to take walks in the morning or late afternoons. You meet joggers, lizards (nothing to be scared of), birds or just people picnicking or doing some arobics. Sometimes they have free open air concerts at the weekends and there is also a swimming pool. Just a short walk from Silom.

Lovely park. The park is huge and beautiful. They have there Thai-Chi in the mornings, great tracks to run and boats to rent in the lake.suits for everybody. Personally, I was terrified from the monitor lizards you can find there wandering around, so I was always on the lookout, not the best way to sit and relax but it's still nice to walk around, also other people didn't seem to mind so maybe it's just me :-)
nice walk in the afternoon. If you want to find a drink or something to eat go to entrance number 5. In the park you can get very littlt

Great for a two hour walk. I took my daughter last trip t Bangkok and walk arounf the perimter.. what a nice change. Saw some huge iguanas in the water. I recommend you bring lunch and eat on a blanket.
Green spot. Nice park, but a bit worn out. Nice to visit though early in the morning when it is quiet and not to hot.

Green patch in the middle of a busy city. Very accessible through Bangkok's efficient rail network. A wide green patch in the middle of a very busy city and a great place to sit back and relax. A vendor just outside the southwest (main) gate sells good iced milk tea - excellent drink to cool off the against the heat. Park maintenance needs to be more active to keep the grounds clean. We saw a lot of trash being blown by the wind into the ponds, maybe because park trash bins a few and far in-between. Still the park is an excellent place to unwind and get away from the busy city life.

Tai Chi Mornings, Aerobics Evenings!. Bangkok has the unfortunate distinction of having the lowest ratio of green space for an city globally. This is Bangkok's version of central park. It's best to avoid the heat of the day so there are 2 options. Come early morning and you will see the park crowded with older people, engaged in Tai Chi and other interesting Oriental martial arts and exercises. Also there is a great food court on weekends near the Tennis Courts - delicious authenticTeochew food and a heavenly fresh juice stall. Come later in the day and the crowd will be distinctly younger with a number of free aerobics areas and the path filled with joggers, walkers and kids. The park can be accessed by public transport using the MRT - Lumpini and Silom stations and BTS - Saladaeng.

Big green space!. It's such a big green space in Bangkok!
Besides local running everyday, sometimes of a year they'll have special fun event, like music and game!

great for a relaxing part of the day. You can take the Skytrain to reach the Lumpini Park, and if you are traveling from MBK Center, you will have a good overview from the height of the Skytrain also. It is not an giant park, but you can spend some time walking around. It is nice an quiet, quite clean, as no food and alcoholic drinks are allowed inside the park. It is a good choice if you want to make a little sport, as the air is cleaner. Also you can take your kids to run around safe from the traffic of the city.

Very nice park in the heart of Bangkok. I am envy of Bangkok to have this kind-of-though-not-really Central Park in the heart of the city. Very good place to do exercise (they even have a small work-out spots with quite facilities inside), run, jog, relax, read, hang out with friends, etc. Definitely a spot that I want to go for my afternoon exercise when I am in Bangkok

Few hours retreat from crazy Bangkok beat. This was such an unexpected experience in the heat of Bangkok - a huge park where you can relax, walk around rent a boat or water bicycle. Recommended, just to remind you that Bangkok has many faces:)

Heart of Bangkok but not worth a visit. If you want a fun fair then go to Disneyland etc. If you want a park, it's OK but you'll still feel you are in the middle of a large city with plenty traffic noise 24:7:365But it is easy to get to and the air is only 2% exhaust fumes rather than Bangkok's usual 20%.Watch out after dark because it really isn't safe. And especially watch out for the "ladies" waiting for their boyfriends at the Silom corner of the park; some are not quite what they seem :)I'd put this close to the bottom of a must see visit to Bangkok except for the frequent visitor.
nice park, loads of cyclists walkers, and joggers. nice central park, colourful flower arrangements, lots to see, and just be aware of the comodo dragons lying about...can be dangerous

Greenery in the city. We have two children and sometimes its nice to get out of the hustle of the city. We always visit this park whilst in Bangkok and feed the large catfish and take a boat ride (pedalo style) TO spot the large lizards in the water and around the banks. There are many play areas too. Its a very pleasant way to fill an afternoon. Around the perimeter of the park are lots of food stalls which sell icecream, freshly prepared fruit and bottles of water very cheaply. They also have bread crusts for the fish!

nice escape. Loved this park in Bangkok we hired a boat and paddled round the lake saw plenty of enormous monitor lizards whilst sailing around. A nice place to relaz from the hustle and bustle lots to see flora people lizards. very clean and well maintained with easy access to skytrain and metro station just a few minutes from the Dusit hotel

Beware of the Crocodiles (not)!. Lumpini Park is a large parkland area handily adjacent to both BTS Skytrain and MRT (Subway) stations, at one end of busy Silom Road in Bangkok, also a kilometer or so from Rajprasong shopping area, Siam Paragon, Central World, Central Chidlom, etc. A large bitumen circuit (2.543km) tracks the park's internal perimeter, and is hugely popular with runners, walkers, and bicyclists (fixed times for bicycles). Or one can just laze on the grass in the shade of a huge tree (byo mat or plastic sheet) watch the passersby or catch a few zzzzz. This park is one of the few relatively tranquil refuges from frenetic Bangkok. At first glance, one might be taken aback by the presence of "crocodiles", but these are actually Asian water monitors (lizards). Some are absolutely huge, and over 2 meters long. Keep a safe distance from them, as they can go on the defensive/offensive if they feel threatened. Carparking free on Sundays. Normally best early morning and late afternoon until dark. After dark it tends to empty out and gets a bit spooky. Lots of aerobics groups in the afternoon weekend days, so take your pick! The playgrounds for the kids (there are 2), with slides, slippery dips, swings, etc are very popular, as are places to play basketball, badminton, etc. There are various places for adults to work out dotted around the park. Some nice rose gardens near the Senior Cits Building, and in season, beautiful tropical orchids abound. A pleasant escape, and quiet uncrowded places can be found as well as places for healthy hyperactivity. :) Btw, no smoking, thank you!

Great Park in middle of Bangkok. Stayed in Soi Langsuan so after breakfast to burn a little calorie and early so the sun is still cool walked down to Lumpini park which has joggers there like any other park :)There was these monitor lizards(big walking lizards) in Lumpini Park. Gave me a scare the first I went :)

Cool place at night. Great place to visit at day or night. At night they have markets and endless varieties of food on offer. In the Day the park is huge and quite tranquil if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of BKK

Interesting experience. Lumpini Park is one of the few outdoor places to jog in congested Bangkok. Running on pavements is not ideal in the city due to the uneven terrain, motorbike taxis and many small alleys. The park is easy to locate, about 5-10 mins walk from Sala Daeng BTS station. I reached there at 5.30pm to escape the heat. However, it started to get dark by 6.15pm. That's when the aerobics sessions ended as well. My advice is, get there earlier so that you can join in the aerobics workout. It's fun!Overall, it's a great place to hang out and mingle among the locals.

Chillax... Watching the Komodo Dragons!!!. The park is great, pretty, relaxing. The wow factor comes from the GIANT Komodo Dragons that roam the park. Believe me, if you are not expecting to see these creatures (as I wasn't!) they give you quiet a fright! But they are placid enough I took a couple of photos with them and they seemed to go about their business regardless. At the end of the park you see the great juxtaposition of chilled green beauty and huge sky rises and a spaghetti junction of fly overs. That's worth a picture too!
chill out. A huge park with useful facilities such as boating puddle, gym equipments. Good for a an afternoon jogg

A lovely stroll.. This is a lovely park, and one can certainly escape all the chaos of Bangkok and stroll through the park for an hour or two.The thing is, that other than strolling, there is very little to do here (maybe take a boat in the small lake, but that's it).Still, the park does provide the peace and quiet that are so missing from Bangkok's streets.
relaxing,calm in the middle of the city. good place for some fresh air and exerciseeasy to get to from Dusit Thani Hotelpark is quite big and can keep you busy for sometime

A god send if you need to entertain young kids. BK seems to be kind of short on outdoor entertainments (not surprising considering the heat) but Lumpini goes a great way towards making up for this. A beautiful park with plenty of shade and water to help keep cool and entertainments for demanding kids in the shape of the playground and boats on the lake. Keep an eye out for the lizards, they're a great hit with the kids, especially as some of the buggers getting bloody big! You can keep kids happy here for quite a few hours.

A great afternoon!. I had a lot of fun visiting this park. It is free to walk around, and you can try to spot Monitor Lizards and turtles hanging out by the water. Paddle boats are available to rent to take out on the water, and the skyline of Bangkok is beautiful from the park.

A getaway in the city. Large park in the city, great for getting away from the hustle and bustle and noise. Beautiful lake with boats, lots of walking trails, and plent of grass land just to lay and relax. You can take the Skytrain to Saladang and walk or take the MRT to Lumpini Park
THE landmark. What can I say. Lumpini Park is one of Bangkok’s biggest landmarks. I’m not saying that it’s necessarily worth a visit, but many people have. If you’re a democrat, go.

A multi purpose family park. This parc in the middle of the city of Bangkok cater for joggers early in the morning. For families to relax and sit in the shade during lunch time. On Sundag there is the early Tai Chi practicing. While on many Sunday afternoons Music school give performances on classical music.

Relaxing and Refreshing. We visited this park in the early evening. Lots and lots of joggers, families and couples strolling around. The most wonderful thing to see was the huge number of regular Bangkok citizens enjoying a mass aerobics session. Not difficult to get to from the Sky Train. Watch out for the outdoor eating place at the edge of the park. We missed it and ended up trying to find a restaurant in the streets nearby but all along one side is the Medical Faculty of Chulalungkorn University. (Should have checked out my Trip Advisor Interactive map before setting out)

Rare Groove. This park would be decidedly average anywhere else, but gets a 'very good' grade due to Bangkok's general lack of green, open spaces. Early morning is a great time to visit, as you'll see regulars carrying out their tai chi moves, while you should (of course) remain perfectly still throughout the playing of the national anthem at 8 am. It's also a great place to run or walk, while the park hosts several interesting attractions, including a swimming pool and a futsal court, among others.There is often a musical performance on Sundays in the park, which can provide a nice setting for a picnic. On the downside, be rather cautious if visiting later in the evening, as you may encounter a few less than friendly folk. However, please note that this is no more of a problem than in any other modern city. There is a nice statue of HM Rama V on horseback at one end of the park, which faces the entrance to SIlom Road (at intersection with Rama IV Road). To reach this point, you can take a BTS train to Sala Daeng station or MRT subway train to Si Lom.

park architect's dreams fulfilled. Staying in the hotel nearby (up to 500m) I visited park every morning (between 5.30 and 8.30 a.m. I mean).Many ineresting places, activities of many kinds and situations including standing during the nat. anthem at 8 a.m.This place really lives in many ways.

visited during the day. was a bit boring :S yes its the only place in bangkok that you can see a field.. but we have them at home! there was a few cool things such as the locals doing spontaneous workout sessions they all new the moves to but basically its a place to work and sit and relax many many runners, wouldnt give it more than an hour on your schedule! easy to get there on skytrain!

feels like asian central park. if you are looking for a place to chill and feed some giant fish, turtles and huge lizards this is the place. located in the center of bangkok, easy to get there by BTS sky train or by a short walking from MBK. great place to to some jogging and running.
The lung of Bangkok. If you want a breath of fresh air, away from the busy streets and trafic then Lumpini is the park, maybe not quite like the original in Nepal though

Good park. Lumpini is the main city park in Bangkok and it is a good place, maybe the best place, to come and get away from it all. I would recommend it for joggers or for those looking for somewhere to go for a picnic.

Big green space. Lumpini Park is a nice park in the center of town... it isn't as good as Central Park or Hyde Park but it is the closest thing Bangkok has to the equivalent of those great park. If you want to relax in the sun for a few hours in Bangkok, this is the place to do it.

Try a stroll early morning week end days. Lumpini is a great resource for residents in central BKK, If you are visiting, and your jet lag helps, try to pop up in the mornings of the weekend days, ad just observe the various multi coltural, multi color groups meeting up... it can be interesting also in the after work hours of the week days, when different spontaneous groups joining up for arerobic sessions. Martial arts groups are scattered here and there. This is a safe and civilized place, relax and enjoy it.

Great place to relax. Lumpini Park offers some nice walking paths, paddle boat/canoe rentals and excellent spots for evening photography. Really nice place to relax and spend a couple of hours or the day. Keep an eye out for the Monitor lizards!
Very pretty. A nice place to chill out for an hour or so. Forget you are in the big city and enjoy the lakes, lawns and nature for a while.

Green!. Lumpini Park is a big space of green in a fairly concreted city. An interesting place for a wander, to see how the locals unwind. There are paddle boats for hire, and you can ride bicycles, but I didn't see anywhere to hire them when I was there during the week.This is a 'park', not botanical gardens - the emphasis is on recreation (walking, running, cycling, sitting). There was a bit of a smell from the drains when I was there.

Jogging and jungle gym joy. Thank goodness we found this park, which was right by our fantastic hotel, Baan Saladaeng. We jogged it in the morning and had a blast watching the fitness classes, dance classes, old timers, wee ones, and everyone in between doing their thing at the park. On our second time there my husband discovered the "jungle" gym- outdoor gym, which was like watching a kid discover Lego Land- he was so excited! If you are wanting a romantic picnic spot, some green, a place to exercise, then make your way to Lumpini Park- you will thoroughly enjoy yourself!

Come to Lumpini Park on a weekend morning for people watching!. In the heart of Bangkok this park is well used by the locals with lots of activity going on, particularly during the mornings. See elderly folk doing their tai chi or dancing with poles and flags, there is one couple that are there every weekend doing ballroom dancing and random people join in around the fringes. Many people running, biking, walking and having picnics. Free entry, children's playground (may not be all that safe by some countries standards) clean -ish toilets scattered around near the entry gates and cold water and drinks to purchase a couple of small vendors in the park.

A park to walk in and all these varans everywhere. The park is very much a citypark, flat, surrounded by a big pulsating city.There are not many places in Bangkok to jog in but the Lumpini Park is such a place. To have a walk without constantly thinking about the traffic might be well worth the visit.But in our eyes there is one more decisive attraction, the park is full of varans, close to the water, swimming, sunbathing, walking around in the grass and from time to time we literally had to watch our feet so we did not step on them. We saw a couple of really big ones.If you have kids, younger or teens, this might be the opportunity to have a park walk together.

A Boat ride is a must. This a completely green area in the heart of Bangkok amid the brick and mortar concrete jungle.Located right opposite Sala Daeng BTS opposite Silom road, the park offers self rowing boats in the lake area there.Very relaxing and a nice place to refresh after all the hectic sight seeing and shopping!

Unfortunally it is a city park not well looked after. big big potential. But now as it stands just a bit to dirty. But. bucker this, second time i write a review. It has the potential to be a very nice city park. But very poorly looked after. But as it is the only park in the neighboorhood, I do do my jogging there very regualarly. But the thai don't look after it that well, wich means it is dirty with a lot of trash accumulated in the sidewalk. But it is the only strech of green around, so you will find a lot of joggers running their laps. You even might see me!

Lovely to walk around and stretch your legs in the early evening.. This is the biggest park by far in central Bangkok, and well worth a visit. It's about 3.5 km to walk around the main path around the outside. During the day you can hire pedalos and go on the lake, and see if you can spot any Monitor Lizards. It's more pleasant and cool in the early evening. If you walk around at 5.30-6pm ish the place is full of joggers and outdoor aerobics sessions, and I think it's a really nice snapshot of Thai life. Important note - at 8am and 6pm the park plays the National Anthem, and everyone stops and stands whilst this happens - including you.

Great to kill a few hours or burn off some energy. Lovely huge park, massive jungle gyms, many people doing dancing or martial arts, bbq-ing or just chilling. Take a cruise on the lake, feed the fish, take some pics. Lovely for kids.

A must for small children. This park is brilliant to escape Bangkok without having to actually leave the city, excellent paths and walkways with a good boating lake centrally with duck pedal boats for 40thb for 30 minutes plus 40thb deposit, the lake is teaming with fish and terrapins and we saw a large monitor lizard swimming across the lake whilst boating. The Park has a mixture of swings slides and climbing frames for children to run around on and explore. Take some bread for the fish, or buy some on site!

Great afternoon people watching. We headed here in the afternoon and lay in the shade by the lakes, very pretty and relaxing. Later we walked around the park and saw some large lizards which were just roaming around - very cool, then as the heat was dropping at around 17:00 we heard dance music coming from one side of the park. On investigation it was a massive aerobics class with people turning up and joining in. It was marvellous to witness! Then when the class ended a lot of people run around the park which is cool, as it really is a lot of people, not the handful I see out when I run at home. But then at 18:00 the park speaker system plays the national anthem and everyone stops still to show respect to the king... Again a really amazing thing to observe - hundreds of people becoming statues at the same time... Then when it ends, they all start running again!I loved it!
Great for relaxing. Beautiful park. Great for walks and for chilling out and Very near Silom. Great at weekends when all the locals are using it and lots of activities going on

a retreat from the city buzz. a nice place to stroll and escape the city for a short bit. At night, it's cooler and the park is full of exercise class of all kinds you can join for free. Or just enjoy a relaxing stroll
green break. a little breather from the Bangkok traffic, nice place to walk, jog or exercise on the park's exercise machines; my kids certainly enjoyed trying them all!

good for both night shopping and day walking. I love the place since they provide us both day and night satisfaction.day time yu can enjoy walking here, and getting here is really easy, take MRT (Subway) then u need just 5 minute walk to start shopping or relax
Lung of Bangkok. Truly relax in this park, people come to excercise from early morning till late night, nearby are lots of leading fitness club - but people still jog outdoor here :)
enjoy. great park lots to do,great facilities,gets busy at night,after 6p.m.

Would be nice if you could get away from traffic noise. A manicured park is a great reprieve from the bustle. Ian hoping that they make it larger in time and have a section that is more shady and tropical.

Park with reptiles in the middle of the city. This has become one of my favorite and most visited places in Bangkok. It's a fairly large park with a couple of lakes and several walking and running tracks. The park itself is nice and surprisingly peaceful (until the evenings), but what I enjoy is all the wildlife. There are numerous Water Monitors (giant lizards) that walk, swim and laze about the park. Near the bridges are fish waiting to be fed, with locals willing to sell you bread and other treats. Wait near the edge of the lake for a while and turtles appear. I've even seen people hand feed what look like eels in nearby creeks.In the evenings the locals appear in large numbers to perform aerobics to loud music.I usually come here late in the afternoon by the subway to Lumpini, then once finished I walk to Patpong (about 10 mins away) for dinner and the night markets, then it's the skytrain back to Sukhumvit. A great relaxing way to spend an afternoon in the big city.
relaxing. spend an evening here..if you are tired of the sightseeing...especially with young kids

Calm oasis. we enjoyed a few hours strolling through the park watching the locals doing tai chi. The ponds are interesting places to watch the wild life - large fish, turtles and the very large lizards.

My favourite place in Thailand. I always try to find a couple of hours to spend in this great park during my holidays.
You can just relax there with a book or with a tablet-PC (TrueWiFi is awailable there) and hide from rain in several places.
Also u can find giant lizards which are harmless, but look fantastic.

Calm in the center of chaos. Similar to parks in the center of the city, Lumpini Park offers a respite in the center of Hectic Bangkok. The walking/jogging track around the park is 2.54 km long and free from bicycles. There is a pool, outdoor fitness centers and a sports complex for futsal, tennis and other court activities. The park has a relaxing atmosphere with beautiful gardens of fresh flowers, plants and trees throughout the park.. Rest rooms and snack bars with plenty of water are dotted around the park. There is a large lake centrally located and plenty of resting areas to enjoy the serenity of the park. Watch out for the dragons, some are quite large. In the early morning many tai chi activities and also a restaurant is open, but it does close early also. In the afternoon there are a number of aerobic classes going available all free. Make sure to stand for the National Anthem at 6:00 pm.

Lumpini Park - a place of calm in a hectic city. Walking through Lumpini park was excellent. it is a calm and well kept park. To walk through and see the locals doing Tai Chi and how clean and safe it felt was terrific. Walking under the shady treas in the heat of the day was great.

An oasis of peace and quiet amidst the hustle and bustle of Bangkok. Lumphini Park was one of the places that I needed to visit ever since I drafted plans to visit Bangkok. After reading several comments, and watching Youtube videos, I knew I had to see it for myself. The park is indeed an oasis of tranquility in the middle of the Bangkok hubub. I was there in the early hours of the morning, and already the park was full of people doing their exercises. We had people jogging, doing taichi, yoga etc. There was even a makeshift gym where folks can do a workout. I was more interested to look for the park's resident reptiles, the monitor lizards. It took a while before I could locate one such critter. These animals must have been so used to humans by now, and the one I spotted didn't scurry away immediately, but just sat there, allowing itself to be photographed. At exactly 8am, the national anthem would be played, and all had to stand at attention. Overall, a nice place to visit.

An island of green in the heart of the city. Come early in the morning (before 8am) when it is cooler and see the people exercising: yoga, tai chi, tai chi with fans and swords, ballroom dancing, latin dancing, aerobics, badminton, basketball. Older people meet for breakfast under the trees around the lake, while young children play in the play grounds. You can rent paddle boats, buy food and drinks (inside the park and at some of the entrances), walk around or just find a shady bench and enjoy the scenery. Access via the skytrain (Sala Daeng or Rajadamri stations) or the underground train (Silom station). You can walk from Sukhumvit Soi 10 via the pedestrian/bike path along the Klong (canal) - it's about 1 - 1.5km.

Just relax. Lovely park.. Take Sky Train and stop at Sala Daeng. From there you just need to walk 5 minutes. I went there at dusk, it was lovely to see people spending their time. Locals, family, couple, or tourists like me. Just sit and relax, read a book beside the lake, watching bunch of pigeons. You can get food or water near the entrance gate. It's a clean place, I love it.

A green oasis in Bangkok. Run, walk, bike, picnic.. You can get here by Sky Train. There are huge iguanas (?) running loose. Local people go there, in the morning there are exercise groups. Some food and water available. Public bathrooms. THere is a bike trail that goes to Lumpini, I got on at Soi 10 one day, not sure how long it is. There is a big Muay Thai (boxing) stadium there. Take a break from the traffic and hustle/bustle of Bangkok.

This picture was old now the shopping center was closed already. To sad that Lumpini night market was closed already, now a day most people still going to the park for relax, picnic and exercise. Easy to go here by public transport such as bus, BTS and subway train

Peaceful and relaxing. This park was within easy walking distance from our hotel (even on a hot day) so we took a walk there. The park is very much a green oasis with enough space for a lot of activities. A good place to just relax.

A typical park in the middle of Bangkok. Sadly, this park used to have much more trees than it does now. You can walk to nearby sky train or subway stations. You can feed fish. You can jog. But basically you will sweat because there is not a lot of shade here any more. Apparently there are also monitor lizards running around, but I have never seen one. Regardless, there is not really that much to do here compared to all the other wonderful attractions in Bangkok.
a restful place. a very simple park, just a place to walk and laze around
Green oasis in the middle of the city. There are walking paths, bike paths, man- made lake and lots of trees. easily accessible by MRT or taxi. Worth the visit

Peacful place. It's the place to go early in the morning to see the people of Bangkok out doing Tai Chi, walking, talking and relaxing or later in the day for a rest from doing all the touristy things one does in Bangkok. The park is next to Lumpini MRT station

Park to go to for people watching. This park is so huge, you can really find a spot for yourself, away from anyone. But you can also go there for people watching: some people exercise there at all times (there is an outdoor gym with free access, some open air gym classes with loud music at the weekend or even some men training at Thai boxing). If you stay by the water, you might meet one of those giant kind of lizards who leave in the lake.
Lovely green space. A lovely stroll through the interesting park. It was amazing to see everyone come to a halt for the national Anthem played at 6 pm. Nice escape from a bustling city!

a good escape.. morning is great, cool and great for a wake up walk. watch tai chi practioners exercising from about 6 am.water and boats, rather like central park. relaxing, nice layout. can also see giant lizards wandering. wake boarding too i think!!

A big park in the center of Bangkok. Not a very good place to go all the time, because Bangkok is too hot, but in the morning you can see a lot of people doing Tai Chi Chuang, and you get a little out of the craziness of any big busy city.

I was amazed when a large lizard type of creature walked right in front of me. It was huge!. What was that creature that resembles an iguana type of lizard? I just stopped and stared at the thing. It walked slowly, looking around for food. It was bigger than a German Shepard dog. Bangkok's Lumpini Park always offers a good day. Every traveler should take an afternoon to walk through the park to where ever they may be off to sometime during their trip.
go in morning. go in the morning lots of people around going about there day very pretty, at dusk is good also nice photo op's then

GREEN IN THE HEART OF CITY. Very very good place. Big park . Near Lumphini MRT, walking 5 minits. Good manage park, given by the King to the Thai citizen permanently.Every morning there are many group of people to do exercise. Tai-chi, Aerobic, jogging, Weight training, Yoga, ETC. The hawker centre inside selling very nice foos in very reasonable price, example, 10B for soyasoy plus red bean. Stall selling teochiew porridge also is good with its many kind dishes. The operation hour is 4.30m morning to 9.00night. Security Guide in bycle with will make sure nobody in the park. Toilets also clean. Perhapes the BEST Park in Bangkok. Can buy fresh fish and fruits in the main entrance (near bus station)

I love the morning walk here. Great place to have a walk in the morning. You can see people come for morning exercising, cycling, arabic dancing, playing with dogs etc. After that, have a simple delicious meal at the small food park.

Make Sure you visit During your stay. This is an Oasis among the Cars Buses, Motor Bikes and the general Noise of Bangkok, I was encouraged to take a walk through the park, and oi am pleased i did, go around 5 Pm many workers jogging, early morning for Thai Chi or whatever if you are into it !!, and Weekends for family, I always make time to visit here, and it is very safe (so Far)

Go see or join wor out in the park, but be there before 6 PM :) !. interesting if you want to join a group workout. What makes it special is that at right before 6 PM a policeman blows a whistle and after that the Thai National Anthem is played and EVERYBODY in the park stop moving. Not special enough to go here, but if you're in the area, do stop here and be amazed.......

Surprisingly pleasant in the middle of downtown Bangkok. The park is in the heart of the town and easy to access with BTS or MRT trains. Despite the relatively small size the bustle of the city disappears quite well. The huge lizards that populate the park make it a unique place in my experience.

Great Break from the concrete jungle. Stayed in Bangkok for 7 weeks and made frequent trips to the park. The best time to go in my opinion is the early evening. Around 6:30 pm the place is jumpin with people jogging, doing aerobics and watching the huge monitor lizards wander around. They stay under water for the most part until it gets cooler out and come out in droves...loved it!!

Perfect place to relax and have a picnic. If you are tired of shopping malls and temples, go to lumpini park! Relax and take a breath of fresh air (as fresh as you can get it in Bangkok).Easy access by public transport.

No interest apart at night. Let's be clear : it may be one of the biggest park of Bangkok, it's not worth it. Especially if you are in the city for a short trip, don't bother going.The park is just not nice. It's more roads, surrounded by grass and few trees, but not a 'nice' park at all.At night, when the heat is a bit down, it can be fun to see thai people doing their chinese martial art exercises.... that's it.
The Park. For me this is the original park, certainly one of the best known. By day it's a great place to stroll and at night the atmosphere changes and it really comes alive.

Central Park – IN BANGKOK. I absolutely loved this park. We went in the morning and were delighted to be surrounded by local gymnasts, joggers and fitness-freaks. The park is clean, gorgeous with a tranquil atmosphere.
green haven. loads of people doing exercise, lovely green escape, big enough for a sizeable walk and relaxing atmosphere

Daytime relaxation.. Not many people frequent Lumpini Park in the daytime. An interesting, quite large and quiet park located just outside of the business district. Only detractor is monitor lizard population.

Not much to see. Only for a jog if you want to work out. If you are looking for a place for a jog, this is it. However, it can be crowded in the morning (fulled with the locals, most retired / seniors). But easily accessed by underground train.

Nice park. Such a nice park to go and relax to take a break from the madness of Bangkok. It's also teeming with wildlife like big lizards and birds. It's also full of locals doing their daily exercise which can be amusing.
An oasis in the middle of Bangkok. A lovely park in the middle of the city but a little disorientating. Make sure you take landmarks when you go in so that you can find your way out again!
Great to relax. I like going to Lumphini to just sit and relax and watch the world go by, the grounds are really looked after and it is so peaceful.
good place to go for a walk. Is a good place to have a walk or a family day. Dogs are not allowed. Is good to visit.

A little like Hyde Park. Went for a stroll through here once or twice during daylight hours. Seemed failry well kept, large boating lake and the odd Thai boxer jogging by. The amenities (at least where I was) seem to mostly be closed or permanently shuttered. Not sure I would want to be here after sundown.

green oasis in the heart of Bangkok. even when it's 30/90+ degrees, humid and muggy outside, the park is cooler, the air is cleaner and people come to relax from the hustles and bustles of the city.
A great place to run/jog, too!

Bangkok's Largest Park. A real oasis in the middle of crazy Bangkok. No Ferris wheel anymore - that was at Suan Leum anyway. Lumphini is a great place to spend an afternoon watching people or riding a bike or skate or jog or just escaping the city.

If you like Lumpini, check out other BKK parks.. It seems that Lumpini is the park that is most touted on visitors. I suppose that's OK. It's relatively large, has a number of things going on (including free concerts at times), and is convenient to the SkyTrain and the underground. But I tend to prefer several other parks in the city.If you can stay at a hotel that's convenient to a park and use that park early or later in your day, your stay will most likely be much more enjoyable than if you ignore Bangkok's parks when locating your sleeping spot. With the Dusit Thani and several other hotels nearby, Lumpini Park would be an excellent amenity to be near your hotel!But there are several other parks - which you might consider booking a hotel nearby. Those include Benjakiti, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dPJFhbTdqAIBenjasirihttp://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g293916-d456161-Reviews-Benjasiri_Park-Bangkok.htmlRomaneenarthttp://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g293916-d456166-Reviews-Romaneenart_Park-Bangkok.htmlSantiphap http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g293916-d554210-Reviews-Santiphap_Park_Park_of_Peace-Bangkok.htmland Chatuchakhttp://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g293916-d456164-Reviews-Chatuchak_Park-Bangkok.htmlEnjoy Bangkok's parks!
Peace away from the hustle and bustle. Definitely recommend going to this beautiful and peaceful park.Take a stroll or go for a jog, have a picnic, rent a paddle boat,just unwind in this lovely park!
Lumpini visit. Lumpini Park is a nice park but does not compare to major parks in other capital cities. Your photograph is out of date. This part of the park no longer exists
Nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city..... Really pretty park to relax in and even has a gym! Even saw some lizards and exotic creatures walking around!
There's no ferris wheel. Your picture of Lumphini Park is misleading, there is no Ferris Wheel. It's a big park and you can take boats onto the pond.

An oasis in the middle of Bangkok.. The park is nice to walk around but not much was happening when we were there. Just a few poeple working out in the open air gym, several families having picnics around the lake, several couples strolling around the park, and a few young people having a paddle in the swan boats. The food stalls open from 4.30am - 10am only so there was no food available to buy except for a few stall holders near the exit gates. The park closes at 3pm.

A big park. This park is basically a big swath of flat park-land as far as I could tell. I mean, it's enjoyable park-land, but nothing exceptional. The big monitor lizards that roam around are pretty fun. There's a section somewhere with these huge HUGE palm trees that I find fascinating. They're always hard for me to find though, because the park is so darn huge. You'll usually see an assortment of people out running or using the permanent exercise equipment that's been drilled into the ground. There's no street-cart food available inside the park, and very little outside of it, so bring your own food if you want to eat.

Bangkok green lungs. This is a huge park in downtown Bangkok near Silom and Wireless Rd. It is well tended with lakes, lawns and trees. In the evenings, this is a favorite spot for joggers with measured marks. It is a good place to watch people, stroll or hide away from the city hustle and bustle. This is a place where you may also come across a few monitor lezards, which wander freely along the water's edge!

A huge park in the city center. Its a beautiful park with lots of greenery in the center of Bangkok City. From Pathumwan its 30 mins walk, from Grand Hyatt Erawan is about 20 mins walk. The walk around the park will take close to an hour if you walk slow. Its really nice.

Tranquil. Considering its location this place is a haven of peace. A massive park with lakes its a great place to unwind. Refreshments are available as are very clean toilet facilities. The open air Gym provides views of muscle Mary's pumping iron. Oh don't smoke in the park or you will face a heavy fine and its advisable not to be in the park after dark as there have been reports of petty crime. Remember though Bangkok is a very safe city providing you keep your brains with you. Nearest sky train station is Sala Daeng 5 minute walk to the park.

Nice park nice stroll. Nice park stroll andnice to escape a bit Bangkok,always nice to find a huge park in the city.just do not understand how the thais can go jogging in the polution....but made a nice escape for us during the afternoon,even saw an exterior gym was quite interesting to see,some say at 5am a lot of taichi addepts to bad was not up at that time to see and join them :)

Great safe place to exercise or walk around. I go there almost everyday to exercise in the morning. It's a great clean place for walking running or riding a bike (only during certain hours). Free outdoor classes all through the park in the morning and late afternoon.

Shopping at Night. This is a great place to visit on daylight. Many nice place to exercise and relax by the ponds or lay down on your lover's lap under the tree. It is very romantic for a couple or friends a like.Then you come back at night. The Lumpini Night Bazaar is start business at night. You will enjoy many good food along with many discount shopping..... BUT .... You must know how to negotiated to the lowest price possible. Negotiation is an art , I can't teach you that. It is depend on how bad you like your pick and.... try to hide the feeling from the vendors. :-) .. If they sense that you want it bad .... prepare to pay higher price.But you are the tourist they know that and this is the disadvantage. Be Patient ...... and .... Be Patient. Unless you are run out of time and want it BAD. So, shop early and check it around.... and .... Good Luck.
space in BKK. just a great place in BKK to have a walk and chill

huge park, lots of fun. Great open space park, lots of vendors down the main entry way that have food and market items like lotions, perfumes, sometimes massage etc. Lots of shade to hang out under. We've tossed a frisbee around there. Good place to run around as it's huge, good running track, quite a scenic jog.
A grand visit, early weekends. This huge beautiful park is best seen on weekends, very early AM when Chinese exercisers festoon the early mornings.
Take a break in the city. And maybe catch sight of a monitor Lizard or 2. And the Chinese residents practicing their Tai Chi in the morning.
great urban park. very large, well laid out and green. many pathways and benches to rest on, close to the BTS.

Oasis in the heart of the city. As a local, we find Lumpini Park to be a god-send, it is right in the heart of the CBD and thousands of people visit each day. Free dancing, aerobics classes etc in early evening, great place for a morning walk - can get a little warm around 3pm (not the best time to train for a fun run, as we dicovered!).

Interesting for the wrong reasons.... I like visiting Lumphini Park with tourists. Not because it's particularly beautiful or peaceful, but because there's always something worth seeing.Early in the morning (6am) there are crowds of elderly Thai-Chinese practising Thai Chi.all through the day there are groups of Thais eating and drinking (it's the national hobby).There's a multi-purpose outdoor gym which seems to be made from scrap iron, where the odd local bench presses a couple of tyres on the ends of an old iron bar.But probably the most famous inhabitants of the park are the monitor lizards. They look like Komodo dragons and can grow to 2.5 metres in length. They lie by the lakeside, basking in the sun and allow curious photographers to get quite close before sliding into the water.Be warned though - they have a nasty bite and can slash with their powerful tails. There are several hundred of these beasts roaming the park, from little 6 inch babies to the monsters. Somehow they all seem to find enough to eat, even though Thais never feed them.There are a few cats and rats hanging around, I suspect the others became lunch.

In the heart of Silom, Lumphini Park is the oldest and largest Bangkok's park. This park is open early in the morning at 04.30 and its gates are closed at 21.00.It's located on Rama IV, Road, you get there with MRT - Silom or Lumphini Station or by BTS at Saladaeng Station

A haven from the hustle and bustle. Just a short (and cheap) skytrain or metro ride away from the busy Sukhumvit Road lies this sizeable slice of heaven. A green oasis of calm, well kept lawns, mirror still lakes and some fascinating wildlife - all completely free.One of the first things to excite me were the giant 5ft long monitor lizards that roam freely around the park. I think the locals found us just as interesting and amusing as we followed and watched the lizards. Graceful white egrets stand serenely at the edges of the lakes and trees are hung with orchids. Beautiful bonzais sit atop posts in the waterways as little arched bridges pass above. Also you'll feel safe as the park is a constant stream of gentle city folk jogging the easy walkways - stopping at 3pm for the national anthem followed by communal exercise. Sit awhile at dusk and watch the bats feeding overhead or small geckos scurry for cover.The park combines tranquility, wild yet kept grounds and wildlife highlights with a safe haven for families, wildlife enthusiasts, photographers or quite simply anyone who just wants a breather in a city that's manic and bustling. Most definitely worth a visit!

Nice play to jog. I always enjoy Lumpini Park for a nice play to exercise. I go to just jog around the entire park in the late afternoon. Many others do the same. Park is huge and very safe (at least during the day). They also have a couple of places to work out, lifting weights, etc.

Enjoy nice stroll in the centre of busy city. Lumpini Park in Bangkok very quite but still busy with people excercise, meet some friend ,bring children walk even just wants to have alone time.The animal surrounding is very interesting.Birds and in the lake if you lucky can spot monitor lizard. The landscape very beautiful and colorful of flower.It is nice place to meet some friend or just want to have quite reading a book here after busy day working or exploring the city.Different atmosphere rather than in the big mall or shopping area
Best place for relax. I been here 2 time, like this park. You feel relax here!a lot of things can do here, jogging and enjoy the view! Definely will come back!!

Relax to the Max!. A nice place to escape the City heat with the large lake and shade in the park. It is quiet and relaxing, great for a picnic, sunbathing, reading books and taking in your surroundings. There are rowing/peddle boats for hire on the lake which is a great way to cool down and relax. There are policeman regularly cycling around the park to make sure all is in order, which is reassuring. We took a picnic to the park where we read our books, doozed in the sun before exploring the rest of the park for a few hours. We combined this with a visit to the Red Cross Snake Farm which was only 15mts away.

The best things in life are free. This is a superb piece of greenery and water amongst all the concrete skyskrapers. Stayed 10th November to 23rd November 2009 and spent as much time as possible here.You can chill out by the lake in the sun and watch the funny moniter lizards, turtles squirrels. There is good value boats to try or you might want to do free airobics with 100s of other people.If you stay all day there is many good people from all countries in the world to chat to.Yes this place is a must to visit

Oasis of calm. Lumphini Park is an Oasis of calm in the bedlam of BKK.Located at Rama IV Road, between Ratchadamri Road and Witthayu Road. You get get there by MRT, Lumphini or Saladeang Station or BTS Silom or Ratchadamri.Big green space with ponds. Sit in the shade next to the water and suddenly you're not in crazy, chaotic BKK anymore. Relax and admire BKK skyline or go for a jog along the jogging paths or use the free weight "machines". At 6pm, there is a free government sponsored aerobics class as well.

Full of activities. We arrived in Bangkok early in the morning, too early to check into the Hotel. Took a walk to Lumphini park and found a park full of activities. A out door gym, Locals practising Tai Chi, Joggers and generally a lot of excitement for that early in the morning! Saw a huge water monitor drinking from the lake. Overall a lovely experience in the middle of Bangkok.
